description:
I love this place!!!

Japanese curry is something that you can easily make at home but the issue is making the tonkatsu; sometimes you can't be bothered to deep fry at home and get oil everywhere.

There's just something really comforting about a big bowl of curry with crunchy fried meat on the side. I ordered the pork katsu curry with extra mushrooms ($2.5) and cheese ($1.5) and the hubs ordered the pork and tomato which makes the dish taste more like hayashi rice than curry. I wasn't a huge fan of that particular dish but I can't recommend the curry more. The spicy here is not that spicy. I might try the Volcano level spice next time. 

It's mostly self service, you order at the counter, you get your own utensils and water and you bus the plates, but they'll bring the actual food to you. 

I wish this place was closer but it definitely hits the spot and I'll definitely be back.
author: Eunah T.

description:
I was really excited to try this place out after reading great reviews from Yelp! There are many solid restaurants serving ramen or sushi rolls, but unfortunately very difficult to find a decent curry or bento places. 

Service is self-serving, hence you need to get your own utensils, napkins, and water after ordering, although they bring the foods to your table! In terms of ambience, it would not be a good place for your date night as it is VERY casual with food-court style tiles. 

I ordered chicken katsu curry with boiled egg as a topping (extra charge). The curry sauce was thick and had a deep flavor, but that was about it. I wish they had more vegetables (more potatoes and carrots), along with your choice of meat. I wish they had something special that distinguished them from other curry restaurants - could have hamburg meat or even croquettes or musubi for appetizers. 

If I had lived near the area, I think it would have been a great takeout place. However, I would not drive all the way just to get their curry.
author: Justyn P.

description:
My wife is still raving about the chicken curry plate. She loves curry and makes her own. So, for her to go on and on about someone else's curry is high praise.  We eat a lot of hot Korean food and while she had no problem with the "hot" spicy level, she said she'd prefer medium.   I had the kara-age plate. Nicely cooked, lightly seasoned, crispy and good taste, though I was not blown away as she was. Kids had noodle soup with chicken which they woofed down -- which is the same as high praise, coming from them. 

While Geary has definitely gotten more expensive than it deserves in recent years, Volcano's prices are reasonable. We ordered take out and food was ready on time and still hot when we got home.  As we are recently returned residents to central Richmond, we'll definitely keep Volcano's number on our fridge or land there for a (rare) sunny evening walk around the block.
author: Jason G.

description:
I got the Beef Curry (Volcano level )this past Saturday, it wasn't as great as my past experience. My partner thinks it's just the beef. I was thinking maybe I got katsu last time.. but no, I got beef as said in my previous review here..

My partner's dish was pretty good he said. 

-

Yeah Volcano isn't my number one Japanese curry place no more...

Maybe I'm not making a fair comparison since at my new favorite place: I haven't ordered the exact equivalent dish to compare.. but the curry itself was little less as great as I remembered... 

So I do want to try their Katsus next time. It might just be a better combination pairing with their curries here.
author: Lilian L.

description:
Volcano was a refreshing change of course for my palette since moving to SF. When I'm wanting something a little different from some of the more eclectic SF flavors, good Asian cuisine is where it's at! It doesn't have to be fancy, or over the top, but just good food that comforts the soul . 

It's a small shop where you order at the register. If you're coming here for the first time, I'd have to say getting the chicken katsu curry is the way to go. It's their most popular item and for good reason. 

They serve a heaping portion of curry (coming with 4 different spiciness levels) with the katsu on top of a bed of rice. There's a few pieces of potatoes and carrots that kind of give it a bit of a stew element. 

If you're good with spice, I'd say the "hot" is pretty mild. I'm interested in trying the volcano spice (hottest) as hot wasn't quite spicy enough for me! 

The curry is quite filling, especially with the rice and potatoes. I inhaled my food and am currently going through a food coma. 

This was so delicious for a chilly evening and exactly what I had been craving (I just didn't know it yet!). The curry is a tad bit soupy, which would be my only comment, but it didn't take away from me thoroughly enjoying my meal!

Seating is limited, but food comes out fast so tables clear out fairly quickly. If you have a little wait for a table it'll be sure to pass within a reasonable amount of time. 

Definitely make Volcano a priority, especially if you're wanting something a little different without paying an arm and a leg.
author: Cecilia C.

description:
The last time I had Japanese curry was over a year ago when I was visiting Japan which was early last year. I've missed my CoCo Curry so much, but I don't plan on visiting Japan anytime soon.

I've had Volcano bookmarked for quite some time now, but haven't gone due to previous notifications about low health score. Now I'm amazed the rating is 100! So I ordered takeout right after I found parking about a block away, and the food was ready in 10mins. I got the Chicken Kaarage Curry w/ potato croquette in level Hot.

Everything was pretty delish. At first, I was like this curry isn't even at all spicy, but I reheated everything in the microwave in which it helped. I think I would get Volcano level next time though because I do like it spicier.

It's definitely not CoCo Curry, but it's a solid Japanese curry place that's nearby. :)
author: Amy C.

description:
The first thing my dude pointed out was their perfect inspection score!

1. He was craving Japanese curry so we stopped by Volcano. We were the only people in line, but after we sat down, an influx of people came in.
2. We got the chicken katsu and the pork katsu and agreed that the chicken was better. Both proteins were breaded and fried perfectly. 
3. They have 4 levels of spice. For chicken, we got mild. For pork, we got  medium. I'm already thinking about going back to get hot next time.
4. The curry is so good. It's like the perfect consistency and with rice, it's so delicious. The potatoes and carrots are cooked perfectly too!
5. You get your bang for your buck here. Each plate is more than enough food.
author: Tammy P.

description:
We fell for the hype of this place and went out of our way to walk to it from the Golden Gate Park. It has 4 stars on Yelp and I have seen some of my mutuals post photos from it, so I thought, "Hey, why not?"

We ordered a hamburg curry, chicken curry, and a chicken katsu curry with a vegetable croquette. All were at the "hot" spicy level (I did not think it was too hot, but they did, whoops).

I thought my dish was pretty basic (probably because I slathered my croquette and katsu with katsu sauce), but my boyfriend said that their hamburg curry had this really weird after taste and my friend who go the chicken curry said it was like they just had the ingredient separate and just plopped it on top. None of the curry flavor was stewed into it. 

Agreeably, all of us were put off by the fact that the potatoes and carrots that were included in the curry were still pretty crunchy and hard (not typical of vegetables included in curry) and had none of the flavor of the curry seeped into it; meaning that the vegetables were probably just tossed in at the end. 

There are much better Japanese curry options out there that are worth the price.
author: Ann T.

description:
Still a favorite take out dinner spot for us. Highly recommend chicken or pork katsu curry. Everything is good but can't beat fried meat over rice. 

Frequent buyers card is replaced with 5 stars.
author: Bessie T.

description:
Decided to try this place out because it had 4 stars and we were in the area. Our first time coming here, it took my husband and I a bit to decide what we wanted. As we stared at the menu, a customer came up behind us (which we didn't notice). I felt the cashier was a tad rude when she asked us to move aside so the other customer could order. 

As we ordered our food, the cashier honestly seemed like she'd rather be somewhere else and continued with her cold mannerisms. 

There were plenty of seating when we got there. Looks like we beat the rush because as soon as we sat down, the place got really busy. The cashier (now our server), brought us our food. I ordered a chicken Katsu curry rice plate "with vegetables", my husband ordered the vegetable curry rice place, and we ordered a non curry chicken katsu rice plate for my son. 

To my disappointment, I had like 3 pieces of potatoes & carrots, half a plate full of rice, and of course my chicken katsu. I was looking forward to a lot more vegetables than that. It wasn't way until after the fact that I realized you could pay extra (which could quickly add up), to add other vegetables to your plate. I felt my husband's & son's dishes looked better. I did like the curry, that was tasty. My husband & son really enjoyed their dishes as well. I'd be willing to give this place another try & see how it goes next time around. 

Oh, and THEY DONT HAVE HIGH CHAIRS which is pretty disappointing ! There's enough room there for them to have high chairs. Management, please get a high chair or two so that families w/ babies or toddlers who want to eat there don't have to feel as if they aren't welcomed!!
author: Ruby V.

description: This place reminds me of Coco Ichibanya and personally, I would much rather prefer Coco. I ordered the pork katsu with the volcano spicy level, which is about $10. For the price, the portions are about average. I wish they had a half portion size option like they do at Coco. Not a fan of taking this home for leftovers cause it's just not as crispy and fresh. The volcano spicy level wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. It's a comfortable spicy. However, if you're sensitive to spicy, I wouldn't suggest this level. You'll probably end up sniffling throughout your entire meal.
author: Carmen L.

description: Got pork katsu with fried shrimp and egg medium hotness. The egg is deep fried and came out too  dry. Curry is pretty generic and has flavours but nothing special and someone misses giving satisfaction to your taste buds . Additionally they could give a bit more curry since it's lacking a bit of flavour so you have to use alot more to eat the rice with.
author: Alexsey G.

description:
I have hesitated to come here for years because the name just seems to play too much on tourists. I finally ate here and was not planning on writing a review. 

Curry is decent and katsu was ok. Not the best, but does the job. The 3 star review is more to the pickles. 

I saw they charged $1.25 for extra pickles, so I asked if it comes with any. "It comes with a little," I was told. But, the amount it came with was just offensive (see attached). Do you charge extra for ice with your water?  Fukujinzuke is part of Japanese Curry. Just how it is. 

Holding it and charging extra for a normal portion forced me to share a warning.
author: Nick M.

description: This place is amazing, they never disappoint. Don't be afraid to go for the volcano sauce if you like a little extra spice
author: Lucas T.

description:
Far surpassed my expectations!!

Got the chicken katsu curry and the tomato pork curry. Spice level: volcano!
The katsu meat was nice and tender with a crunchy crust. Went so well with the curry base. 5/5 
The pork tomato curry was completely different but oh so delicious as well. 5/5. 

Deliciously spicy but not so spicy you can't taste anything. Not too heavy but not too light. Just enough rice and meat.

The wait time and price is totally reasonable. The flavors are delicious. I don't have any changes to suggest. 

Will be back!
author: J P.

description:
Came back the 3rd time, & had to add 1 more star!

- Service was so efficient, speedy like a curry fast food chain! (My food was ready w/n 5 min)

- Ordered basic chicken curry (non-breaded), and it was surprisingly tasty!  (Last time we ordered chicken katsu curry & chicken karage curry (~$10 each). And they were super delicious. 

This time I was expecting to be less impressed by the cheaper option (~$9 ), thinking that it might have less flavor than the deep fried dish. However, it turned out so well, fresh, authentic, & w/ layers of flavor.

Will def be back soon!
author: Jess W.

description: Beef Curry Noodle Soup...Bomb!!  Food came quickly and the portions were just right.  Gonna have to try "Valcanoe" Hot next time.  Hot was only a 3 on my 10 scale.
author: Ira Y.

description:
My colleagues wanted to try this place for lunch today so we ordered a bunch of dishes. I was not in the mood for curry so I ordered a tempura udon which comes with a side salad and miso soup. 

Udon soup was lukewarm with spinach floating in it. Udon noodles were plentiful but the tempura was a dry oily piece of fried vegetable which ruined the meal. 

I would come back here to try their curry but no for their udon noodle soup!
author: Annie L.

description:
I had been looking forward to coming here for months because Japanese curry is one of my favorite comfort foods, but the food ended up being pretty disappointing. It's really a travesty that there aren't more Japanese curry places in San Francisco. 

I ordered the pork katsu for $9.95, and I got it spicy but I wasn't asked how spicy I wanted it, so I have no idea how spicy it actually was. There's probably like 12 tables in the restaurant, and they were all full on a Saturday night around 6:30 PM. It's kind of awkward when you do get a table and there are people standing and just staring at you. But such is eating out in San Francisco.

The food came out in roughly 12 minutes, and it was definitely a sizeable portion. The entire plate was covered, half with rice and half with curry. But when I looked at it, it looked like a sick joke. Where were the vegetables? There were 3 small chunks of potato, and 3 small chunks of carrot. How much are they really saving by skimping on the cheapest vegetables known to man? 

The pork katsu had a nice and crunchy coating, but the thinly sliced pork was a little overcooked and tough. The vegetables didn't really have that melt-in-your-mouth texture that is characteristic in good curries either; they were pretty bland and unexciting. The curry was decent and not overly salty, and there was definitely some heat that tasted kind of like Tapatio. There were some pickled onions below the pork which I wasn't a huge fan of. Unfortunately, the star of the dish was the rice, which was admittedly really well cooked and had a great texture. 

Ultimately, my meal tasted uninspired, and it was just made much worse by the laughable portion of vegetables on the plate. It looks like a pretty large portion when you first get it, but since half the plate is literally just sauce, it's not even that filling of a meal. It will do if you really have a craving for Japanese curry, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again.
author: Eric Y.

description: Here's one of those places that you just love and return to time and time again.  This is the Japanese katsu curry spot for the city. Now there are the standard options for a curry rice plate. But the real gem here is the sandwich.  Fried Chicken Cutlet, a touch of curry, some slaw, on toasted white bread; it's really amazing. I've been eating that sandwich there for years - recently some more hipster place in the Mission released a clone of it and charged way more.  Come here, it's legit.
author: David S.

description:
Being so close to work, this place is a good go-to for your Japanese Curry Fix. Usually pretty easy to get a table around weekday lunch time and the Food comes out in about 10 minutes.

Great selection of meats to go with the different spice levels of curry. I've had the Pork Katsu, Hamburger Steak, Beef Tendon, and Chicken Curry, along with the Katsu Spam mini sandwich. The average price I end up leaving here with is around $13-15 with all the toppings. 

The Pork Katsu is probably my favorite. Great juicy pork option, and has a good crunch. Plenty of rice to soak up the excess curry. 

I typically go for the HOT or the VOLCANO depending on how I am feeling. The hot isn't too hot, and the volcano can make you sweat, but it's not unbearable. 

Overall, not a bad place to get Japanese curry, I just think the prices are a tad bit too high for their toppings. Although that never stops me from ordering my fair share of toppings.
author: Paolo B.

description:
My favorite restaurant in town

I love their levels of spiciness - I've tried volcano and it took me the whole night to eat it haha I'd recommend hot for those who definitely want to feel the burn (let it burn #usher)

I'll recommend to grab the curry katsu (versus Muracci's) - $11 -$12 here and hold off on the chicken katsu here since its about $12 and others places are more quantity and cheaper for about the same thing lol

Hot curry noodle soup is bomb too

totally recommend to try if you love curry!
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Solid place for curry, and yes, volcano level is definitely spicy. Came here for dinner and was surprised at how tiny this place actually is. We luckily grabbed the last table for 2, there isn't too much seating in there. It's fast casual, you order food at the counter and the rest is all on you. 

Opted for one of the specials, beef tendon curry with volcano level spice. This dish had me lowkey sweating but I have a fairly good spice tolerance so it hurt in a good way. Know what I mean?? That's how you know it's a good spicy. My boyfriend opted for the karaage curry with a potato croquette and he says it was better than the katsu he ordered last time. Definitely going to come back here again and try their other tempura items!
author: Nicolette E.

description:
I've eaten here about 4 times now. Each time I've gotten the chicken katsu curry with the potato croquette, either the mild or medium spiciness. 

The curry sauce is well made - it's not too bland or too salty. The medium spiciness is just right for me, with a bit of sting. They could give you a bit more potato / carrots in the curry, but when combined with the rice and katsu it's a lot of food so that's ok.

Sometimes they give you so much rice that there isn't enough curry for all of it, but that might be because the dish would literally overflow if they gave any more. 

The katsu is tasty, and crispy. The potato croquette is also very tasty, with a slightly sweet flavor. However, it should be eaten on the spot as it can get soggy if it's stored for later.

All in all, for the price it's a great value especially in SF.
author: John L.

description:
This seems to be a really popular dining spot and I would of never known about it, if not for my old roommate. We wanted a sit down place for a simple dinner and she suggested Volcano. She was craving some Japanese curry and I'm not a fan of curry... but you know when fried katsu is involved, I'm all over it. 

We headed there on a Thursday, rainy sad, evening, and luckily found some street parking. The line wasn't too long and there wasn't much people dining inside. The menu is fairly simple. One side is for curry option (lots of different protein to select from and they have a special menu!) The other side was non curry options, noodles, sides, and sandwiches. 

You order first, get a number, and then grab a table, and wait for your food hungrily to come to you! I like that they tell you up front what 's in the curry so you're not always wondering: there's peanuts, dairy, wheat, and chicken stock. They also have different levels of spicy depending on what you like from mild to volcano (hence their store front name). 

I opted for the chicken katsu sandwich and it was pure enjoyment! It was on some deliciously soft brick toast bread stuffed with shredded cabbage, sauce, and katsu. It was breaded well and juicy on the inside! It wasn't Japan, but it gave Japan a good run for it's money. Plus, the portions were huge and the price was on the cheaper side.
author: Winnie G.

description:
The hot and delicious pick-me-up meal from your dreams!

We were craving something for the chilly day and Japanese curry was the perfect solution. I ordered the pork curry plate, which had a friendly portion size for a good price. Our food came out piping hot in record time which was really impressive. 

My curry was mild, but it still had good flavor and depth without so much heat. It did an incredible job as a standard curry and had all the fixings. The pork katsu was crispy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside. The rice was just right and tasty even without the curry. 

The general consensus from our group was that the food was solid and authentic but a super awesome wow factor didn't pop up. Therefore everyone's overall rating was about 4 stars. Still, I wanted to give it the fifth star just because of the feel good vibes I got from this whole place. 

Overall- tasty, good portions and perfect for a rainy day!
author: Irene R.

description:
I'm surprised at how long it's taken me to try this place out. I first had japanese curry in NYC (s/o go-go curry!) and easily was a fan, so I was curious of how the curry plates here compared.

I went with the original pork katsu curry plate and my bf had the chicken katsu curry. Both katsus were breaded ok, I feel like it could be crispier and each of the strips weren't that meaty. But the curry was flavorful and it just seems like there's a lot going on to notice.

Serving size is huge and really filling...definitely a hearty meal. Overall we enjoyed our plates and now that we know its tasty enough we can venture out to trying some toppings.
author: Georgina G.

description: Good food but poor service. There were people who ordered after me who got their food before I did and who got their food faster.  I waited 20 min for mine while they got their in half the time.  Wouldn't recommend going
author: Leighann M.

description: Excellent chicken katsu Hot curry, next time I think I will try the signature Volcano spiciness!! Definitely coming back
author: Christopher M.

description:
Incredible place for fast-casual, tasty Japanese curry! 

i got the pork curry katsu, "hot". The dish starts with a bed of hot rice, covered in the gravy-like Japanese curry, all topped with beautiful slices of fried pork cutlet. The pork is tender and moist, and the fry is tasty and crisp. The curry itself has hearty chunks of potato and soft slices of carrot.

If you're worried about getting the "hot" spice level, I got it my first time and it's spectacular. I've yet to try the "volcano" spice level, but perhaps I'll try it in a future visit. Till next time, Volcano!
author: Julien I.

description: So good at a reasonable price. Tastes homemade and is served quickly. The plate is filled to the brim; I'm so full after eating this. They also have vegetarian/non-peanut options, which is great for my friends. Can't go wrong with this place
author: Maddie A.

description:
This is a great place if you want casual comfort Japanese food, that to a long-time consumer of Japanese cuisine, tastes pretty authentic, and importantly, delicious!  

Different family members prefer different menu items, but my personal go-to are their non-curry plates, that range in price from $9-$13 for a main meat entree (eg. tonkatsu or deep-fried pork cutlet; chicken kara-age, or Japanese-style deep-fried chicken), rice, salad with their yummy house dressing, and miso soup. My only gripe is that, as with many restaurants, prices have steadily risen over the few years we've frequented here, and the volume has noticeably gone down.  Its understandable and we still take out from here at a pace of 2-4 times/month. Particularly when we're too tired to cook and require a hearty, balanced, tasty meal.
author: Hot Lunch Lad Y.

description:
I've been here a few times because it is close to my university and it's definitely a good place for katsu! This restaurant is on Geary so if you drive, know if you want parking in front it will likely be paid parking if there is any spaces available. If you luck out you can find parking on the residential streets off Geary that are free! If you're taking public transportation, the 38 drops off either right in front of it or a block a way -- either way the location of this restaurant is pretty accessible. 

I always order the chicken katsu dish and it comes out to a little over $10 (you pay before you eat). When you get your meal it is a beautiful plate filled with meat, curry, carrots, potatoes, and rice. I believe the price has been slowly raising through the years, but one plate is good enough to make a single decent person pretty full, so I might think it's worth it. 

The employees kind of just leave you alone -- part of the whole pay before you eat culture, which I personally like. You even get your own water from a pitcher on the counter. The last few times I've gone it hasn't been crowded at all and my party never had trouble getting a few tables together to eat as a full party. 

Overall, this place is decently priced and in a good location. I'll go here for the next katsu craving!
author: Danielle S.

description: So delicious, just the smell of walking in this place whets my appetite. Just the right amount of spice and love the pickles and vegetables.
author: Julian F.

description: The place to go when I'm craving for japanese curry! It is very flavorful and the meat is so tender. I love this place so much they offer different kind of curries like from beef to pork and chicken katsu.  Although I really haven't explored their menu yet but I'll definitely gonna try them one by one. It will surely give you the feels of home cooked meal from your momma
author: Salie E.

description:
Volcano is a Richmond classic. Is it the best and most authentic Japanese curry in the city? No. 
Is it tasty and hits the spot when you're craving something warm and fried? Yeup. 
I like to get the medium spicy curry. Do not order "volcano" spicy, you'll cry. 
All of the fried items are great, I usually go for the chicken Katsu or fried shrimp. 
Add a croquette and hard boiled egg and YOU ARE SET.
author: Antonio W.

description:
This is not my favorite restaurant, but I do regularly come here. In my circle of friends, this is one of the spots that we often settle on to grab some casual food. Like I said, it's not my favorite because it is definitely quantity over quality. You get heaping amounts of food for around $10. You really can't beat the price. If you want to overstuff your belly without breaking the bank, this is the place to be. 

I tend to get the chicken katsu curry and while good and satisfying, it is inconsistent. Sometimes the rice is hard. Sometimes the chicken has too much breading. The potatoes have a tendency to big undercooked. The curry itself is okay. I like how you can customize the heat level. I get medium and it is perfect for me. It has just a little bit of a kick, but I'm not guzzling water like a dog locked in a hot car. 

The place is super casual. You pay the lady, grab utensils and a glass of water, and seat yourself. You clean up after yourself too. The instructions for disposal at the trashcan are pretty detailed so no room for confusion (please don't be that person). The bathroom can be pretty sketch though.

BTW, you don't need a plate of curry to order toppings. If you wanted, you could just order several toppings and have yourself a little appetizer sampler. Not suggesting it though. I went that route once, and once was enough.
author: Kim W.

description:
We went to volcano because everyone and their mamas were telling me this place was amazing and I have to try it. So I tried it.

When we walked in the restaurant was pretty small. I ordered the chicken katsu curry medium and it was the perfect level of spicy! The water was self serve as well as getting your utensils and putting away your plates to the right trash cans. The curry was good, but in my opinion not as good as people were hyping it up to be. 

Overall, it was worth the price.
author: An L.

description: My favorite place to go on a cloudy day in the city. As a vegetarian, they do a tremendous job of serving a veggie-friendly katsu that is absolutely delicious!
author: Alicia R.

description:
TL;DR generous portion for a good price

I want to give 3.5 stars but am rounding up just because prices are very reasonable. The portions are huge and average to $10/meal. You can choose from four levels of spiciness for your curry. I got "volcano", which is the spiciest one. It was spicy, but not so spicy that I couldn't eat it anymore. The chicken to bread crumb ratio was also way off. There was a lot more Panko than chicken. Another thing weird was the curry wasn't hot, but lukewarm. I also got a mini chicken sandwich for $2.25. It really was mini- imagine the size of your palm (smaller if you have big hands).
author: Sophia L.

description:
The food here is good but the attitude and service of the people who work there is for SHIT!!! First of all, learn how to answer the fucken phone!! Theres no "hello" even! Just "what can I get you?" That's how they answer the Fucken phone! The problem here is the food is good so these Shitty Attitude Servers/Cashier really dont give a Shit because they know people will still go back for the food even when the food is served with SHITTY ATTITUDES! I hope they keep that SHITTYASS Attitude up because no matter how good the food is after people get fed up with these SHIT Attitude employees nobody will be going back because the first thing they will remember is their SHITTY ATTITUDE and say "it's not worth going there plus there are so many other places that have curry and better! 

Just remember how SHITTY THEIR ATTITUDES ARE AND RE-THINK TO GO ELSEWHERE!!
author: Rod W.

description:
This place was v v v v v v v v v v good ok??? Like wow it was everything that I was searching for in a curry place, Volcano really delivered the goods k? I got the Chicken Katsu which comes to around $10 after adding tax.

The portions are super generous and the chicken katsu comes out fried and piping hot! I waited five minutes to eat the chicken and it was still hot lmao, which is super good because you're eating it and you're like dam this was HOTT OFF THE FRYING PAN WITH TWO T's. The medium level of spiciness was perfect for me, not too spicy but definitely still had a kick, but I'd probably be a bit more adventurous next time and try one level up. 

I really enjoyed the chicken katsu and curry, both the flavor and the *temperature* (like idk why, the freshness of the chicken katsu is just so on point tbh) and food comes out super quickly and price is reasonable so um yes plz come here this is prob one of my fav restaurants that I have been to in SF LOVE IT
author: Brian W.

description:
Super long overdue review, but this place is simply amazing! I've been here at least 20 times in the past 3 years of living in SF! I was introduced to Volcano Curry from my Big and I'm glad she showed me this place! This place is my favorite place to get Japanese Curry. It's really cheap and the portions are huge. I always leave with leftovers for my next meal :) my boyfriend and I always get the chicken katsu curry with a potato croquette! So so good! A must get! 

This place gets really packed and it's hard to find seats since the place is small! The parking is hard to find so give yourself 10-15 minutes to find parking. They recently increased the prices but it's still affordable! :) 

I hope you give this place a try!
author: Katty X.

description: First time here visiting from Los Angeles. I liked it so much came here twice during our stay in the city. Tried the chicken and pork katsu at the volcano spicy level. On my scale of spice I'd rate volcano at 6/10. It's not so hot you can't taste your food but hot enough to give you some enjoyable heat but then again I eat spicy food all the time. My wife could not handle it. Love the simple menu, I'd recommend this to my friends should they crave Japanese Curry when in town. Prices very good.
author: Ryan D.

description: All curry is not created equal. There is nothing like going to another restaurant, and getting a bad version of something, to make you really appreciate Volcano.  Prices are great, portions are big, and food is consistently phenomenal. I'll never cheat on you again. Now if you could just deliver to my house. It's not far!
author: Monica F.

description:
Food: I only ever try the chicken katsu curry sometimes with a potato croquette. I definitely recommend this order! It's so good. The katsu is nice and crispy, the curry is in abundance and compliments the curry v well. There are also some carrots and soft white potatoes that come along with it that are also pretty good. You can ask for extra red pickles as well. 

Space: sometimes you might have to wait 10-15 minutes to be seated as the restaurant is small but they work really well to bring your food out once you're seated, warm and all. Seating clears up pretty quickly as well. 

Parking: it's sf, enough said.
author: Lili L.

description:
Hiked on the Batteries to Bluff trail in the morning and went to Volcano for a post-hike carb lunch! It was only a 10-15mins ride from Presidio Park. 

My boyfriend is allergic to nuts. A disclaimer note in the cashier table is shown to tell us that all of their curry contains nuts in it. So we ordered the katsu sandwich, a karage sandwich and croquettes. The katsu was crispy and balanced really well with the lettuce and sauce. (Just my personal preference: I would love to have more lettuce in my sandwiches :D) 

They provide water for free, which was perfect for a hot sunny day. 

Śervice was great, the girl in the cashier was very helpful and polite. My sole wish was that they had a curry option without nuts in it.
author: Marygrace C.

description: Just came back from Japan and have to say this curry is pretty authentic. Dish comes out hot unlike other places. Chicken isn't dry. Great portion size . Not 5 stars cause this isn't the best curry I've had...But would def come back if I want a quick Jap curry fix!
author: Isabelle C.

description: 2 small slices of potatoes. 2 small slices of carrots. 4 slivers of radish. I asked for more than they said it would be $1.50. Level 3 out of 4 spiciness wasn't spicy at all. Would not go here again. Bhugays is much better!
author: Chris L.

description: I liked my ginger pork curry . The pork I assumed would've been in small cubes, but were inconsistent in size and text. There were only three  pieces of potatoes,and three pieces of carrot. A nice ginger flavor to it, but when you say volcano in terms of heat I was very unimpressed with that description. Chicken katsu was also good just needed a few vegetables.
author: Steve K.

description:
Best place to get Japanese Curry in the city!

Been going here for several years, good food with decent prices. 

Customer service: It's ok (not the best), everything is self serve other then them taking your order. Fast, got our order around 10-15 mins after.

Serving is medium size.

Good amount of seating and there doesn't seem to be to much of a rush even during dinner time.

Food: Katsu was tasty and crispy, sauce was a good consistency and rice was good as well. They offer 4 levels of spicyness for the curry: Mild, Medium, Hot, and Volcano. I would go with Hot if you like slightly spicy because I orderes medium recently and it was not that spicy at all.

Prices: $10.80 after tax and you can also get add-ons which cost more money
author: Michele G.

description:
One of the best Japanese curry I've ever tasted.

I got the pork katsu in medium with a boiled egg and potato croquette. Let me just say, it is so damn good that I could go for seconds. I am normally not a huge curry fan either so that says a lot. They give a generous portion of rice and katsu. They are not stingy with their sauce which is perfect because you could mix it in with rice. Although it is really carb-y, I'd say it's worth the calories. 

The parking isn't ideal but you'll most likely find a spot if you circle around. Just wished this place has brighter lighting. It reminded me of restroom lights which isn't the most appetizing. Overall, I would come back if I ever want any legit Japanese curry.
author: Anny W.

description: Spicy n tasty, krispy white meat on the chicken katsu. Like the potatoes and carrots in curry sauce.
author: Corinne Z.

description:
Ordered takeout from here and the portions were a good size! It tasted pretty close to curry I would get in Los Angeles but the one thing I missed was the pickled jar that should have been on the table or on the condiment stand. I only had about 6 little pieces when I constantly want spoonfuls with every bite. 

Wish there were more vegetables but then again thats just me wanting more carrots. The chicken katsu was not soggy once I got home and was perfectly fried. Ill be back
author: Nats S.

description:
This is a small little shop that serves some pretty good Japanese curry. I really enjoyed the food here and would come back.

You order at the counter and they bring the food out to you. Prices vary, since you can customize what comes in your dish, but you can probably expect to pay $9-11. The dish itself is quite large which you can share with two people, so it's a pretty good deal.

The food itself came out very quickly (~2 min). It's very yummy and filling. Maybe the curry was a slightly too watery but still delicious regardless. Great place for a quick meal!
author: Desmond C.

description: this isnt a chain, which i like. unlike chain's these types of restaurants are made to a specific taste that make the flavor super fresh. I love their chicken katsu curry, always been my favorite. Customer service is great and food is always delicious! Definitely recommend to everyone who has never had japanese curry to try this place
author: Shaeli Z.

description:
We went to Volcano on a Sunday around 5:30pm and there was a few people in line with a few people seated at the tables. 

This place requires you to get in line, order what you want, they'll give you a number to place at your table so they know where to deliver the food. You get your own cups of water and when you were finished, you bus your own table.

Service: 1/5
Since this place requires you to service yourself, there's not much service to speak of since you clean your own table and get your own water.

Food: 3.5/5
We chose the chicken katsu. It was nicely breaded. The portion is pretty big although they are a bit skimpy on the veggies and the potatoes were a bit undercooked. The food was a bit spicy for my taste, but we probably chose too high of a spiciness level, although I'm weak against spice...

Cleanliness: 4/5
The place is reasonably clean, and even the single bathroom was pretty clean considering the fact that most places that have single bathrooms are a lot dirtier.

Overall score: 3/5
Would I go back? Maybe... I wouldn't specifically go here though...
author: Gilda W.

description: Good curry,.. i like how you can customize your curry here by choosing your meat, and then adding toppings,.. they have a variety of topping(spam, sausage, cheese, etc) i got the pork tonkotsu curry,.. and it was good,.. i didnt customize because i wanted to taste the curry by itself, and i liked it,.. the only problem i have was the spice level(i chose volcano level spice),.. i thought it would be really spicy (i mean volcano is hot), but it wasnt that spicy(id say hotter than the usual medium level spice im accustomed) maybe its just me,.. but id say try the usual level you are comfortable with then go from there,.. i wouldnt recommend it if you are not good at handling spicy food,.. i also liked the portion of the food and curry that they give you,.. not the best curry in the city, but u definitely get you money's worth if you like curry,..
author: Chester V.

description: There's something tantalizing about the smell of Japanese curry and you just gotta have some! Volcano is a no frills curry shop. You can choose your spice and they'll put curry on top of many things besides katsu (I had it with karaage and it was delicious). I like that the curry has a sweetness to it. It's just yummier that way!
author: Sherry L.

description:
First time at this restaurant and it was delicious! It wasn't crowded when I went around 6pm and the service was faster than other restaurants. The employees were very nice and helped us with the menu and our questions. 

I ordered the chicken katsu curry with a hot spice level and it was very delicious! The dish also came with some veggies and a lot of white rice! Very filling. I also ordered the potato croquette which was good, but nothing too impressive. For anyone going there for the first time, I would highly recommend the chicken katsu curry. 

Overall, very good restaurant! Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for some delicious curry!
author: Ethan N.

description:
I'm actually rounding up, but if I can have an honest rating, I'd give it 3.6 stars. Maybe we came in on an off day, but my husband and I thought that it was only pretty good. Also, during our visit there were flies around...didnt bother us, but idk how anyone else would feel about that.
We searched for a good curry place after a long hike and found this one. We got the chicken katsu curry with potato croquette (level spicy) and the pork katsu curry with a boiled egg and potato croquette as well (level medium spicy). Overall the plates tasted pretty good...but that's about it, nothing spectacular, just good and very average. The boiled was just a regular hard boiled egg, but wonder if it would have left a better impression if it was a soft boiled egg??...
The pros would be that it's a good place if you want something quick, very affordable that's not too crowded and has pretty good food!
author: Cat C.

description: Came here yesterday with my boo thang since he was craving for curry and I wanted some good chicken katsu. It was both out second time here, and it surely didn't disappoint. However, I'm giving 4 stars because the portion size for what I'm paying is too small. I'm a tiny person, but I sure can eat a looot! I just wish the portions were bigger. I can literally eat two orders of the chicken katsu myself in one sitting.
author: Annie Y.

description: The pic shows how much red pickles they give you. The one with more is the free pickles added. Make sure you ask for utensils for Togo orders, they are stingy on that, it was not the first time I had to wait till 11:30pm when I got home to have a fork to eat the dinner.
author: A L.

description: Average.  Prefer murracci,  but service was good.  Pork katsu breading was great. The actual meat was decent but not spectacular. I like my curry quite thick, and this one was a bit thin. I would consider coming back to give it a chance
author: David L.

description:
First, the location is easy to find, the parking is kind of hard especially during lunchtime. But after a few circles, found metered parking right infront. 

The restaurant itself is kind of small with a few tables. The lady that was in the register is very nice and friendly.
We got the mild chicken katsu curry and the pork katsu curry with fried shrimp, fried potato croquette and sausages. I also got two miso soups, strawberry calpico and coke on the side. The total would be around $40 because we got a lot of toppings.

For me, the price that we paid is worth it. The miso soup was warm and tasty, the katsu's, fried shrimp and fried croquette are freshly made, crunchy and delicious. The Japanese curry was thick in consistency and the taste was so good, the veggies were also yummy!

I would go back again!
author: Nikki V.

description:
Ordering at Volcano is easy! 1. Choose curry. 2. Choose toppings (approx 1.25 each). 3. Choose spiciness level.  
The musts of Volcano: 
-Fukujinzuke pickles (THIS IS A MUST. TRUST ME. ) 
-Cheese
-Chicken or pork katsu ($9.95)

The food comes out really quick. The portions are also gigantic so those with smaller appetites could potentially share.  Clean and bus your own dishes! Overall, great place to fulfill anyone's Japanese curry craving.
author: Sara S.

description:
My friends and I came here the other day since one of our friends from the SF area hyped up this spot and recommended this place to us. I was super excited for some curry but saw that their curry had peanut butter in it, which I'm allergic to. Instead, I ordered the chicken katsu plate without curry which came with rice, salad, and miso soup. Two of my friends, on the other hand, ordered the chicken katsu with curry. We thought that the food was average, nothing too special. 

The restaurant was crowded so it was hard to find a seat in the store. The cashier seemed rather tired and unhappy, which I understand since it was pretty busy. They also have a designated area for customers to put away their cups and dishes after they're done with their meal.
author: Tracy C.

description:
Haven't really had much Japanese curry experience but I was hooked on Volcano's chicken katsu curry. 
The katsu's chicken meat was juicy and tender wrapped around a light crisp breading. Not too much breading nor was it greasy. The curry sauce was spot on and flavorful. 
I recommend getting the pickled veggies and egg on the side. 

This is a casual, self-service kinda place so don't expect anything fancy. Just some good 'ol straightforward Japanese curry.
author: Carmela A.

description:
ORDER SPICY W/ JALAPENOS!! So good. Tangy with a little kick to it. 

I would come back again. Happened to be in the city on a personal matter and since traffic was crazy decided to look up a curry craving. Found this place and I'm surprised by it. It's really good, I got the pork katsu mild with extra fukuzinzuke , my husband got the same pork katsu but in spicy with jalapenos and OMG! So flavorful! I was so jealous, next time I am getting the spicy with jalapenos. It was really good and worth coming back. 

The reason for the mark down is because with my curry I don't like huge chunks of carrots and potatoes and I feel they could be a tad smaller to make it more appetizing and consistant. Just my opinion. 

No photos- I had it to-go and I just dove in lol
author: Aly P.

description:
Some of the best things in the life are the simplest things. Volcano does an incredible job making simple, comforting, delicious Japanese curry over rice. I've had the chicken and the beef curry and both were fantastic. It's well seasoned, the flavor isn't salty or overwhelming with spices, and there's something about this combination of food that always hits the spot.

All things considered, it's a fairly sized restaurant with plenty of tables. The menu is pretty straight forward letting you choose between the protein you want in your curry. Everything will set you back about $10 and portions are big enough to share between two people who aren't starving. But let's be honest, who wants to share? Get your own dish and enjoy!
author: Corey P.

description: Most astonishing curry I've had in my life and would definitely come back!! Come here if you want good ass curry. XD
author: Sammi L.

description:
Tasty, but more like 3.5 stars. I'll round up. I ordered the chicken curry, and added in mushrooms. The curry was solid.

But, there was so little pickles that came with it. I ordered the mild, and my husband ordered the medium. I tasted the both side by side and his was a lot more flavorful. I thought the only difference would be in the spiciness level, but apparently when you go mild, you go mild on everything. I also wish the toppings could be less fried or just pan fried instead of deep fried everything. oh well.
author: Cynthia X.

description:
Searched curry places in SF post-hike and came upon this one! The biggest turn off for me was the area that it was in. Parking was kinda crazy, but it didn't take too, too long to find a spot! 

We ordered the pork katsu curry (spice level: volcano) with pickles (+$1.50) and a chicken katsu curry (spice level: medium) with cheese, croquette, and shrimp. I liked my pork katsu! The curry was pretty yummy as it came with vegetables! The curry that I ordered with volcano spicy wasn't that spicy, so if you're a spice lover - definitely get that level! I'm glad that they were super generous with the pickles as they charged an additional $1.50 for it when most places don't charge for that item. The chicken katsu was juicy, but I was definitely not a fan of the cheese with it. Overall, portions are huge so if you're in need of a quick, cheap bite - come here!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
A friend of mine told me months ago that I need to try this place out, and I finally did!

FOOD: A lot and spicier than I was expecting! I will say, however, that the curry I got had very minimal pieces of carrot and potato within the curry sauce and only like 4 small slices of the pickles... It was still good though :) It's super filling since it's a lot of rice, a lot of curry sauce, and a decent portion of katsu (or whatever you choose) on top!

INSIDE: It was pretty loud.. If you're softspoken or hard of hearing, it would definitely be difficult to hear your friends or maybe even yourself! It's also a quaint little space with not too many seats. 

While I may not be back to dine in any time soon for this place, I would definitely be down to get a takeout order from here.
author: Nadine F.

description: Small place, limited menu. Seating limited. I ordered Chicken Katsu with Curry (medium spice)... it was OK.  Street parking.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: I like volcano. However my issues here are with the lack of white meat chicken for the Katsu. Given that a large portion of customers would prefer breast meat over dark meat, especially for these prices, it would make sense to offer breast meat even if it adds a dollar to the cost. Also they are a bit stingy with the shrimp on the shrimp Curry. 425 pieces of shrimp is totally fair, three are not. The atmosphere here is good but very basic. Come here for the Curry, get spicy and you'll be pretty happy
author: Eric A.

description:
Even though their curry seems to be the ones you can buy in the store, their chicken katsu and chicken karage are definitely well made. 

The chicken katsu is super crispy and the chicken is pretty soft. The chicken karage definitely has a crunch. I do wish they gave a little more chicken karage though. 

They give you some potatoes and carrots along with your curry plate, which I love. 

I always get the Medium spice since I don't handle spice that well, but I do enjoy the spicy flavor. 

This is basically like comfort food to me, so I will enjoy eating here. I think you will too.
author: Allyson L.

description: This place literally is as epic as an erupting volcano. Oh man. Sooooo delicious. Chicken Katsu is my favorite but everything here is on point. They use good quality ingredients and you can tell. The prices are low and the service is fast. They also have a great rewards program and generally this is one of my fav spots in the Richmond district. The curry can be very spicy so only get the "volcano" spicy level if you can realllly handle it. I go with the medium typically unless I am sick and really need to clear out my sinuses! Can't say enough good about this place. 5+ stars all day
author: Ian S.

description:
I love japanese curry, and the curry katsu over right here is the bomb! Make sure to grab a drink with your meal as the curry is a little on the salty size- I killed my friend's remaining rice just so I could soak up more curry :D

Also, you can set your level of spiciness- Definitely go for HOT if you're looking for the burn- the levels are a little on the high side (even the medium gives you a little heat)

Enjoy the great good at great prices! Love the Richmond!
author: James L.

description:
There wasn't much service, you come in order and they bring it to you and that's about the extent of their service. Service wasn't bad or good just absent in my opinion. The atmosphere of the restaurant is very mediocre at best. It's a little hole in the wall place, the door is constantly open so flies can fly in and out. It just isn't the cleanest place out there. I give the store a 3/5 for . 

The food was decent. It lacked in the presentation and spice dimension. I ordered the fried fish at the hot level. The fish had no flavor at all, just bland. Te potatoes and carrots the same. The only semi-redeeming factor was the spiciness of the curry that gave the plate its little flavor. The food I give a 2/5. I think there is room for improvement but if you're a college student looking for a cheap filling meal, this is your spot.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Maybe was an off day when we went to visit this place but it wasn't as good as I hoped it would be. 

Curry with Chicken Cutlet: The curry had the heat to it, the cutlet was kind of thin though, leaving most of it to the breading only. The potatoes and carrots had no flavor to it, left me too full to finish 3/5

Teriyaki Chicken : So dry and bland. Don't get , this is a curry katsu place... 1/5

Volcano Katsu: The katsu was very fresh, and for some reason thicker than the one in the curry. 3/5

Curry Katsu: Same as the chicken. 3/5


Self served - so no service commentary. Clean up after yourself please!
author: Carol T.

description:
Curry: 4.5/5
Katsu: 3.5/5
Service: 4.25/5

Curry is good! May not be my favorite curry place in town, but it's definitely good!

Katsu: Pork katsu wasn't tender, nor juicy. It had a rougher texture than what pork katsu is supposed to have. The katsu fried skin came off it easily, I was literally eating a half skinned tonkatsu and eating the second half of the skin that fell off in different bites. Experience wise that's a no-no. However, this is a consistency issue. I've been here several time and the katsu isn't always this bad, it's normally fine, but consistency is dinging my score to 3.5/5.

Service: totally unobtrusive, but smiles are rarely given.
author: Alvin D.

description: My go to place for the best curry. Always crave their chicken katsu with curry. Yum. The prices are great. Gets a little crowded but that's because the food is worth it.
author: Jr D.

description: Best takeout in SF. Can't find better curry. The Chicken Katsu is next level. Try it with a croquette and cheese. The cheese is a little weird to think about but once you try it you can't go back.
author: Bobby B.

description: I don't understand why this place has 4 stars. They messed up on several of our orders. First there was no more beef curry soup, then there was no beef at all. How can you not have beef during a Saturday lunch? I asked for no rice and substituted with extra salad for my katsu plate and I still ended up with rice. Also only got 4 small pieces of chicken katsu, definitely not worth the price. I was still hungry afterward. Then the katsu mini-sandwich never came and I had to order again.
author: Cathrin P C.

description:
We were actually planning to go to a pho place for dinner after a full day of hiking, but parking in Richmond is actually so horrible. I think we circled around for about 30 minutes before finding a spot 3-4 blocks away, and by that time, that pho place was almost closed. Yelp came to the rescue and suggested Volcano nearby, so we thought we'd give it a try. We were also super hungry, so food in general sounded good lol.

Since this was a curry place, I figured I would get curry. I had a sore throat, so I was contemplating either the normal chicken curry or the katsu (since crunchy things might scratch my throat), but I opted for the katsu anyways because katsu is delish haha.

- Chicken katsu curry: this was so delicious I can't even explain. I'm so glad I went with my heart and got the chicken katsu because the chicken was so tender and the coating was perfectly thin and crispy. The only thing is that there wasn't very much vegetables/potatoes (it looked a bit sad in the curry sauce that covered half the plate). Nevertheless, the curry itself was decent, but it's really the chicken katsu that was hands down the best thing on the plate. I got hot for spice level, but I think I could have tried volcano (the spiciest) hehe. But maybe it was because I was sick, my senses were dampened :P Maybe I'll give volcano spice level a shot next time haha.

Highly recommend! I'd come back for the chicken katsu :D
author: Joanna C.

description:
My only real complaint is that I want more!

The location is pretty easy to get to and park around (at least when I went). 

The vibe is very much a neighborhood stop-in eatery and it doesn't get huge traffic, but seemed like a steady stream of people coming in during dinner-ish time. 

Food was great. The potato croquette is awesome! it's really a mandatory side to order. The curry was spicy and hot. I just wish there were MORE! This really says more about my obsession with curry than the restaurant's portions.

I'll definitely be back if I'm ever in the area again.
author: Jacky C.

description:
My friend and I came to volcano in hopes of having some delicious curry, but was sadly disappointed. While ordering, the cashier told us they ran out of white rice, so our only option was to order brown rice - which was fine with us, until she decided to charge us EXTRA. What the heck - why are you charging us extra for running out of white rice?! This was completely your fault!

We actually didn't notice they had charged us extra until they already ran the card and saw it on the receipt, but we brought it to their attention, hoping this was a mistake, and they said they couldn't do anything about it. She said she can only give us one extra point for five star, which meant nothing to us because we already have a free meal for the next and last time we go.
author: Carrie L.

description: We had Katsu and Beef noodle soup.  They were fresh and tasty.  I will definitely come back again to try other menu.
author: EunJoo C.

description: Very solid curry, always good, and always hits the spot. I usually get the chicken or pork katsu. The chicken karage is also good. The hot spiciness level is perfect for me. I wish it comes with some more veggies so the meal would be more balance. Even if I add veggies, like eggplant, it only comes with a few (less than 5) pieces. So adding veggies is definitely not worth it for the price of $1.50 - $2.50.
author: Michelle T.

description:
My go to spot when I'm in the mood for curry and I'm in a hurry (really didn't mean for that to rhyme). I highly recommend the katsu curry (pork or chicken). Everything is always fresh and the portions are even enough for a big eater like me. I've had some of the other grilled chicken dishes but nothing really compares to the katsu as the outside is always perfectly crispy with a tender inside.

I'd also highly recommend their mini sandwiches-- spam katsu is pretty amazing.

Environment is very casual and usually a younger crowd (hs/college kids) with pretty limited sitting. Try to dine in as you want the katsu to stay crunchy! Enjoy!
author: Kelvin C.

description:
I ate at Volcano a couple of years ago and I came here again today for dinner. I was going to go for the Chicken Katsu or Karaage but then I saw a special curry menu right under their original menu! The Fried Oyster Curry caught my eye and I had to order it!

Food - 

**Fried Oyster Curry - My order came with four pieces of fried oysters along with some pieces of carrots and potatoes. The oysters were perfectly fried and the curry was really good! I don't like my food too spicy so I can taste it so I chose my level of spiciness to "medium" which was perfect for me! 

Service - You walk straight to the register to order and you get a number and they hand you your food when it is ready. My order took about 10 minutes at the most!

Overall, I will recommend this place if you are a fan of curry. The price is cheap and the portions are generous. I still needed a box to go for the leftovers!
author: Allie Y.

description:
Good for value. Portion is huge (lots of rice n huge Katsu)
Quick service (5ish min waiting time from order to getting the food) 
Came here on a weekday for lunch, n best thing is no line. This place is def under radar :-) 
Tried the level 4 (out of 5) and it was still bearable. Will come back to try the spiciest they have.
author: Hester D.

description:
I've written one star reviews for Volcano because of my sheer saltiness of not being able to get my favourite dish and I'm sorry.

The best thing is karaage curry with cheese and then tonkatsu curry with cheese. I always get medium spicy or hot.

But I hope no one else loves it as much as I do because the reason for my previous one star reviews is because they sold out!! 

But really, this is probably the closest thing we have to Coco Curry in San Francisco... but please tell me if you know of another curry place!! (Cheese add-on is a must)
author: Becca W.

description: Still so good but I think prices went up. The spice level was off today so I asked for their hot sauce on the side. It tasted much better but when I finished my plate with the spoon that was concentrated without the curry mix, my tongue started burning so be careful. Love this place.
author: Minh H.

description:
Volcano is my go-to spot for Japanese curry in the bay area. You order at the counter, get a number, then wait for your order to be served at your table.

There are almost always a table available when I'm there anytime of the day. The space and tables are always clean.

An order averages to around $9, so pretty good pricing for lunch/dinner. I usually order pork/chicken katsu curry. Any add ons is additional charge.

I removed a star because service and order is always inconsistent. Sometimes there would be like 15 pieces of carrots/potatoes, sometimes I get 4... and occasionally there is a layer of oil over the curry. I mean the taste is the same either way.
author: Sarah T.

description: This is the best Japanese curry dish that I've ever had! The best thing about this dish is the sauce, it's so good it tastes great with everything in this dish. I had the chicken curry when I was here and it was $8.95. It was the perfect Japanese curry dish with the rice, vegetables, sauce and chicken cutlet being cooked and fried to perfection. The food is reasonably priced and is actually quite filling. Also the food comes out super quick so that's a big bonus. I'd really recommend this place to anybody who wants delicious, cheap food in this area or if they want really good Japanese curry!
author: Christopher L.

description: I thoroughly enjoy this spot. I have been coming here for years and I like the fact that you can customize your order to make it healthier. My personal favorite is the spinach and chicken hot curry with brown rice and an egg. You really can't go wrong. Their katsu is also delicious!  If you like spicy I would recommend even going for the volcano option. The idea of spicy here is a little on the mild side
author: Michael B.

description: Very yummy Japanese curry! I came here with my family and ordered a pork katsu plate without curry,  beef curry,  and chicken curry.  The plate without curry comes with salad, but has less rice than the curry plates. We shared so I got to try all of them. I liked how they add some carrots and potatoes to the curry plates too besides meat. I like the no-frills restaurant setting where you get your own utensils,  water,  and napkin.  You also bus your own plates,  so you don't need to tip much. (I tipped a dollar knowing how hard it is to work at a restaurant,  since I worked at my college's dining hall before.) Reasonable prices and yummy food! However, they don't have the chicken teriyaki no curry rice plate anymore.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Cheap and large portions- what more could you ask for when you want to grab a quick bite to eat? Easy to order to-go or to sit at the tables with friends. It's not full service, so no need to go through that nonsense. Just figure out what kind of curry you want, the toppings, and spice level. 

Now a lot of people are knocking Volcano and giving it only three or four stars, but it deserves five stars from me because I'm always satisfied and it's so quick to receive. I always order chicken katsu personally, but I don't think you can go wrong with chicken or pork.
author: Arezou A.

description:
If you are looking for something quick and relatively cheap, then Volcano is the way to go! 

I've been a frequent diner for the past year, because my boyfriend is a fan of this place. I like to switch it up between the Chicken Katsu Curry and the Chicken Katsu Plate as the breading is amazing! The pork is good, as well!

Portion sizes are generous to share with. Service is quick. One thing I am not a fan of is that the shop is small in size. It's not really an issue until it gets busy and tables get full.

Lastly, a friendly reminder that those yummy toppings do add up and it can get pricey. Also, prepare yourself, parking is no fun around this area.
author: Julia L.

description:
I'm lame and only get the same thing everything (Chicken Katsu w/mediYum curry, and sausage topping), but man is it good! The place is popular so it can get busy, but the staff is friendly and your food comes up quick.

I don't live in the Richmond anymore, but for sure don't mind going out of my way to pick it up,
author: Josh S.

description: I absolutely love Japanese curry, so when I came into town my friend recommended this place and I can say I does not disappoint. The place really is a littlw whole in the wall, but those are some of the best. You walk in and order what kind you want and choose 1-4 spicy level. I got the pork katsu curry with level 3(hot). It was amazing. As someone from Tucson, Az where everything is spicy, the hot was hot but not over whelming. The service was great and professional. If I lived next to this place it would become an addiction. Wish we had a place like this in Tucson!!
author: Troy H.

description: The food is really good! It's my favorite curry and their toppings are great! Sometimes it takes a while for your food to be ready, but hey that means that it's fresh, right? One thing that bothers me is that they aren't consistent with their spicy levels so sometimes when I get medium it's spicier than other times and that sometimes they're stingy with the amount of veggies or the pickles they give you! Overall I really like the veggie curry and how filling this place is!
author: Linda N.

description: I ordered the chicken katsu volcano curry because I wanted to test out how spicy it was. This is the spiciest curry I've ever tasted in my life. My mouth was literally on fire for a good 10 minutes LOL... So, if you're into spicy food and is down for a potential heartburn, go for it! Just make sure you have a cold drink with it! I prefer getting the spicy level in hot instead though because it's more enjoyable and your mouth doesn't feel constantly on fire.
author: Kristi A.

description:
Pretty good. I recommend calling ahead if you're getting take out as it can take some time. However, good easy cheap Japanese curry in the Richmond. 
Only tried chicken katsu here and it hits the spot.
author: Ariel P.

description: I don't really go out of my way for curry, but when my friends want to try it.. I guess I'll go with them. I ordered the pork Katsu curry plate without any add-ons. I really like how the pork Katsu doesn't break once you bite into it! The plate was practically filled with curry sauce and two pieces of vegetables... heh. I wish they added more pieces of vegetables for a bigger variety of sides to go with the rice instead of just the meat.
author: Sarah F.

description:
This place is located in the heart of Geary Blvd, where there are a tremendous amounf of options on where to eat dinner.  I decided on getting take out from this place because I wanted curry.  The menu is pretty much a construct your own type meal with any of the ingredients.  I ordered the chicken katsu.  I also added a potato croquette, an onion croquette, and an egg.  I also like how there is a brown rice option, but (of course) with an up-charge.  The total cost of the meal went from $9 to over $18 with those add ons.   

The wait time was ten to fifteen minutes, which seemed completely reasonable.  There were also a few orders before mine.  The presentation of the meal was great.  I appreciated how the curry was in a separate to go container so that nothing gets soggy.  The chicken itself was delicious, and the curry was very flavorful.  The potato croquette tasted as I expected, and was A-OK.  The onion croquette was very intriguing, but in a good way.  It was unlike anything I have ever tasted.  It was creamy, and sweet, and a little bit salty.  

The only downside to this place are the potatoes, carrots, and the egg.  The potatoes and carrots would taste a lot better if they were cooked longer.  They tasted raw and crunchy, which was not pleasant.  I wish they offered fried eggs instead of boiled eggs.  Boiled eggs seem too mediocre.  I think fried eggs would complement the dish better, especially with the curry sauce smothered all over.
author: Victor L.

description: If your ever in the area. Volcano has some bomb ass curry! I got the Curry Mild but instead of Chicken Katsu I got spam katsu and I was not disappointed. I also got their tempura noodle soup and it was exactly what I wanted. Good food at a great price! Parking wasn't too good, crowded area with numerous vendors so we drove around a few times but it was worth it!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Solid 4 star restaurant, the cleanliness is probably 3 starts, but nice to get a quick bite.  I like their chicken curry over rice.

They are also conveniently located by my favorite sushi restaurant. Atmosphere is cozy and space is small but not too small.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Omg, this place has the RUDEST cashier ever! Gave us attitude when my bf couldn't pronounce an item, gave me attitude when I asked for our order for to go after waiting 15+ minutes for 4 MINI fucking sandwiches?! (What in the actual F***???) when our order was ready, threw our Togo box at our table, didn't even have the decency to give us a bag and wanted to charge us for it? And gave me attitude and talked while walking away? Lady, with that attitude and how you treat customers who spend money at your work place, you're going nowhere with that attitude. That's no way to treat anyone in general. Throughout these whole time, she gave us stares and mean mugged us the whole time. She ignored customers and did not make anyone feel comfortable. I need to speak to someone whose in charge about this, I am deeply disturbed by her treatment.

The food was good. But her attitude made it taste disgusting.
author: Karen S.

description:
I live in South Bay but I've been here maybe 6 times in the past 2 months. It's sooo good and addictive. I always get the volcano chicken Katsu curry with spam and egg. (Go big or go home). Def recommend. 

The only issue I have is the inconsistency of the spice level. Some days the volcano curry is so spicy I can't finish it and go through 2 glasses of water, while other days it tastes more like The "hot" curry.
author: Dee Dee T.

description: I got food poisoning from the chicken katsu, so please check your ingredients. I was sick for a whole day with the biggest stomach ache I've ever felt
author: Alvaro B.

description: This place was really popping right before closing on a Friday night. The service was fairly friendly and there was a good selection of food. I ordered a hamburger curry and it was pretty good. I wish there was more..bite or even a little bite to their curry. The place has a lot of seating but is pretty crowded with people. It's moderately clean and isn't all dressed up like some places. The price is OK too.
author: Jenn T.

description: First time coming here and it will definitely be my last. The unhappy waitress/host was extremely rude. From the moment I ordered, she was short and so unfriendly. I ordered the chicken Katsu for lunch for $11 and it was the worst $11 bucks ever spent. Rice was chewy and not hot and the salad was just green spinach with some mayo sauce (yuck), the chicken was on a bed of cold shredded cabbage like someone sprinkled cinnamon on it. Then when I asked the unhappy waiter for a side of gravy for my 4. yo son, she seemed bothered that I talked apparently and tried to charge me $4 for a side of gravy (my meal is $11). This place is highly priced for the lack of quality. Get better food and better service!!! No wonder this place is always so empty.
author: Nikki T.

description: On chilly days when you're really hungry, this simply hits the spot. They give generous portions at a reasonable price. I got the pork katsu, which is garnished by a few vegetables. If you want more variety, go for the sides. I got it medium spicy and it had a nice kick. Adventurous diners should definitely checkout volcano lol and see if it lives up to the name. The curry overflows the half the dish satisfyingly too. It was a really hearty meal.
author: James N.

description: For chicken katsu it is one of the best in SF. Chicken is extremely moist. Curry has a range of spice levels which actually can be quite spicy. Go for the volcano!!! Don't be deterred by the atmosphere! Staff is friendly, they delivered mine to another table and without even trying to give it to me they immediately said a fresh one would be right out. Definitely will return!
author: Brandon F.

description: If you've had Coco-Ichibanya in Irvine or elsewhere in Southern California, this comes pretty close to it. I got the Chicken Katsu Curry - w/ the Volcano level of spiciness (highest end of the spicy scale). The curry was amazing, though it didn't really wow me as much as most other Japanese curries I've had in the past. The texture of the Chicken Katsu was perfect for my dish - they did well on the breading of it to deliver that nice, scrumptious crunch that you look forward to when eating Chicken Katsu. I would not recommend the volcano spicy level unless you can handle really spicy food. I grew up eating Lao/Thai food so this was tolerable for me - had a really good kick though nonetheless.
author: Jerry V.

description:
If you're looking for a quick bite to eat then this is the place to go! I ordered the chicken katsu and the order came out pretty quick and it was hot! So the katsu was super crispy and that's how I like it!

Another good plus about this place is that if you play pokemon-go there is a pokestop here! =)
author: Sherry L.

description:
My friends have been wanting to take me to this place. They live in the city, and go here all the time. I haven't had japanese curry since I was in Japan a year ago, so I was excited!!

Parking in this area is always a nightmare. What ever spot you see... TAKE IT!!!

The restaurant is rather small. It could probably seat about 25-30 people. It looks a little old inside, but most of the time, its the hole in the wall restaurants that serve the best food. 

The service was all right. Basic service for what you get at a quick eatery. 

There wasn't a line when we walked in, so I was able to scope out the menu. I played it safe and got the pork katsu curry volcano (I like it spicy!), and added a fried shrimp and potato croquette (it was recommended). Both of my friends ordered the chicken katsu curry medium. One added potato croquette and the other added sausage. We grabbed water cups and seats.

When our food came it looked and smelled soooooo good. While I was taking my typical food picture, one of my friends said that his curry was way too spicy for medium, so I tasted mines comparing it to his. I think they accidentally swapped our plates, so we asked them just to make sure. The girl suspects they might have had a mix up too. No biggie, we switched plates. Then he begins to eat again, but now he says that it wasn't chicken (which is what he ordered). We assumed it was the pork I ordered, so we asked the girl again to double check... which one is the chicken and which is pork. She explained to us that the chicken is longer in length, so we switched the meat on our plates. It was starting to get frustrating. My friend then asked how many sausage comes with a side order because the price he paid was too much for just ONE. She looked at him confused, and said its suppose to come with TWO. She apologizes for all the mishaps, and offers to fix it by bringing him another sausage. She even asked if there was anything else we wanted, so that she could give it to us on her. It wasn't her fault, so that was nice of her to offer, but we were fine. A few minutes later she brings out the sausage. Then my other friend notices that we didn't get any pickles. I my friend if she was certain all plates come with pickles, and she was certain because she loves the pickles with her curry, and she always has it without having to ask. We told the girl again, and she was so shocked with everything that was wrong with our orders! She apologized again for all of the mess ups, but at this point I just wanted to eat and go...

Food was pretty good. I knew going in that it wouldn't be anything like Japan, but it does the job. I preferred the fried shrimp over the pork katsu. I was never a fan of potato croquettes, and I'm still not. My friend really likes it, so I gave mines to her. If I ever go back, I'd try the fried oyster curry.

This was my first time here, and my experience wasn't so great. I hope that it was just a off day, but even that was the case... isn't okay because who knows how many first timers walk in there? They might just think that's how the business is and not come back. I'm willing to give it one more try if I'm in the area. I just wouldn't go out of my way to go here.
author: Lily T.

description:
For those who grew up with Golden Curry-integrated meals, this place hits the spot for those longing curry+rice meals. Come here for fast comfort food and a casual vibe. I love that this place is order/pay first and then self-seating/helping with the water and utensils. This place is rather small so don't try bringing your group of 10 as they only have 2-person tables.

The rice+curry plates are super simple, super yum--basically you order a meat which comes with curry (some potatoes/carrots) and rice, and you can add toppings/sides. Portions are filling and reasonably-sized.There are spicy levels but the spice is one of those after-taste spice if you are into that (medium spice is very doable). I tried the chicken karage which was juicer than the fish katsu (dry) but both had pretty decent flavor--wasn't a gross frozen-type meat you'd find at food trucks (my first chicken karage came from a food truck: never again). 

Only thing I didn't like was the huge, largely-uncooked potato chunks. I wish there were more veggies than just carrots and potatoes but I guess that's what the toppings are for (a little pricey for the quality/amount they give).
