author: Lydia Z.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I've passed by many times but finally got to try it. It's good food at a good value.  Order at the counter, get a number and wait for your food to arrive at the table.  We had the beef curry nooode soup and this was really good. Noodles with spinach and chunks of beef in a tasty broth. The chicken katsu curry was also quite good, but just needed more of the little red pickled radishes. The potato croquette was lightly crisped and good too. When done, put your own dishes away in the appropriate tubs.

Super casual neighborhood restaurant. Not fancy, but definitely fulfilling.
author: Ali F.

description:
If you don't like Curry. Definitely avoid this place. There's plenty of street parking to go around. Inside there's plenty of seating for groups of two to six people. The place overall looked very clean and well maintained. 

They have a very extensive menu of items that come with curry. I decided to go with the chicken katsu plate. The plate came with a very respectable portion of chicken and curry to go along with the veggies. Taste-wise, I thought it was a little above average. The curry to me felt a little watery for my liking, but the curry had a good enough taste with a perfect amount of kick. Considering the prices here, you're getting a good bang for your buck in the city.

The service here is pretty good. The workers here are kind and served the food in a timely fashion. I had a decent time here and if you're on a budget, but want to eat out, this is one of the places in the city that you should try out.
author: Jason P.

description: Came here at around 8pm on a Saturday and the place was empty which was kind of a relief to me since I've been there before and since the place is small it can get a little crowded. Ordered the chicken katsu curry plate with added boiled egg in medium spicy. It was sooo good. Definitely the right kind of spicy for me. I like spicy but I don't think I'll ever be able to try volcano level of spicy. My friend tried it and he remained red the whole time he was eating lmao the portions are just the right amount and I had a lot to take home and heat up for later. Usually the place is kind of like a self serve kind of arrangement where you place an order in the counter and you get a number, sit down, they take you your food, you finish and put your dirty dishes in a bin close to the door. However, since it was pretty empty the cashier on the counter came by to ask if everything was good and she helped us clean up and offered us more water. Kudos to the service and great dinner :)
author: Melanie L.

description:
This place makes me wish I lived in San Francisco!

Came here on a whim a few days ago, and I'm still thinking about it. It's a no-frills place that's just like a small hole in the wall. If you want a fancy restaurant or a wide variety of things to order, maybe this isn't the place for you.

I ordered the veggie katsu curry with a fried shrimp topping, and wow!! Their fried foods are so delicious!! Lightly fried, not too oily. The veggie katsu includes two skewers of fried zucchini and onion. WOW!! They were insanely delicious, and I don't usually like zucchini at all. The curry tastes great, and is a happy medium between being soup-like and stew-like. I highly recommend ordering it with medium or higher spice. Also make sure you add the katsu sauce on top!!

Service was also really great! The girl taking our order was really patient with us and polite. Thumbs up!

I'll have to make a special trip back out to San Francisco just for this place.
author: Janel Q.

description:
Delicious everytime! This is my go-to spot for japanese curry. It's a very casual establishment where you get your own napkins, utensils, and water cups from plastic bins near the register. On top of that, you also put away your own plates in the designated bins by the door. I prefer this casual setup to a normal restaurant at times honestly.

It's the perfect spot to just kick back and dig into some great curry. You get your food quickly, no fuss at all. 

Nothing beats Curry House in my eyes but that joint is FAAAR from where I usually am or need to be. Volcano is one for me! For reference, I get the Volcano Chicken Katsu Curry pretty much everytime. I love spicy food, I grew up on it. That level of heat does warm me up pretty quickly. It's do-able though and you don't lose the flavor at all. You can never go wrong with your order here, as far as I know.

Trust me. Sit down. Enjoy your meal. Come with family or friends (larger groups, beware of minimal seating) and enjoy a plate of absolute goodness.
author: Kris P.

description:
Food:  One of the best Japanese Curries you can find in the city.

-Beef Curry - You can get this over rice or udon.  I typically go with the udon.  The meat is tender and the curry has a good flavor to it.  The good thing is that it's cubed instead of sliced.
-Chicken Karaage Curry - Same curry base but instead of Beef, the Chicken Karaage...what can I say...fried chicken...sure why not?

Service:  Nice staff but it's more of a grab and sit place rather than waitstaff service.

Ambiance:  Very local and casual.

Overall:  Whenever I have a craving for a japanese curry...this is where I'll go.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
Volcano is basically Japanese fast-casual dining. The menu offers different curry dishes, ~$8-$9, with 4 levels of spiciness. Additional toppings, such as egg, cheese, and spam, are $1-$2, so that can quickly add up. They also have sandwich & noodle soup options, as well as rice plates sans curry. Japanese curry is my idea of comfort food, so obviously I ordered their main attraction.

Chicken Katsu Curry w/ carrots, potatoes & pickled ginger over rice:
The tasty curry sauce was savory with a mild sweetness, so flavor was there, but the consistency was on the thin side. I am more accustomed to thicker, creamier Japanese curries. The consistency of the sauce didn't bother me, since I always mix rice into the curry for flavor. I went with medium spicy. I enjoy spicy flavors, but I'm not great at handling super spicy food. Japanese curry is usually very mild in terms of heat, so medium was just right for me.
There was a good-sized portion of crispy, crunchy chicken. The carrots and potatoes were stewed to a very soft texture, but there were only 3 pieces of carrots and 3 pieces of potatoes. I could definitely have used some pickles or zucchini to add some crunch. Oh well, maybe next time. 

A Japanese curry house is just what this block needs, or just what I need when I want something quick and filling. Food is tasty & relatively inexpensive, and service is quick. Though they have a low inspection score, the space was rather clean and bright. In my opinion, these ratings aren't informative enough to be useful. I've seen restaurants in far worse conditions with 90+ scores. Besides, I noticed plenty of families eating with their kids here, so I shrugged it off.
author: Joy W.

description: The curry chicken noodle soup at Volcano is a very good bowl of soup with fresh spinach and pickled ginger. I've been here once before and tried the chicken Katsu, and that dish is very good as well. What makes this place interesting is that they offer authentic Japanese dishes like curry, which is brown in color, and a little thicker broth.
author: Marlon T.

description: Always on point with the flavor. I wish it gave just a little more curry.  But they still get a 5 star
author: Tim C.

description:
For crispy katsu battered meat dish doused in a heaping pile of yellow curry, come to this establishment to get your fix. Small seating area, but quick service and casual eatery leads to a quick turnaround time to get a seat. 

The best part about the katsu is that it's light and crisp on all their choices of protein - never overfried or oily. I always get chicken which is tender and battered to perfection. The rice is sticky but firm, and with a healthy pool of curry on top, it doesn't clump together or fall completely to grainy pieces which is a nice to have (you don't realize it's a problem until you realize how awesome it is when it's done right!)

Extra perk, they accept FiveStars with some reasonable redemption options for freebies.
author: Kathy T.

description: Really satisfying with large portions and relatively inexpensive. I was super hungry, and this really hit the spot. The got the pork katsu curry. The breading was perfectly crispy, and the curry was nice and hearty. I would definitely recommend coming here!
author: Cynthia M.

description: I really like what they do at this restaurant. The four different styles of curry make it easy to determine just how hot do you want it. Though the menu is limited it is focused and delicious. The price is right and the service is fast.
author: Ted R.

description:
I don't know how, but this place slowly became my comfort food, and that's not a good thing. 

The food is bad, the utensils are worn, the location is convenient but not convenient enough to keep on coming here for 3 years.

Now, you might be wonder "how bad can it be?" The first time my girlfriend tried the chicken katsu she almost puked. 

Take me as a cautionary tale, don't come here.
author: Rodrigo C.

description:
Not a bad curry place, but not amazing.

It seems like a well known restaurant according to SF locals for a quick bite of Japanese curry. Came here with a friend for dinner, and the place was half filled. The small restaurant seats about 25 people, and their menu displays an extensive list of curry options. Each curry dish has the option of adding more toppings such as potatoes, carrots, etc. (this isn't a boba shop what the heck). Also you can change the hotness level of the curry. Once you order, they'll bring the food over to you when it's ready. In the meantime help yourself to self serve water and clean utensils.

I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry.

I never quite understood the appeal of curry. I mean it's great comfort food, but other than that it's nothing really glamorous. I liked the serving size of their chicken katsu, and everything  tasted good. Sadly, none of it had that wow factor to keep me coming back.

Volcano isn't something to go out of your way for, but it'll satisfy a curry craving if you're nearby.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Decent curry, great prices. 

If the dishes came with some sort of side salad or any kind of green veggies I'd definitely come here a lot more. Worth checking out if you're looking for something quick and cheap!
author: Eric S.

description:
It can get busy during dinnertime, so plan accordingly if you want to sit and enjoy your meal. They have a rule where you have to order first before sitting down. The place can hold roughly 20 people.

Though flavorful, I wish the curry sauce had more to it. It looks like they boiled some carrots and potatoes, then poured a cup of sauce over it. I do however like their fried items: fried katsu, fried chicken katsu, fried potato croquette...
author: Vans C.

description:
When I'm in the mood for curry. I always think of volcano. 

Be aware. Not a lot of seating spaces

All the curry choices are good, just depends on your mood for the day. I'm a big fan of the onion croquettes and zucchini add on. 

Spice level is important. I think hot is perfect amount of spice so I can still enjoy the curry. Medium just didn't do it for me and volcano can be a bit painful.
author: Lyman C.

description: Consistently yummy curry. Tastes pretty darn authentic!!!! The katsu is drool worthy :3
author: Justine C.

description: Was excited to have some Japanese curry but the curry beef disappointed me. The curry sauce was runnier than I like and the beef was clearly cooked with the curry sauce sperately (because many pieces had no sauce on it).  The beef just isn't curry enough that way.  The rice and roots are good.   I would recommend the chicken katsu over the beef.
author: Larry L.

description: If you want bomb traditional Japanese curry, this is the place to go! You order at the front of the cashier, get a number and they serve it to you. You have the option to make your curry as spicy as volcano lol. I recommend just getting the traditional curry which is the chicken curry. Definitely will come back!
author: Jenn L.

description: I ordered the mild spice, Tonkatsu curry dish. As someone who doesn't have such a high spice-tolerance, the mild was perfect. The sauce was delicious, tonkatsu pork perfectly crisp, rice was cooked perfectly! My only complaint is that there were only 6 pieces of veggies, but it's nothing to be too upset over. Overall, delicious! And we keep coming back to this place when we crave Japanese curry.
author: Kristina B.

description:
Oh my freakin' goodness! This place is AMAZING! 

First of all, I never really liked curry in general and that had included japanese curry. BUT after trying it over here, my opinion has changed! 

The curry here literally feels like it's so light and fluffy to your tastebuds. It's just so difficult to describe. With the combination of the not too mushy but instead stiffer rice, it was such a balance! The fried ingredients are made to perfection; so crispy!! I seriously enjoyed my pork katsu with curry and extra side of croquette and you could tell if you saw my plate! CLEAN!
author: Tina R.

description:
I've had a couple of Japanese curry places in town but this is my fav. Although it's a little far from the downtown side I think this place is nice for its food option and price. Make sure you stack up your points to get free food (I did that). The level of spice - I tend to go hot, but the sriracha is hotter than volcano. 

Yes, you pay first then you sit. So sometimes when it's full you do need to plan with a strategy, like playing battleship.

My fav here is the tonkatsu, with brown rice, side of onion croquette and spam. They're so yummy.
author: Kevin L.

description: I went in for a quick bite before meeting some friends in the neighborhood. Ordered a chicken mini sandwich and a veggie soup. I was given veggie Katsu (spelling). It was in edible. It was deep fried food with curry. Not at all what I ordered and wanted. They refused to give me my money back. Such a bummer it's a cold night just wanted some soup. Don't go here!!
author: Lacie T.

description:
I love this place. I come here whenever I am craving some curry and chicken katsu or whenever I planned to get a burrito next door but didn't want to wait in line.
Not sure why but I feel like the chicken katsu taste different from time to time.
author: Ryan Z.

description: While their curry is still bomb, they seem to have gotten cheap with the vegetables. There's barely any in there now and they only have carrot and potato. I believe they used to have more before and they used to cut them so that it can easily be eaten rather than a massive chunk.
author: Jessica W.

description:
This is my favorite curry place in San Francisco!

If you like your curry spicy this is the place to go. I usually get the chicken katsu curry and add a potato croquette(HIGHLY recommend) and zucchini :-) Their miso soup and spam sandwich are also great sides.

However, I don't care for the their noodles and wouldn't recommend subbing your rice for the noodles. It gets all types of messy and eating curry noddles on a plate just doesn't work.

COME HERE, EAT CURRY, AND GET FAT. IT'S ALL GREAT.
author: Courtni W.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by the fast service, great prices, and delicious curry at volcano. Located right on Geary, in Richmond, if You are in the area, you should definitely stop by. My friends brought me here, and I have pretty high expectations for curry, because I am Japanese. However, I ordered the pork Katsu curry, and was very satisfied with my order. The portions are large, and you can leave full with spending less than 10 bucks. Something you can't say about too many places in the city.
author: Ross S.

description:
Found this place by yelping around me. My boyfriend was like "hey let's try some curry!" I'm just like sure, let's try it out. 

They have so much variety: shrimp, chicken, beef, and pork. You can choose with curry or without. The one with curry comes with vegetables and the one without comes with other adds on the plate. 

You can choose the spice from mild-volcano. 4 types of spices you can choose from. 

All the yelp reviews I've seen said the food comes out quickly, but when we were there it took about 10-15 minutes. Once the food came out I just couldn't wait to eat. First bite and I was amazed. The food had so much flavor and it was very delicious.
author: Anriella D.

description:
Irony. It can be funny. I can dig it. Do you guys like irony? Well let me tell you a little story if you do.

It had been less than 24 hours since I had returned from a short-ish Japanese vacation. It was raining in the city, but it didn't bother me any. Tokyo Novembers are frighteningly cold. I mean, it snowed one day. Also, that earthquake. What did bug me was the parking. Always with the parking! Anyway, 'what's with the low rating' you may ask?

My time at Volcano has so far been my worst experience since coming back. The irony here, of course, is that Volcano is a Japanese restaurant. I kinda feel bad calling it Japanese. Nothing about it says Japanese to me. 

I ordered 2 mini sandwiches to go: Karaage and sausage. Sadly, they were mostly bread. And incredibly boring. I'm more than sure that Guy Fieri on quaaludes could come up with better sandwiches. They were just the paltry amounts of protein and then bread. Maybe some mayo and a shred of cabbage? Ultimately, the food sucked and was not Japanese in the most diluted sense of the word. 

Karaage was beyond wack and the sausage was unappealing and didn't taste very fresh. Why bother putting shite on your menu? It doesn't make any sense. Also, it took like 15 minutes for them to be ready. 2 mini sandwiches? 15 minutes? I don't know, man. I came in a few times to see if it was ready, but no dice. 

The supervisor was kind enough to bring out my order. I was a little confused when she brought out a little plastic box of food for me in the rain. I asked about the plastic bag for which I had paid. 

She didn't seem to care much. So I wondered out loud what the heck was wrong with people. I guess she didn't like that too much because I waited another 3 minutes before I realized that she had no intention of bringing me back my order with my plastic bag. 

I was even more confused about the heck was wrong with people. Why bring out my order initially and then not bring it out when you realize that you made a mistake? 

And then when I called her out on it inside, she couldn't even have been more unapologetic. It was pretty unbelievable. Why work in the customer service industry if you don't care about someone's customer service experience?

Remember that irony thing? She was training a new hire. Hilarious! Why is she training people!?

It took less than 24 hours for me to have a inexcusably poor customer service experience in my own backyard thanks to Volcano. 

Sure, sure. I didn't have their curry, which is their whole deal. And I suppose I never will now due to this experience. Which is probably a blessing in disguise based duly on some of the reviews of people IN THE KNOW and my recent trip to Japan. And if their karaage is an indicator of their "Japanese food," then I have no business testing out anything else. 

Also, more irony. The only reason I went into Volcano is because Gordo had a long line. There was no line at Volcano, yet somehow took longer.
author: Aren A.

description: I want to try the Katsu Sandwhich! The curry soups, though, I can't get enough of.  You can choose your spicy level and the soup is always temperature  hot! Great for a cold sanfrancisco day.
author: Meagan M.

description: This place is super chill and has the best Japanese curry. Volcano level heat will clear your sinuses and still really tasty. Pork Katsu medium heat with potato croquet is my favorite.
author: Alejandro C.

description:
It's the only "curry house" near me, and when I'm wanting a quick meal, it's there for me. The food is good, though not great compared to others.

I'm not familiar with any others in the city, so I'll go here when I'm in need of some rice and curry.

I normally get the tonkatsu or karaage, both are great with cheese!

The service is always friendly, the establishment tidy and clean. I have no complaints.

The difference between this place and other Japanese curry places is the flavor to me. Maybe it's just not strong enough in flavor or too watered down? I don't know, I just know I'd rather cook my own...normally the S&B black box is my go to.

Though how can you complain when an order takes 5-10 min to make.

I'll be back again, until I can find something more like coco ichiban which is my normal go to for chain curry restaurants!
author: Masa K.

description:
I love this place and try to go whenever I have a staff meeting. The food is so hearty, filling, and tastes delicious. The Japanese Curry selections they have are amazing and full of flavor. There are 4 different curry spice levels, so for you spicy fans out there, feel free to knock yourself out with the spiciest curry. 
I get a little bummed sometime because they can get a little cheap with the potatoes and carrots that sometimes they hardly ever put any. I always like to ask for extra pickles because of their crunchy texture and dill tang. 
The capacity in the restaurant is decently spacious, however, do not be fooled, it can get packed. 
The prices are decent considering the portions you are served. 
There is meter parking, residential based parking, and bike parking as well. 
I recommend the Chicken Katsu Curry or Veggie Curry.
author: Stacey M.

description: Good place for Curry dishes. Add ons are a good idea, but can get pricey the more you stack on. Levels of spicy seem pretty appropriate so far (only had up to medium right now) but it's a good spot. There's only a handful of people working at any given time so be cool and bus your own tables. Helps a lot.
author: Thomas C.

description: They specialize in curry.  The curry is very thin so I am assuming with my fatty tongue they use a lot of butter. Wasn't my favorite :(
author: Fatty A.

description: Arrived on a Saturday night around 6:30 for dinner. Once we began eating, all tables were getting filled. I would recommend arriving around 6:30 or slightly earlier to if you want to dine in. However many people do order to go, and that doesn't take too long. I got a non-spicy chicken katsu curry with a potato croquette. My friend got the spiciest option but it wasn't that spicy to her. The food tastes great and was really filling.
author: Daisy L.

description:
Would recommend! This was our first time here and we called in a take-out order. I got the Chicken Katsu curry while my girlfriend got the beef curry. The food was excellent! 

Pricing was fair too, it came out to roughly $20 between the two dishes. Our order was ready about 15 minutes after we called in and was an easy process to get it.
author: James D.

description: Yummy yummy yummy! :-) always a favorite place for Japanese curry,  this place is good
author: Kelly B.

description:
I was introduced to this place back in 2009 and have been in love with it ever since. 

I love Volcano. I love the fukujinzuke pickles, but I just wish they provided you with free unlimited pickles like Curry House does. You gotta pay an extra dollar just to add it on here. But I mean, back then, when they still did the stamp cards, you could always get a free topping for like every two visits. I'm not sure they do that anymore since they converted to five stars. 

I always get the beef curry, medium spicy. I know a lot of people get the katsu curry, but that just doesn't sound very appetizing to me, so I just stick to what I like. I've tried the beef curry at the spiciest level (volcano) with my friends this one time we were feeling hella adventurous. That wasn't a really good idea...our stomachs felt like they were boiling hot lava from the fiery pits of hell or something. Never again, haha.
author: Sydney C.

description:
Affordable.

Delicious.

Hole in the wall.

Order first and then take a seat.
author: Evan W.

description:
Awesome spot to grab some Japanese Curry! 

Before you barge in here with a party of 10, I'm just gonna tell you that it's not gonna work. I would say that Volcano is a relatively small restaurant located on a busy street. Seats are somewhat limited and the crowd is not one to mess with. When dining at Volcano, you first wait in line to place your order and THEN you can grab your seat (please be understanding you guys).

At the counter, they have multiple pictures and combinations that people throw together. I was originally thinking about going with the curry noodles because of one of the pictures, but thought against it and chose something safer.

After getting seated, the line sorta died down and as me and my friend waited at our table, the cashier came by and brought us our utensils and napkins. To be honest, i'm not sure if they're supposed to do that, but I really appreciated that since it was our first time. On the other hand, I made sure to get our own water before she troubled herself to do that as well.

Our food arrived shortly after, I would say that we waited no longer than 10 minutes and the food was relatively hot. Feel free to reference to my picture because I don't know how else to describe it; it tastes as delicious as it looked! Definitely an A+ in my book, would love to come back here if i'm in the area, but it's unfortunate that it's so far.
author: Wiseley F.

description:
I came on a Sunday night and there wasn't much of a line. You order/pay at the front and then they bring you your food. 

I ordered the medium chicken katsu curry, which had plenty of flavor and a good ratio of curry to rice. The chicken katsu was fried just right and still juicy. Medium has just a little bit of spiciness to it. 

I'd love to go here more often, if only it wasn't so far far away...
author: Edward W.

description: We were really eager to try the Japanese curry, as we read great reviews. But, it wasn't quite what we expected. The chicken Katsu was fabulous, but the curry was on the sweet side, which we weren't too jazzed about. We were hoping for denser-tasting curry. But, overall the service was quick and friendly.
author: Mary F.

description:
I love this place because it is so simple. I got chicken katsu curry over rice. Or, you don't have to get curry either, and get chicken katsu over rice (plain). You can ask for different degrees of spiciness, and since it was my first time, I got medium. Great flavor! I wish I got a tad bit spicier though! 

One highlight for me, even though this sounds weird, was their rice. It was perfectly fluffy and chewy and so yummy with the curry. The portions are huge, and with a $7-8 plate, you'll be able to take some home for leftovers! This is a great place for a weeknight dinner.

Service was friendly. We came here 20 mins to closing and they still let us order. The place was pretty clean, although it feels like a McDonalds with the floors and seating. It's just a really cute fast-food type mom and pop shop.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: A solid choice for Japanese curry. There's lots of options and toppings to choose from here. The chicken karaage curry with fried egg is quite satisfying, and if you like your curry sauce spicy, you'll really enjoy things here. While i felt that my order was fried up just a bit much, it didn't spoil the whole meal. Worth trying if you're in the area.
author: Vincent L.

description: You can't go wrong with Japanese curry. It is delicious! Volcano does the curry sauce amazingly, and everything that covers it: rice, potatoes, carrots, protein, you name it tastes so good smothered in it. My one "beef" is that they just covered the beef/carrots/tomato with curry sauce, whereas at previous places, the food is actually cooked in the curry, at least for a little bit! There were about 4 pieces of potatoes, and 5 pieces of carrots, but plenty of meat! The texture of everything was perfect. I definitely suggest adding a topping because if I just got potatoes and carrots I wouldn't be satisfied.
author: Ke C.

description: Over the last 5 years, this is what ive noticed. Price went up ~$2 for curry. Less sweet ginger now. Less veggies in the curry. Before, there was zucchini in the curry. No sweet katsu sauce on the katsu if you order the curry. Portion size did get a little bigger. Qty of veggies are more consistent now it seems (3 pcs of potato, 3 pieces of carrot). Straws have paper sleeves now. Before, straws your just in a jar for anyone to touch.
author: Jason C.

description:
I thought this was a regular restaurant but it's fast casual which is great! I love Japanese curry and getting it served right away is awesome!

I got the chicken katsu with curry which seriously didn't disappoint, it was very tasty! Which makes sense for all the great reviews! I'll most definitely be back here!!
author: Samantha L.

description:
The first time I tried this place a few years ago I actually didn't like it. I got some mild curry with beef and was disappointed and underwhelmed. Took the L for the money I paid and didn't come back for 2 years...

Well I'm back 2 years later and I shit you not, my boyfriend and I come here every weekend. We always each get the chicken Katsu curry with extra veggies and they are ALWAYS consistently delicious! First of all, the katsu is perfection. Crunchy outside, juicy chicken on the inside. Cover/dip that in the curry and I swear your eyes will roll back from how delicious it is. They give you a lot of curry and rice and, in the event you don't finish, it's just as delicious as leftovers. I will say that as a personal preference, spending the $3-4 for extra veggies is a necessity if you like veggies in your curry. Considering how much food you get in all, and how bomb it always is, it's well worth the price and the parking wars that you'll face if you drive there. My advice about that is to call 15 min ahead and order to go. It helps if you have someone else driving so you can just jump out and run in. Otherwise, be prepared to pay meter if you have no luck finding parking on one of the avenues.

Overall, highly recommend eating here, particularly if you get what I get (as that's what I can speak on).
author: Pearl L.

description:
So glad we discovered this place! We tried Japanese curry for the first time in Tokyo and were hooked. Tried a few places in the bay area and were disappointed, the flavor intensity was not even close.
The vegetarian curry here is really close to the curry I had in Japan. The flavor intensity and spice levels are spot on. The food is cheap and the place is really casual.
author: Bhavya K.

description: For the price and portion of food they provide, it's not bad. I've had better curry before but this place hits the spot after a day at the beach or going around SF.
author: Rae Dawne G.

description:
I'm turning JAPANESE. I think I'm turning JAPANESE. I really think so! ITADAKIMASU!

How overcliche and overplayed that 80s song is! But it never gets old and my otaku weaboo creeps out once in a while as a homage to my middle and high school years. 

Moving on... I simply LOVE Volcano. It is my go-to spot for Japanese curry in SF, albeit I have not tried every single curry joint but the few places I've graced, Volcano takes the crown. It was also a supporter during my Baker Beach afternoon daycation: http://www.yelp.com/biz/baker-beach-san-francisco?hrid=WvnrHvkA48ogH7uph9LhnQ

I've never opted to eat in the dining area because I was always eager to take to-go with a handy cup of Sharetea Oolong Tea Crema boba to the beach with me. I've done so about 3x and each time was as glorious as the setting suns I experienced. Sunset is my favorite time of the day where the orange, pink, and blue colors swirl and dance in the air. Call me a romanticist if you must! 

The katsu is light and crisp, same goes for their vegetables. I don't know if they have GOT Daenerys' baby dragons back there blowing some fire, but I swear, deep fry to PERFECTION. What do the kids say nowadays? On fleek? Volcano got through with a clutch? Haha. 

Rice is also supple and moist, never had a bad grain. If you order the simplest basic (like me), you get chopped pieces of fried chicken katsu, carrots, potatoes, and red pickles topped with their drizzling super secret curry sauce. It's so flavorful with the right amount of spices. Distinct from Indian or Thai curries, but subtle in its powerful creaminess like the humble Japanese people :) And of course better than any store-bought powder/liquid ish, blargh. RIP college days. Prices generally under $10 unless you crazy for their add-ons/sides. 

I am visiting Japan soon and I am sure that'll give me a perspective on Volcano's worthiness. I bid adieu, Volcano! I shall return for your deliciousness. Yakusoku shimasu!
author: Donna T.

description:
This place is delicious! 
The Pork tatsu is good, and the spicy flavor is actually pretty spicy.
The only downside to it is that it doesn't have very much seating space
author: Kent N.

description: Curry was good but had the noodles and tasted bland. Chicken karaage was tasty too!!! It was just that soup.
author: Jaide F.

description:
This spot is a WINNER. If you're looking for Japanese curry, you absolutely must come here. I'm glad my cousin took my mom and I here.

The concept for their curry is perfect because you can customize your own plate. Order the base curry (which comes with carrots, potato, rice and radish pickles), choose the spice level, and choose your toppings. I chose the medium level and it was spicy already. I thought I had a strong spice tolerance, but I was sweating while eating it inside despite it being mid-40 degree temperature outside. The only topping I put was the potato croquette but next time, I will definitely add more.
If you've been making homemade Japanese with S&B Golden Curry, Volcano's curry has enhanced and richer flavors.
author: Jaime F.

description: Im giving the restaurant two stars out of virtue that the food is actually always great! The curry and katsu is always great, however upon my most recent visit the employee working at the counter severely mistook my order and failed to adjust accordingly. We ordered a N/C karaage plate, and a katsu curry plate, instead we received a katsu sandwhich and karaage curry. For about 5 minutes she sat behind the register texting her manager and muttering "i dont know how i took the order wrong", she eventually went back of house and ask the cooks to fix the order. The group bickered for a while and the cashier employee continue to exclaim over how surprised they were for getting the "order wrong". Eventually we called back out to them and sat back down with the wrong order. There were no accommodations or apologies made. While id love to come back in for my curry, I think after that experience its near impossible to do so.
author: Jun I.

description: I'm not to big on curry but I will try just about anything once. So I can honestly say that I'm impressed by this place, there's always customers so that's a plus. My opinion on how the curry sauce was (good) I again don't really care for curry but I will be returning here ,the ladies are friendly too so that makes it all worth it.
author: Sherisa W.

description: Fast casual Japanese curry at a great price. Katsu was cooked right and curry was rich and flavorful. Most dishes ranged around 8 to 10 bucks. You order and seat yourself. Would recommend for a quick bite or after a day of hiking!
author: Tiff N.

description: I think volcano is amazing they sometimes play games like when they see if you can catch it in your mouthMy favorite thing is when they cook in front of you.  When they start to make the flames  It looks like a bon fire And a volcano about to explode.I think you should go to volcano  they have amazing food  and they do tricks where they use there Hat  and they use a egg and juggle the egg
author: Beth C.

description: Ordered the chicken katsu curry to-go and I thought it was just average. Nothing special about the curry here.
author: Cheyne T.

description:
A lot of food is offered, so this makes for a very filling meal. 

I ordered the tonkatsu with curry and a potato croquette. 

Tonkatsu: it's nicely battered and crispy, but the pork is a bit dry. And no katsu sauce! Idk if authentic tonkatsu doesn't serve it with the sauce, but I think not having it emphasizes the dryness of the meal. 

Potato croquette: this bad boy is very simple, but holy moly, this thing is delicious. Definitely should add this on to your meal! 

The Japanese pickles that come with the meal are so damn minimal. I feel like it's a necessity and expectation for Japanese curry, so the fact that you have to pay for more really irks me. For the serving, hardly any is given! 

Curry: the curry is watery. I feel that the curry is pretty basic, just some potatoes and carrots...kinda lame. I ordered volcano since most people said they take it easy on the spice despite the name, but holy crickey does my curry have a kick! 

Customer service: lacking. The lady that mans the register gets the job done, but isn't very friendly. But nonetheless, the review is about the food, not the service. 

Just another ps. I'm also irked that when I ordered my food to go, they asked if I'd like a bag for it. I know this is sf, but I find that ludicrous, it should be mandatory for take out, that's kinda part of the service. What? Am I gonna be asked next, "do you want our take out containers." 

"Oh no, I'll just bring my own Tupperware"
author: Valerie N.

description: Very solid neighborhood lunch spot!  Sometimes the chicken quality is questionable but I keep coming back.  Unique curry dish and filling portions at good price.
author: Alan S.

description: Came in for lunch and tried Volcano's Katsu Curry for the first time and was not disappointed. Price and portion size were decent and affordable. If you're looking for a warm and comforting meal, this is the place to go. A bite of katsu with curry rice makes for the perfect meal, especially on a cold day. If you cannot tolerate spiciness, you can tell them what level of spiciness you prefer, as it's displayed on the counter. Overall the service was quick and the food was good. Katsu was perfectly crisp and juicy and the curry was packed with flavor. Will come back here for a quick lunch if I happen to be in the neighborhood again.
author: Jessie H.

description: Cute spot in the Richmond area. The menu is pretty simple - choose whether you want noodles or rice with your curry, then choose your meat and spicyness level. I chose "hot" which is just one step below "volcano". It was very spicy but not inedible, just right for me. My boyfriend got "medium" which was pretty mild in my opinion and seemed a bit sweeter. The veggies were simple, just carrots, onions and potatoes which is pretty standard. I thought the veggies could be seasoned a bit more as they were soft and bland. The curry itself was delicious, although a tad on the watery side. Each bite was addicting though and I felt like I couldn't stop eating it. The portions are also quite large and is very affordable at around $10 per plate. The inside doesn't have too much seating so I can imagine it getting crowded during popular hours. I came in on a Tuesday night and had no problem finding seats although every table was full. I will definitely be coming back here if I'm ever in the mood for some good Japanese curry.
author: Sara S.

description:
Japanese curry is my absolute favorite kind of curry and Volcano does it so well. The prices are affordable and the service is fast. The portion sizes are really good for the price. The actual restaurant is small and I've always only seen one waitress taking orders and bringing food, but I really like it because its a comfy atmosphere. For the short time you're there, it feels nice and homey. 

I always get the Chicken Katsu curry. The chicken katsu is crispy and goes so well with the curry sauce. What I love about Japanese curry is that it's sweet, but it's also spicy so there's a really nice kick to it. I like to get the medium spicy level so that I can taste the delicious curry without my mouth burning off! :D There are two higher levels of spicy - hot and volcano - but as I said, I do like tasting the curry more than the spiciness. There are additional "toppings" you can add to your dish too like tofu nuggets, croquettes, sausages, etc. 

I love this place and would definitely recommend it to anyone!
author: Kelly N.

description:
If you're looking for a place to eat good curry on a cold SF day, this is the place to be. This place has a fast food kind of style where you order your food at the register with no waiter service. 

Service:
The register person is always very nice and friendly, very chill like the restaurant itself. 

Food:
I always go to the chicken katsu with the highest level of spice (the spicier the better!). The portions are a good amount, enough to make me full and it's pretty much you're ordinary curry dish. There's nothing that stands out about it but it's comfort food. 

Fun fact: The owner of this place inspired another restaurant owner to open up their own curry place in Portland, OR called Kale. If you're in the area, it's a definitely must try!
author: Annie V.

description: Great for a quick Japanese curry fix! The katsu is nice and crispy. My favorite is generally beef curry but I'm not a big fan of the beef here. It's more like beef chunks as opposed to stewed beef meat, so that's a bummer. Spices don't run that spicy so kick it up a notch if you're feeling adventurous!
author: Winnie L.

description:
The curry dishes here are amazing! Portions are generous and everything is priced at a great value. Sometimes, I even hope for a little more rice so that I can mix it in with the curry!

The place is pretty low key, you place your order at the counter and get a number plate. You then put the number plate on a table and the employee will bring it to you. After you finish eating, you put your plates and utensils in their respective bins by the entrance/exit. Seating area fits around 20 - 25 people I'd say, it's not that big inside.

There's free parking around the residential areas and metered parking all along Geary but it's definitely a crap shoot. Parking is usually bad around this area, so expect to circle for a little bit unless you're lucky.

Great portions, great pricing, great tasting curry. What else can you ask for??
author: R C.

description: Really great place to get since Chicken Katsu Curry. It tastes amazing and has just the right amount of spice to it. You can actually tell that the curry is made from scratch and does not have that packaged curry tastes to it. Great and fast service. I really like the art they have on the walls.
author: Camera P.

description:
This is definitely a long overdue review. I've been coming here since 2011 and I haven't even written a review for this place yet! There is just something so comforting about Japanese curry that keeps me coming back!

One of the many things I appreciate about the food here is the portion size. I'm a sucker for huge portions. Volcano is my go to with friends during our cheat day binges or after a long day of school. I always have enough left on my plate to take home for meal #2. 

There are a lot of options here, but I always settle for Chicken Katsu curry in medium spiciness with extra curry!! Yum!!
author: Sophia G.

description:
This is a good option for a quick, cheap, big lunch. 

I have had the chicken katsu curry and it was OK. I was pleasantly surprised with the quantity of food -- especially the rice and chicken -- however, there weren't many vegetables. The curry sauce tasted OK, but it's definitely low-quality. 

I also tasted the potato croquette, which was good.

Overall, there is nothing special about this place regarding the food. However, the price is its selling point. I would come back here for a cheap bite to eat during the week.
author: Andréia S.

description: When I'm high or not high and craving for curry. I always want to go here because it's good. Their take out service only takes 10 minutes or less as well.
author: Domo S.

description: Was in town for visit and craving for some spicy curry. Ordered the pork and chicken katsu volcano.. it has a kick of spiciness for me. So cant complained much in fact that im not home. Maybe next time ill add jalapeños.
author: Syerine H.

description:
I love the pork katsu. It's so crispy but not greasy and just so full of joy and happiness. I appreciate how Volcano actually knows what spiciness is. My go to is usally a single volcano spice level. Pretty spicy, like I need a couple glasses of water, but not to the point where I cry and regret my life decisions. 

The only thing I don't like about it is the actually flavor of the curry. It's a pretty average curry flavor. I'm a huge fan of Curry House, so that's why I don't want to give this place 5 stars. But other than that, good price, good portions.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Extra points for having a vegetarian curry-- which they previously did not have. It was delicious, and they always get the spiciness level just right, given that I'm not that great with super spicy. 
Definitely recommend the potato croquettes! My partner always gets katsu curry and it's always bomb
author: Angie L.

description: So excited to try this restaurant. Curry was really good. But I ordered beef curry and the beef is just real hard. So i asked if they can give me new one. The cashier was really sorry that she can't do anything, it varies who cooks and the owner is strict. What? Seriously. I'm just really disappointed. I left the restaurant still full plate, didn't touch it after. The only good part here was the cashier, really nice. So disappointed with the owner!
author: Clariz M.

description: I'm not a fan of traditional Indian curry, so when my friend kept begging me to try Japanese curry, I'll admit I was hesitant. But I had no idea it was completely different. My eyes were opened to this Japanese comfort food. Japanese curry, as explained to me, is not spicy (well the way I order it) and is a bit sweet. It can douse a number of protein but I tend to go towards the chicken katsu. I also order the potato croquet which is a couple bucks extra but worth it in my opinion. They have bottles of Katsu sauce available for even more flavor. I haven't been here in a while but I'm making plans to come to Volcano soon. It's inexpensive and filling, what more can you ask for?
author: Stefanie S.

description:
Right next to Gordos taqueria they have the best curry with rice here.

Always make sure to add extra toppings as they have so many different toppings.

I always get the chicken katsu curry extra spicy.
author: Cm Tú Đ.

description: This is usually my to go spot for lunch. Waited 30 minutes for a simple curry plate. Didn't even get to eat it as my lunch time ended as soon as my plate got to the table.
author: Jose N.

description:
Fuck me i love japanese Curry. If you got a craving Volcano curry has the answer plus all the fixings to go along with it. Don't like pork katsu? Don't worry they got chicken! and if you can't eat meat they got veggies! Hell they even have brown rice. Do you even know how thoughtful that is for a Japanese restaurant to give you the option of brown rice over their far superior sticky white rice? but hey if rice ain't your thing they have noodles.... so fucking thoughtful I love it xoxo.

Oh but I'm not done yet lets talk about the fixings, they have a lot of side orders, from eggs  to fried spam! YES FRIED SPAM, the kind that warrants the "lets get fat and die" mantra. Which i whole hardily support. The list goes on but i never really get past fried spam part, but I assure you they have a whole menu list of other things to make and create your own perfect Japanese curry experience. 

Now Volcano isn't the best place i've been do, but they do a good job they always hit the spot and fuck do they stick the landing. Always an option when I'm in the area. 


YUMMER SCORE (obviously biased):    Food - 8    Service - 6    Experience - 8
author: Ryan M.

description: My go-to stop when I don't want to cook dinner. My favorite are the beef tendon and burger steak curry. Of course you can't go wrong with their Karage mini sandwiches. So good!
author: Madeline Q.

description: I have to say, living in Okinawa and having Cocos, I haven't found any place as authentic as this place for Japanese curry. I would give them 10 stars if I could! I just wish they could give you more of the pickled radish when you ask for it. Haha, I could eat handfuls of that in my curry
author: Grant J.

description:
The eight of us were looking for a place to eat after a round of golf.  It's way past lunch time.  More like 2pm.  Someone suggested Volcano.  Yelped it and the poor food prep and handling warning pops up from Yelp. That doesn't deter us.  We go anyway.

Hubby and I both got the curry plate.   He ordered curry pork katsu and I ordered the chicken katsu, both medium.   I have to say it was the best prepared katsu.  Given a choice, I'd go with the pork katsu.  The curry sauce was spicy with more of an after taste.  

We all had a taste of the volcano curry sauce.  I can see why it's called volcano.  It can blow your top if not your palate or tastebuds.

I'm happy to report I'm writing this the next day and have lived to report no one got ill.
author: Shirley N.

description: Pretty good food! Parking can be a challenge, pretty much a hit or miss or luck! There's somewhat limited sitting areas so it'll be a little bit hard for bigger parties. Maybe best to go during non-peak hours.
author: Lorna L.

description: Best place to get Japanese curry.  I love getting their chicken katsu curry with extra fukinaze pickles!  =3
author: Rebecca V.

description: Another great meal of katsu-curry and peach  nectar and Diet Coke at Volcano Curry. A tasty, budget friendly, hearty meal on a cool day in San Francisco.
author: Michael B.

description:
Volcano Curry of Japan~ too cute a name and too delicious a thought to pass up. The pictures and description (especially the "of Japan" part) sound authentic, but it wasn't as explosively mind-blowing as we had expected.

We got the chicken katsu curry, a little under $10. The katsu was very good, with a thin layer of crispy golden panko--one of those moments when you discover fried food that's actually fresh and not pre-made and frozen and bland. The curry seemed better than the box ones with their a guilt-tripping dose of salt and MSG. From taste alone though it's not all that noticeable, so it wasn't until I found out from their website about how they cook it for at least 8 hours, that I was able to fully appreciate the homemadeness.

Katsu and curry aside, everything else fell a bit short of our unreasonably high expectaions for Asian food (along with my perfectionist inner Yelper). The curry didn't seem to be cooked long enough with the veggies, so the flavor didn't sink in to the potatoes and carrots, and the rice was dry. Also, the ambiance had too much of a casual chain feel and some of the decor was bizarre (though quite entertaining).

Tip: It's difficult to comment on the spiciness. In general it seems very mild (we got level 3: hot because level 4: volcano sounded frightening, and the hot level was quite mild). However, it's a delayed onset of spicy--like hot lava creeping down instead of an angry volcano eruption.
author: Edna C.

description:
I generally liked this place, though the cashier seemed a bit unhappy. Pretty sure it wasn't because of me, though! :p

I ordered a volcano plate, featuring beef steak, and subbed brown for white rice for an additional fee. It came with a small bowl of miso soup, and a salad as part of the plate.

Everything tasted great, and there was definitely enough food for two meals (for me!). I also like that the place is unpretentious.

I will someday try a curry. :p
author: Shendi X.

description: My favorite curry place in the city.  I always order the chicken katsu curry, extra spicy with a side of (kinda overpriced since they give u like 5) calamari rings and it's very satisfying and decently filling.  The curry is exactly how do want my curry to be, very thick and spicy and it comes over a good amount of rice and ginger, along with a piece of carrot and potatoes.  My wife gets the same thing, except medium and there is a noticeable drop diff in spice levels so they're pretty consistent about that.  Water comes via a dispenser and you have to clean up after yourself - like putting our own plates away (or you should at least) but it's worth it.  The sitting is pretty cramped too, but the place is at least clean (even though the first time I went there i got the impression that the tables would be hella sticky).  The staff are nice and would take the time to explain the menu to you if you have questions (but of course the people behind you probably wouldn't appreciate it).
author: Charles H.

description:
I dont usually give 5 stars but this place is the BOMB!!
Price is reasonable ~$10 after tax and portion is hugeeeee and they have alot of selections. I've tried katsu, chicken tomato curry and they both A+!!

Close to SFSU, we usually find non-meter parking on the side. U go up, order, pay and they deliver the food for you. Food comes out fast and taste amazing. So affordable and quick. You can do add-ons for like $1 or so extra too. I added jalapenos and hashbrowns. 

PS: make sure you clean your table so people can sit after you, especially if you dont tip lol
author: Debbie D.

description: Wow... hella great foods! Their vegetarian curry was amazing, and I'm definitely very pleased to have gotten the spinach mushroom version. The volcano spice level is volcano and that's coming from someone who craves spice. Careful for those not up for a bit of a challenge. Thank you Volcano for the spice fix! I'd recommend coming here
author: Michael W.

description:
Pork Katsu curry = piping hot, delicious and when you ask for hot, they bring it!  $8.95.

Extra topping of Fukujinzuke pickles = $1.25. 

Tomato chicken curry = heavy on the tomato, definitely something we hadn't tried before. Worth it. $8.50

Calpico drink = $2.50 

Soda = $1.25

Service = order at the counter, and wait for the food (take out or sit down.) The food comes out pretty fast. Self-service on the silverware, napkins, etc. Yes, please remember to bus after yourself. It's really not that complicated. 

Decor = simple, clean and check out the large two-piece painting on the right wall. Look closely at the 

Prices = reasonable to moderate. Lunch for two was $24.69.

Parking = street. Good luck.
author: Fannie S.

description:
GREAT SPOT!! don't be fooled by the exterior,  places us kinda hard to miss if your not paying attention. 

This place specializes in Katsu chicken with curry.  

Food:, First time eating here,  I ordered chicken curry noodle soup and my friend ordered the pork noodle soup. Both soups were very tastey, full of flavor and balanced.  Their food comes in 4 different spicy levels, #1 Mild, #2 Medium, #3 Hot, #4 Volcano

Interior: Clean,  nice decor,  doesn't look bad at all.  

Prices: nothing is over $10 (As of 05/07/2016)

Parking: haha,  where?  Just take a Uber or Lyft.
author: John T.

description: Generally like Volcano Curry but this is the third time they got my take out order wrong.  They did offer to replace again but did not feel like walking another 30 minutes to get my order right.  On the bright side, I guess I get to try new dishes.  I will need to check the box before I leave the restaurant next time.
author: Kaz M.

description:
This place would've gotten a 5/5 from me if the female employee that was taking orders and handing out food wasn't inefficient.

Knowing that it's San Francisco, parking was hard to find so we parked a couple blocks down and walked towards this restaurant. I was excited to here because I've heard some good things about this place.

We got in the restaurant and it seemed like it was a small restaurant with a maximum capacity of about 20-25 people. Weird thing was that there was a sign by the counter that said "No card games allowed"... okay?... LOL

Placed our order in and waited about 15 minutes to get our food. I was wondering why it was taken so long. Found out the employee that was supposed to hand out food was counting money. Why would you count money knowing that there were orders out? There was more than 5 orders backed up until she finally started handing it out.

After getting our order, we instantly devoured it - probably one of the best katsu I've had!

Would I come back here? Yeah, unfortunately, I feel like the service wouldn't improve.
author: Aj C.

description:
Got the Chicken Katsu Curry, Medium Spicy. Actually pretty good kick, despite having too more levels higher. The katsu came out pretty nice and crispy. I liked the spice level. 

It's about $10 for a plate. That's average/reasonably priced. The amount of potatoes and carrots are kind of small. Probably better if they cut it to more bite sized pieces. 

All in all, it's pretty average. Portions are okay, price is okay, taste is okay. Good for a quick meal.
author: Brandon L.

description:
The roommate finds Japanese curry comforting. For me, I crave other kinds of curry as comfort, but I can appreciate a good, fast and cheap Japanese curry. Enter Volcano.

I typically get the beef curry with brown rice. Since the volcano level is the hottest, I always request that along with adding jalapenos. The curry is warm, spicy and oh so soothing. Just the right meal on a cold day. I just wish the curry was a little thicker as I like a good rich curry with my rice.

The roommate is a katsu fiend so he always gets the pork katsu curry. At times he'll add fried shrimp, sausage, a potato croquette or all of the above! I've never tried the katsu, but it looks crispy and is fried nicely.

The roommate makes Japanese curry at home all the time, but when he's lazy, Volcano is a good alternative for some comfort food!
author: Elena N.

description:
If you've ever been a fan of curry, or are curious even to the slightest, this is a must. 
Pick your spiciness, and hold on. It'll keep you coming back.
author: Kristopher D.

description:
Honestly, the curry itself isn't that great, but I really like the pork katsu that I had on top! The curry was pretty watery and tasted sort of like the package curry. They give very little vegetables too, which was pretty disappointing. The pork katsu is super crispy though and doesn't taste super fatty at all.

The service was lacking though. The girl who took my order at the cashier was pretty rude, but I've had worse service before, so I let it slide. I'd recommend Volcano if you're in the area, but I've definitely had better curry elsewhere.
author: Trisha V.

description: They have vegetarian curry--finally!! praise jesus! I've been eyeing this place for awhile but never went because they didn't have a vegetarian option. The vegetarian version is a bit sweeter than their normal curry but still very tasty. I like that you can customize your dish and add any sort of katsu you want, reminds me of coco curry in japan. So delicious! And so grateful that I can finally eat here!
author: Margaret Y.

description: Always love coming here, my go-to curry spot. Good value and large portions. Very tasty and last a while in the fridge since you're bound to have leftovers. Vegetables are soft and cooked thoroughly. The space is small though so not good for large groups. It's mostly self service--they only bring you your plate after purchasing at the counter.
author: Alison M.

description: I love Japanese curry, and this curry shop gets an "alright". I appreciate the large menu with many different options and add-ons, including sandwiches. The quality of the curry is very good, with 4 levels of spiciness as an option. However, I am giving this place only 3 stars due to the fact that they are heavy on the rice and not much else. The cutlet you will get when ordering katsu (I've had both the chicken and pork) is on the smaller side, and they will really skimp you on the vegetables. Even when ordering the add-on of extra veggies (3.50+, rip-off) you get maybe an extra scoop with squash added. Other reviewers have posted photos on here complaining of the same thing, and they are accurate. It's a shame there aren't more curry shops in SF, the other options being the randomly occuring curry katsu you will see at traditional Japanese restuarants. Go only if you really need the comfort.
author: Dillon G.

description: Great curry and rice! We had the chicken and pork katsu curry, hotness level to your taste!  Curry was flavorful and price was just right.
author: Ho N.

description:
I've tried their Katsu curry rice and their beef curry noodle, both are pretty good. It's not amazing or anything but it's cheap and tasty!

I can eat pretty spicy and thought hot spicy was perfect, but if you want an extra kick then go with volcano.
author: Khanh N.

description: This place has really good Japanese curry! I love that you can get croquettes and that there are other yummy side choices. It's reasonably priced as well!
author: Erni S.

description: The Volcano Spicy curry here is amazing and the croquette and chicken katsu are a must have! I absolutely love how you can customize your level of spiciness here I like my food extra spicy so I recommend the Volcano level of spice its super good.
author: Wren X.

description: This was my first time here and I have always wanted to try it knowing it was Japanese style. It's really difficult finding good katsu in the city but this place was great! Chicken katsu was crispy on the outside and soft and tender on the inside. I had the medium spice curry which wasn't the best I've ever had but it was the best level of kick. Great prices and I will be back to try the sandwiches.
author: Dylan L.

description:
Seeing as how I'd had Japanese curry three times in the two weeks prior to this already, I figured I might as well continue the trend just so I could compare while the flavors were still fresh on my tong-- er, mind.

Not wanting to get katsu yet again, I opted for their hamburger curry instead, but tried a bit of my friend's pork katsu. And, well, not bad, not great: the hamburg steak was similar to meatloaf in texture, and went well with the curry. The boiled vegetables could have been a bit more tender, and my friend and I both found it odd that they don't cook the veggies together with the curry, adding it as an afterthought, pouring the curry over it all.

My favorite curry place in the city is still Kare-ken, hands down. And while Japacurry also beats out Volcano, these guys are still better than Muracci's, by far.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - With plenty of spacing between tables and in the aisles, accessibility isn't a problem here.

Bathroom - Accessible! I seem to have vague recollections of something quirky about their restroom, but it's escaping my memory at the moment.
author: Johnny W.

description: Although I love the flavors and the spiciness of the curry here, I have to say both times I've eaten here, I got diarrhea right afterwards. I don't know if it's a coincidence but twice is a bit odd. I love the curry here, and I'm very sad I cannot keep coming here.
author: Alice S.

description: I go here often with my friends and we never fail to grab a seat. Try to come before the dinner rush or else you'll have to wait for seats sometimes. I like the system of order first then they'll deliver your food! The only annoying thing is that other people like to hog the sauces. If you're allergic to peanuts I wouldn't recommend this place because you have to try the curry, which has peanuts in it. My go to order is just curry with katsu.
author: Sarah H.

description:
I really like Volcano because of the amount of decent food they give you for the amount you're paying for (any plate of food less than $10 in San Francisco is good for my sad poverty wallet). Their rice to meat ratio is great, plus there are options to add various sides to your meal (from sliced eggs, croquette potato/ onions, sausages, etc). Who doesn't love options! 

Although there are lots of options and combos you can choose from, I always get the Ginger Pork & Onion curry plate. I haven't bothered to get the other plates because I was so satisfied with the taste and amount of meat they give you on the plate (pretty much half the plate). The only complaint I'd have is the consistency of the food they make-- I've been there 3 times and the quality of the food recently has not been tasting as good as the first time I tried it couple months ago.
author: Grace H.

description: This is the style and flavor of curry I am used to growing up in Japan. Curry is very popular in Japan as there are many authentic Indian restaurants all over Tokyo. So, when I discovered "Volcano," I was in love with their curry dishes. One can get mild to very spicy "volcano" flavor, which is "hot " !!! You  can also add so many sides, you will be happy and satisfied!!! It is a small, cozy place on Geary Blvd.
author: Fred K.

description: I come here probably 3x a month for the Hot Chicken Katsu Curry over rice. Add spam. Deliciously filling, would not suggest for a light lunch. Call ins for pickups take only 15 minutes.
author: Iaintworried B.

description: we ordered curry pork Katsu and chicken katsu for Togo and boiled egg for extra topping. The pork was RAW..100% un~eatable ... say good bye for my $20 lunch box....
author: BoBo F.

description:
I ordered a medium spicy chicken katsu curry with a potato croquette. My total came out to $10.87 or so.

My food came out in less than 10 minutes. The chicken katsu wasn't overcooked and I didn't get any fatty pieces, which was good. The potatoes in the curry were undercooked, so I didn't eat them. I'm glad I got a potato croquette to make up for that. 

I know I said I wanted the curry medium spicy, but it honestly tasted mild. Next time, I know not to get the medium spicy because there was no heat to it at all. I also would've liked a thicker sauce. Nonetheless, it had a good flavor. 

Overall, I would come back and try other items and maybe even get noodles instead of rice. They really give you a big portion of food. Also, the waitress was pretty nice and offered help if I had questions about the menu. 

FYI, they do use the Five Stars rewards system. For instance, it's 3 points to get 1 free topping.
author: Fallon P.

description: Fucking bomb ass food! I'm sorry for swearing but omgggg! Price is amazing, the food is amazing, the quantity of food is also very generous, the place is clean, the cashier is extremely friendly and sweet! Love it love it love it
author: Júlia B.

description:
My to go place in inner richmond for a casual meal or just a quick takeout. It gets pretty packed during lunchtime, probably easier call beforehand if doing takeout.

Tried their curry, noodle soup and volcano plate. The curry was pretty good, they have various options for entrees like tomato pork and fried fish. Noodle soup was alright, not a wow. Volcano place has entree (I always got chicken katsu), shredded cabbage and rice with miso soup. It stuck with me since I liked a balance of different things.

I also liked adding some topping like croquette to my curry. They have a rewards program (fivestars) so I accumulated some points from my frequent visits for free curry and topping stuff. Would definitely come back!
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
It was absolutely amazing. 

The chicken katsu all the way. 
With 2 potato crocchette. 
The way the crocchette was made, is unbeatable. 
Way to go Volcano!


This is really worthy of 5 stars.
author: Lorenzo S.

description: Came here after a hike so I was really hungry.  I ordered the chicken katsu curry and it was so delicious.  I devoured it.  I recommend this place if you're in the mood for curry and have a good enough appetite.  I did have to wait awhile for my curry but it was worth it.  You also have the option to choose your spice level.
author: Mikayla M.

description:
I have only done take out here twice. Pretty decent Japanese curry. 

It isn't as spicy as I thought it would be. I've ordered medium and it was still rather bland to me. I need to up it a notch or two.

The curry is thin but not too watery. You can opt for brown rice at an additional cost (I love brown rice).

The price is definitely reasonable for the amount of food you get. Give it a go.
author: Susy C.

description:
A cat and his friends found their way here due to the simultaneous craving for curry and rice. 
Luckily, volcano was right by us! So we decided to paw our way into the place to give it a shot. 

Volcano has a pretty basic menu, and has varying degrees of spices for their curry. As a cat who has a sensitive tongue, I opted for the mild curry with chicken katsu. 

The meal arrived very quickly. The server was ok but she seemed very bored if anything. 

I have to say I was a bit let down by this. The very seemed like it was that pre packaged curry you get in Asian markets. Barely any carrot or potatoes in it, kind of watery, felt like microwave instant curry. The katsu was decent, the rice was just rice, I would say that you get what you pay for, and that's cheap. 

If you need a quick bite for cheap, it's basically worth it here, but the curry really didn't do it for me here. 

*chirp*
author: Jei C.

description:
Firstly, was surprised that this place was not as big as I imagined BUT the space made it feel more homey and the waitress that night was super nice, patience, and helpful. The place was full (all the seats were taken) but there was no line when we stepped in. 

Went with my boyfriend on a Friday night and shared a chicken curry (mild) with tofu nuggets and brown rice. It was just the right amount of food for the two of us! Everything was flavorful and the best part were the tofu nuggets! 

I definitely would recommend this place if you like or love curry! I will be back to try the katsu curry! 

Pros: 
- Super yummy 
- Super nice waitress and pretty fast service 
- Options for customization 

Cons:
- Parking is always hard in SF 
- Small? (If you don't like small restaurants and I can imagine that this place could be packed)
author: Cassy Y.

description:
I highly recommend the tonkatsu curry over rice. It's definitely some of the best in the city and I'm picky about both my curries and my pork katsu. 

The miso soup is good. Udon noodles are kind of thin, but my kids eat it without complaining so I guess that doesn't matter.
author: Hanster P.

description:
3.5 stars.

They were closing in like 20mins, so we ordered to-go.

Got the regular curry with brown rice, spiciness level hot. I wish I'd gotten volcano though.. Next time! Regular curry comes with carrots, potatoes, and zucchini, all in fairly large chunks. Added eggplant, tofu, and calamari. Everything was really good, but I wish there were more than just two sad pieces of tofu. BF got the fried fish over curry, which was good too. White fish fried to perfection. I don't agree with charging an extra $1.25 for brown rice, but I guess eating healthier comes with a price (literally). Brown rice trumps white rice any day, anyway! I also wished they offered protein that isn't fried.. Oh well.

Last (but not least) complaint? I was about halfway done with my meal when I found this hard, sharp piece of white something in my food. I'm not sure what it was, but it looked (and felt) like tile.. weird! I'm glad I saw it because it honestly prooobably could've cut my esophagus or chipped a tooth. Be careful when consuming your food! 

I really do want to try the volcano level though. We shall see if I'm brave enough to venture back!
author: Leslie C.

description:
I thought this place would be a japanese curry place like curry house, but I was dead wrong. Limited selections on curry and judging by the food, I don't think it's japanese owned. I ordered the original in spicy, which also comes with brown rice like menu says, but I got white rice, wasn't spicy, and no pickles. Didn't say anything to spare more trouble for my cranky self. 
More than 80% of the people eating there were chinese too so you can tell it's definitely not japanese owned. Should've drove a little further for ramen. Never coming back here. What's weird is that you get self serve ice in a bucket instead of a dispenser.
author: Jessica T.

description:
3.5 Stars for the food. We ordered the Pork Katsu Curry & Chicken Katsu Curry and our friend ordered the Shrimp Katsu Curry. It was good, just not Muracci's level.

2 Stars for service. The girl at the front didn't seem to know what was going on. Every single one of us got served the wrong thing. Our friend was served Fish Katsu instead of Shrimp. Upon mentioning the issue the waitress replied that our friend was mistaken and she had ordered the fish. Both of us who were waiting in line to order after her and independently heard and could confirm she had ordered the shrimp. The waitress left no room for it being her own mistake, just blamed our friend and walked away. She also did not offer to fix anything or have the correct order made. For us she mixed up the Chicken / Pork plates, so we were eating the wrong orders until we realized the meats were wrong. 

Overall, this place has potential but needs some help training its staff.  Sadly this looks like a recurring issue that isn't going to change. So if you don't mind getting the wrong order or dealing with some random service issues this is a good Katsu in a crunch situation.
author: Nik G.

description: Great place. Get the Katsu with the potato croquette and egg. Always a quick go-to when I can't cook at home. Customer service is also awesome, and the food is done quick enough for me to run errands.
author: Levi F.

description: Solid curry all around. The chicken katsu is the best. The pork katsu could stand to be much more tender so they get docked 1 star for that. But this place combines realistically inexpensive curry with overall good quality and lots of options - win, win, win.
author: Art W.

description:
Japanese cuisine is often known for its beautiful and artistic presentation. It is aesthetically pleasing to the eye and looks too good to be eaten. What about a brownish goop of Japanese curry that looks like your fur baby's big dump? Oh Lordy! This is one rare instance when a gastronomic delight should not be tainted by your visual perception. Have you ever tried Japanese curry? Believe it or not, curry along with ramen, are considered the national dishes of Japan far more than sushi or even miso. Every Japanese absolutely adores curry (or kare).  It is cheap, easy to make, wholesome and irresistible! Can't think of anything else that can beat that!

Having said that, it is surprisingly hard to find good Japanese style curry houses here in the US whereas sushi places abound. In SF, we have a few places to choose from one of which is Volcano on Geary. We dropped in the other day later in the afternoon to avoid the crowd and to satisfy my cravings. Curry is always eaten with rice and with Western style fork and spoon. The curry base is usually made of meat (beef, chicken, pork, shrimp) and veggies (carrots, potatoes, onions) although noodles (udon) and bread (pan) are available in Volcano as well. The menu is quite simple. It is basically just curry over rice (white or brown) and you pick the heat level from "mild" to "volcano". Pork Katsu Curry ($8.50) is my favorite and perhaps their best seller. Pork katsu (or tonkatsu) is pork breaded with panko (bread crumbs) and fried to a golden brown. I was surprised the meat didn't dry out even though lean meat was used. Kudos to the chef! My wife ordered the Chicken Karaage Curry ($8.50) that came in 4 good-sized pieces. Karaage is the Japanese version of fried chicken. It had a dense crunchy texture but I preferred my tonkatsu being more flavorful.

There were some side orders to go with the curry and Fukuzinzuke ($1.25) was a must. Most Japanese can't enjoy curry without it. This was a bright red, sweet and savory pickle.  A major disappointment was the absence of "rakkyo", a white shallot pickled in sweet vinegar.

Overall, Volcano's curry was sweet, savory, fragrant and rich. If I were the judge in the race for the best Japanese curry in SF, Volcano gets the silver. The gold will go to Tani's Kitchen in Daly City.
author: Geoff G.

description:
Simple and convenient restaurant to get your curry fix on!

Their Pork Katsu was fried up okay.  Their sausage was below par.  Their curry was okay.  Their food entrees, in general, was decent.  I didn't care for it, but it fulfills that curry craving.  You can substitute the rice with udon noodles instead - for the noodle lovers!

I like the style of this curry shop that this place exudes.  Other than that point, passable curry, but not the best.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
My friend has been raving about volcano curry so I decided to give it a try. I personally think my mamas curry is the best but this place was better than I expected. 

I got the pork katsu curry and added a boiled egg. I think I got mild spicy and it was the right amount of spicy. The portions were huge but I still managed to finish my plate like a champ. The curry wasn't amazing but it was good. But the pork katsu was the best part. It was crunchy and so tender and juicy. 

It's a self service type of business. You order your food and pick your utensils out and sit yourself and wait til they bring your food out. Once you're done, you bring your plates/utensils to the bins on top of the garbage and sort them to where they belong. Simple and to the point. 

I'll def be back for my quick curry fix if I'm ever in the area!
author: Joanne L.

description:
I go to Volcano every time I visit my friends in SF. Delicious Japanese curry and katsu and very conveniently located. We even waited outside at 10:45am for when they opened at 11am. They have good rewards on Five Star and a super chill atmosphere inside with self-serve water. 

I usually get the Chicken Katsu curry plate and add on eggplant. The rice is really good quality too and everything just tastes really good with the curry sauce together! Mild is not spicy at all but medium has quite a bit if heat for me (I'm a wimp though, so if you like the heat then for for the full spicy volcano curry). 

The chicken katsu itself really good and balanced unlike other katsu places I've been to, not too much fried skin but not too much heavy chicken. Would highly recommend chicken katsu with vegetable add-ons! 

Go for some Sharetea right after to cool you down ;)
author: Esther M.

description: I LIKE!!! I got the Chicken Katsu Curry with medium spice level. The breading of the chicken katsu is really crispy and the chicken isn't dry. Medium is a pretty good spice level. It's not too spicy to the point where my nose is running and I'm dying of thirst, but you could definitely feel the heat. The curry is so flavorful! The spices are incredibly strong, but in a good way. It also comes with potatoes and carrots that aren't too mushy. Serving size is pretty generous.
