I was stuffed and had a little bit left over for a really small meal or snack.
author: Tara T.

description: First time I walked on I got the volcano chicken Katsu I tried Mild and it was awesome! I was going to do all the spicy flavor but not the first time I walked in. On the order, I was impressed. I'm definitely going back next time I'm in the area. Spicy flavor next time!
author: Lawrence C.

description: My friends suggested this place and I couldn't be more pleased. Food was clean and tasty. Loved the health brown rice option and was surprised to find the fried pork not greasy. Excellent place, enjoyed it so much I order it two days later and got the shrimp. Can't wait to try it again.
author: Jacqulynn O.

description:
Pros:
-great food
-big portions
-great service 
-affordable 
-good options 

Cons: 
-the ambiance may not be what you expect, basic chairs and table, hole in the wall. At one point, someone came in to look through the trash can for recyclable. They were very respectful but just odd to see while you're eating
-Warning: Volcano spice level is super spicy, might be an explosion later on lol
author: Van N.

description:
There's a paltry amount of Japanese curry restaurants in the city. Besides Volcano, Muracci's, JapaCurry & Kare-ken come to mind as the only specialty shops. It's kind of boggling that Curry House (from House) or Coco Ichibanya (world's largest Japanese curry chain) haven't established a shop in SF yet.

I don't believe Volcano is a chain from Japan but either way, something was lost in translation here. Their pork katsu was not breaded well and too oily. The medium spiced curry itself was average tasting, with no specific kick or distinctness to stand out from the standard. The sauce was more watery than thick and there wasn't enough curry to cover the whole plate with the other toppings, doing it wrong!

A good thing about Volcano is that the default curry gets served with the traditional soft potatoes and carrots which usually isn't found as a default option at larger Japanese curry chains since you have to add it on. I personally found the potatoes and carrot lacking in flavor probably because they weren't directly cooked with the curry. 

There's better katsu curry choices in the city, skip!
author: Steven C.

description:
Came here the other day with some friends. A friend from Chicago came into town and...has never had Japanese curry. WHAAA?! At a quarter century, we sought to rectify this situation. Volcano Curry was okay, but I think I prefer Muracci's in Financial District.

First of all - the portions are huge. Like, pre-ask for a take out container. I ate about 50%, then like a goat that doesn't know when to quit, continued and ate the rest. Let's say the rest of the night was a lot of belly hugging. I love my belly. My belly sometimes doesn't love me.

I had the hot (level 3) Chicken Karaage curry with zucchini and eggplant added on. I felt like too much of a fatass to order an egg too, but those eggs were hardboiled to perfection. Like, legit, one of my friends works at a Michelin star restaurant, and he agreed. 

As a spicy lover...I think I should have gone with the 2x or 3x volcano (there's a 3x!). I wasn't sure how spicy it was, so defaulted on just hot. Hot...is like a normal curry spice for me. I tasted my friend's volcano, and it was spicier. But...not spicy with depth of flavor. Just felt like they added a dash of something for the spice. BUT! It was still a better spice than "spicy." 

The Chicken Karaage was about 4 giant pieces of dark meat chicken, breaded and fried. Yum. Zucchini and eggplant were both fried, and pretty good (juicy). The curries also come with some potatoes (cooked separately from the curry...weird), and slivers of pickled radish.

Overall, I'd say this place was good, but not quite at 3 stars. The other reason it was weird is because of service. You HAVE to order before sitting (which is totally cool), but you CAN'T bus your own table, or bus a dirty table to sit down at. The ONE wait staff does it...and as she took the orders, cleaned the tables, and brought food out...it was a little much for the wait. Then again, the place can only seat about 20 people, so...I suppose it's not that bad.
author: Lily W.

description:
I love Japanese curry, so I've been hoping to try Volcano for a really long time.  Finally came here for dinner and ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry in medium spicy with a Croquette.  Usually I like my curry to have a slight kick of spice.  Medium spicy started with a nice spiciness, but eventually it died down.  A bit disappointed since the flavor didn't last.  The chicken katsu was crispy and tender so that was nice.  Not much to say about the croquette though, crispy like the katsu.
Decent price for a pretty large plate.  Definitely wouldn't mind trying again and maybe up the spice level.
author: Karen L.

description: This is a pretty good place for both curry and udon. I mostly enjoy eating their curry especially their hot spicy curry. I wouldn't suggest the volcano because I've tried once and it felt more like pain and punishment. :) It was a very funny experience and if your up to it, then try it. It was the spiciest food I have tried. Their udon is great to and it is a pretty healthy meal. I wouldn't suggest the vegetable curry because it taste like they only boiled the vegetables instead of stewing it with the curry. I would have given it a 5 star if they had stewed it to infuse the curry flavor, instead of a plain tasting carrot or potato. This was an exciting experience and I would come back for more.
author: Christopher L.

description:
I live in the city so I passed by this place a million times and every time I pass by, my boyfriend always asks me, "do you wanna try volcano?" I'm always like "nah" because I'm not a huge curry person but it's not like I hate it or anything. My boyfriend tried it without me and told me how good it was, that he "killed it in 5 minutes." I'm like wow, that's pretty impressive. So I decided to come and try it out today and I'm so happy that I did! 

The menu is a bit extensive but variety is good! So you choose the curry that you want, the spice level (mild, medium, hot, volcano), and any toppings you want to add. My bf and I both got the katsu curry in hot but he got eggplant while I got the potato croquette. Let me tell you, the first bite I was like "it's alright" but as I kept eating it, the more delicious it became. The katsu was standard but the curry was so flavorful and spicy. It was the type of spicy where it burned... But it burned so good! The potato croquette was a nice touch and the eggplant turned out to really work well with the curry. But my absolute favorite would be the Japanese pickles! They're sweet, so when paired together with the curry, you get a sweet and spicy and savory burst of flavor in your mouth. So delicious! Each plate came out around $10 if you decide to add on a topping. 

The service is prompt and friendly! It's more like a serve yourself restaurant where you get your own utensils, water, and put your plates away. The only time the server helps you is when taking your order and serving you your food. So if you want to tip, tip when you pay at the front. 

This place is really good, definitely recommend!
author: Brenda K.

description: Well the katsu was good. Can't say the same about the curry. It's a stretch to call this Japanese curry. Too spicy. Also, the way the curry is made spicy tastes like hot sauce was added to the sauce, instead of a more complex flavor buildup, which can be accomplished with a mixture of spices. I won't be returning.
author: Keau K.

description:
Woah, what the hell happened to this place ?? After a long time, we decided to go back as we were missing some good old curry but It was such an awful experience. We ordered pork katsu and shrimp. Pork was dry and it was like chewing a rug. The potatoes tasted weird. Everything had an unpleasant smell. The person at the counter did not even say Hi. Shrimp was ok but still not as good as it used to be. I hope this place will take a turn back to become a nice spot on Geary. 

Sad sad
author: Ashish N.

description: Volcano is still my favorite spot to get chicken (or pork) katsu curry: a Japanese fusion dish made popular in Hawaii before finding it's way to our very own Geary Blvd. The serving sizes are gigantic for it's price, the wait time is always at a minimum, and there's generally always a spot to eat. If you'd like a change of pace, I'd recommend swapping out your rice for garlic noodles only and adding extra pickles.
author: Dominic E.

description:
I stared outside Volcano for a few quick seconds.  No, this wasn't an actual natural disaster waiting to happen, rather a Japanese curry shop.  Peering down at my Bun awaiting her little nod of confirmation to enter, she was nowhere to be found.  I looked through the glass only to notice that she already scurried in.  
 
Everything inside is fairly no frills containing plain chairs and tables in a cafeteria style.  I noticed others cleaning up after themselves and bussing their own tables on our way cashier to order.  
 
CHICKEN CURRY and the HAMBURGER STEAK CURRY with POTATO CROQUETTE were our dining plates of the night.  MEDIUM spicy was a safe bet for both.  I'm not testing any spicy level called "Volcano" on a first try.  Who knows how I'll react the next morning.  

Curries flavor depth were very simple.  Both included a couple potatoes and carrots.  Chicken meat from the CHICKEN CURRY was fine.  Nothing was seasoned out of the ordinary.  Bun's HAMBURGER STEAK was topped with cheese, nice touch.  It wasn't the best ever, but it was good complimentary to the curry.

I really didn't know what to think.  Was I expecting too much?  Leaving I had a sense of disappointment.  As far as satisfying my appetite, it did.  For me everything was just satisfactory.
author: Arnold T.

description:
I was so hungry on my way back from class, and I was craving Japanese curry.  So stopped here.

I wanted the chicken katsu curry, but I need to get ready for a wedding.. so I opted for just the plain chicken.  I cheated a little and got the spam katsu mini sandwich.... 

I think the chicken was cooked with the curry (I got it with medium spice), which gave it a lot of flavor.  Overall, it was a good dish, but something I could have made on my own.

I used to get the curry mild, but now I'm really liking the medium spice.  It's doesn't hit you hard at first, but once you keep eating, the spice gets stronger.

And I enjoyed my spam katsu.  It's fried spam, so what's not to love?
author: Vira P.

description: Ahhhh.. Yummy home-cooked curry with rice. Simple dishes like these satisfy me.
author: Gloria L.

description: Delicious curries! Got the chicken soup and it was almost gone by the time I left. :D Doesn't happen too often!
author: Dominique F.

description:
yum yum yum!! First time trying this place, and definitely enjoyed my first experience here. The food is very homey and definitely comfort food for me.  I had the tomato chicken curry, and the bf had the special that day, I think it was the ginger curry? Both were pretty good!  All the curries come with rice, and there's usually veggies in the curry as well.  You get quite a bit of food for the amount that you pay, and it's pretty filling.  

This place is set up almost like a cafeteria, where you walk up to the counter, order, and pay.  Even the ambiance has an almost-cafeteria feel to it.  

The service was good, the girls working the counter seemed nice.  They do need a better system of giving you numbers when you order, instead of doing it by memory, because they got a few orders wrong when bringing food to the tables.
author: Kay A.

description: I'm down grading my review of Volcano and I'll explain why. When they first opened they serviced more generous amounts of curry and the quality of the produce they used to use was a lot higher. They also used to include zucchini in their curry which my hubby and I really enjoyed and thought was a nice and unique touch! I'm saddened by all of these changes and I hope the owner reads this and takes this all into consideration! It's really sad to see all these changes happen to such a great place!
author: Sayuri I.

description:
They have a great food selection, affordable selections , good and reliable service. You come here for cheap good Japanese curry! not for the interior look. It's totally acceptable, clean and comfortable don't get me wrong. But this place isn't a high end cute eatery with decor and such. 

PS: their hot level spicy will literally make you feel like your mouth is on fire.
author: Brian L.
Vivian C.

description:
Volcano's a weird place that I have walked pass a few times. The inside reminds me of like a donut shop with its layout, but they sell curry and other stuff. 

== Food ==

Katsu Pork Curry. There's a nice portion to the dish. The katsu pork is nicely done where it's very crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The curry sauce is a bit weird. It's a thick creamy sauce unlike the more watery kind. There's two pieces of carrots and potatoes that are added afterwards. You can tell that hasn't soaked in the curry spices. They throw off the dish a bit.

== Service ==

This place has a weird system going on. There's a sign that says to order first before seating. So it's a hybrid between a cafe and restaurant where you stand in line and order at the cash register. Then the cashier tells you where to sit. If you try to sit down before ordering, the cashier will kick you off the table. It didn't happen to me, but I saw it happen to a couple of tables. After ordering, the cashier brings the food to your table.

== Overall ==

Tastes okay. Nothing really special here. It's cheap. Good portions. It's A-OK. Don't expect anything amazing.
author: Steven B.

description:
It's good but it's not great. The cashier girl was amazing and really knowledgeable and food came out promptly.
One star off for being spicy but not spicy and for the curry sauce not having that awesome home made flavor that I love so much about Japanese curry.
Another star off for not having omelette - Katsu combo which is the absolute best Japanese curry combo IMO and for being so cheap with the pickle radishes.
On the good side, other reviewers are right, the Katsu is awesome
author: Sara C.

description:
UGH. This place is always amazing. If I could afford spending $20 on a meal with all the veggie add ons I would come here everyday. 

The add ons is definitely what completes the meal. Each add on roughly range from $1 and up depending.
author: Pj A.

description: the chicken curry... wow. this is definitely my new favorite spot in sf. i came here after a shoot with my sister and best friend. the day after my best friend came in for another two days, 3 days in the same week! we honestly, really enjoyed the food here. my sister chose to get the chicken noodle soup... BOMB. so GOOD. i can't wait for my next visit, i highly recommend!
author: Juliet Q.

description: Came in for lunch and had the chicken katsu curry, medium intensity. Came nice and piping-hot and smelled wonderful. Chicken was breaded nicely and the curry was spicy. I underestimated the medium intensity. I love curry, and it had me sipping on water. So choose wisely. Plenty of food leftover after i had my fill. Great plate and happy i chose this one on my first visit. Volcano intensity in my next attempt, bring a towel for sweating.
author: Eric G.

description:
The Chicken and Pork Katsu Curry seem to be the popular items here and that's what I stick with. The staff is usually busy, but they will always help you with the menu as it can be a bit confusing your first or second visit.

I always just walk in and order takeout. Even when busy its usually not more than a 10 min wait and a free table may be available for you to sit at.

Simple review here: I love spicy food but I stick with the "medium" spice level at Volcano. Volcano's curry doesn't have spice at the beginning of tasting like many spicy foods; it's that spice that creeps up and just heats up your mouth at the end. Even though I like to sweat from spicy food sometimes, I believe I'll stick with medium from here on as it lets me just enjoy the other flavors of the food better at Volcano.

Highs:
-Portion of protein is generous, beautifully cut, and cooked to *perfection*
-Rice is nicely cooked and with lovely sticky texture
-Tofu nuggets have a few edamame inside (fried)
-Availability of fukujinzuke pickle  (!You must have this with Japanese curry to balance flavor and texture! Really, don't skip it!)
-Spam (also fried) is tasty

Lows:
-The price of all the little add ons, (like the pickle, nugets, Jalapenos and anything else) can make the meal a bit pricey.
-Not many vegetable options if you want a "balanced" meal 
-Curry sauce ( of all spice levels ) is surprisingly not the highlight; in fact a little refinement/ creativity in this area could improve this little restaurant to be stellar.
-Volcano spice level simply added heat/burning over the medium level of spiciness, not really a flavor element.

Pro Tips:
-Don't skip fukujinzuke pickle.
-They have a "secret" Double Volcano level of spiciness if you dare.
-ShareTea (update: now TeaOne) bubble tea is a few stores down; If you can fit all that food in your belly then a nice boba is a cool accompaniment to your curry.

Take away:
I like Volcano, and I'll likely go back many more times. The only caveat is that what is good food could be amazing with some tweaks; but I don't expect them to break what isn't fixed as Volcano seems to do steady business thanks to quality, consistency, and fast service.
author: Steve B.

description:
I came here wanting to see how their curry fared. When I came in on a Monday night, the place looked pretty busy so I thought that's a good sign. Guess I was wrong. 

I ordered the chicken curry, heat - mild, to go. I will say I was a bit underwhelmed. The curry smelled amazing but it was very bland. The chicken was tender and the carrots and potatoes were fine. But overall not the best first impression. I didn't get a higher level of spice because I wanted to taste the actual curry. I will not be coming back.
author: Yvonne T.

description:
A Japanese curry house in San Francisco?! Sugoi ne!

You'll see these types of curry houses all of Japan. You get to choose your level of spiciness and then choose the protein from fried shrimp, sausage, to the traditional pork cutlet (katsu). For the record, HOT is pretty hot. I would recommend it for those who like spicy food to begin with otherwise it might be too spicy for some people. Otherwise, most people should just order medium. 

The curry itself was awesome. I cook Japanese curry at home often but this was unlike anything that I make. It was light and smooth yet had depth and spice. I don't know how they make it but the curry was flavorful and not watery at all. On top of that, the average price is only around $7 a plate. 

For fans of curry, you have to make a trip to Volcano in San Francisco.
author: Pari P.

description:
Japanese curry is my guilty pleasure.  I know I'm going to over eat whenever I order it, yet I can't help but love the saucy and spicy goodness that is Japanese curry.  I came here with a good friend for dinner and for the price, got a pretty good portion of beef curry with a side potato croquette http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=rq360H75ee1wO8kKv0CgHQ&userid=pA9wbuYcK3GArQA8gS85Lw.  It was soooo yummy that I almost finished all of it.  Almost...

Alright, you got me, I finished it all.  

But enough about me, my friend had the chicken curry which was yummy as well http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/volcano-san-francisco?select=jHqJ8u4XCVrYzA3iwWRU1g#jHqJ8u4XCVrYzA3iwWRU1g.  I do wish they provided more of the red pickled side dish, but I don't even know what it is called to be able to ask for more.  They have noodles and sandwiches too.  Was that spam I saw on the menu?  Yes, another guilty pleasure of mine.

It's pretty casual here and the staff are very nice.  If I'm in the area, I'm definitely going to stop by again. Those mini spam sandwiches are calling my name.
author: Maria S.

description:
Volcano offers a satisfying curry that is on par with fast food establishments I visited in Tokyo. Today, I tried their 'hot' flavored pork katsu curry ($9) as takeout. The dish was spicy enough and with plenty of meat. The thing that knocked a few stars off was the lack of curry with my take-out. As you can see from my photo, the curry was only half full and was not enough to soak the rice as well as the katsu. In addition, the rice barely covered the base of the take-out container. There were no zucchinis in my curry as pictured from their website. 
 
The positives: Quick friendly service, fast kitchen, tasty food and cheap.
The not so greats: Not enough curry and rice.
author: Jeff H.

description:
So, I was starving the whole day, and Starving Me = No good No fun. ALL BAD. Luckily, Christina H. introduced me to Volcano and brought me here as well. 

FYI:
-Playing cards/games not allowed
-volcano is the highest level of spiciness (mild, medium, hot, volcano)
-you can add additional toppings to your meal (i.e.  spam, broiled egg, pickles, croquette, etc)
-order at counter and you seat yourself
-they have Frequent Buyer Cards where you get deals after filling up on the stamp cards! 
-*********CASH ONLY******
-Dont worry! if you forgot cash, there are nearby ATMs!

Chicken Katsu Curry ($7.95): 4 stars. I'm probably the worst Vietnamese ever, but I got mild because I cant handle the heat! My first time having Japanese curry and this was pretty delish! The katsu did not taste too heavily fried and the curry was just right. The curry was extremely flavorful and melted with the chicken. I LOVE how they were very generous with the curry because they gave a LOT! Reasonable price for delicious food!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/volcano-san-francisco?select=t-8ok0O1FyjKD-2xzoOXuw#4cl6mYnRhaDT9bHSX9XPTA 

Cravings satisfied!
author: Chena N.

description:
I've always heard about this place but never really had the urge to come in (too much good food in Richmond district lol). One day, while yelping for places to eat, my boyfriend being the foodie he is, told me to give this place a shot. He's been here once before and said it was pretty good. Just your average curry katshu with rice BUT better! 

I was a little taken back about how casual this place was. For some reason, I pictured Volcano to be a bit more fancier? Ordering food was a bit weird. We had to go up to order and pay before sitting down and waiting for the food. This was different because I'm used to being seated, getting menus, ordering, waiting for the food, eating, and then paying! But I guess since this is a quick grab and go kind of place? 

The food was pretty spectacular here and I could definitely tell that the curry did not come from a box. The katshu was wow, simply all that I could hope for. It's fried and the top layer has this amazing crisp and crunch to it that I just couldn't say no to, even when I was full. The rice was a bit hard but that wasn't a problem once I mixed it in with some curry. I finished my whole plate and once my boyfriend and I was done, we got up to leave because the bill has already been dealt with in the beginning! Great experience, will come back again!
author: Abby C.

description:
Spicy food. If those two words are in your vocabulary, Volcano Curry should be on your go-to list of places to burn your insides. The fact dishes go as high as you want past the menu's listed heat levels puts VC definitively ahead of Burma SuperStar's "Chili Lamb", John's Snack & Deli's "Suicide Volcano Burrito", Khan Toke's "fire! fire! fire!", and - I'm saying it - Lime Tree's "very very very spicy very very very". (photo http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lime-tree-southeast-asian-kitchen-san-francisco?select=jVfqy5Q77IAzMnvpiH-G1A)

Volcano's public levels are Mild, Medium, Hot, and Volcano. I skipped 2 x Volcano and went right into 3 x Volcano on my last visit. Just a whiff of my curry burned my friend's nose. I chose my speech carefully so as to not move too much air as I spoke lest I feel extra burn. I don't recommend going much further, but they've got it as hot as you want it.
author: Dan B.

description:
been coming here forever but never reviewed it till now. love this place and so happy there is good Japanese curry here in the city. I usually get the fried shrimps curry but today i ordered chicken katsu instead. 

the shrimps are never over cooked and done perfectly. the chicken katsu was good too. nice crispy outside and soft chicken inside. I got hot level with the curry and always ask for no veggie which are carrots and potatoes. they are filling and it is already hard for me to finish the big plate of curry rice. 

I like the cute girl with the colored hair there. she busts her butt off even when busy and keeps people in check. I love that she asks people to order prior to sitting down because it is only fair for the people that are in line waiting to place order and eating there. 

lots of college kids there because it is close to a college housing complex. good pricing on the food.
author: Jules L.

description:
On Saturday, October 29, 2016, I came to Volcano for dinner with a friend and ordered a Shrimp curry. However, when my dish arrived, I took a bite out of the shrimp and it immediately fell apart, both in my mouth and my chopsticks. Now, this was not the "melt like butter" sensation; rather, this was more of a far-from-fresh, mushy shrimp. The breading crumbled off the shrimp and the shrimp could not hold its shape. I called over the waitress/cashier and she brought my dish to the cooks to make sure it wasn't raw or if anything was wrong. She came back and told me that the cooks said it should look like this. I was quite disturbed and told her I probably still wouldn't touch the shrimp anymore. She was nice enough to offer that they make a new dish of my choice for me. I ended up picking chicken, but the wait for the new dish took so long, I asked them to just to-go it. For the rest of the meal, I ended up just picking at my friend's rice.

Once we got home, though, my stomach began to feel uneasy and nauseous. I proceeded to spend the next 4 hours trying to calm my stomach with pepto bismol and ended up throwing up whatever I had at dinner. I did not eat the chicken curry I had brought home, as I could barely keep down water at all. I had plans to go out that night, but I had to cancel them all just so I could attempt to recover from this episode. The next two days was spent living off of bananas, saltine crackers, and oatmeal.

I was quite shocked to see this place serve food of such low quality, but even more astonished, knowing that the employees told me to my face that it was okay. If one bite of bad shrimp put me out of commission for 2 days, I can't imagine what would have happened if I took their word and ate the rest of their dish.

This will probably be my first and my last time visiting this establishment, but I do warn all future customers to watch out for what they put on your plate. I would hate to see anyone else go through what I had to go through.
author: Alexa W.

description: One of the better Japanese curry spots in San Francisco! Usually from what I see the katsu plates are the most popular. I always get the chicken or pork Katsu plates because i feel like the other ones are too soggy! comes with rice and slices of potatoes and a piece of carrot. definitely a spot you want to stop by if you looking for a quick n easy grub. Also if you are thirsty after this flavorful meal, stop by sharetea down that block for that quick boba fix!!
author: Auden W.

description:
Great curry and the other dishes are solid too. 

No great for young kids. No boosters or highchairs.
author: Peter F.

description:
Great Curry. Fast service.

All of their currys are delicious. I def come here alot 

Try their chicken tomato curry if you dont want fried
author: Moto B.

description:
Good service and bomb @$$ curry! What more could you ask for?

I've tried the crispy shrimp, chicken w/ added tofu, and the beef curry. All with the medium spicy level, all were soo good I finished the whole plate each time!
author: Dennis L.

description: The chicken katsu curry is pretty good. The service is fast and the place is cosy and well located.
author: Sadia H.

description:
Great place, great service, great food.

I tried the pork volcano curry with rice and it was amazing. It tastes as good as it looks in the picture. and the level of spiciness is very accurate. I ordered medium, at first I thought it was too mild for my taste but as long as you keep eating it will build up the hotness until it reaches what your tastebuds want.

Additionally the place is very clean. Costumers have to be self-conscious about putting their empty plates and bowls in their corresponding bins. 

I will definitely come back many times.
author: H C.

description:
I've heard about this place for a while and always wanted to try it. Came here for the first time with my boyfriend for dinner. It was our first time eating japanese curry.

My boyfriend ordered the pork katsu curry with medium spice and a potato croquette on the side. I had the chicken katsu curry with medium spice. Dishes are served with a couple of chunks of potatoes and carrots. The katsu was crispy and tender.

You order and pay at the counter and seat yourself. The dishes are reasonably priced, around $10.

I'd definitely come back.
author: Michelle L.

description: For my group & I's first time the food was good, we enjoyed it but the customer service was poor. The lady who took our order did not want to take our order or so that was the vibe we got from her.
author: Pater C.

description:
I came here, absolutely famished, after a hiking trip with some friends. That being said, I do think the food here is objectively good. 

I had the pork katsu curry, with sausage topping and fried spam sandwich. (All in one sitting!) Both the pork katsu and curry were solid, and I appreciated that the included vegetables and potatoes. The spam sandwich (deep fried spam in a sliced roll) was simple but yummy.

The setting is very casual, great for takeout or a quick meal. And, as others have mentioned, it's great value for the price.
author: Lawrence W.

description: Very solid curry place!  Very casual as well.  Very affordable!  All great starts to my first meal here.  I got the chicken karaage curry medium with white rice and no extra toppings.  When I received the food, the first thing I thought was, dang, I wish I got more chicken pieces.  But the flavor of the curry itself was delicious!  The chicken karaage was also not overfried and very juicy.  I would come back to try some other curries!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
I honestly didn't want to come here because I was never craving curry, but my boyfriend insisted that I try this place out because the menu looked good and there were other options I could choose from. So, I decided to try this place out because 1. I have an hour break and 2. it's right across the street from where I work.

When you walk in, there are signs that tell you to place your order first, then take a seat because no one is going to walk to your table and take your order, so I would suggest going up to the cashier to break the habit of seating yourself and waiting for someone to come to you.

My first time here, I ordered the beef udon. I actually had to ask the cashier what her favorite was out of all the udon choices they had and she recommended me the beef udon. So, I went with her decision and sat myself down afterwards. It took around 5-10 minutes to get my order, so you don't have to wait long depending on what dish you get and this time, the cashier comes to you to drop off your order, but you have to get back up to get utensils and napkins.

When I tried the beef udon, it was pretty good! It didn't look like the typical udon I normally get, but I'm glad I went with the cashier's decision. The beef chunks were tender and delicious! I'd definitely eat here again, but I don't think I will be since I don't work around the area anymore (it was more convenient for me to eat here since I worked across the street. It's a 30 minute drive out to this place if I were to go again).
author: Trisha L.

description:
Putting this curry house on my quick comfort food list. I normally make japanese curry at home using Golden Curry and my own veggies. I can see myself frequenting Volcano often for a fast meal when i'm lacking time to cook it up myself!

Their curry sauce is slightly thinner than i'm used to. The flavor is right on though and i could ask seconds for tonkatsu curry with a lot of potatoes. I always go down a notch when i have to choose a spicy level for the first time i dine at a restaurant. The medium did not pack as much heat as i would have nearly liked. Going for the "Volcano" next time :)

They take your order up at the counter and bring you the plate after you take a seat. Easy!!
author: Samantha L.

description:
Pretty good, curry looks a bit water down, but didn't effect the taste!

Love that their curry uses chicken stock base!

Will definitely come again!
author: Jennie C.

description: I've unlocked the special delicious secret of Volcano- the Chicken Katsu sandwich.  Generously portioned on soft white bread, doused with tonkatsu sauce and complimented with chopped cabbage- this is a great option in the area.  I'll be back for this one again and again...
author: Andy S.

description: You must try to get to know what the real curry is. Even tho the Mexican people are the one preparing the Japanese curry but I believe the owner pass down his talent to them for sure because the curry is really tasty and rich. I recommend this place to anyone who like to eat curry.
author: Alan L.

description:
This is one of my go-to spots when I'm very feeling hungry and cheap. For less than $10 (depending how crazy you go with add-ons) you get a BIG portion of rice topped with with a lake of golden yellow flavorful kare (curry) sauce dotted with a few potatoes and carrots and whatever meat/ fish thing you choose. I pretty much always get the chicken katsu, a piping hot deep-fried slab of breaded chicken. I usually throw on a hard-boiled egg as well. All garnished with lurid red pickles of some sort. This is Japanese curry, curry by way of England to Japan, flour based turmeric roux,  thus it's not really Indian food, so don't be surprised. 
The atmosphere is semi-self-serve (you order at the counter, they bring it, you clear your dishes).
Your belly will be filled and your purse will not be too emptied.
author: S M.

description:
Japanese curry isn't something that I would usually go out of my way for (hence, the Golden Curry you can find in the Asian supermarkets does it for me already!)  but this place has been on my radar for a while.

I went simple and tried their original curry medium spice (7.25) with the tofu nugget as a topping (+1.25 for two pieces). All in all, the curry itself is good but like others have already said, it isn't amazing and still, a dish I won't go out of my way for. I do like how the curry texture is smooth, thick and NOT grainy (which I have experienced in my instant curry.. hehe) and full of flavor. According to my understanding, all curry dishes come with vegetables which include potatoes, carrots, and zucchini (correct me if I'm wrong). For a little less than $10, I was full from eating the rice with curry and I still had leftovers.

The food itself ranks up to 3 stars for me, but the service and cleanliness of the place bumps it up another star. The girl at the counter was very helpful and kind with taking my order. If you get takeout, they separate the rice and curry so they won't get soggy in the box. I don't know when the next time I'll take a visit here, but it's a good choice if you're craving this kind of food.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Quick in and out sit down or take out!

Big plate of food, volcano plate special of shrimp and calamari for $10! 

Big mound of rice, fried squid rings and three fried shrimp. Of course with my huge appetite I ate the whole plate but yes it really is a lot of food.

The poor gal at the register was also busing and cleaning tables and she was definitely doing her best. 

I'd definitely like to come back and try the udon!
author: Malika H.

description:
The donkatsu curry wasn't bad.  The outer layer was crispy, maybe a bit too crispy.
The curry comes in 4 spiciness levels: mild, medium, spicy, and volcano.  The volcano is definitely doable.  It;s the subtle kind of spice where your lips burn.

The curry comes with chunks of potato and carrots.
You pay and you sit.

There's a lot of flies in the resto. 
They should invest in those air curtains.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Not bad, not great. Solid spot when you're hungry and looking for a quick, comfort meal. I ordered for take out from here in the restaurant and they forgot the potato croquette add-on which I didn't realize until I had already gotten home. Too lazy to walk back since I ordered during warriors game 6 half time. Check your orders before you leave!

Chicken katsu was crispy, curry and vegetables were alright.
author: Kevin L.

description:
LOVE this place!! I have had chicken Katsu curry, chicken Katsu volcano plate, and pork Katsu curry. Typically I don't stray from these choices as they are my favorites! Never ever disappointed! Get food from here at least once every 3 weeks, always end with a full stomach and feeling satisfied :) so glad to have this place around the neighborhood! Oh and to go ordering only takes about 5-15 minutes to be ready! 
Each plate is roughly $10
author: Terilyn T.

description: Ordered the brand new Spinach & Mushroom Veggie Curry (with added Eggplant).  It was phenomenal!  So excited to see a veggie curry added to the menu!  Highly recommend this deliciousness.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Volcano is usually my go-to spot for spicy curry, but yesterday sucked. I've been craving spicy volcano curry for weeks, and I finally had the chance to go. I called in for take-out. The convo went something like this:

Me: "Hi I would like to order take out" 
Cashier: "OK" (awkward silence + doesn't say anything else)
Me: "Um.. I would like the chicken katsu curry" 
Cashier:"OK" (again... AWKWARD SILENCE. Is she even gonna ask me what level I want? How about if I wanted to add any toppings?)
Me: "Can I get it 'volcano'?"
Cashier: "OK, itll be ready in 10 minutes." 

Food was ready when I arrived. When it was time to eat it, I realized that my curry was not spicy at all. She gave me "non-spicy".... The portions also got smaller over the years. This place has definitely downgraded. My spicy volcano curry craving was not satisfied :(.
author: Fanny H.

description: Authenticate Japanese curry.  Fairly large portions.  This is a quick serve restaurant so don't expect table service.  Food was hot and fresh and fair value for the money.
author: Gil L.

description:
So I eat Japanese Curry quite a bit, and even at small places in Daly City :o But I happened to find the Volcano experience both delicious and differentiating.

Spicy? Well yes of course it was, and not so much that it was overpowering.

Toppings? Again yes as I was able to get egg and croquette to go along with my rice and vegetables.

Positives? Room to sit and an incredibly tasty meal for both of us.

Negatives? Need more beverage choices maybe? And a slight tomato taste to the curry.

Revisit? Yes
author: Matt M.

description: Went to this restaurant last night and it was soooooo goood. All the items I believe are under $10. You order at the register and then can take a seat. We ordered the chicken katsu and the hamburger steak (which actually is pretty much meatloaf). When you first get the dish, it doesn't look that appetizing, but the flavors are actually really good. Between the chicken katsu and the hamburger steak, I'd recommend the hamburger steak because with the curry you get a taste of sweet and spicy (there is ketchup on the hamburger steak). You can choose how spicy your curry is. Just a heads up, mild is actually no spice added. Plus you get a ton of food. I do think it is strange though that the cashier will bring you your food, but then you have to get up for your own utensils.. Plus they also bus your table for you, but won't bring you utensils and napkins? Strange. You do also have to get your own water so I guess it's fine, but it was weird since we had to get up again right after she brought us our food. Anyways, not a big deal. I highly recommend this place though. Get the hamburger steak even though all the reviews say chicken katsu. It's delicious!
author: Julie L.

description:
Great food
Selection is better than any other curry spot in the city.
Chill vibe even on sunday,which is hard to find these days.
I love the mini sandwiches, reminds me of hawaii.
Come here and try the volcano curry, if you dig spicy,you'll be satisfied. 
Also,their miso here is made right,and not watery in the least
Curry spots are few and far between ,quality ones are fewer
This guy made me and my family happy,so there you go
Simple food,great traditional flavors and a great topping selection. 
5 stars to funk you up
author: t m.

description:
A friend of mine who lives in SF always comes back to eat here whenever he goes home. Since I was in the area with him and my dragonboat team from Davis after competing in the College Cup race, we decided to see what this place was all about on a Sunday night at around 5:30-6:00pm. 

It was pretty packed already with my whole team being there but we were able to find a seat in this small place. Service took a while but maybe because it was pretty packed at around this time.

I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry. In my opinion, I think they overcharge their curries for the price of about $8.00 a plate. They give a lot of rice, decent amount of meat, a lot of sauce, and not enough of the carrots and potatoes. Even though it was a bit pricey, I definitely was full off the plate because of the amount of rice they gave you. 

Might come back to this place to try their other dishes if I am in the area and if I am really craving Japanese curry.
author: Amy T.

description:
You should choose volcano curry on these occasions. 
1) last minute dinner on a weekday as you have no idea what to cook
2) headache from hang over or just drank too much and you need to fill your tummy. 

It's an easy option. You order at the counter and grab a seat before you order as the dining area isn't big and seating is first come first serve.
author: Sam S.

description: I had the chicken katsu curry with rice and it was delicious. I will come back to try the volcano plate (no curry)!
author: Coralie S.

description: Dank, Affordable and Good Japanese Beef Curry.
author: Ivan Y.

description: I noticed this place got a bad health rating but I've never seen anything at the actual restaurant mentioning that. The place itself looks fine to me and I've never gotten sick from eating there. I actually went there last night. My food tasted the same, but I did notice that the batter of the chicken was a little different. It wasn't a big change and not a negative one either. I love coming here for the chicken katsu curry with the potato croquette. I come here whenever I'm in the area and suggest it whenever people ask!
author: Athina L.

description: Terrific!!!! I was definitely craving Japanese curry for the past year and half and now that I'm in San Francisco, I had to eat Japanese curry.  I had the beef curry and my fiance had the pork curry. So good!!!! I would totally want to eat here every week if I lived in San Francisco.
author: Thuy-Nhu N.

description:
This place wasn't bad, considering how much bang you get for you buck. That being said, the food is basic. It's not like I was expecting some SUPER authentic curry. In fact, I had zero expectations going in, and I left full and satisfied, it just wouldn't be my first choice for a Richmond district lunch. After all, we did pass up on Lou's Cafe (power outage) and Chomp and Swig (open at 4pm on Mondays). 

Pros:
CHEAP
Easy ordering experience
Super cute cashier ;)

Cons
Basic food

I think the 3 stars is fair. Wasn't bad, but wasn't great, therefore it's "A-OK." Ok, fine, 3.5 for the cute asian cashier girl :D
author: Aaron C.

description: I probably get takeout curry from Volcano every other week. I can't live without it! The interior is pretty basic fast food style, clean, and the staff are all very sweet.
author: Alina L.

description:
You get a LOT for what you pay for! The food is very filling and delicious, and  the service was fast and easy. The cashier/server was quick to respond to spills and created order out of circumstances that may have otherwise turned to chaos. 

Definitely coming back again, especially on those days when I'm really hungry and on a budget.
author: Angelica R.

description: The curry here is good, yet it is not as flavorful as I had thought. Many friends recommended this place but I didn't think it lived up to par with the Chicken Katsu Curry.  You order by the counter and the food is brought out to your table. There's free water available as well. Overall, I care most about the food quality above all and since it didn't impress me, I most likely won't be coming back until a long time.
author: Eva H.

description: Clearly the best Japanese curry I have ever had. The restaurant is nicely decorated, the staff is chill, and the prices here are definitely cheaper than other places. They also give pretty big portions in the rice plates and the noodle soups. My favorites here are the chicken katsu curry w/ a boiled egg and the beef curry noodle soup, and they NEVER disappoint. Only thing I could say is that to me there's a lot of veggies in the soup, but I just rly don't like veggies, so maybe it's just me. Overall, this is definitely one of my favorite curry restaurants and well deserving of five stars.
author: Nathan J.

description:
I REALLY REALLY LOVE to eat curry and this place offers a very flavorful one! I always get the chicken katsu either medium or mild in spice level (they have mild, medium, hot, and volcano). I recommend putting a generous amount of their katsu sauce over the chicken katsu. It's the bomb.com.  I always wish that that they gave more veggies instead of 4 measly pieces of potatoes and carrots.  If you like you're food spicy, I recommend getting medium. It's at the point where you get a nice kick but you can still enjoy the curry umami flavor.  

They also have sandwiches, noodles, and different rice plates if you personally do not like curry.  I'm not sure if their machine was broken today or if it's been this way always but they do not accept card...so just being cash in case.
author: Sam L.

description:
May I please have the pork katsu with no curry.  No curry?  Wait, are you guys known for you curry?  


#1 If you've never been here before and you have no idea what to order, look at the pictured menu or ask for help
#2 Get the curry

The pork katsu was nice and crispy, not too greasy.  Half the plate was filled with pork, the other with rice and sauce.  My friends and I had a lot of leftover rice and curry so feel free to ask for a to-go box, combine that ish, and enjoy a second meal at home.
author: Linda N.

description:
Located on Geary just a block from Sharetea and Creations, parking is fairly difficult. It's a very tiny location with about 8-10 tables inside so you have to be quick when a table opens up to dine-in. Definitely not made for groups. Right next to the cashier, you can grab your napkins, utensils and water.

To order you pick your protein, the spicy level that you want and any add-ons if you wanted. 

Our Order:
Pork Katsu Curry ($8.50) w/ Hard Boiled Egg (+$1)
Onion Ginger Pork Special ($8.50) w/ Potato Croquette (+$1.50)

We ordered our food in to-go containers because there were no tables when we walked in. Luckily one opened up and our food was brought to us. It was a little confusing trying to figure out whose order was in each container (though one was labeled "meeedddiiuuumm.") That threw us off because neither of us had the medium (I ordered mild while my friend had spicy). My friend was too hungry to have them exchange it for the spicy curry that he had ordered though. 

I can barely handle Sriracha and the medium was just manageable. I really enjoyed the Garlic Onion Curry though and would definitely suggest ordering it if it's on the menu. Wasn't overly packed with onion or garlic. The carrots and potatoes weren't super soft like I would've liked though which is usually my favorite part of curries. =( If you like thicker curries, the curry here would disappoint since it's more on the soupy side. Fairly good curry but not really that authentic.

Note: They use the FiveStars Rewards Program
author: Kitty K.

description: The first time that I came I actually got lost getting here. When I came in, the servers were fairly friendly. When I walked in, I actually just sat down waiting for the servers but come to find out that I had to order first. Thus I felt a little stupid. I ordered the mild chicken Katsu, which was good and fairly price. Yum
author: Shirley G.

description: I come here semi frequently due to the location being close to my workspace on Geary.  I typically get a to-go order of the chicken or pork katsu curry with [hot] level spice; sometimes [volcano], but [hot]  is pleasant enough.  If I'm feeling particularly hungry I add the potato croquette.  I recently decided to try their katsu sandwich.  I was pleasantly surprised and have since switched up my lunch between the curry or the sandwich.  We're not talking about phenomenal curry etc, but it's tasty for the price, convenience, and repeatability.
author: V. Y.

description: I had the Chicken Katsu Curry Plate with no extras on top. The chicken Katsu itself was great and it came with a ton of rice. I didn't particularly like the curry vegetables. Overall, I expected a bit more from the place, but I'd still have it again
author: James V.

description: This is always a hit when I don't want to cook but still want something comforting. Service is usually pretty quick, but it can get busy so I'd expect a wait. I've had some success with calling ahead to order but often times they're too busy and don't answer the phone so usually I just walk in and order. I've only tried the chicken katsu curry and it's always predictably a satisfying and filling meal. The only reason I've knocked it a star is that the service is sometimes hit or miss. Always efficient but not always friendly.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Capsasin "hot" spot. My mouth was recovering from the spicy Japanese curry even thirty minutes after my meal! Volcano has a simple easy to follow menu and a small dining area that gives it a more homey feel. There are four different levels of spice you can have in your curry, Mild, Medium, Hot, and Extra Hot. I'm a bit of a wimp with spicy food, so I went with medium. But WOW it was delicious and the spice didn't mask the taste of the food. You can still pick up flavors from the rest of the dishes! 

Also, I'm so glad they have a self serve water bar available to the customers. So for all the wimpy spicy food-ers, you won't feel embarrassed to ask for a barrel of water, it's part of the routine. 

Bottom line: Little hot spot, very tasty.
author: Jaime W.

description: Always good, always nice, gets packed so I usually order out in afternoon time,  but they manage seating well. Get the curry, or don't but do add a topping so yummy. The soups are great, literally everything is good :) don't change the plates too much they are delicious the way they are don't be afraid to try new things. :)
author: Katie B.

description:
I just don't get why this place is such a popular curry spot? 
It's the furthest thing from a quality Japanese curry place. 

For one, it's far too watery. 
Secondly, the veggies are boiled separately and mixed together when you order. 
I tried desperately to like but after 2 times, I just can't go anymore. 
The quality is nowhere near where it should be to get 4 or 5 stars from Yelpers.
author: Chris L.

description:
Amazing!

Katsu was very well fried, it has good crunching texture when chewing! Not over filling the plate! Right portion curry and veggie! Japanese standard of spicy, authentic!
author: Michelle W.

description:
My friend loves this restaurant, but not for me. I wasn't expecting anything special, and indeed it was nothing special. Just some normal white rice with simple chewy braised meat/or pork for around $10. 

Not sure if related, but I got diarrhea later that day.
author: Peter C.

description:
FAV PLACE FOR CURRY.

I come here very often (20x atleast) and this restaurant never fails to SATISFY me!!!

Workers are nice, tables are
Clean n spaced out, cute decor, and yummy food!

I ALWAYS get the chicken katsu curry, as it is what the place is famous for, and on mild spicy. It cost 9$ for all this goodness and it will fill you up so bad !!

You order before you eat, get your own eating utensils, water, and as you finish, they leave a cute note on how to organize your finished dishes! They also accept fivestars and Ive gotten free chicken katsu curry :)

The menu has sandwiches, curry with noodles or rice, soup with noodle or udon, etc.  I honestly dont recommend their udon or soup noodles. Tried it once and just hated how plain it tasted.

LOVE THIS PLACE, TRUE CUSTOMER HERE!
author: Josie D.

description:
This place was relatively new when I first went here and right after my first curry plate here, I was in heaven. The portions are between just right to almost too much.The curry is nice and spicy no matter what level you decide to get and the cashiers are very attentive. The first time I was here, there was only one person in the front giving out orders, taking order and clearing everything from tables to the dirty plates and she still had time to ask us how we were doing. If you've ever worked in a restaurant or a similar setting as her, you'll consider her a saint.

The favorite dish here is the hamburger steak plate whereas my girlfriend likes the tried and true chicken katsu plate. Both are different and charming in their own way, but both are extremely hearty and filling. 

The hamburger is much like a nice thick piece of meatloaf, but not filled to the brim with onions like many diners might have them. The chicken katsu doesn't come with katsu sauce in case you guys were wondering. The fried chicken has a nice crust, but not too much to the point where all you eat is breading.

I'll be coming back here again and again everytime I have a craving for curry even if I have to drive halfway across town to come here. It's that good!
author: George Z.

description: The curry here is delicious! A good place for a quick bite and a full satisfaction. The only thing that I didn't like was that they charged extra for everything! Asked for a little bit more of the red pickles but they told me that I had to buy it as a side. So I ended up buying as a side and they gave me a full bowl.. Way more than I wanted.. Extra sides are good but the prices can start adding up.. Cheese here is like $1.50.. I would definitely recommend this place for the curry but I'd recommend just adding one or two topping and make sure to get spicyyy.
author: John L.

description:
I've had my fair share of Japanese curry in San Francisco.  I'm been a freaking customer of Muracci's when I worked in the Financial District.  I've been to Tani's Kitchen, one of the Bay Area pioneers of Japanese curry in Daly City, a handful of times.  I've also had the JapaCurry food truck and I also fought off the spice at Kare-Ken in the Tenderloin.  In other words, when in comes to Japanese curry, I can give a provide a good opinion.

I've heard great things about Volcano and it didn't disappoint.  Unlike some of the other restaurants I've named, if you can't take the heat (of Japanese curry), then you should be okay with Volcano because they offer several levels of spiciness to choose from.  Another thing I really liked is that you're not just limited to pork and chicken katsu.  There is a veggie option, non-fried meat options, etc.  In addition to that, you can add sides/toppings, like fried shrimp, a boiled egg, sausages, etc.  The combinations are endless.

As for the curry itself, it's quite delicious.  I wouldn't say it's the best among the other restaurants I mentioned, but it's good.  Though your order arrives whiff of curry, the curry taste is less strong and a little overpowered by the spice.  But I liked it.

Portion-size, it's huge.  I couldn't finish it and had to bag up the leftovers.  So it's a very good value. 

Overall, I think Volcano is good.  I would say Kare-Ken still tops my list.  I would certainly recommend it to other Japanese curry fans.
author: Albert L.

description:
Chicken katsu curry plate ($8.25) comes with a few chunks of potatoes and carrots, a heaping serving of rice, and a pinch of fukujinzuke pickles.  The chicken katsu was outstanding but I wish I could say the same about the curry itself, which I didn't find remarkable at all.  The curry flavor tasted quite average and seemed to be overpowered by the heat, even though hot spiciness wasn't spicy enough for me.  The potatoes and carrots in my curry were undercooked; nobody likes raw potatoes!  Overall an underwhelming experience. 

After ordering, grab your own water and utensils at the counter.  Don't forget to bus your own table after you're done eating!

Price is about average for the amount of food in a standard curry plate.  However, it gets pricey quick if you start to add toppings. 

There aren't a lot of tables in the small shop, so if there's a crowd during prime eating hours, you might have trouble finding a seat.
author: Renee L.

description: I love this little restaurant! The curry is so tasty like homemade. Recommend the toppings! Tofu nugget and onion croquette are yummy!
author: Eunice L.

description:
I do adore Volcan's curry!

I always get their Chicken Katsu curry, medium spicy with extra pickles.
Katsu is always crunchy and delicious, plenty of rice and curry. I can never finish my plate in one sitting, and it makes great leftovers.  The vegetables are cooked wonderfully.  And the pickles are a nice touch.
author: Monica V.

description: First time trying Volcano after recommendations from a few friends. Had a late lunch a with a few friends and ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry (mild). The taste was okay, nothing too special in my opinion. Customers have to get utensils and napkins on their own as well as cleaning up the table (since you pay up front). The wait for food wasn't too long and there were a lot of open tables. Overall, it was a decent dining experience. Will probably try another dish next time.
author: Joanne H.

description:
Mild Pork Katsu Curry! Must get potato croquette too
The curry is by far the best curry I have eaten  so far. Ive always wanted to try Japanese Curry , the pictures always look so good ! and finally I found it here ! the Japanese Curry here did not disappoint me at all :) . worth the price! and worth trying
author: N S.

description:
When I crave Japanese curry, my mind takes me back in time to winter afternoons in a Tahoe cabin. My family's just gotten back from a day of snowboarding and Grandma or my mom is cooking up a nice big pot of Japanese curry, using those S&B curry packets.

In comparison, volcano's medium curry isn't bad - it has the right amount of kick. But, in terms of actual taste, if you're ok in the kitchen, you're better off cooking up your own more flavorful version. 

Although, I'd still rush out to Volcano's for a potato or onion croquette! 

PS - Great service! The cashier was super friendly and helpful.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I'm still crying over Kareken's sudden closure. Volcano has been bumped up to my top choice for Japanese curry. 

The portion size on the katsu curries are large and satisfying. You can also add a variety of toppings such as spam, egg, or croquette. I prefer the chicken because the pork is a bit dry. The curry itself could be more flavorful but it's decent for the price point. 

They also have a frequent buyer system!
author: Xinxin W.

description:
Good Katsu, but honestly, the curry tastes exactly like the powder cubes you can buy from supermarkets. 

My friends and I couldn't decide where to eat and we were in the area for Sharetea. We came to this place on recommendation. It's a small place; you pay at the register before sitting down. 

I ordered the pork katsu curry. It's decently priced and the serving is pretty big. The katsu is crispy, not too oily, and could use a bit more salt. So, I just dipped it into the curry. It was a filling meal, but there was nothing special about the curry. I've used packaged curry powder cubes and the similarity was spot on. 

Decent place, affordable, but not impressed.
author: Jonathan C.

description: This place was good, I actually ordered to-go, I got the medium katsu curry and it was delicious. Definitely had a kick to it after a few bites, and since this is a heavy meal, it would surely please two. Also I gave another star for their quick order & price(:
author: Camille B.

description: I love the concept of paying before eating. This place allows you to choose your level of spiciness and the portions are really big. Definitely recommend the chicken katsu curry. Pretty clean and thy don't serve the water to you. You are able to get your own water and utensils. Good place to eat, but closes early.
author: Courtney D.

description:
We ordered the chicken katsu curry and the pork udon with egg. I wouldn't recommend the pork udon; it was just average although I appreciated the distinct ginger taste in it. The best part of the dish was the pork. Mmm. I wish the egg was soft boiled like ramen aha 

The chicken katsu curry was a better dish. We usually make our own japanese curry. I never had it at a restaurant so I was had pretty high expectations.... Sadly it didn't meet them. It was good and definitely hit the spot but the texture of the curry seemed a little watery and the carrots and potatoes were such an afterthought. They could have at least put some curry over it to make it seem like it was cooked all together instead of on the side. chicken katsu was crispy and no complaints there. 

Overall, solid place. Next time I have a curry craving and am too lazy to cook it, I'll come back. I will try the beef curry noodles maybe. 

Of note, I felt like the two tables near the garbage was just a little too close and could potentially hinder a customers experience. Nobody wants to eat their food near a garbage can...
author: Elaine L.

description: Curry was underwhelming. Chicken karage pieces were good. The vegetables in the curry didn't cook well with the curry. The flavor in the curry is lacking. The lady at the counter was very nice
author: Jones T.

description:
Good value for money. Tastes good and fast. My favorite & default menu is the pork katsu curry (spicy level: hot)

Parking is a bit competitive in this area.

Order food from the counter and grab a seat. It is a 1-unit restaurant with about 10 small tables.
author: Krist W.

description:
Craving something thick and spicy on a cold sf night.  I've always walked past volcano ever since they opened but have never been tempted enough to try.  Tonight was the night!
Got the tomato chicken curry and was deciding btw hot or medium.  Got the hot, which was not that spicy; I couldve added siracha to it and still be okay.  wonder if the "volcano" is indeed spicy or not...
I got a plate full of food, half rice, half chicken curry.  not much veges but loaded with chucks of chicken.  rice was cooked well and had a great texture.  wish there was more crunch of veges in my curry.
you can add toppings for extra $ and can have brown rice instead of white for extra 1.25.  I was tempted to but my wallet will not allow me to take the healthier alternative.
pretty much self service here. order at the cashiers, find your seat and take your plates and trash to the appropriate bins.
author: Linda T.

description:
Volcano is a solid 4 stars!

If you're craving Japanese curry and you need a quick fix, you've found the right place. 

Their curry isn't exceptional, but it is really cheap and super easy to customize your order. 
Great topping options & different levels of spiciness, ranging from mild to "volcano"

Also, their fried items (katsu, shrimp, croquet, etc) are always perfectly cooked and crispy!
author: Dana M.

description:
Mm, Japanese curry. Takes me back to the days when I was a poor university student in Kyoto. All I could afford was a small bowl of curry with a potato croquette at the cafeteria. It was enough, and it was delicious. Volcano brings back the memories of the comforts of Japanese curry, along with my pleasant college days.

It's not that the curry tastes cheap; it simply reminds me of the curry I had when I was in the countryside, rich and yummy and comforting. You can choose the spiciness level, and all I really needed was a potato croquette. They have a vast selection of things your curry can be made of, so it should cater to many a taste bud. For me, though, the simplicity of croquette curry is all I need, especially when the croquette is so crunchy and the curry so plentiful and flavorful. I went for mild, but found that I actually wanted a little more kick in my curry, so I think I'll get medium next time.

If I lived closer to this neighborhood, I can definitely say this would be one of my go-to places. Curry, unfortunately, isn't one of the things I think of right away when I'm hungry. I should probably change that.
author: Robbin A.

description: Best damn chicken sandwich ever!! Perfectly toasted bread on the outside and nice and soft on the inside nice crunch from the cabbage and amazing Krispy chicken!!!!  Must try if your in the city.  I would drive from Petaluma to eat here.
author: Marlon C.

description:
Great food, reasonable price point. And lets face it, where can you go to get some good Katsu Curry. They have almost no competition. 
The levels of curry spicyness? Mild, medium, hot and volcano.

I asked about the heat breakdown.
Mild = no hot
Medium = 1 hot
Hot = 3 times more hot than medium
Volcano = different sauce and most hot.

They have different toppings you can add on to customize.  

The last time I can I was feeling like I had a cold. I wanted to eat something super hot. If you want a good meal you've got to sweat for it!
author: Ben M.

description: I come in every few weeks and the night cashier always remembers my family and our order. The customer service is amazing the food is off the hook. Best place to get a nice filling and not expensive plate of delicious food.
author: Rebecca P.

description: I am a huge curry fan, but sadly i cannot say the same about volcano. The curry is good but one thing that bugged me was that they charged for a side of red radish. I have never been charged for that. Other than that it was good curry.
author: Daniel W.

description: I've been here so many times, but not as often as before. I always go with my chicken katsu but I know they have other yummy stuff. People always rave about this place, but for me it just satisfies me. I usually can't finish an order by myself. Usually the service is moderate and things are usually self serve after you order (utensils etc..), but last night the lady who was working was fantastic. She would occasionally check up on us and ask how's everything. When I stopped eating she knew I wanted to box the rest and she brought it over to me. On our way out, she thanked us and we gave her a tip because she deserved it. The place is usually clean too. They have stamp card as well. It's a good place to go for curry. The food comes out quick and phone orders always went well too.
author: Maggie W.

description:
One of the crispiest tonkatsu curry curry I've ever had! for around $8 of the curry plates you get a good portion of your choice of meat, rice and some veggies.

I finally decided to come here after reading the reviews, and hey, who doesn't like some good curry?

I got the Pork Katsu Curry plate and babe got the Chicken Kara-Age Curry Plate. Both of the curry were super fresh and crispy and the meat itself was amazingly juicy. I don't think I've had a curry this crispy before. Usually, it gets soggy quick since it's drenched by the curry quickly (by the time it's served to me), so huge thumbs up for crispiness. 

I guess I kind of don't like how you order and seat yourself. What if you can't find a seat? If you order to go, it won't be crispy anymore by the time you get home, unless you live near by. 

But overall, definitely a place I'd return to. Maybe even a regular spot if I'm ever craving curry.
author: Harriet W.

description:
Can never go wrong with hamburger steak curry rice here. 

Always my go-to place for some quick curry cravings!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Volcano is like a sleeper (car)...looks unassuming from the outside, but the inside is high-performance fantasticness. 

It's been sitting in my bookmarks for awhile. I'm trying to avert my boyfriend who's stuck on eating Thai every damn week. Volcano has curry, not the same as Thai curry, but the bones are there. I offered Volcano as an option for dinner recently and he was game. 

We arrived to quite a few tables of patrons at 8:15pm on a weeknight. The cashier was kind and asked us if she could help us in choosing a dish. I knew what I wanted going in, so I ordered the chicken katsu curry plate with a potato croquette on the side. The bf surprised me and ordered the chicken teriyaki dinner which is HUGE by the way. It comes with rice, salad, and a bowl of miso soup so bring your appetite if you want to order it! 

The chicken katsu was perfectly crispy and golden and the chicken wasn't dry. MMM. The curry sauce and veggies are tasty and the strange red pickles aren't sour...more of a savory pickle? They gave a nice crunch to the dinner. The croquette was seasoned well and piping hot. My bf liked his chicken teriyaki, but as I mentioned before it's a huge dinner so he didn't finish it all.

Definitely coming back for more of the Japanese curry! Can't wait to try their other dishes as well.
author: Liz G.

description:
Its been a long time since I have been here, since I no longer work in the city, but when I did this was a spot I could not get enough of.  

Not only is the food cheap but its quality and you get a good portion.  A good enough portion that you feel like your pants are about to burst.  Or maybe I feel that way because my coworker and I used to race over here just to get our food by 9pm.  We used to get off by 830 and jam on down there and kill our food in about 10 minutes.

I would always order the katsu with volcano sauce and 2 croquettes back when they were $1.
This place has always been awesome and worth it, if Im ever out in the city for any reason I would definitely stop by here. Parking sucks as usual but thats not the fault of the restaurant.
author: Greg Heckler N Koch A.

description: Good curry locaiton. Very friendly staff but we've definitely had better Japanese curry elsewhere. I had the beef curry with a potato croquette with volcano heat and hubby had the hamburger steak with curry, boiled eggs, and hot seasoning.  The spicy level was good not to spicy on either dish but i feel like the curry sauce was missing something to each his own I guess. I would definitely be willing to come back if i was in the area. but would i make my way out there solely to eat here, probably not.
author: Janet D.

description:
I love curry on almost any edible items. My volcano-like appetite nearly erupts when I landed at one of the popular spots in the outer-Richmond district for lunch. 
 
I was also a little shocked that this medium-size place was not crowded during noon (lunch) time. 

From the menu posted right above the cashier and kitchen, I ordered the popular Curry Chicken Katsu rice plate. For $7.25, I get a panko-battered chicken breasts smothered in a thick curry sauce with a side of rice. You can choose the level of spiciness for the curry sauce ranging from #1 for mild- #4 "Volcano" (the spiciest). I had the third level (Hot) of spiciness and the curry sauce was indeed spicy. For the price, the rice plate is a nice size portion too. 

There is a big pitcher of water to extinguish your flaming taste buds.

I'm not much into Japanese food, but this place was good to me. The food and service were great.   

Hopefully on my next visit, I'll try the spiciest curry sauce on my upcoming dish!
author: Matt G.

description: Food was good! Service was good and quick! I got no complaints. I got the Pork Katsu (in case anyone is wondering) and I would recommend it!
author: Cici L.

description:
i usually come here for the pork katsu curry with an croquette and zuichinnis. It is pretty delicious but i like my curry sauce a bit thicker. The sauce here is usually sort of runny/watery. The pork katsu is battered and friend to crispy perfection.  I prefer the consistency of Muracci's curry. Usually i get the curry in medium and it packs a bit of a punch. 

Definitely would come back here for a quick curry fix!
author: Stella J.

description: Had the worst indigestion in my life when I went there recently because I ignored the food inspection warning. Tried to give the benefit of the doubt because I have been a long....long time customer from the beginning but that pain hurt sooooo bad. The topper was, I was asked for utensils and a bag which I assume I probably paid for. Well, I got the bag, but no fork, spork or chopsticks. Nothing. Didn't feel that walking back would be good considering it's a good 10 blocks and my food would get cold by the time I would get back. So I spent another 2 bucks on a box of forks. Unnecessary hassle and unnecessary pain. Gave that extra star in hopes you can still revive your great name. Till then....adios
author: Jas P.

description:
Love this place. Their curry and Chicken Katsu dishes are all phenomenal and the prices are great. 

Also, one of the girls who works the counter is super cute and friendly. :P
author: Tyler B.

description:
Love Volcano. They do basically one thing, and do it well: Japanese curry, in 4 levels of heat from Mild to Volcano (I usually go for Medium; I'm afraid to try Volcano, even though I like heat)

I like the minimalist atmosphere... the paintings in the walls are cool, and the colors and music combine to give it a fun, casual vibe.

When I'm in the Richmond, sometimes I just have a craving for Japanese curry that can oblnly be cured by this place.

Menu is a little confusing to order from... they have curry with toppings, and then additional "toppings"

All the fried stuff is good... especially the katsu, shrimp, and potato croquettes.

Yum! Casual Japanese soul food, for under $10
author: Matthew G.

description: Awesome, simple but winning combination of chicken katsu curry and 80s music. Love this place.
author: Jason O.

description:
What makes a 5 star for me? A restaurant I know I'd come back to again and again. There aren't many japanese curry places in SF, at least not a lot that I know of. Volcano is one of 2 that I've been to, and by far the best. Their chicken katsu curry is great! The portion is not disappointing and it's affordable. The curry is to the level of spiciness you want it and I feel an absolute sense of japanese curry satisfaction after every time I go here. 

If anything, I wish they were a tad bit more generous with the curry sauce, but that's just me being a fat kid. I also love the potato croquette, but get full enough with the katsu curry alone.

This place isn't fancy by any means. You go up to the counter, order, then wait for your food to be done. It's sort of like an L&L, except this place specializes mostly in curry. They have other sides that you can order along with your curry. I've also tried the calamari side. It's not great, the potato croquette is a much better option.

This is my current go-to japanese curry place. I've never had an issue with the service, or finding a table to sit at. I'll be returning shortly!
author: Junel S.

description:
Japanese Curry.  

Whenever I'm trying to figure out what I want to eat, Volcano is one of the options that I ALWAYS consider.  I'm a big fan of Japanese curry, and I think their katsu is on point.  On one occasion, I had Volcano 4 times in a week... don't judge me.  

The spicy level on the curry ranges from mild, medium, hot, volcano (and double volcano).  But sometimes this can be hit or miss (maybe it depends on who's cooking or prepping), as sometimes the hot can be really spicy and other days it may not be spicy enough.  If you like spicy food, I'd recommend starting at hot and then working your way up if you like it.  

Whether I order for pick-up or dine-in, the person taking the order is always very friendly.  I'll be coming back soon... maybe next week... or tonight... or right now.  =)
author: Matthew C.

description: My go to place when I'm craving for curry. Delicious! However, the rice seems undercook when I had my plate the last time I was there. But overall it's good.
author: Patrick T.

description: Not that good. I live close so I thought I would check it out. It's been on my radar for a couple of months. Looked good and reasonably priced. Tried the pork katsu and it was okay definitely filling but not my favorite. I was disappointed by the vegetables aka carrots and potatoes. They were overcooked and just meh in flavor. I don't think I'll be back for round 2.
author: Lauren R.

description: This place is located just a few blocks from my job. I haven't been here in a few years. The first time I tried their food, it was yummy. Tried it again yest & it tasted even better! Their Chicken Katsu curry is sooooo good! Spicy level of HOT is perfect! Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for some good curry in the Richmond District. And their health inspection score is 94/100!
author: Nat S.

description:
Now I don't think Volcano serves the best Japanese curry I have ever tasted but for its quality to portion to price ratio, this is some good food!

I asked for the Chicken noodle curry which mistakenly ended up being curry on noodles, I meant the soup one... Without any hesitation, the person helping me immediately had that resolved and I received the chicken noodle in soup curry. Nice! The chicken was deliciously chargrilled and the noodles were a good consistency for the curry. Everything was drenched in curry and came in an insanely large portion. I probably would have only been able to eat half of what was in front of me so my partner had to finish the rest.

There were also samples of sugared deep fried bread when we were there. Yummy!

Our total barely came up to $15! Cheap, satisfying and relatively good. Although, I do  wish the curry was a tad bit spicier.

Enjoy!
author: Winè C.

description:
This is one of the best Japanese curry places in Outer Richmond. We once went there for dinner and were happy with our decision. A lot of sides to select from, several options for soup and curry dishes.

They  also accommodated to customize our order as we don't eat meat. We still had several options. Great food and very reasonable price.
