author: Jay M.

description: This is alright, nothing special, nothing great. I came here with a friend after he was craving some curry katsu and low and behold, we ventured 30 mins into Karl the fog to arrive at the restaurant. The menu is pretty simple and I liked how they had options of katsu with or without curry. I ended up getting the chicken katsu without curry and instead they had a nice salad on the plate with miso soup on the side. The friend got the pork katsu curry - pretty standard rice + fillet of pork + couple pieces of carrots. The curry was nice and thin and not too spicy. I felt like it wasn't enough to satisfy my hungry friend, so I gave him more pieces of my chicken katsu. Overall, I would definitely come again... but not if I have to drive more than 10 mins out of my way and have to pay for parking.
author: Anh Thu P.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place for a while.
I like that they just do curry and do it well.
You pay for it at the counter, get your food, eat, and leave your dishes near the trash. 
We came here after our first dinner and two desserts because we were still hungry. 
We split the tonkatsu curry with rice and had some water. 

1. Totally not used to non msg laden curries. 
2. It has a distinct tomato-y base
3. Cutlet was a cutlet, some perfectly boiled potato and carrot on side, but no onion. 

Verdict

Probably would drop in if I was starving and didn't want to pay a shit ton for dinner/lunch and needed something filing. But it isn't some place I'd wake up on a Saturday and say LET'S GO THERE! Probably has to do with the fact that I can easily make this at home. If you can't, then go.
author: Stacey T.

description: Haven't had too many Japanese curries in my life, but I have to say that Volcano would be hard to beat. I love how customizable it is! I usually stick to the katsu (depends on if I want pork or chicken at the time) curries, and adding a potato croquette is a must do. I love the fact that you can get a Katsu-fied spam as well. Whut. YES. Also, I typically can't finish my plate, so portion wise, it has great value! Two meals, one price. :D This past visit I tried a spam mini sandwich as well. It's a Panko breaded spam slice sandwiched between this baked bun style bread. So yummy. Volcano curry, always satisfying. Introduced our friends to this place and now they crave it. Haha. Plus they use fivestar! Keep them rewards coming. :)
author: Mariel A.

description:
I have been coming to Volcano since they opened. This really is my go-to place in SF. Japanese Curry is hard to find in the Bay Area. There are a few decent places, but Volcano does it best. Volcano is affordable, delicious fast food. 

Japanese curry is not like curries from different cuisines. It doesn't have a very strong curry flavor, but certainly can be spicy if you order it that way. The sauce is not vegetarian, or dairy free, and it's not low in fat. It is a delicious, dark sauce that is the epitome of comfort food. I always order my curry with chicken Katsu, veggies like eggplant and zucchini, sausage, and an onion croquette. I also like to put some Katsu sauce on the chicken which adds a whole extra depth of flavor to the dish. 

Please keep this place alive by giving it business. I would be heart broken if it ever closed.
author: William O.

description:
Probably my favorite restaurant in all of San Francisco. I'm a regular with one of the cashiers knowing me by name and knowing my usual order - chicken katsu curry (hot) with a boiled egg or calamari on top (you should get this too - super delicious). 

The portion sizes are huge and you can get the food really spicy (double volcano, which isn't listed). You could easily eat half and save the other half for later. It looks like a bit of a hole in the wall, but they're well staffed with friendly hostesses and the place is generally clean. They take all cards except for American Express.
author: Brandon C.

description:
The "ESSENTIAL 4 C's" and I ain't talking about diamonds... 

Cheap
Clean
Comforting
Curry-fic 

In a neighborhood saturated by sushi restaurants, Volcano is a welcome change to the Outer Richmond district. It's a place with a hipster vibe so naturally it attracts many local high school and college students.  

M E N U:
I love the idea of being able to customize your own CURRY PLATE ($4.95-$6.95).

1) PICK YOUR MEAT: chicken, beef, chicken katsu, pork katsu, fried shrimp, etc.

2) ADD TOPPINGS:
*Boiled Egg, Cheese, Potato Croquette, Fukujinzuke Pickles, Sausage, etc (+$1 each)

*Zucchini, Eggplant, Calamari, Onion Croquette (+$1.50 each)

3) PICK YOUR LEVEL OF SPICINESS: Mild, Medium, Spicy, Volcano (Very Spicy).

There's also various Katsu Sandwiches (Mini $1.75 and Regular $5.95-$6.50), Noodle Soups ($4.95-$6.50), Volcano Plates - Same as Curry Don plates minus the Curry ($6.50-$7.95), and Salads ($2.50-$2.95).

F O O D:
I ordered the PORK KATSU CURRY w/ Cheese and extra Fukujinzuke Pickles which took about 5 minutes to prepare.

The Pork Katsu was sprinkled with cheese, however, the cheese didn't melt. It should have been placed underneath the broiler for a minute since the pork katsu wasn't hot enough to melt the cheese on its own. It was served with a heaping amount of short grain Japanese rice with the curry sauce in its own separate container.

T A S T E:
The PORK KATSU was fried to a deep golden brown and had a nice crispy exterior that wasn't greasy. The pork was tender but lacked moistness. The RICE properly cooked; it had just the right amount of stickiness and a bite to it.

The CURRY SAUCE was well-seasoned but was lacking a stewed richness and was NOT authentic. Authentic Japanese Curry should be thick and coat the back of a spoon without dripping like a faucet. The curry sauce at Volcano had the consistency of chicken broth; perhaps not enough roux (flour and butter thickening agent)? The potatoes and carrots were soft and tender though.

WARNING: I suspect the Curry Sauce has MSG in it because soon after eating the Katsu Curry, my heart started racing. I only get this side effect when I consume MSG and I don't have high blood pressure. 

As far as the SPICINESS level goes, I only ordered medium because some Yelpers had mentioned that the medium was "spicy", but spicy it was not. The medium had some kick to it that would hit your tongue seconds upon tasting it, but the heat quickly dissipated. As a Spicy Foods Lover, if I were to go to Volcano again, I would go with the "Spicy" or "Volcano".  

I only ordered the CHEESE topping so that the dairy could cool the spiciness from the curry, however, the curry wasn't spicy so the cheese wasn't necessary other than if you wanted to add some creamy richness to the curry. The FUKUJINZUKE PICKLES are a must for me when having Japanese Curry. It adds a crunchy texture contrast while the acidity helps to balance the richness from the curry katsu.

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R:
Volcano is a no frills, casual, and self-service establishment. Order at the counter, get a number, seat yourself and wait for your order. Water and utensils are available at the front. 

The modern wooden furnishings are clean and sticky-free.

Being located nearby Wash HS, I can imagine Volcano being a local afterschool hangout spot. 

P A R K I N G:
Easy metered parking on weekdays before 6 PM. Difficult parking on the weekends.

Overall, the food at Volcano is 3 Stars; it's filling and satisfies your belly when you're hungry.  Volcano also fulfills 3 of the "Essential 4 C's": Cheap, Clean and Comforting (unfortunately not Curry-Fic). If you're looking for quality and authenticity, look elsewhere.

So why 4 Stars? I remember being a broke college student where all I could afford was burgers, burritos and pho, so kudos to Volcano for providing youths in the area a homestyle comforting alternative to fast food.

P.S. - Each customer is given a Frequent Diner Card: FREE Topping on your 3rd, 6th and 9th paid Curry and FREE Curry and Topping on your 12th Visit!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Had five other people that ordered after us receive their meals first.  The curry isn't worth the price, and the sides cost over a dollar each.  The service was subpar with no welcome feeling.  When they brought out the food, they went to every single table before asking if its ours ( there are placement card numbers that correspond to the receipt, odd that she wouldn't check that first before asking). Tried the place and didn't find anything special about it. Potatoes tasted undercooked, the curry like those that you'd find in the boxed premade curry.
author: Braden H.

description:
I've been here multiple times, sometimes with a group of friends and sometimes with just one other person.

The curry is delicious and just the right amount is ladled onto the rice. There's not so much that you're practically eating soup. The meat (I've gotten pork katsu every time) has the perfect crunch and there's no excessive grease. When I first heard of this place I expected the curry to be as spicy as Wingstop's atomic wings. To my surprise, the curry was actually quite bearable. (I think I had the option right under volcano). Also the little sweet and sour veggie bits they add (not sure what to call them) are amazing! Compliments the curry perfectly! 

My only complaint is, I think the price is a bit high for curry, I normally find myself content, but not full after a dish of curry here. In comparison, curry at King of Thai would always fill my stomach up completely (and if I recall correctly it's like $1 cheaper!).  

However, would definitely recommend this place! :]
author: Kennie D.

description:
This place is the reason why I started to love curry. I've haven't had any curry that could top this place, at least not yet. My usual is the medium fried shrimp curry with a potato croquette, and it's so good!  

It's a self-serve restaurant where you have to grab your own utensils, napkins, sauces, and drinks, but your meal gets served to you by the waiter/waitress. Staff -  very friendly people who are very accommodating to people's needs. For example, if you have a huge group of people, they will allow you to move the tables together if there are enough.They have a ton of options for curry plates, and even more so for sides! All curry plates are below $10, and adding one side would place your meal just around $10. The portions are pretty reasonable for the price, and it fills you up quickly. I love the fivestars rewards card system here as well - certain amount of points can get you free toppings and curry!! My boyfriend and I go here all the time, so we get to utilize the card system often.

This place has yet to disappoint me, so five stars for you! :D
author: Michelle I.

description:
I love a good Japanese curry but I must sadly report that Volcano does merely a passable one. 

Their menu is extensive and includes toppings like jalapeños, tofu nuggets and white fish and they allow you to choose how spicy you want your curry (I was not brave enough to try the Volcano level though the medium I did try had a nice kick). This curry is on the thin side and lacks the richness I've come to love in the dish. Also, the white potatoes they use in the curry seem really low quality and lack taste.

Muracci's on Kearny is no doubt superior, and certainly the place I'd send folks seeking Japanese curry.
author: Miriam W.

description: First time Japanese curry and so glad my friends took me here because it was super scrumptious!
author: Michelle H.

description:
I am a huge fan of this Japanese curry house.  It's probably the closest tasting to real Japanese curry I can find in the city.  I'm here just about once a week.

I rave about their mini spam katsu sandwich, so delicious, with its sweet portuguese roll and freshly fried katsu breading, and how can one go wrong with spam luncheon meat.  That meat is delicious even straight out the can.

The curries that I enjoy are the tomato chicken/pork and the beef.  I prefer white rice over the noodles.  I almost always go medium, its got a little kick but not enough to make my stomache hate me.  They offer "Volcano" level, but only the crazies venture there. My favorite toppings are the spam katsu, tofu nugget and boiled eggs (for extra protein).

The only wish I had would be that the prices were cheaper.  If you get a curry with rice its about $7-8.  But once you add a couple of toppings its around $10-12, which is a little pricier than I would like since the place is more quick cafeteria style.  But its still good, so I always come back.

And don't forget to grab one of their rewards cards, you get free toppings and a free curry after so many orders.

Volcano is literally on the corner from my place, so I will be back weekly.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Hands down one of the best Japanese curry places I have been to so far located in San Francisco. 

Let me start off that parking was not hard since they do have meter parking spots in front of the restaurant. It was a nice area that had other food places around as well. Walked in and it was not too busy. The worker was also gave her recommendations to my boyfriend and I. 

I ordered the chicken katsu curry with the spice level in between hot and volcano. LOVED IT. It was the perfect amount of spiciness. I usually go into a place wondering if it's going to be too spicy or not spicy at all, but it definitely hit the spot.
author: Irene O.

description: maybe you guys should hire people with better customer service skills. i was ordering and the cashier blanks out and goes "what did you say" i don't enjoy repeating myself LOL maybe listen next time
author: Kwan V.

description: Now I haven't really eaten a lot of Japanese curry in my life, but this place is really damn good. My go to order is the chicks karaage with a potato croquette. The curry sauce is amazing and tangy and the serving sizes are enough to get you really full. For the price and the taste, this place is really good! I'd recommend this place to everyone I know. The only downside is that sometimes finding parking is hard especially if you don't want to pay for meter.
author: Randell Kenneth R.

description: Tried the spinach chicken curry with tonkatsu medi-yum spicy. love it. Adrienne is such a great employee. I am sad to see her go.
author: Janelle O.

description:
Went to Tokyo a few weeks ago and have been craving Japanese curry with pork katsu. Tried another place in Japantown that was a huge letdown so I kept chasing the dragon and found this place.

It took me right back to that tiny curry shop in Tokyo. The pork katsu was perfectly crispy and moist and the curry rich and spicy. Will be back!
author: Andrew H.

description:
I see this place every time I take muni to work. Finally decided to try it out after looking at the reviews. I got the pork Katsu curry and added the fried boiled egg. The medium spicyness for me was not spicy at all but delicious nonetheless. No other places around here have this big of a curry selection so I recommend getting your curry on here.

The meal itself was extremely filling and delicious. The only downside is that the toppings are a bit pricey at $1.25 each. Next time I will probably skip the toppings since I was super full at the end of my meal. The fried boiled egg was the most interesting topping I saw so I decided to try it out. The outside is crispy but there is no seasoning on it.
author: Jenann P.

description:
I frequent Volcano because I live close by and it's the best Japanese curry option in the area. I wouldn't recommend getting the "Volcano" heat level, as although I love spicy food, the taste gets worse when you reach that hottest heat level. The curry already has a strange sweetness to it, and it gets worse as it gets spicier. I have settled on the second-hottest "Hot" level.

Although I have had better-tasting Japanese curry, it's a great value, and it's still Japanese curry, after all. Even a crappy Japanese curry is still good to me...not that this is crappy. I think it's a little above average. I think of Japanese curry (especially chicken katsu curry with cheese...aww yeah) like pizza. A crappy pizza is still pizza and therefore is decent. Well Volcano is decent, and you can get chicken katsu curry with cheese there, which is just swell.
author: Dorian K.

description:
One of the most disappointing things about a restaurant is when you see that they offer a scale of spiciness for their food, and the "spicy" you order really isn't all that spicy.  It's like false advertising!  But when you see that the highest level of spiciness is "Volcano" (hence the name), feel secure in the knowledge that yes, it really is spicy.

The Chicken Katsu curry plate is my go to dish, and it's delicious (and also the only dish I've ordered here so far).  The breading is not too thick, and the meat isn't dried out.  Perfectly golden brown, with a slight drizzle of katsu sauce on top...yum!  With a generous serving of rice and tasty curry sauce, you've got yourself a hefty plate of food.  I do wish there were a little more vegetables, but it's filling enough as is.

However, if you are feeling like maybe you need a little something else, there are about a dozen different toppings to choose from (boiled egg, croquette, extra sauce, calamari, pickles, etc.).  They've added a Spam Katsu mini sandwich to the menu too, and I tried it out since it's not the kind of thing you see too often, but it's not something I would get again.  Nothing wrong with it....it was perfectly fine and it tastes about what you would expect, but it was more just for the novelty for me.  

Prices seem a little high, but it's actually on par when you compare it to what most decent Japanese places charge for their dinner entrees.  Parking around here can be a pain in the ass, but it's kind of a given if you want to eat at any restaurant along this stretch of Geary.  Will most definitely be back...after all, I need to fill up on stamps for my frequent buyer card!
author: Mike L.

description: The curry is cheap, quick, and delicious. You get your choice of the level of spiciness, but medium seems to be the most popular without overwhelming your capsaicin receptors. The chicken katsu was fried very well and came with white rice and red pickles. The curry comes with large chunks of potato and carrots. The portion was large enough that I was full before even finishing my whole plate. They also have a number of toppings available at an additional cost. I added on a potato croquette, which didn't add much to the plate and not worth the additional dollar, but it was good.
author: Bailey Z.

description: I think this is a pretty decent place to get katsu curry. It's not bad, but I definitely won't be going out of my way to come to this place. This is more the kind of place where if I am in the area, and I happen to want to eat some katsu curry, then I'll stop by. Their katsu was pretty tasty, but their curry isn't as good/thick as Muracci's.
author: Jeanette S.

description: I really love eating the chicken katsu curry plate here. Amazing, delicious, and very filling. The price is debatable but reasonable since it really filled me up. I'm just sad that the side orders are slightly expensive. But ordering the curry plate in itself is already really tasty.
author: Vicky P.

description:
I'm absolutely satisfied! Great tasting food for a reasonable price. Parking available on side streets nearby, definetely a must-do! 

By the way: dont be messing around with spice level, even medium is ok, hot and volcano will really burn! ;-)
author: Benjamin B.

description: Food is okay, it's curry, rice and protein. But it's the terrible service, unorganized manner and unnecessary long waits that bring this down to two stars for me. This normally would be a three star review alone, but I've frequented this place alot and have experienced better service here, so it's on the decline.
author: Marvin M.

description: If I could marry this place and give birth to its baby, i definitely would! Curry rice is one of the most popular western-Japanese foods in the world, because of its affordability and oishii-ness factor! This place definitely lives up to its reputation. I go to Volcano once a week and it's almost like a ritual- or an addiction. Gosh, I can't live without this heavenly golden liquid! I love their fried shrimp curry rice at Volcano spicy level. This spicy level is definitely an addiction for a spicy food enthusiast like me.
author: Jimmy B.

description:
Highlights
- I wish I ventured into this place and discovered this place sooner! 
- This place hits the spot when you have a craving for Japanese curry and don't want to endure traffic and parking in downtown. Love this neighborhood spot!
- Curry Vegetable or Chicken Udon. The perfect amount of meat and vegetables, flavorful broth, and you can never go wrong with udon noodles. 

Improvements
- Katsu Curry: It's good, not the best that I've tasted but I like that they add carrots and potatoes in their curry. Maybe it's because I got mild since I'm a wimp, which didn't have heat at all. They have 4 levels of spiciness, so go ahead and get that next level!

Tip
- They also have BBQ sauce as a condiment near the utensils, if you like to add it onto your fried goodies. 
- You can also customize your orders and add however may add-ons as you like for additional charges: jalapeños, cheese, tofu nugget, etc.
author: Tracy T.

description:
The chicken katsu is so yummy! It's always so crispy! They also have pork katsu and a bunch of other fried things including spam! 

This is a good option for something fast and affordable. I usually come for dinner and it always has a good amount of customers. Not too crowded and not too empty.
author: Carmen C.

description: Came here early for lunch and beat the crowd.  Portions are big and curry is very good.  My chicken karaage pieces were huge and tender.  Would definitely eat here again.  Prices are reasonable.
author: n y.

description:
Food is so good! EXCEPT the Asian girl (cashier/server) with the blonde & bangs needs to get her attitude checked out. So I was in the area & wanted to grab something quick to take out. I walk in not knowing exactly what I should get, so I ask her a few questions regarding toppings & also if she could place my curry on the side. She wasn't helpful, she seemed so annoyed by my presence & when I mentioned I wanted to have the curry on the side she raised her voice at me saying "SAUCE IS ALWAYS ON THE SIDE WITH TAKEOUT." Like okay.. It's my first time here, sorry for the stupid request.

10 minutes later I'm sitting with my friends at a table & she rushes by & THROWS my takeout order on the table--not acknowledging me, or giving me the opportunity to say thanks.  I understand she's the only one working the front end of the restaurant but the place wasn't busy. I don't know what her issue is with me? Or was she having a bad day? Either way, no reason to take it out on customers. I've worked in a restaurant before, so I know how things are.. 

Plain & simple: SHE IS RUDE or needs to adjust her tone of voice so she doesn't come off rude. Management, please talk to her about customer service.
author: Michelle T.

description:
OK. This is a quick service semi-fast food feeling. The curry comes in a couple of spice levels and seems mostly to be run of the mill S&B boxed curry sauce with added spice. Fried katsu meat was acceptable, presentation a bit lacking. Not bad, but clearly not worthy of the rave reviews here (challenge with most yelp reviews).

The cashier was quite pleasant and happy to explains things. Like many SFO restaurants, moderate clean. Certainly not bad, but also not worthy of a huge detour to get to.
author: Chris K.

description:
Before arriving to Volcano, my friend and I were walking around Lands End, and worked up quiiiiite an appetite.  

When we walked into the restaurant my mouth immediately started to water with delicious scent of curry that swirled around in the air.  I ordered a katsu curry plate... the wait for the food wasn't too bad as well!  For the price I paid (I'd say around $9, I don't remember the exact amount), I got a great amount of food.

Now for the eating experience: It was a standard curry, but it was executed pretty well.  The katsu was nice and crispy as well.  Overall, it's a good quick pick-me-up type of place.
author: Jessica A.

description:
Went here for lunch with a group of friends on a Sunday afternoon. For lunchtime the restaurant wasn't very full, which can be a little disconcerting. The boyfriend and I went up to the counter to order and ended up sharing chicken katsu curry medium spice and I added a potato croquette. 

The serving was pretty large, but maybe just a little small to share without any other additions. The curry itself was tasty, but nothing amazing. I didn't think the medium spice had a good enough kick so if I came back I would get it more spicy.

I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if someone else wanted to I'd be down.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
My favorite weekend lunch place. 

Their katsu curry is tasty anything with it is just an extra add on. Decently priced, good portion. They are not kidding when they tell spicy or Volcano hot. So if you feel like going on a hot ride try the volcano spice.
author: Milana R.

description:
Curry has always been my favorite food ever since I can remember. After our first half of the day exploring the city, we decided to get a late lunch at Volcano. I have been here before but we brought a friend here so she can try it. I got a hot pork katsu curry. I could handle the curry so I guess it's not that hot. The pork is pretty good. The portion is big for 2 of my girls but me and my guy friend finished the plate way before them. I mean I can say that I eat a lot and that really filled me up but it's still deliciouoso. 

The people were nice. Food was good. Got really full. The place was clean. But it's in Richmond?! Might go back if I'm in that area cause it is just way too far.
author: Lily L.

description: This is the second restaurant in the city that offers food spicy enough to satiate me. The first? The carolina reaper wings at the nearby (for now) Hot Sauce and Panko. While the tonkatsu itself is not nearly as crispy or tender as that from Muracci's or the deceased Kare-Ken, but what they do offer is an amazing spicy brand of curry, the triple volcano curry. The five star rating is for that deliciously spicy flavor that only Volcano can bring to curry. Ask for the triple volcano and you will not regret it (much).
author: Gilbert L.

description:
Four of us arrived at 6 pm on Sunday and luckily no lines.  First we ordered and paid for the meal and then had to wait for a table of 4.  The cashier was friendly and was also the waitress in passing out the food only.
Pluses
The volcano plates are a good deal, included soup & salad but minus the curry sauce, extra $2 if u want it.
The Ariage Chicken was fried to perfection and delicious
The tomato chicken was flavorful and tasty
The pork Katsu was substantial and crispy
Minuses
Gave a restaurant tip when paying for the meal, not realizing you had to get your own water, utensils and clear the table afterwards
More of a cafeteria feel than a restaurant
Wished someone would tell couples to take the smaller tables instead of hogging a table for 4, had to wait 20 mins just for the table whilst the small tables were empty.
Parking can be difficult in that area.
Overall, big portions and very satisfying.  Extra toppings available for a reasonable price.  Luv the fresh homely taste of the food.  Seems to be freshly cooked upon ordering.  Will definitely go back for more
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I probably go to Volcano once or twice every couple of weeks because it's close to my place and it never disappoints. The service is really fast and food is consistent. 

Chicken katsu curry is the go to. Try it with the noodles too! Extra pickled veggies if you're feeling bold
author: Kayhan K.

description:
This place is great for a quick casual meal. It's a self service kind of place.

They mainly do curries, but they also do little sandwiches and korroke. 

We had the Pork Katsu Curry medium spicy, which was very good. The curry is a little thinner than I'm used to eating but I thought it had a really nice consistency that wasn't cloying, very clean finish and full of flavor.

We also ordered a potato korroke and a chicken Kara-age sandwich. The Korroke was super hot, be careful when you bite into it! I would let it sit for a couple minutes after it comes out, but i was happy that they brought it out right away instead of letting it sit.

The chicken kara-age was a little dry for my liking, and the bread didn't help the moistness situation. I put some sriracha on it and it was fine, not going to have it again though.

Overall I give it two thumbs up.
author: Danny D.

description:
It was my first time trying this place out. We were looking for something filling yet comforting and this did the job. 

Seating - Small restaurant but I like how you have to order your food before taking a seat. This makes the tables clear up faster. 

Customer service- Employee that helped us was very nice and patient. 

Price- It was priced well for the amount of food and quality of food we got. Everything came out hot and freshly fried! 

What I ordered- I ordered a chicken katsu curry plate with a medium spicy level. It was so yummy!! 

I would definitely return if I'm ever in the city.
author: Mona D.

description:
I absolutely love this place! Every time a friend from a different city asks me where we should go grab something to eat, I always recommend this place first. The menu is simple and the price is fair compared to the portion of the food.

The pork or chicken katsu with curry garnished with ginger is a good starter and its always a good choice if you are indecisive. The food is always hot and ready to eat when served. Unlike some restaurants, you can actually see them meat between the crunchy crusts of the katsu. The rice is always moist and well cooked. I especially like the fact that Volcano cooks the carrots and potatoes the way I like them. The carrots are soft but not over cooked and the potatoes are soft and sometimes even has a mashed potato-like texture once you poke your fork through it. 
 
Every time I come to Volcano I receive excellent customer service. The cashiers I have encountered have always been friendly energetic. I like the idea of self serve water and utensils as well as busing your own table. It teaches you a bit of responsibility. Although the space is a bit tight inside and between tables, the overall atmosphere is friendly and welcoming. 

I recommend this place for someone who is taking a significant other out on their first or second date. The vibe is super chill and relaxing. The cost of food is easy on your wallet and Sharetea is right next door! Enjoy!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Volcano serves fresh, hot and delicious curry.

I enjoy how the plates are generous, you're allowed to add other toppings and how it reminds me of my grandmother's curry. I like the chicken katsu curry in mild the best.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
The curry here is exactly how I imagined Japanese curry to look and taste! It's so warm and hearty, perfect for the foggy SF weather.

I usually get the beef curry with spam katsu. If you like spam, you would love it fried - So gooood! (It's about $11 alltogether which is kind of pricey)

They also have frequent buyer card and utensils and seating are self serve.
author: Tina O.

description: I would give this place a 3.5, but rounded up bc the staff was nice . We've lived in Japan, so my husband and I are curry snobs unfortunately now.  I will say the taste was just about spot on, but I do wish the curry was a littl thicker.  We had the chicken katsu curry, and the chicken was exactly how it should be cooked.  Other than that it was a nice place to eat with good food!  Prices are fair too for what you get.
author: Kassandra M.

description: I love this place. It's a great quick stop for an excellent meal and they are generally very friendly here. The Katsu plates are the best!
author: Patrick M.

description:
Saw the decent nice yelp reviews, always love Jap style curry so decided to give it a try. Ordered the chicken katsu curry with volcano level of spice. Because most of the Japanese style curry I try are not hot at all, but this one made me sweaty n runny *sniff*sniff* :~~~not like super spicy but at least I felt the spice =p. 

They have a variety of toppings that you can choose to add on, such as cheese, sausage, or  pickle, which I don't see it elsewhere. Why do you wanna put a hot dog in japanese style curry? but hey, chicken katsu curry itself is $7.95, not that expensive to add an additional $1.25 sausage. The portion is huge to me with a lot of rice, service was quick n friendly.

The only thing I didn't give it a 5 star is the potato which had a bit raw taste. If they can cook  through the potato and carrot  all the way with the curry first, it would've be even better.

oh btw.... they also give you stamp card, a free curry for every 10 stamps. :)
author: Patty L.

description:
This place is so hot. 
Pork katsu is great, curry is so yummy too. Staffs are kind.
Everything was perfect, but better not try volcano even you like spicy food. It's soooo hot. I'll comeback in few weeks, and will try different katsu and toppings.
author: Yejoo K.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for a while now since I'm a big fan of Japanese curry, but haven't had the chance until just recently. I ordered the chicken katsu curry with a potatoe croquette and my boyfriend ordered the same, but with a boiled egg instead of the croquette. The portions here are huge and very filling. Towards the end of the meal I felt like I was about to explode, but it was just too good not to finish!! I'll definitely be going here again when I get that curry craving.
author: Leah Marie F.

description:
Seeking a reprieve from the normal cheap Chinese places for lunch, my bro-in-law and I decided to try something new. We tossed out a few ideas before settling on Volcano's spicy katsu curry.

I went with the pork katsu curry (medium spice) with a side of sausage. For less than $10, the quality and quantity was just right. I was totally satisfied with the fresh flavors but my bro-in-law found his volcano-spiced curry tough to eat. It wasn't so much a tip of the tongue spice, but more of a pepper-in-your-nose spice. It packs quite a punch and sticks around a while. Very tasty though!

Volcano is a great lunch spot and has a bunch of fun options. I definitely want to try their chicken katsu and a few other things next time. The curry plates are a better deal than the combos so I would stick to those. Good service an a funky atmosphere tie it all together and, with rewards card in hand, I'll most certainly be back!

Food: 8/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: Good food and this is a pokestop for everyone playing pokemon go!! Unfortunately it Seems like it's already getting pretty crowded due to that. Also pretty affordable for those who aren't looking to spend much for a decent meal!
author: Tim T.

description: I'm always weary when I walk into a restaurant and there are no other patrons there.  Being as hungry as we were, we decided to try the place out anyway.  We ordered with the cashier (who by the way, did not look like she wanted to be at work), were given a number, and picked a table to sit at.  While waiting for our food, the restaurant started to fill up pretty quickly, which was a promising sign.  It was just too bad that it wasn't an accurate sign.  The food was a bit bland so were left a little disappointed...
author: Rose A.

description:
My friend and I always want to try the curry here and we finally did.

Came here around 8:00pm on Wednesday.  The restaurant was not packed at all.  Volcano is like the fast food style restaurant.  You order the food at the counter and find the seats yourself.  

The girl behind the counter was very friendly, sweet and efficient. 

We ordered:

Tomato Chicken Curry (Medium) with brown rice (extra $1.25) - You can add topping to your rice dish too.  We got Tofu Nugget (additional $1.25).  The food came out pretty fast.  The portion of the rice dish was decent.  I like the brown rice.  The texture was chewy but soft.  The Tofu Nugget was ok.  Nothing special but went well with the curry thou.  The curry was flavorful and thick.  Pretty good but it was too spicy to me.  We ordered medium but did not expect that spicy.  After we finished 1/3 of the rice dish, the girl walked by and checked with us.  She asked, "Did you guys order Volcano?!"  Me and my friends were like Dangggggggg...no wonder it was so spicy.  Since my friend could handle the spiciness, we did not ask the girl to change the rice dish.

Tempura Noodle Soup - This one was pretty bad.  The soup was lukewarm and the presentation was very bad.  They put the raw spinach on the top of the noodle, just like salad.  The noodle was undercooked the tempura was just soso.

I think I will come back if I crave for Japanese Curry but I will make sure that they give me the level of spiciness that I order.
author: Liza T.

description: I have been to many places in the bay area trying japanese curry. Some good some bad. I always ended up going to Sanpo in jtown for my curry because all the other places sucked. I heared about this place and decided to try and see if they met my expectations for japanese curry. Dang it was good. They have a big selection of curry not just beef in most places and their curry is rich and well spiced. This place is great for takeout not so much to eat there if u want to fight for a table. I also have to say that it wasnt very spicey but flavorful mind you. I recomend people to try its worthit.
author: Peter D.

description: Best chicken katsu curry in all of SF! I always get the medium spice which sometime can have a little extra kick but always hits the spot.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Well, gaawwwllleeee geee! Japanese curry? Now I done heard of everthang!

Seriously though, Volcano seems like one of those places that everyone loves. Easy to see why. It's tasty & it's something different. We don't have anything this fancy, niche and delicious out in the backwaters.

I was in a big rush and the restaurant wasn't busy. I had the beef curry with calamari. I'm just too wacky for my own good. The beef was cut up into small chunks and was tender. The brown curry sauce was tasty and not overwhelming or oily. I definitely would err on going spicier if you like spicy food. Bonus: my meal was ready fast and it was still awesome.

"Bravogato!?" Or whatever "bravo!" in Japanese is.
author: Ian W.

description:
Pros: accepts credit, accepts five star, clean
Cons: $$$

I gave Volcano a 4 star rating because I liked the volcano level curry that I got. I ordered the chicken kara-age curry volcano level and really liked it. The dish was just above $9.00 after tax. I just wish I got a little more for that price. The plate contained a handful of rice, four balls of fried chicken and a puddle of curry. I also got two potato pieces and a couple carrots in the lava pool of curry. I really wanted some more carrots and potatoes if not any other vegetables. Other than that, the chicken was really good, moist with a light fried coating and the volcano curry was not as spicy as I thought and actually very tasty. I want to try the double volcano spice level the next time I go to Volcano. The girl at the cashier/server/busser told me as she came by to clean out plates about the secret level and it sounds deliciously dangerous, none of that atomic wingstop mess of a level. I was confused on what kind of eatery this is. It is somewhere between a cafeteria and a restaurant. Not saying it was bad, I just felt as if I were in a food court eating a plate of curry. Worth coming and checking out. I've never had Japanese curry, and I can say I'd try some more.
author: Alex T.

description: It was an okay curry. I'm not really a fan of curry so I wouldn't really know the differences between Indian and Japanese curry. There was a lot of carrots in my dish. I would come back here once in a while when I have a curry moment.
author: Nick F.

description:
Volcano currently makes up 25% of the reason why I love working on the 5100 block of Geary.

Some of the naysayers compare the curry that Volcano serves up to some of the more alternative (or, "authentic", as they say) curry variants such as those of the Indian, Sri Lankan, or the Thai Schools. To those naysayers, I would like to point out that comparing Japanese Curry to Other Curry is like comparing Chicago-style Pizza to NY-style pizza and saying one or the other is objectively better--though on face value the idea may seem logical, and even good to an extent, any point made for or against each side can be refuted through two simple words: "personal preference"

That being said, Volcano serves up a mighty awesome plate of JAPANESE curry, supplemented by their even more delectable selection of ton/chicken/shrimp katsu curries and sandwiches (their chicken katsu sandwich is HUGE), makes this place an amazing choice for a sub 10 dollar comfort food choice in the city. 

My personal favorite is the 2x Volcano Chicken Curry with an added side of Fukujindzuke--the only thing that could give me a faster food coma is probably a direct IV of glucola. Or a sucker punch to the kisser.
author: Scott S.

description:
Simple menus make me happy. Sometimes I like having an abundance of options. Other times, I like having the guess work taken out of the process of picking something yummy to eat. Volcano has a simple menu that you can customize any dish you want. Choose your protein, toppings, carb (white or brown rice or noodles) and spiciness of the curry. Get the Volcano if you dare! Easy as 1-2-3! They also have a few noodle soup choices, katsu plates and sammiches. Order and pay at the counter, then they bring your food out. 

I tend to gravitate towards Indian curries more than any other types of curry. Japanese curry is fine by me but I am no expert on it bc I don't eat it too often. With that said, my meal there having a chicken curry plate with a medium level of spiciness was pretty good. The curry just oozes all over the plate and I just couldn't stop eating the rice with it. Bf had the fried shirmp rice plate with medium spicy curry. I tried one of the panko breaded shrimp with the curry and it was pretty good. Only wish that the curries had more veggies incorporated into it other than a few scarce pieces of carrot. 

Volcano is a no-brainer for a super casual spot for a filling meal or take out for under $10. One improvement  I would suggest is that the seating area should be cleaned more often. When I was there, lots of napkins littered the floor, chairs were dirty and the tables were not wiped down.
author: Liv A.

description:
CURRY. I love curry, and coming to Volcano always provides me with a nice place to get curry that's quick without sacrificing quality or taste. When ordering any dish, you get a nice portion of rice in addition to whatever type of curry/meat you ordered.My favorite (and undoubtedly the most popular dish here) is the Chicken Katsu Curry. It's gooood. It's got the perfect crispiness on the outside while still being chewy and tender on the inside. Mix all that with the rice and you've yourself a pretty delicious meal. In addition to this, they've got quite a variety of curries so definitely try other ones if you're up for it. More pros about this place is that they allow you determine how spicy you want your curry as well as having a stamp card system.

Only real con I can come up with is the parking out here. Parking is always a pain in the butt here...so expect to be circling around quite a bit.
author: Aaron W.

description:
I had a mad craving for japanese curry and saw this spot on Geary after getting dim sum over the weekend. The next Tuesday, I came in for dinner. The cashier told me the spiciest curry they had was volcano so thats what I ordered. I also got a potato croquette cuz cmon who can't resist a deep fried mashed potato ball? Well, this girl can't. 

There was only one other party in the restaurants so the food came fast. Volcano wasn't very spicy at all! I reached for sriracha to remedy the situation and the cashier comes over to check on us. Noting my sriracha, she says "by the way, for next time, we have a secret level 5 spicy, super volcano." Thanks for telling me now! Oh well. I got the original curry without any meat and it was very tasty. Lots of curry sauce and soft carrot, potato, zucchini, and eggplant chunks. It also comes with a little sprinkling of fuschia radish pickles which I found to be a good complement to the curry. The croquette was also good, the mashed potato filling a bright yellow, im assuming from the addition of curry powder. Watch out, this puppy comes out hot. With the first bite of my croquette I burnt off a chunk of the roof of my mouth making the rest of my SF food adventures more painful. 

On my way out, I eyed an asian man glistening with sweat, shoveling down what I assumed to be secret level 5 spicy. It looked like it had chopped jalapeno slices along with another red pepper. so jealous!
author: Kelly Z.

description: Remembered this place use to be better. Came in early Sunday morning and maybe they had not started the curry long enough but it was pretty bland and the potatoes weren't really cooked all the way this time. Extra star for past experiences
author: Alex C.

description: Can't complain. Great curry, fast service. The katsu was fried to perfection
author: Frank L.

description:
Great food.
Very small place. However, the food has a lot of favor. So happy to have found on Yelp.
author: Joe A.

description:
went here for lunch, pretty busy since the tables were mostly taken
I take it more for a to go/ fast food place because you have to order at the counter and try to snag a table, get your utensils and water and then put away ur dishes. Its not much of a customer service oriented place to me. 
I ordered chicken curry and my friend got the chicken katsu. portions were medium.
Both were under $10 each.
 The chicken katsu was pretty standard. 
 The curry was disappointing however. It wasn't very flavorful, veggies were a bit undercooked and the chicken looked like it was boiled and then the sauce was just poured over it. it may be their style of doing it but I like when a curry has its flavor thanks to the meat and veggies cooking together in it.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Hello curry galore! I love the Japanese curry here and they have a great variety of curry, from chicken katsu curry, beef curry, tomato chicken curry, etc. I've only recently discovered this place (thanks to my lovely friend who brought me here) and I can't wait to try more. My first visit, I got the beef curry and thought it was very good! The beef was like chunks of beef, kind of like stewed beef but curry version! I saved a bit for the BF to try some and he was hooked. After he took a bite he asked "When are you going to take me there?" lol.

The next time, I came back wtih the BF and I got the chicken katsu curry which seems to be very popular, and for good reason. The katsu was fried very nicely, crispy but not dry, and went well with the curry. The BF got beef curry and wanted to try it with noodles since he is a noodle-lover (he liked it). 

Tip: They let you choose the spicy-level: Mild, Medium, Hot..etc. If you want your curry to taste a bit spicy, I would suggest Medium spicy. It's enough spicy to feel like its curry, but not super spicy that it is going to burn a lot or make you sweat. I got Medium both times and thought it was perfectly spicy. The BF got mild and it was not spicy at all... like no spice. at all. Even he (the guy who usually can't take very spicy stuff) says Medium is a good amount of spicy.
author: Kathleen Y.

description: Get your Katsu on volcano style. They will ask you twice just to make sure but some times you should require a second affirmation. Put it at a 6.5 on the spice rack. Great flavor with the spice. Friendly staff and prompt service. Winning.
author: Nathan B.

description: yasssssssssssssss. Love the food here. If you come often, the cashiers will even remember your order. :P
author: Paulo R.

description:
One of my go-to places whenever I visit my family and friends up in SF.

Curry is really great, esp for someone like me who loves spicy foods. Try the "volcano" level of spice if you dare!

My typical toppings include: tofu nuggets (a vegetarian fav) and vegetable katsu. 

So good!
author: Caleb C.

description:
I love Japanese curry!  I love curry!  
This is curry heaven!!! Simple place with a decent price.  

I don't remember what I got but most likely a chicken karaage curry coz they are just yummy!
author: Claire J.

description:
I love the curry and volcano curry hotness level! The place is small, a little warm when there are a lot of people inside the shop, but overall, a nice place to enjoy dinner or lunch with a small group!

One time I got takeout because I was craving curry, they separated all the rice, chicken katsu, curry and the pickles radishes for me
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Go here as soon as possible.  Eat until you cannot eat anymore.  Go home.  Repeat as often as possible....

That pretty much sums up my experience with Volcano Curry.  I absolutely love this place.  The food is delicious, completely reasonably priced, and served quickly (and by friendly waitstaff none the less!).  4 levels of heat for the curry, all are terrific, and countless combinations of amazing.  Ambiance is about what you would expect, but the curry, oh the curry...

I have absolutely no idea if this is traditional Japanese curry or not.  To be honest, I really don't care.  I'll be happy to be a cultural apologist on days that don't end with me picking up this potentially crack-laced container of goodness on my way home.

Thanks Volcano, you guys rock!!
author: Jared J.

description:
My first time having Japanese curry! I didn't even know it existed.

I did have a lot of questions that they answered patiently. This place isn't fancy but has a lot of options. It also is fairly busy for a late lunch.

We got the Chicken Katsu curry and Tomato Chicken curry. Both were delicious!  

Next time I'll probably try the Curry Noodle soup.
author: Anoo L.

description:
I honestly am that one girl..who would cringe and hide with the mention of "curry"... I only eat Thai curry and Filipino chicken curry both of which are light on the palette and doesn't not have that strong aroma that clings on the walls and travels around the entire house....no. it's not the spice that bugs me. it's the smell that overpowers the dish, that makes me nauseous...it's that smell that clings to your clothes, which carries on throughout the day -- which overpowers the cigarette smell in my car interior. that type of smell.

BUT...one fine SF day... my friends wanted some Japanese curry. I honestly have not had Japanese curry before. So i was scared to life. I looked at diners' plates when we came in...and it's very..uhmm..BROWN. and saucy. And a LOT of it was on a plate. 
But i also saw some empty plates that looked like it was devoured and licked clean...So i took a deep breath and ordered the Chicken with Curry and a Potato Croquette.. everything deserves a try.. including this unattractive plate of curry.

Well Guess What?!?!?!?!

I actually Liked IT!!!!! 

Here were my steps:

1.) Forked a piece of chicken (which was so juicy and well battered)....

2.) Dipped a bit in the curry on the side of the plate.. (they place the chicken on top of the rice)

3.) Chew... Chew..

4.) Swallow...

5.) Little Dip again...this time with the rice.

REPEAT until i realized YUM...it's good. BUT sooo filling. Maybe i'm still mentally shy to it... or maybe it was still so powerful on my palette. But at least i tried it!!!

The portions are huge. The rice scoop most especially. My friends devoured all their plates. But they were proud of me for even eating half of mine.

I'd definitely give it another try. I have a strong feeling I'm on my way to liking it without being hesitant to the "brown" sauce.

ps: curry mixed with sriracha... actually what i liked better.

Oh! the potato croquette was YUM!!!!!
author: Monica H.

description: The curry here is good. I always order the most spicy ones when I am here. The food is cheap and the portion is quite large. Overall a decent place to have lunch and hang out for a while with a friend.
author: Johan K.

description:
*Came here after a surf session, and while it was good and filled me up, I should have gone with either the tomato-based or spicier curry, as the medium hot curry could have used more flavor. 

Luckily, I was with a group of 5, so I was able to taste a bit of everything they had to offer, including the very spicy Volcano curry. Comes with rice and small serving of potatoes and carrots, and they also sub with brown rice. I'll be sure just to ask for all carrots next time as well. 

The set up is clean and minimal, food comes out quickly, and it was not too busy when we stopped by. Cashier/server was nice.
author: Mary S.

description:
Volcano

Volcano.....Curry of Japan
Here at Volcano the Curry is a slow cooked curry base (8 to 10 hours of cooking) and sits overnight prior to being served.  That's a lot of work to have put in.  Curry was introduced to Japan in the late 1800's time frame.  Japanese curry is not as strong as an Indian Curry, but here at Volcano the Medium level curry does have some kick to it's curry.

So I just had to try their dish out.  I've been here twice already and I've tried the Chicken Katsu with Sausage topping with a medium level curry sauce over Noodles.  I've also tried the Pork Katsu  and  Curry sauce over rice.

After having tried both dishes, I can say the flavor of the curry was excellent.  I did notice a variance in the thickness level of the curry.  One time the curry was a little thicker than the previous time, but yet packed a favorable curry.   

I've had the Noodle and the Rice, I think it's a safe bet to get the Noodles....for some reason the rice did not meet my expectation and I can't remember why not?

The Sausage, I was hoping for something along the lines of a Hillshire Farm type sausage, but I'm not sure what type of sausage it was.

To sum up the two dishes I've tried so far...

Noodles vs. Rice....I'd pick the Noodles....4 Star

Chicken and Pork Katsu....I can tell there were two levels of crunchiness to both Katsu's which may be a variance in cooks....so one may like it and another may not....until the consistency of the cooking becomes a standard...it's difficult to rate....but I'll have to say it's between a 3 and a 4 star.

As for the Sausage topping....I could have or not have again....3 star.

Chicken Katsu with Noodle
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WnQoN1uV65vacUj0q1TgoQ?select=lYCKLTp2Hheiz6_yoHlxfA

Pork Katsu Over Rice
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WnQoN1uV65vacUj0q1TgoQ?select=Sp___kFvzjlswobzrEf1vA

Service was excellent, I like the way they had came by and checked up on me asking if everything was ok or not.

Ambiance....nothing special....just a typical dinning area, tables accommodate 1, 2 and 4 people.  Nice relaxed environment.

Would I be back for more.....Yes.

Recommended....Yes

Overall rating....3.5 to 4 stars
author: Alan L.

description: So far it is the best curry I have found outside of Japan.  You always know when a place specializes in one thing that is worth trying.  I will be getting my fix on soon.
author: Mary B.

description:
I feel like I'm eating at mom and pops house!!! Best grub ever!!!! 
I love eating here on a cold day when I want a hot plate of food with rice, warm curry of my choice, potatoes, tender beef and fried potato and shrimp topping....
author: janat s.

description:
Fast, Japanese food!  Not exactly Japanese fast food haha.
Order at the counter, get your own utensils, and then get ready to eat!

The curry is so yummy (not watered down like other places), but the mild honestly has no spice to it.  So I would stick to medium or even hot!  I didn't dare try the "volcano" spiciness, but I heard it's not even that hot!  Japanese food is never that spicy anyways haha.

Super cute and casual place to hang out and eat some good curry and cutlets!
author: Cathy T.

description:
Service: quick and friendly service.

Food: Food is not freshly cooked. The plates come out in a fast pace. 

- Taste: I ordered Chicken Teriyaki, it was microwaved. Chicken was dry and luke warm. Teriyaki sauce was bland and did not compromise with the chicken.

- Freshness: Salad was wilted. Felt like it was bought days ago.

Question: would you pay 10 bucks on a pre-heated food? I know other restaurants at the same price rate, cook fresh.
author: Pasin W.

description:
Come inside volcano and you'll find a pleasant space, with quaint paintings hung around the walls depicting absurd scenes centered around the curry here.

For the times that I have been here, I had never been disappointed with what I got. The curry base was always of a consistent texture, and my favorite side, the croquette, was always crispy, soft, and delicious. 

For what it is, the food is pleasant and the price is fair.

I usually leave the restaurant happy and feeling more content than when I walked in.
author: Henry H.

description:
This place was delicious!!!

We ordered the volcano plates - chicken katsu and chicken teriyaki, as well as the fried fish curry plate. We all enjoyed every bit of the food. I ordered the katsu and it was aaaammmaaazzziiiinngg!!! Makes me want some more... I would recommend that place! And the prices are all around 8 something! Good deal to me!
author: Yan L.

description:
I never thought I'd have such delicious and CHEAP curry in San Francisco. This place has exceeded my expectations of restaurant curry with their low prices and huge selection of foods. I am especially a fan of their chicken katsu curry, but would DEFINITELY grab a spam katsu (say whaaat?) sandwich any day of the week.

Grab a punch card for some eats when you swing by, too. This place is WAY away from Japan Town, which is a damn shame since the Japanese food in that area is just alright. Volcano is definitely worth the trek for some good food. While you're out here, you might as well make it an adventure and discover the Sutro Bath Ruins since you're only a few minutes away.
author: Patrick K.

description:
My go to place for good, quick, and inexpensive food.  Portions are huge so at least for me, I always have leftovers after coming here.  I can handle the medium, but after a while it gets kind of hot, so I've dialed back to mild these days. My typical order is pork katsu with potato croquette and eggplant.  

Service has dramatically improved too.
author: Charlie A.

description:
Yum!!!! I am a huge fan of Japanese curry, I love the thickness and flavorful taste that arrives from every bite. This place did everything right with their curry and I appreciate that they allow you to choose the level of spicyness since I'm a wuss at eating anything spicy. The chicken katsu I had was cooked to perfection and a crunch with each bite. 

Another plus about this place I the variety! It's great that I can add additional toppings and or what not. My bf especially love the fact that you can have noodles rather than rice! 

Love this place, definitely will return when I have another craving!
author: Mimi P.

description:
Good-sized portion for curry, economically priced.

Japanese-style curry here is good.  Medium spicy barely registered to me and I usually don't like spicy so I would suggest ordering at least hot if you like some heat.  If you can't handle it, I guess you can grab some self-serve icy water they have on the counter.  Another plus is their stamp card which can get you free toppings and curry.

I've only had the chicken katsu curry here but I would definitely come back and try other things again if I ever find myself in the I-don't-know-what-to-eat-and-I'm-in-the-Richmond dilemma.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Not sure what's up with these new alerts touting a business as having a poor health score. I guess it could have changed, but all I can say is this place has made my day for many years. It's good food and in all my visits, I've never seen anything to complain about.
author: monica d.

description: I would have to say this is my favorite spot to get some katsu curry!! Curry house used to be my favorite in Hawaii, but Volcano has definitely topped it. I also love the fact that you could adjust the level of spice for your curry as well. My go to spot whenever I'm in SF!
author: Tammy N.

description: Would give it one star if it weren't for the super friendly and fast service! The chicken katsu curry is mediocre at best, a few lazy, giant chunks of carrots and potatoes. The chicken teriyaki is... like Quickly. The miso soup was salty, no tofu, and strange seaweed. I think my favorite part of my plate was the spinach salad...
author: Elexis K.

description:
I couldn't decide on giving Volcano four or five stars even after going here at least six times in the past two months (I know this because of my beloved stamp card!).  But, the fact that my boyfriend from Oaxaca who rarely craves Asian cuisine always wants to go here tipped the scale over to five stars!  Really, Volcano, that's not an easy feat!

I love the simplicity of ordering, sitting, eating, and leaving.  Casual to the max.  Never had issues in any regards, and as of my last visit, I'd say the service and care has gone up exceptionally.  Medium spiciness is my shizz, but I've gone with a couple folks who said VOLCANO level was not spicy enough!  So, if you're all about the hotness, may be ya need to ask for an extra kick.

Also, I'm a sucker for places with stamp cards, and this one rocks!  You get prizes like free toppings for your dish in between completing your card.  Lovesit!
author: Nadia D.

description:
I had a bad craving for Japanese curry so instead of getting just crepes, me and my friend went for a hardy, warm meal of curry. Especially it was a chilly day in SF. And I was pretty satisfied and am excited to eat my leftovers later.

1. It's easy to find. Just take the 38 or 38L bus from Union Square, heading straight down Geary Blvd, get off on 20th Street, walk a little bit and there it is. But because me and my friend, Chelsey, got off at the wrong stop for a different destination, we decided to walk the rest of the way there which worked up our appetites.

2. Once we both walked in, the delicious aroma of curry blew into our faces. It tasted as good as it smelled.

3. The place was a bit small but what can you do about that...

4. For about $7.95 of the chicken Katsu curry on a large portioned plate with big chunks of carrot, potatoes and rice, adding a potato croquette for a $1.25 more, I was pretty happy about that. I'm adding another star for the fact that it's more food for cheap compared to other places that barely give you anything and is overpriced.

I will definitely come back for more in the future.
author: Candice L.

description:
Volcano is a simple no thrills eatery, in decor and menu wise: curry, sandwiches, toppings, rice plates, noodle soup, and sides. etc.


eats: chicken katsu curry(6.95)
-whole section of tender chicken, hand sized, lightly crusted,
-curry only mildly spicy, ordered medium spiciness
-lots of food....

temaki:
-order at counter, take a seat, food comes to you
-day after xmas was a free parking day at the meters
-cash only
author: Victor G.

description: My boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco, and we were starving and wanted a quick bite before dinner. We just so happened to drive by this place and I really wanted to go because I have always wanted to try curry. I ordered the pork katsu curry and my boyfriend got the chicken katsu curry each with an extra topping of fried spam. It was delicious! The katsu was crispy and the curry packed some heat but in a good way! Both of us were very happy to have stumbled luckily upon this place. Definitely coming back next time we are in SF!
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Besides Muriacchie's, this is the second best place for ton katsu curry! Order it medium, ask for extra sauce and pickled veggies and savor the goodness! 

Oh and be sure to get one of their stamp cards to earn yourself free toppings and a free entry. It really adds up quickly.

If you don't feel like having curry, try one of their mini sandwiches with homemade tartar. The fish one is especially tasty.
author: Petra S.

description:
- Very friendly service
- About $9 per plate
- Generous portions of rice and curry
- Curry has quite the spicy kick (I ordered the Volcano-spicy curry)
- A bit stingy on the potatoes and carrots
- Tastes pretty good overall 
- Somewhat limited seating
- Plan to spend a few minutes looking for parking or park a few blocks into the residentials--you're either going to walk quite a distance from your car or burn up gas looking for parking

The food is good but not $9-good
author: Horus Y.

description: I came here for dinner with a couple of friends, and my experience exceeded my satisfaction! This restaurant is fast-food style, so you walk in, order, and take a seat. I ordered the chicken katsu curry - it was amazingly delicious and filled me up! The chicken to breading ratio was perfect, a healthy amount of breading over the tender chicken, but not too much. The plate comes with some steamed carrots and potatoes, a nice touch. There was also sufficient amount of curry to complement the soft and moist rice. The service was also very pleasant. I will definitely come back again!
author: Hurnan V.

description: I like things REAL spicy, so I would suggest getting spicy curry.  It's not mouth numbingly spicy, but if you like your nose to run ALOT I would suggest the Spicy. Also, I always get the chicken katsu with a hardboiled egg. SO GOOD. Real good hangover food too!
author: Ruby R.

description: I came here for the curry just to find out their curry has peanuts in it. I've lived in Japan for a couple of years and Japanese curry doesn't have peanuts so I'm wondering what's going on. As I am allergic I couldn't try their signature dish. I bought the katsu instead and it was ok. Eatable but nothing mind blowing. Probably wouldn't go back as there are better places for Japanese food if I can't even eat their curry. Allergen signs should be posted on the huge menu as I had decided on what to get to only to reach the cash register to read the notice posted on it.
author: Carol L.

description:
Five stars for them, even though the spicy was not spicy at all. My mistake really, having my palate trained to literally withstand really hot peppers, I should have opted for the 'volcano' instead.

Anyway, this is my 3rd time here. I have always ordered the pork katsu curry. There is one reason why I do that. to see if they have consistency. They do. 

They are very comparable to the curry that I have experienced in Japan. Having stayed there for half a year, curry was one of my staple foods. Up to now, I have a stash of Japanese curry (instant) and a few ingredients to make it from scratch. It's really one of my go to dishes. Satisfying and comforting at the same time.

To me, Volcano is what comfort food is. I don't really have an affinity to fried chicken, but give me curry and I'm just sitting there, enjoying it. 

Serving size was just right and hits the spot. I even brought a friend this time and he enjoyed it a s well. We both added the kurobuta sausage, which was a great addition.

Next visit, I'm trying a new dish. 

Their menu is not very extensive, which is a good thing. I don't like those places that have 300 items on the menu and everything is mediocre at best and they claim that they are authentic. 

Authenticity gets blurry on every other tastebud, and word of mouth is what makes it hyped up. 

Volcano is not one of those. If you've been to Japan or have tasted curry that is from Japan, come here. This is as close as it gets.
author: Bryan J.

description: One of the better Japanese katsu curry joints in the city. Wife and kids all like this place. Added plus is it is super clean. Last rating was a 94
author: Darryl H.

description:
Fast, friendly service and hot, crispy katsu-- the perfect lunch. I only wish that the curry had a few more carrot pieces- or maybe other veggies- since I only got six pieces or so.

Overall, it was just what I was looking for and I'm very glad I ate curry here.
author: Rachel W.

description: Volcano is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in SF! Nearly always packed, it's a great meal when you're starving af, out with friends, or solo.
author: Andy C.

description:
I'm a regular here and this place never disappoints. Service is great. The cashier is also the busser and server, and is always really nice. Food is delicious. I always get the fried shrimp curry (it comes with 3 shrimp tempuras and carrots and potatoes and curry sauce). They have 4 levels of spiciness: mild, medium, hot, and volcano. Keep in mind the volcano sauce basically numbs your mouth to the point where you can't really taste whatever you're eating, which I'm sure some people really enjoy. It's sort of tangy, too. But I like to get the medium. When I'm feeling daring, I get the hot. You can also add extra toppings, including fried calamari, spam, pickles, cheese, extra meat, etc. for more.

I've also tried the udon noodle soups. Note that if you order the tempura shrimp noodle soup, the tempura will get soggy in the soup, so I order it on the side. It's pretty good, but definitely do try the curry plates before anything else if you've never been here before! Can't go wrong with the chicken katsu (unless you don't like chicken, then I'd recommend pork).
author: Vivian W.

description: This place sells the best curry. I love the chicken katsu the most. It's crispy and tender inside. Although it is a little pricey for curry in my opinion. Still giving it five star though.
author: Emily C.

description: I've been coming here for awhile, ordered the Chicken Curry Katsu with 2 potato croquettes and a boiled egg to go. I only got one croquette and no boiled egg, my order never gets messed up. So sad but still love this place.
author: Alvin N.

description: I LOVE Japanese curry and this place always hits the spot! It's just as good as the curry I had in Hawaii and I love that it's super cheap. I always order the chicken katsu curry, which comes with rice (brown or white) and veggies. I also added tofu nuggets once and those were really good too. Highly recommend this place if you're a curry fan.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
I always see this place when I go to Geary Street, but I've finally tried it today.
I ordered the curry chicken katsu (#4) in medium spicy level, and I paid then took a seat. It's one of those places where you pay before you sit. You can also get water and utensils by yourself which I like. My dish came out looking delicious. It had two chunks of cooked carrot and potato, some red crunchy stuff (maybe carrot?), rice, and chicken katsu. I ate it and it was yummy. The spiciness did have a kick. I don't have any complaints about the food. :) I didn't get to finish it though because I got full halfway through. Good thing my bf was there to finish the job.

The dish was a little over 7$, so the price was not bad. I would definitely come back for more!!!
author: Julian Y.

description:
This is one of my favorite places for curry in SF. I go here often enough that I always know what to order. I love love love love the curry here. It's one of the best I ever had. The price is right with the curry. I think I come here at least three times a month with my friends. The water and utensils are like the cafeteria at school, self -serve. The staff is always friendly! 

I would bring people here !
author: Cynthia D.

description: Everything about this place is fairly good, except for its claim to be Japanese Curry. I've had plenty of Japanese curry, including that served in Japan, and this is not it. However, the place is clean, has a good amount of tables, good prices, fast service, clean restroom, clean utensils, etc. The curry is not authentically Japanese in flavor; neither is their tempura, udon, or really even their rice. Just wanted to make that clear in case you were thinking that you wanted to have some authentic tasting Japanese curry.
author: Cindy M.

description:
We all have one of those go-to neighborhood joints where we can order for pick up, when the fridge is empty, or when you're just plain lazy.  Volcano is that place for me.  

I live a few blocks away and work right across the street, which translates to me eating here way too much.  They have a stamp card and every few stamps you get a free topping (eggplant, sausage, potato croquette, etc..) and on the last stamp (12th) you get a free curry+topping! 

When i first tried this place i thought their curry was too runny and not as thick as I would have liked it.  However, it really did grow on me and i don't mind this type of curry at all. It's not life changing, but its solid, consistently good curry, always hot and ready 5-10 minutes later after i call in.  The portions are pretty big, with the dry ingredients in a separate to-go box and the wet ingredients in a soup container.  Pour the savory curry on top of the rice and pork katsu and start devouring.  I highly recommend the pork or chicken katsu curry, and i usually get the 2nd highest spice level - spicy, which definitely tingles my taste buds, but i have yet to try the volcano heat level.

With that said, i've met most of the staff and they're all super friendy. I'll continue going to Volcano for delicious curry that always hits the spot, and even after eating here 10-15 times i'm still not sick of it! Now if only i can remember to always bring my stamp card...
author: Randy N.

description: I really like their curry pork Katsu with the noodles. The Tonkatsu  meat was tender and moist on the inside. It was not greasy, the breaded pork cutlet was cooked just right. The noodles cooked perfectly, not too stiff or too mushy or too sticky.  Authentic Japanese comfort food. I took a picture. I will come again.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: My co-worker keeps on talking about this place and I finally gave in and decided to give it a try.  This place is more of a self-served place.  You order at the counter and grab your utensils and wait for your food to be ready.   I ordered the original curry with the tofu nugget, eggplant and a fried egg.   I didn't expect much from this place but I ended up loving my order.  I like how you can customize how spicy you want your dish and what ingredients you want to add to it.   There was only a few pieces of the tofu nugget and i wished there was more.  The tofu nugget was o good! I think i'm going to try to look for this in stores.  The portion to me here was pretty big.  I wish i knew that the hard boiled egg was fried, i thought it was going to be a poach egg.  I ordered the mild curry and it wasn't a bit spicy to me, which i guess was good, but the next time i go I'm going to try their medium. I think they also do to-go orders so the next time i go i'll just order it to-go.
author: Belinda C.

description: Had the katsu chicken volcano curry over rice. It was spicy but I expected it to be SPICY. The potatos and carrots are boiled in water and dumped on top of the curry so veggies were flavorless. The katsu chicken was fried nicely but completely bland. The meal was underwhelming.
author: G L.

description: I came here with my friend on a visit to San Francisco. We both got the pork katsu although he got a potato croquette on his. The time it took to get our food was a bit long. The curry was a bit bland because I got the mild spicy one, I probably should have gotten a spicier version. But the pork katsu had just the right crunchy texture and meat to coating ratio. The vegetables tasted good in the curry sauce, and there was just the right amount of rice. I ended up soaking the rice in the curry and spooning it into mouth. Tasty! I will be back, hopefully.
author: Shirley X.

description: Best curry ever. This is literally the only place I go to for curry. I usually get the medium chicken Kara-age curry. It's the perfect amount of spicy and the chicken is fried to perfection. It's nice and juicy.
author: Ray W.

description: Katsu-curry is always great here.  Went with my hubby and my son.  They both had Katsu-curry which is what I usually have  I tried the chicken-tomato curry today.  It was pretty good, but still love the katsu-curry the best!  I do have to add, I make a better Japanese katsu curry than them, but who can beat my true Japanese cooking, really?????
author: Yoshiko D.

description:
We were just walking around trying to find a place to eat before a football game at a nearby bar (that was far too crowded to order food at, and the game hadn't start yet so we had time) so we wanted somewhere quick. We had no idea this place was popular on yelp until after we ordered our food--we just thought it looked like a decent, quick place to grab some yummy food. And it was yummy! Service was relatively fast and the girl who took our orders was very nice. It was really easy to figure out the menu.

I just had the chicken curry and my boyfriend had the katsu curry. I ordered medium spice and ended up with zero spice but they have sriracha bottles everywhere so I just piled that on. Yum! The servings looked small but of course the rice filled me up. I wish they had put the curry on the rice so that it was easier to mix (they were side-by-side) but that's hardly an issue.

Prices were good and there was plenty of room to grab a seat. If I were in the area I wouldn't mind popping in again, this time ordering a higher spice level since apparently mild = medium = none.
author: Katie V.

description:
If you've ever been to CurryHouse, this is exactly like it!  Located in the inner richmond, it's a great place for Japanese-style curry.  You can get various toppings and add-ons from eggplant to chicken as well as choose from a spectrum of spiciness/hotness of your curry.  This is a order at the counter and sit down type of place so its quick, tasty, and easy.

I ordered the chicken katsu curry and was not letdown at all.  The katsu was nice as crispy and they gave me a fair amount of rice to finish off my curry.

Definitely recommend this place for lunch!!!
author: Robert T.

description:
I spent many years in Hawaii and have been to Japan before as well, so I was really hoping this place wasn't going to disappoint.

The interior is an atypical unassuming curry shop w/a simple mixture of Japanese inspired wall art. Expect to see a menu w/pictures to help present a visual representation of the food items available.

I judge a curry shop on its ability to serve up a curry that has a good consistency that's not too runny and not too thick. It also has to be able to hold up on the spicy heat spectrum as well. Another good indicator of quality is the color, temperature, and cut of meat used in their Katsu.

I decided to order the Chicken Katsu and chose the hot curry sauce. My gf went with the Pork Katsu and had the medium curry sauce.
