They don't have very much seating space, and an influx of 20 people all at once definitely strained their seating ability.  We ended up eating standing at the counter.  That said, the waitress was super friendly and did everything possible to make sure we had a good experience.
author: Wayne L.

description: I honestly can't compare this place to any other curry place, but my goodness I'm in love with how everything is set up here. I love how you are able to choose the level of spiciness of your curry! I also love that water is self served & you're able to choose your seating. Last time I went here I got Chicken kastsu curry w/ the hot spiciness and a potato croquette and I was in love with life.  The only thing that stops me from giving this place 5 stars is honestly the meat to rice ratio. I feel like I always run out of run to proportion out my meal! but otherwise, I've come here a total of 3 times now and I feel like I've got my order down. I love this place & highly recommend it for your spicy curry fix!
author: Kai S.

description:
No frills, no resos cafeteria style joint that specializes in Japanese curry, which I love. However, as far as curry goes, I thought it was just ok. 

The chicken katsu curry was fine but I made the mistake of ordering it hot, which was way too spicy (can't even imagine what volcano heat would be like). Next time, definitely will stick to medium

Other toppings are add-ons. I liked the fukuzizuke pickles added a nice crunch. Next time I think I'd go with the chicken karaage (fried but not breaded like the katsu). 

The mini fried spam sandwich was meh. If you really have to have it, just order it as an add-on to the curry dish.
author: F. P.

description:
3.5 stars! I got the chicken katsu curry with an eggplant topping and medium spice (~$10)

Taste: the curry had a little but of a sour tang, but it was still good. The potatoes were a little tasteless. I've had better but if you're craving curry, this will do. The chicken katsu itself was very crispy and good. The eggplant was tender and full of flavor. My friend got the potato croquette and it tasted like fried mashed potatoes - like breakfast hash browns: good, but nothing special. 

Service: A. Go to counter and order. I came with 3 other friends. My 2 friends and I got our food quickly, but I think the chef forgot my last friend's chicken katsu curry, but they remedied that quickly!
author: Irene K.

description: After being brought here by some friends I fell in love with the place. I am not much of a foodie like other reviewers but I do love spicy food. And if you're looking for something spicy then this is the place! There are 4 levels to the curry's spiciness mild, medium, hot and of course volcano. I was even told you can do double volcano but even volcano is spicy to being with. The selection of food and toppings is great. They even have sandwiches which I do recommend if you're not in the mood for the curry. The cashiers are always polite and courteous and the dining area is well kept. They have bins for you to place your used plates, cups and silverware after you're done with your meal. And there is also comic shop a few doors down which is a plus for me. Anyway if you're up to trying some spicy Japanese curry this is the place!
author: Lionel F.

description:
This place is great.  I've been here twice and enjoyed both times.  I should try something new but both times I had the same thing - medium curry pork katsu with sausage - why fix it if it aint broke?!  

Katsu is crispy, curry is flavorful.  Both times were perfect.  It wasn't overly hot where you can't taste the curry flavor.  I probably won't get the sausage anymore...could be that vienna stuff.  The food is relatively inexpensive ~$9 for a hugeass plate of food.
author: M T.

description: Hmm, now I am worried about the food safety of this place. I can't even go here anymore because my lady decided we are now veg.
author: Nancy D.

description:
This place has delicious katsu curry, my boyfriend got me hooked on it. I keep telling myself I'll try something new, but I haven't yet. Usually the servings are very large, but today it seemed smaller.

Is the curry soup good?
author: Jill B.

description:
Ordered takeout here the other day for dinner. The place was empty, but had decent reviews. I stopped in and ordered the tomato stewed chicken with "hot" curry and a side of the seaweed salad. I can handle my spiciness, but this "hot" was not "hot" in the least bit. Also, the chicken was ALL dark meat, no white. Which is fine, its just speaks to their position on quality. And it was all meat, no veggies like it suggested it came with in the 'original curry.' The seaweed salad was fine, but just fine. Not great, or bad; just fine. 

It was decent food, although I most likely will not return.
author: Carlynn A.

description:
I got the pork katsu, with potato croquette, sausages and some zucchini. I got mild. Thought the curry was alright, got nothing to based it off of, because have not tried real real Japanese curry. The pork katsu was alright, potato croquette, thought it be cool but just fried potato lol. Zucchini was juicy, and temperature hot. 

Overall I thought it was alright, nothing too special. Curry is way better than supermarket curry though that is for sure.
author: David L.

description: Quick and cheap, spice levels in tune with my spice tolerance and always hits the spot.  When I'm hungry and too lazy to make dinner, Volcano is my go-to for non-portable food (burritos and sandwiches).
author: Michael G.

description:
GUILTY AS CHARGED. 

I came back here over the weekend for a Chicken Katsu Curry (medium spice). This time, I opted for all zucchinis in my curry as opposed to having 2 slices of zucchini, 2 slices of carrots, and 2 small potatoes. Not a huge fan of carrots or potatoes so zucchini it is! They gladly gave me all zucchinis. 

Don't forget to pick up a yellow frequent buyer card!! On the 3rd, 6th and 9th curry purchase, you get a free topping! And on the 12th purchase, you get free curry & a free topping. Yayuhhh..!!
author: Heidi C.

description: Really liked this place. Delicious curry and shrimp tempura. The curry noodle soup is especially yummy!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Food is good and the curry is definitely worth a try.
But the service is just horrible. Two waiters who sits behind the counter and did not even realize that there was a homeless person eating from the trash inside the restaurant today! Just shows how ignorant they are. Tables are dirty.
Eat here at your own risk.
author: Andrew T.

description: This is my go to japanese curry place in SF.  Usually order the medium-spicy, Chicken Katsu curry.  Never disappointed.  It's like fast food.  Order at the counter, get a number, and they'll bring you your food when it's ready.  Get your own utensils and drinks too.
author: Edward N.

description: They have curry with noodles! I've never seen a restaurant offer this so I was happy since I always prefer noodles over rice. The chicken Katsu was nicely breaded and the sauce was yummy! Hubs liked their chicken katsu as well and he always orders it at different restaurants. Also, inexpensive and casual!
author: Freckles H.

description:
For 5 star curry, you have to go to japan.  But you can get 4 star curry right here at Volcano curry.  Now when i eat here, I usually get the same thing and don't stray too far so I am really only rating their curry and not anything else on the menu.

I typically get the vegetable curry as hot as you can get it (level 4) with a potato croquette.  That is yummy comfort asian food.  And I split the portion into 2 meals as this spreads out my caloric intake.  I could finish it all in one setting - it is good and filling but I am also trying to eat sensibly.  This is an occasional splurge.

This is far from where I live so I don't come as often as I like but I have been here about 15-20 times.  Finally remembered to review it.  

the food comes out fast and is reasonably priced.  I like this better than muracci's and better than japa curry.  Unfortunately, the other two are easier for me to get to so i eat their curry more often than this one, but in my book, this one is the best locally.
author: Bebe W.

description: Maybe our expectations were too high, or maybe we tried the wrong dishes, but we thought this was just okay.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry with boiled egg. Being the hungry petite Asian girl, I downed my portion near to the last bite of a katsu piece. Needless to say, the meal was enough as a late brunch. Though I see how people in the area would come to eat here for the flavorful curry, I'm sure it's decent for what it's worth, but not something that I'd recommend to others off the top of my head.
author: Nicole C.

description: When I've got a craving for Japanese curry I come here. Aside from just being a few blocks from my apartment, it's one of my favorite spots to get my Japanese curry on. I typically go for the Tonkatsu curry (pork). I recently went hot and it was pretty intense. Typically I go with the medium, which I think i'll go back to. I can only imagine the pain that would be the Volcano level of spiciness of their volcano curry. They also do a very good udon curry soup. My tip is to not go too hot with the soup if you want to drink the soup.
author: Grant O.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. The curry here is better than CoCo Ichiban in Japan, which used to be my standard for excellence in Japanese curry. Please open a location in Japan Town!!! It's worth the trip from wherever you are, but I'd come all the time if I could walk over.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Their level of spicy is really spicy. They weren't joking when they named their restaurant Volcano. I only had one lick of my friend's volcano curry and I was glad I ordered mild. I love spicy food but Lord knows curry doesn't do me well. My friend really wanted to come so he assured me that Japanese curry does the stomach differently than Indian curry.

Ordered myself a mild chicken w/ tomato curry while he got the volcano beef. I wish I had gone with my instinct and got the regular mild chicken curry instead of chicken tomato because the tomato sauce made the dish slightly tangy and I prefer my dish to be more savory. 

Not really digging the order at the counter, self-seating and self gathering for utensils theme but the food wasn't bad. Though the portions are decent, it certainly isn't worth $8-$9 for rice and a few pieces of meat covered in sauce. 

The stars speak for itself. A-OK.
author: Jenny K.

description:
The other day I had the Chicken Katsu Curry for lunch, OMG.

I dreamt about the curry deliciousness. I'm going to go back. I need to. Need. To.
author: Jenelly D.

description: not a big curry fan but went to this place with a friend who loves curry. got here and ordered. portions are huge! not  a bad place to eat curry and would come back if my friend drives me back =D
author: Janne Y.

description: I rarely give five stars but this place was really spot on! The cashier was really nice and helped me out when I didn't know what to order. I really wanted curry with shrimp and calamari so she told me which option was best to get. I love the music at this place. When the food arrived, the shrimp and calamari tasted perfect. They were both really crispy. The curry was delicious, not too spicy for me and the vegetables tasted fresh. I'll definitely come back!
author: Griz S.

description:
AWESOME FOOD, HORRENDOUS SERVICE.

The curry is so addicting! Pick what type of curry you want, level of spiciness, and for a price, any assortment of add-ons they have. I came here with a bunch of friends today and we all ordered something different. Order any type of curry dish you and you won't go wrong-- everything was delicious. However, many other things DID go wrong... 

1. My friend wanted to order the "volcano" curry (the spiciest on their spice-o-meter) and the female server (the only one there today) insinuated that he wouldn't be able to handle the degree of spiciness. Then she proceeds to ask him if he was Thai or Vietnamese (he's Chinese) because apparently those are the only people who can handle spicy foods. I could not believe she had the nerve to say that to anyone, let alone customers... 

2. We each ordered different levels of spiciness, mild, medium, and volcano, and they all tasted the same. Not spicy at all. wtf?

3. One of my friends ordered 2 boiled egg add-ons ($1 each) for his curry and he received two egg halves. They either forgot to give him the 2nd egg or they're shitting us by charging $1 for half a hard boiled egg...

4. My bf ordered the spam mini sandwich which still had not come halfway through our meal. We reminded the server thinking that maybe they forgot to make it. Finally, after we were already done eating, she comes out of the kitchen with the super dinky sandwich in a small paper bag. Without looking or saying a word, she TOSSES the sandwich onto our table!! It would have rolled off it we didn't stop it. WOWOWOWWW. If we wanted to play catch, we would've gone to the park! This girl seriously needs to check herself. She does not know a thing about customer service or food management. (To add insult to injury, the spam sandwich flat out sucked.)

The server's attitude was seriously APPALLING. For her service, I would give negative stars if I could. BUT the curry is their saving grace as it is delicious. I'm only hoping the other employees here are nowhere near as unpleasant as the female we encountered today.
author: Helen L.

description:
First time here, good to decent food. I can't complain about the flavoring of the meat since I got katsu... anything fried is delicious! I really like the onion croquette, creamy with caramelized onions in the center of a potato croquette. 

This place is a $ but when you order toppings it becomes $$ but at least there's a decent amount of food for your money!

BONUS PTS for having a stamp card for toppings! I will definitely come back when I want casual, not too expensive, good food. Cheers!
author: Jen L.

description:
So So So Good.  The Chicken Katsu Curry is my absolute favorite meal in the Richmond.  I had never had Japanese curry before my partner took me here (which he stumbled upon randomly), but I was hooked after indulging in the spicy spicy curry.  I have a spicy food addiction and this is where I go to get my fix ;) Add on veggies, egg, or sub brown rice.
They have four different levels of spicy if it is not your thing too! With Volcano being the hottest, I always choose double volcano which isn't on the menu.  My partner once had triple volcano--which was too hot (I didn't know I even had a limit! but apparently it is double volcano). 
Volcano is very much worth the trek to the Richmond, I am waiting for the day that they open a pop-up of some sort in my neighborhood, until then!
author: Lyndsey L.

description: Love their potatoes and onion croquettes! They do a good job with their frying. Quick service too for hungry bears~
author: Viv N.

description: My favorite place in San Francisco to get Japanese Curry. The spiciness of the curry is on point for my level. The pork katsu or Tonkatsu was delicious and had good portions. The price was good for the amount of food and taste. I'll come back frequently with my friends.
author: Jason L.

description:
My boy and I were in the area and he told me this place was just as good as anywhere else Ive tried.
He was right I couldn't ask for anything better. 

I had the pork katsu curry not to hot on brown rice.

Ill be going back soon to try all their other options.
author: Blake R.

description: Chicken Katsu curry with a side of fukuzinzuke pickles and an onion croquette!  A side the pickles comes with a looooot!  It's either too little without the side or too much with it, so I'll usually share with a friend. But the onion croquette is amazing!  Deep fried mashed potatoes with some caramelized onions.  Def can't go wrong with that.
author: Tina L.

description: I would give this place 4 for decent curry rice for under $10 in the city. Pros are the price and variety: shrimp, chicken, veg, pork at varying spice levels. Cons: Pay extra for red radish and the curry is so-so.
author: Sara N.

description: Everytime I'm craving Japanese curry,  this hits the spot! Katsu is really yummy and not dry. Good portions and not expensive.
author: Karen Z.

description: Volcano is a my quick curry fix at night.  I always get the chicken katsu curry mild because I can't take the heat lol.  They give you plenty of curry, rice, and meat.  Very affordable as well.  The girl at the cashier works really hard.  She cleans up the tables, brings to the food to you, and takes your order at the cashier.  Be nice to her!
author: Alister L.

description:
so i found this place because there was a Scoutmob for it like 9 months ago.  We've been going back ever since...and i don t live anywhere near it. that's how much i like it.  It is good to go at off times since the place only sits like 20 people...the food is amazing...if you haven't had japanese curry, def try it.  so good and filling.  I also like that you can adjust your spicyness (since i'm a spicy wimp).  Oh, did i mention it's cheap?  a big bowl of japanese curry chicken soup is like $7. so lunch under $10 in SF? amazeballs. 

ps - to the students who go here:  please try NOT to talk on your phone, at full volume, in mandarin, while you're in the restaurant.  They may not have taught you yet in school, but that is rude.  Oh, and put on some jeans while you're at it. Sweats should only be an option if you're going to the gym or you're sick. 

but even among the annoying, sweatpants-wearing students, the food still shines.
author: Mike B.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of Japanese curry. I always feel its heavy on the herb flavoring and lacking in the heat department. But Volcano has converted me with theirs.

Different levels of spiciness for the curious and brave. Most dishes come with potatoes, carrots and zuchinni...but there are toppings you can add. Served with rice or noodles (yay!) and they have noodle soups as well (just ok).

Chicken curry tastes and looks like boiled chicken, nothing special. Go with the katsu's! Katsu sandwich was interesting, nice touch with some veg, while the mini spam katsu sandwich is a good snack on a Hawaiian bun. I love the pickles that come with the curry dishes, it gives a nice crunch.

Nothing fancy, good, easy meal. Pretty much self serve, self clean up, not much service to really complain about. Some cool artwork on their walls incorporating their curry dishes.
author: Ly T.

description:
ScoutMob brought me in here originally, but I've returned a few times because I can't keep the curry out of my dreams. No really, last night I literally dreamt about this place.

I'm one of those veggie types, so I always get the Original Curry, which has super tender eggplant, zucchini, potato, and carrots in it. You can get it with brown rice (happy colon!) or noodles for an extra dollar. Then you chose your spicyness level. The first time I came I made the mistake of getting the Mild, because I am a wuss, and assumed it would have a little kick-it did not. The Medium is the perfect level of spice for me. No snot/sweat dripping from heat overload, promise. Then, if you are in the mood for indulging your inner fat kid, like I was today, you can get toppings!

Get the potato croquette. Just do it. You will wonder why you've lived your life so long without one. The tofu nuggets are yum too.

The water/ice situation is kind of jenky, whenever I reach in that bucket for ice I wonder who else has also reached in with unwashed hands. And there's only one bottle of Tonkatsu sauce that you have to try to not to bogart. 

But it's pretty cheap and the girls working there are always super nice and working their asses off. And there's a stamp card too where you can earn free toppings! Like I needed another excuse to eat there...
author: Chelsea W.

description:
I had been wanting to try this place for a while, and I finally managed to find my way in this past weekend. I've always been a fan of Japanese curry, and up until recently have been making my own by buying blocks of the pre-made stuff. I was pleased to find out that the curry here was several times better than anything I could concoct in the comfort of my own kitchen.

Being a fan of chicken katsu curry (introduced to me at Wagamama's in the UK), I chose to eat the volcano curry variation of that dish. It was a great tasting curry, served on top of a bed of very nicely cooked rice, with a bit of tonkatsu sauce drizzled on top.

Definitely coming back here when I have a craving for some Japanese curry. I may be more adventurous the second time around and get some extra toppings as well! Oh, and they do have a double volcano spiciness as well (not on the menu), which I am looking forward to try the next time around.
author: Victor R.

description:
This place is one of those neighborhood spots you want others to try but are afraid if they do it may get too busy. But this place has the best Japanese curry. I ordered the chicken katsu curry, it was cooked nicely,. it comes with rice and delicious veggies. However the star of the dish is the curry sauce. The sauce comes in 4 spicy levels, Ive tried the spiciest level and it was awesome.
This is the type of place you order and find your own seat. It is clean and the register lady is always super nice. I always see people peek through the window as if they are not sure about this place...walk in order some food and you will come back for sure. One bad thing is the seating, when it gets busy it may be hard to find a table. No worries they have to go boxes.
author: Miguel C.

description:
Chicken Katsu Curry FTW!
My friend lives down the street from this place and it is our go to spot whenever we hang out. 
Their service is fast and the restaurant is clean. It's got a great home-y feeling and I feel that the food is cooked very well. 
They have all these different add-ins that just add that little kick to your curry, and a stamp card that could get you a free add in and at the very end a free curry. I keep losing my card but i don't care, i love coming here.
author: Gretchen B.

description: Love this curry!!!! Good price, and a really interesting menu.  Japanese curry is totally different than thai or indian and for me, it is a welcome change.  Try all the toppings! Try it with brown rice!  You can have it how ever you want it.  I totally digg this place.
author: Ryder D.

description:
Japanese curry is probably my favorite comfort food.  Having a bad day?  Some Japanese curry would help.  Getting over a cold?  Nothing a little Japanese curry can't fix.  Just broke up?  Have yourself some Japanese curry.........then drown your sorrows in liquor.

So...just the mere fact that it specializes in Japanese curry means that Volcano is guaranteed two stars at least.  As far as how its curry compares, it's solid.  It's not the best I've ever had, but it certainly hits the spot when I crave curry (which is ALWAYS).  They also make a mean tonkatsu, so that's a plus.  They're a little skimpy on the vegetables, though, unless you order extra.

Next time I come I will hopefully try the curry soup noodles, because that sounds intriguing.  It's just so hard to NOT order a fried pork steak with curry every time, ya know?
author: jon y.

description:
Never been a fan of Japanese curry until I tried this place. Their curry is much more flavorful than the ones I've had in the past. 

I always get the Chicken Katsu curry. Medium spicy. I love spicy and this is the perfect amount of spice before the food doesn't taste good anymore. The katsu is perfectly crunchy. They put it on top of the curry so the katsu doesn't get all soggy before you start eating. The veggies in the curry are also perfectly cooked so they're nice and soft. Love it. 
The dishes also come with some pickled diakon (I think) which I really enjoy. Wish they'd give me just a little more though. 

Service is great and price is decent. 

**Side note about the spicy levels**
The first time I came here with my husband he decided to get the Volcano level of spiciness. I warned him not to get it since he's never been able to handle his spice. But he insisted that since it's Japanese curry, it wouldn't be that spicy.  And guess who was right?! I think he started to lose all sensation to his tongue around the 4th bite. So if you can't handle your spice, I'd stick to anything below a medium.
author: Lang T.

description:
So today, I continued my endless journey for the perfect, tremendously spicy, Japanese curry. The Holy Grail, essentially. Finding this place right next to one of the great nerd Meccas in the city, Cards and Comics Central, I figured that a place called "Volcano" would have the answer to my lusty craving for the ideal, fiery Ambrosia.

So I entered this establishment. It seemed pretty clean. Nothing much, except for a few Japanese and Hawaiian artworks.

They have 4 different levels of curry, the hottest being "Volcano". I went for the Pork Katsu curry with this "Volcano" level. The person at the cashier put it down immediately. Apparently, she didn't warn me about it being extremely spicy, or give an awkward "You sure you can handle that, fella?" warning, like at WingStop when you attempt to order "Atomic" or at On the Bridge when you get something at a higher level. It made me expect for it to be not so hot. Yeah, I have weird expectations.

So the cashier brought me my dish to my table. The first impression I got from it was the slightly strong sweet scent from it. One thing I expect out of Japanese curry is for it to have a certain amount of thickness to it. This was actually pretty runny. The pork katsu on the plate was actually pretty large and plentiful. There was exactly 2 pretty thick pieces of carrot, exactly 2 pretty large chucks of potatoes, and exactly 1 pretty thick piece of zucchini in the brown pool of mystery.  I think I would've preferred a bit more vegetation in my curry but, at minimum, this was adequate.

The taste was a little sour. There was definitely some nose-clearing heat to it, but nothing to extreme. The protein itself was pretty nice and moist, but I can't say I was the biggest fan of the overall flavor of the curry. It just didn't have that heavily spiced, strong flavor that I expect out of a good curry. Disappointed overall.

I think it is worth a try. Price was okay. But personally, I wouldn't come here again myself, even if I do happen to be in the immediate area, nerding out at C+C Central. My quest continues.
author: Kevin W.

description:
So I only had Japanese curry once before and Volcano was better. My friend and I each ordered a katsu, mine curry pork and hers was chicken katsu. I had a medium katsu which was just the right amoutn of flavor. Not too spicy but enough kick. The curry was a little sweet. The katsu was fried pretty well too. 
Honestly it's not the best but it tastes great on a cold SF day.
author: Wilson T.

description:
We happened to be in the area and found this place thanks to yelp!
We got the chickenkatsu and chicken karage.One of them was a volcano plate rather than curry, not sure which. We asked for the "volcano" option in the spice level.

First thing we noticed- the curry doesn't contain the meat, it's just gravy. The curry plate came with rice and the grilled chicken with the gravy poured over. Anyway, we never knew there was a Japanese version of curry and we loved what we had here.
Though we took the highest level possible for the spice, the dish was not super spicy. The volcano plate had fried chicken cooked to perfection, it also came with some salad.

Given the ambiance and kind of service I think the prices can be a bit lower.
author: Minu M.

description: I only really come here for the chicken Katsu sandwich, which is so delicious with some Katsu sauce. I've have the chicken Katsu curry and it really wasn't all that great to me, I guess I prefer thai curry. Overall good service and decent food.
author: Ellie R.

description:
I ordered the Chicken katsu with noodles and my bf ordered the beef curry with jalapenos. My chicken katsu was a little thin so it wasn't as meaty as i thought it would be. The medium sauce is nice and rich but since i wanted the noodles, it cost me $1 extra. So my plate was about $9.

The beef curry wasn't all that great. He got a mild level because he wanted the jalapenos. The beef was dry and chewy and the jalapenos were different, because they were fried! =) 

Overall, its an ok price for what you get. If you are really feeling for some good homestyle curry, this is a good place.
author: Anita W.

description:
I was expecting this to be typical sit-down and order restaurant. Instead it's more cafeteria- like where you order at the counter first and the staff brings you the food.

Nevertheless, I haven't had Japanese curry for some time, and my meal here brings back memories of my college days at Berkeley where I order curry like this from a food truck. It was yummy. I ordered spicy level #3, which is hot, and to me it wasn't that challenging at all. There is a fourth level called "Volcano", which is what I'll have to try if icome again.

The basic dish prices here are quite economical, but you can easily run up the total with additional toppings. Also very nice service when I came this past Wednesday evening.
author: H K.

description:
I love places that do one thing really well, so I can say I love this place. It's not fancy, or exotic, or filled with tatooed hipsters, but they make great Japanese curry. The pork katsu is good enough to stand on its own as well. Put the two together over steaming rice and I'm busy, leave me alone. 

If I'm in the Richmond and it's time to eat, I'm here. 

Weekends they can get invaded by role-playing card players on weekends, so if you are into that...
author: Jay M.

description:
I was feenin for Japanese curry one day and decided to search on Yelp for it. Valcono was pretty far, but it sounded just like what I wanted, so I drive all the across the city to try it out.

When you walk in, it looks like a fast food restaurant with the menu behind the counter, tables, but there's someone there to wait your table. We stood there for a good solid minute, trying to decide what we want. They have a good variety of curry dishes ranging from curry over rice, or noodles, or just plain curry dishes. When we ordered, the girl behind the counter had a bunch of follow up questions - how spicy, what sauce, any sides, drinks? So be prepared with all your answers cuz its rude standing there going "hmmmmm ..." :P

The curry was solid. The portion was very healthy and fills you up. I can't say its the best curry I've had, but it was good, hit the spot, fast and inexpensive.
author: Rosie W.

description: Best place to go when you want Japanese curry around SF. They offer 4 level of spice with all your normal meats and vegetables.
author: William C.

description: I was not so impressed by the curry sauce BUT I WAS impressed with the perfect chicken Katsu.  YUM.  It is the kind of meal you sort of wish you had a hangover when eating it.  Sadly (or luckily) I was not hungover, yet it still hit a crispy (very crispy) spot in my cold (and soggy) heart.
author: Amy W.

description:
Décor is nice with its paintings, but the place felt small was the feeling right when I walked in for lunch. I love Japanese curry and could never find one that was really spicy and heard about Volcano. Upon seeing the lunch crowd, I decided to get my order of Pork Katsu (Tonkatsu) with an egg and decided on Volcano spicy. The lady warned me it has Ghost peppers in it, but I was settled on finding that level of spice I've been craving so I proceeded.

Tonkatsu was nicely breaded, fried, and sweet (not sure if it's supposed to be sweet). 

The curry was on the side with carrots, potatoes, and zucchini. I am use to curry places having chili oil to help add heat if the taste wasn't to your liking; therefore, you are stuck with what you ordered.

The volcano level of spice didn't really kick in till about 2/3 when my lips were tingling and the top of my head was itchy. However, I didn't stop and my eyelid started twitching. Feel free to laugh at my misfortune, but I continued eating because I liked the heat the curry had.

Regardless, I enjoyed Volcano curry because of the level of heat more than the flavor of the curry. Flavor-wise, it didn't really stand out to me and I can only give this place a 3-3.5stars.
author: Casey L.

description: Excellent curry! The spicier options do actually pack heat. Price is reasonable, and food is well-made. I have yet to try the toppings, but they look fun and tempting. Also have a nice selection of soft drinks. Will definitely frequent this place.
author: Dave Y.

description:
If you want good, cheap Katsu Curry, this is the place to get it. For all you people in love with Tani's Kitchen, this place is better. Don't forget the Fukuzinzuke pickles. It comes with a few but I always like to get extra.

If you want your curry really spicy, get it Volcano style. It even burns coming out
author: Gary K.

description:
The food was really good!! I ordered the fried shrimp curry (hot). The portion was very large, definitely filled me up. The curry had so much flavor and was the perfect spiciness for me. And it was under $10.

I will most certainly be back!
author: Wanda M.

description:
I've only tried the beef curry here (medium and then later mild because the medium was a little spicier than I cared for...I don't even want to think how the volcano tastes!) but I really enjoy the curry.  The bf had the katsu curry and also thoroughly enjoyed his dish.  Oh, and I also really like their seaweed salad, but when has anyone ever gone wrong with seaweed salad?


Little story: I came here with some co-workers for the first time. The co-worker saw eggs on the menu and asked for a fried egg over his curry.  Little did he realize that the eggs they listed were hardboiled egg.  When his dish came out, they had cut the hardboiled egg in half and then pan seared the sides of the hardboiled egg and put it on top of his curry.  That's right a hardboiled egg with some grill marks on it.  We all just kind of stared at it for a while before we burst into laughter.
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
Gnom Gnom Gnom!! 

I don't know why it only has 3.5 stars... but this place is yuuuuumy! Ugh.. i'm actually thinking about it now. I went here on a whim because I saw a deal on Scoutmob. 50% off... how can I resist. I ordered the curry with rice and chicken... the bf had the katsu... O...M....G.... I love rice, and curry... and chicken.. so this... was... awesome. 

The price is decent too! and the Tofu Nuggets were pretty great. :P 

It's not some waiter serviced joint... just go to the register, order, sit, and your food will come... get your own utensils. Hassle free... great place to get your grub on and leave. :)

Will I go again at full price and without my Scoutmob deal.... HECK YEA!
author: Kristina L.

description: I've been coming to Volcano Curry for years and it never ceases to fulfill my curry cravings. I love the curry with beef, chicken, and chicken katsu. Any of those three meat with curry over rice is delicious! Add a croquet and you have yourself a delicious meal! The staff at Volcano are very friendly and even brings out forks and napkins if you forget to get them yourself. If you're in the mood for curry, give Volcano a try. It's good!
author: Edgar G.

description:
It was my first time on Monday night, but I'm sold!  I love the food, extremely fulfilling!  The staff was super nice, and the place had a very welcoming kitchen feel to it.

I really appreciate the four different levels of spice.  I think that's a huge fear for some folks who aren't always keen on the hotness of curries.  This place is a gem for curry enthusiasts with their Volcano spice, but safe for the more curry-curious folks like myself.  

I will be going back.  Soon.
author: james r.

description:
Sadly I thought I'd be writing an update to a review, but apparently I only thought I wrote one before.

Found this place a few years ago when we got a val-u-pak coupon for it.  The menu was pretty limited, but it was pretty tasty.  We ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry.   Curry was dark brown in color and flavorful.  They also serve brown rice with is a plus.

We just went back this week since we were in the neighborhood.  I think they changed the curry recipe because it was lighter in color and the flavor was a tad sweeter.  We ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry with medium spiciness - which actually has decent kick.  Also ordered the Fried Shrimp Curry with a Potato Couquette topping.  I usually get potato crouquette as a main, so was surprised at how it was a topping.  Here's the thing, had I not gotten that potato, I would still have been hungry.  They only give you 3 shrimp  for like ~$7.50 versus a slab a chicken for cheaper ~$6.50.  Very disappointed with this.  

Not sure If I'll be back anytime soon.
author: Denice L.

description:
I admit the vegetarian Katsu was tasty, however...

The hostess asked me and several other customers if we minded ordering to go complaining that she had been there all day and wanted to close.

The food took an obscene amount of time to be prepared.

The hostess took money from several customers and went to the kitchen and dipped her unwashed hands into some kind of spice to sprinkle over the to go orders.

The dining area was a bit messy.

I'm still new to SF and have yet to find the places I will frequent. This won't be one of them!
author: Thomas Nathan S.

description: I'm a fan of the chicken katsu curry. I love their Japanese curry--it is definitely different than other curries I've had. They have four levels of spicy-ness, so everyone can enjoy their curry. Of course, they also have non-curry options. Keep in mind that Volcano is very casual, but also very delicious!
author: Caitlin C.

description: Volcano Curry is definitely one of my go-tos on Geary because of its great taste and proportions. The food always taste fresh and the curry is also a good temperature. The service does vary though having some good waitresses, yes waitresses as I have never had a male waiter there, which is weird now thinking about it, but getting off topic. Volcano Curry has a good variety and I love their stamp card system. Overall I definitely recommend this place.
author: Lawrence Y.

description: For it's relaxing atmosphere and quick service! Five stars! And a stamp card? Even more stars! I always go for the chicken katsu curry noodle soup. Highly recommended
author: Claire H.

description: Absolutely love this place! Great prices, consistent great service, and of course fresh and delicious food! Their curry is ALWAYS spot on.
author: Jen R.

description:
My love for Volcano Curry = A frequent eatings card. I also have cravings for this place on a regular basis. 

1. The frequent eatings card, great idea! For every three plates of food you order, you get a topping for free. Toppings are all about a dollar a pop, so it's always nice to have the option to try the toppings for free when you eat at this establishment so often. On your twelfth visit, you get a free curry and a free topping. Who can say "No" to a free meal?!

2. Pork Katsu for $7, no complaints. The plate comes with a generous portion of the pork katsu, rice, slices of potatoes, zucchini and carrots and more curry than rice! The medium spicy curry is just spicy enough for the ones that want to try to eat spicy but really can't. And the perfect spicy for a person who turns their pho broth red with Sriracha sauce should order the Hot or Volcano. The pork katsu is juicy and the panko breading makes the katsu amazingly crispy. I can drink a bowl of that curry myself; the flavors are absolutely on point. The portion size is perfect.

3. Self service. Grab your own glass of water and please be courteous to clean up afterwards; it would make everyone a lot happier. 

4. This place gets busy during the lunch hours. Many of their customers during this time look like high school students. Gee, when did these kids get more than $20 a week for lunch. I would have to go without lunch for a day to eat here. But so be it, I'd do it.

The battle between Volcano Curry  vs. JapaCurry Truck. Volcano Curry wins, by a landslide. Trust.

P.S. The potato croquette = delish.
author: Maggie H.

description:
The curry here is actually spicy! My boyfriend and I have been to too many places where their "spicy" food were not spicy. So we were very pleased with the curry here. 

My boyfriend can really handle spicy food and always complains if something is not spicy enough. So he ordered the Volcano level and was very happy with it.

I ordered the chicken katsu at the spicy level. It was little bit too spicy for me, which came as a surprise because I have been here once long long time ago, and I don't remember it being that spicy. But I still liked it. And the chicken katsu was crispy and cooked perfectly.

Love this place! my new favorite place to go to, especially when I am broke.
author: Alicia W.

description: Had the mild veggie curry noodles. At first, I felt the noodles were bland but I realize the trick was... To eat the noodles and then drink a spoon full if curry soup.
author: Christina K.

description: We tried this place a few days ago.  Portions were perfect for one person or two light eaters.  Taste were ok, not salty like other curry places.  We had the chicken katsu curry, one over rice and the other over noodles.  Chicken katsu were moist and would've been crispy but we ordered ours to go.  Prices were fair for what you get.  Not a place we'll crave and go out of our way for but definitely a choice if we don't know what to eat if we're around the area.  Also, it doesn't come with any toppings unless you specify but there is a small fee for each one.
author: JE C.

description: I had the chicken katsu plate...large portion of cabbage...little rice and little chicken...reminds me of a non sweet version of Hawaiian bbq...tge curry Volcano and double Volcano arent that spicy...they are thick enough yet a light film of oils remains ince its poured out of the bowl...its okay..dont think its worth $10 yet its SF thats standard..The udon bowl I did not try yet it was big and a lot of muahrooms .n,potatoes..
author: Mar L.

description:
Service is a bit slow, but it's mostly because people don't know what to order when hey walk up to the counter so they stand around while the poor girl behind the register patiently waits and asks questions. The menu is fairly simple so I don't know why people ask about every item on the menu.

I had the chicken katsu curry over noodles with a potato croquette. I was surprised by the amount of food on my plate. I had a massive slice of chicken perfectly fried over noodles. The potato croquette was also fried perfectly, but nice and soft on the inside. The large chunks of veggies was a nice addition as well. I had asked for Volcano level curry . . . I was told it had ghost peppers in it. I don't know what ghost peppers are, but the hotter the better. The meal was very filling and delicious. I didn't want to eat my whole plate, but I couldn't stop.
author: Adelina W.

description: If you like katsu, this the place!! The curry is ok, but the katsu totally makes this place awesome! Chicken kaarage is also really good!
author: Ric C.

description:
After frequenting the curry house about once a week for the last several months, I'd rather swallow my tongue than head back to Volcano Curry again.  

Two weeks ago -- I waited in line for 10 minutes (for 3 parties to order) while my take away order sat chilling away on the counter.  This week, my takeaway order was completely wrong and when I called back to alert them that one katsu was missing -- all I got was a breakdown about how I was wrong about what I ordered.  I rolled back 5 blocks to replace my order, and I come back with a slightly disgusting partially cooked piece of meat that I ended up chucking it straight away -- fairly confident that it was not the trustworthy replacement.  Cold, flavorless curry on cold rice -- I'm now going to the crappy pizza place around the crappy corner to find a second replacement dinner.

What is it about customer service?  It's important -- and I'm beginning to think that some restaurants don't even care about their customers.  And so this former customer shall spend the cash elsewhere.
author: James D.

description:
Simple decor
Simple menu
Good consistency to food quality..

If I had one word to describe this spot it would be "different." If I had another I would say, "spicy." If I could use another it would be "currylicious"

I recommend the chicken katsu.
author: June C.

description:
called ahead because i have an allergy to MSG. the woman on the phone said:

"we don't use MSG, but some of our products may contain MSG."

????

so basically, not only does your curry contain MSG (yuck), but you are using pre-packaged products? no thanks.
author: Molly E.

description:
So I came back after making the mistake of ordering a Volcano plate instead of curry, and ordered the curry beef. Here are my thoughts:

- The curry itself had the consistency of bottled turkey gravy. I would have liked it thicker, with a more robust flavor.
- The chunks of beef were surprisingly large and tender. A definite plus.
- The temperature was not consistent (this is a big pet peeve of mine). The beef was lukewarm, the curry was a little warmer, and the vegetables were piping hot. 
- I ordered medium spicy; this was perfect. It was hot enough to leave a tingle on my lips and to break a tiny sweat, but it wasn't overpowering.
- The portions were just right. Filling, but not to the point where you're busting at the seams.

On the scale of canned food to culinary delight, I think volcano teeters towards glorified fast food. It's super quick, very filling, and clocks in at just under eight bucks. You won't impress anybody by bringing them to Volcano, but you will certainly fill them up.
author: Tony L.

description: I was expecting more of a kick with their spice levels. It's a little pricey for curry here but it was still good.
author: Victoria L.

description: Came here with my family during lunch time when we happened to pay a visit to SF and wanted a quick Japanese meal. My cousins have been here before and they love this place. I ordered the beef curry plate and the curry was good, but I wasn't too much a fan of the meat. The texture of the meat in particular was cut up in cubes and I rather like my beef thinly sliced. They give options on white rice or brown rice (if you go with the brown rice there's an additional charge). Overall, this place gets the job done! I think I might come back to try the other dishes next time.
author: J L.

description:
Japanese Curry. Yum Yum Yum!

Ordered the Pork Katsu ($7.25) with a Calpico drink. For an extra cost, you have the option to add toppings but I waived that so I could try their basic dish. You also get to choose how "hot" your curry is: regular, spicy or volcano! Seeing that we were at Volcano, I had to get the spiciest one. Plus I have a thing for spicy foods.

The tonkatsu (Pork Katsu) was breaded and cooked right, passing my taste-buds' test. The curry was good but nothing amazing. You will definitely feel the burn and get full because the dish serving size is more than adequate.

While the restaurant has a more fast-food kind of feel (no one waits on, you order and pay at the register, food comes out on trays) the employees do provide great customer service and "check up" on you.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Twas a cold and rainy summer day in SF...  tired of umbrella fighting old ladies on the busy side walk I decided to rest my bones and put something hearty in my belly.   I looked up and it read in smoldering letters: VOLCANO!,  just the place for me.

The girl at the register was super friendly as she helped me through the menu.  The pork katsu was succulent and saucy, couple veggies and potatoes, rice and also ordered fried tofu which was delicious and added good variety for only a dollar something.  Hearing that they used white ghost peppers in their sauce scared me so I went with the level 3 instead of 4, which had some respectable heat (but I'll probably go level 4 "VOLCANO status" in next time around.)

Cool "volcano man, almost Hawaiian-ish" art motif with lots of SF inspired works up, really brings the place together.  Great service!  Girl was a sweetie and served me my dish and even came around later to check and see how I liked it.  

Must say, this hit the spot and put some fire in my belly!

Also have curry udon.. and also are on ScoutMob!!!   Check it out.
author: Jason L.

description:
Love it, for a couple of reasons.  Reason 1.) The food is delicious and leaves nothing to be desired. 2.) Simplicity. What do you want, how spicy do you want it? Pay sit enjoy. 

Highly recommended for a late lunch or a pre-bar padding and I'm confident the beef curry noodle soup can do wonders for a hangover. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Jesse T.

description:
Inexpensive.
good size portions.
fast and friendly service.
delicious spicy goodness.

What is there not to like about Volcano?
author: Patrick B.

description: Not exactly the friendliest staff, but the spinach chicken curry I tried was good. The food is decent, and an affordable price. It's a good place to stop in to get a Japanese curry craving fix.
author: Jeffrey Q.

description:
Volcano Curry is a restaurant that you walk away from realizing that you could have made the same food at home, at a much lower price.

The pork katsu curry featured katsu that was well-breaded but minimally seasoned, a couple pieces of steamed veggies, a respectable portion of rice, and curry that could easily have come from cubes in a box at a grocery store down on Clement.

A superstar in this otherwise ordinary restaurant is the potato croquette - its crispy exterior and soft, fulfilling innards helped it shine in its inevitable comparison to McDonald's breakfast hash brown.  

If anything, I will come back for a couple of potato croquettes!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Get the spiciest curry here!

Came here with a coworker on a weekday afternoon and it was a bit challenging to find parking, as it always is around noon on Geary, and we walked inside. I immediately sat down and noticed we were the only ones in here. Kinda strange. My coworker then reluctantly walks in behind me, sat down, then leans over and whispers to me that usually when he notices a restaurant being this empty, he ends up walking right out. There were some flies hovering in the center of the restaurant which was unappetizing. I figured since we're already seated, let's not be rude, right?

Boy, was he wrong about this place. He ordered the extra spicy chicken katsu curry and I ordered the spice level below that one. Mine was delicious! The chicken was pretty tender and moist and went very well with the sauce and rice. I couldn't stop eating it. Then I tried my coworker's curry and it was BOMB! His extra spicy curry was so much more addicting and tastier than mine. I almost wanted to offer to trade him but knowing how much he loves spicy and flavorful things, he wouldn't want mine. We ended up murdering the entire plate. The portion was very generous too, like food coma portions. Oh yes, they do take credit cards.

Never tried anything else on the menu but if I do come back I might try their sandwiches. Never had a curry sandwich before but I know for sure that their yummy curry is enough for me to come back to visit again.
author: Elaine L.

description:
I have to give credit for to this place for trying. They have a suggestions box, and seem to be moving in the right direction. That being said, they are just a 3 STAR place to grab a bite to eat.

Likes: Cashier is nice and friendly. Paintings on the wall are pretty cool. 
Portions are good.

Improvements: Food is just okay...nothing wrong with it, but definitely nothing to RAVE about. Maybe hire a new chef?
author: Nick C.

description:
Yum.

The Katsu seems to be a favorite here, but due to my avoidance of fried foods, I instead opted for the spicy version of the chicken curry.  I really liked the kick level - good enough to feel it but not overwhelming.  Meat was solid and was mixed with a nice bonus of zucchini and mini potatoes.  The green tea they have is from a can and unsweetened, so be forewarned if that's not your thing.  

As mentioned, the place feels very sterile and like you're eating at Ikea.  Didn't bother me since it was clean, but a little decorations woulda been nice.  Overall, it's a great addition to the neighborhood and a nice lunch option.
author: John H.

description: Just a typical Japanese curry house. Maybe nothing special. Kinda working man lunch place I think. I don't think anyone hangs out in here. Just eat and go back to work. I kinda notice a few flies. It's just near the front door. They buzz around u as u walk in maybe u don't notice but it's kinda always there when u go in.
author: Satoshi K.

description:
I never had authentic Japanese Curry until I found them near the local collectibles shop.

I at first tried their non-curry stuff since I was curious about it. Then I started eating a lot of their plated curry items at all spice levels. They have a total of 5 different levels of spiciness. 4 of them are listed with their ultra spice unlisted.

They have a variety of toppings and thing to put on your curry. But if you do it'll cost you a little bit at a time to make sure you don't take things for granted.

All the free ice water you could drink and has the option to take your stuff on the go.

Their service is top of the line for a little place on the western side of town.

I would go there for as long as I had 15 dollars to pay with for a good meal at a reasonable price.

They also have a restroom. It don't stink too much for anyone who want to use it to take a dump in there.
author: Jacen W.

description:
YUM!!! This is one of my favorite curry places to eat. HUGE portions, lots of options for sauce (spicy levels), meat, and veggies, and really tasty curry.

KATSU SANDWICH is my favorite thing to order. 

Make sure you get a frequent buyer card, because I know I will constantly come back here for my curry fix!
author: Gina R.

description:
It has gotten a lot better. They just need to do a few more things and this restaurant can be a solid 4 to 5 star restaurant. 

Thicken up the curry 
The portion is perfect for me but I can see how others might see this plate as being half full/half empty kinda deal. Fill the box up with rice and put another chicken katsu and charge a little bit more, like Murraci's. I think this curry sauce is better than or as good as any other Curry houses that are out there, including tani's kitchen and Muracci's. 

The batter on the chicken was perfect. Not too thick, crispy and light. Good brownish color to it. I enjoyed it a lot. 

Vegetables are finally hot.............woot woot 

The different level of spices are perfect. I am still adamant about this and I honestly think you guys can do it.. Do a curry challenge, or a spicy curry challenge and this will be the place to be.
author: jason g.

description:
Ridiculously cheap for the quality and amount of food you get. It's my favorite place to eat in the city. My girlfriend can attest to that. 

Katsu curry is phenomenal. Love, love, love this place!
author: Malkov D.

description: I come here way too much. Veggie katsu curry or chicken katsu curry, with one of those little potato (or onion) croquette slices of heaven. **mouth watering**
author: Amelia W.

description:
This place is strictly for curry, Japanese style curry that is.  They have other things on the menu, but not really, if that makes sense.  It's definitely not a Japanese restaurant.

Volcano has really good curry.  I generally don't like to eat curry, unless it's at Iroha Restaurant in Japantown.  Iroha has the best Japanese curry in my opinion.  My friend wanted to try this place, so I came here reluctantly, but this place actually has really good curry.  The texture is just right, not too thick, not too thin.  Color is a nice dark brown, just like it should be.  Taste is on point.  There are 4 different levels of spicy you can choose from (mild, medium, spicy, & volcano).  I chose medium, which was perfect for me.  It had a nice kick without overpowering the flavor of the curry.  Another plus are the vegetables in the curry.  Usually when I have Japanese curry it only has carrots and potatoes.  Volcano puts zucchini, eggplant, potatoes, and carrots, which is a nice touch.  The tonkatsu(fried pork cutlet) is amazing too; it's almost as good as my mom makes it. 

Recommendation:  order the Fukujinzuke as a topping. it comes with all of the curry orders, but if you order as a topping you get a lot more.  It adds a nice crunch and it's refreshing to the spice of the curry.

Minus 1 star because I thought this was more of a sit down restaurant, but really it's more like a cafe, where you order first and pick a seat.  I would have liked to sit down, look at a menu, and have a waitress take my order.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Curry was okay.  The thing I did not like was that the meat was not cooked in the curry.  They just cook the meat by itself with virtually no spices and then pour the curry on top.  The chicken I had was really dry.

Portions are big.  

I don't think I'll go back.
author: Melissa W.

description:
I'm pretty picky with Japanese curry because I really like the way my mom and I make curry. So when I got to curry restaurants they generally have to offer something truly different from what I do at home to really catch my attention.

This place is pretty darn good. I like that their curry is a bit thinner but still very flavorful. Their tonkatsu is well made and there are no gaps of air in the breading that you find at a lot of places that make their katsu poorly. They add zucchini to the curry and that was a nice twist.

Still, I wasn't blown away by the quality compared to stuff I've eaten at home or friends' places. I ordered a fried boiled egg to top it off and the breading on that was very tough and chewy. Also, it would be nice to see them do some creative stuff with their rice (pilaf, garlic, etc).

But the curry is authentic, has a kick (if you order volcano) and the tonkatsu is good. But I definitely prefer staying home and eating my own.

Cheers!
author: Andrew B.

description:
Very, very good. Having lived in Hawaii where Japanese curry is a staple and is offered at almost every plate lunch place, I was a bit wary of trying a Japanese curry restaurant in San Francisco. But I did. And it was tasty, filling, and a great value. 

I ordered the chicken katsu curry with two toppings: fried tofu and eggplant. Wow! I was pleasantly surprised that the although deep fried, the katsu wasn't greasy, and the chicken was of good quality. I think I can safely venture to say that it appears that Volcano changes the frying oil regularly, unlike say, Coco Ichiban. The curry was a bit thinner than I am used to ... not sure if it is the style or because it is simply watered down. The flavor was ok ... I was hoping that it'd be savory and a tad bit more sweet. When preparing curry, many Japanese people add chocolate bar pieces (I'm not kidding) to the sauce to make it slightly sweet and to add a slightly more complex and richer flavor. I was tempted to ask for some chocolate to add to the sauce. 

I ordered hot but requested a side of the Volcano sauce, which is added into the base curry if ordered. The hot wasn't spicy to me, so I poured in the side of Volcano sauce. Wow! The heat takes a few moments to settle in then it's like mad fire. 

I also ordered a regular chicken katsu plate (no curry) that came with salad, rice, and miso soup. I really enjoyed the salad because it was refreshing and wasn't comprised of iceberg lettuce like most Japanese restaurants tend to serve. The miso soup was good and had wakame (seaweed) and green onions. It was good but lacked some of the complex flavors that miso soup can offer. I appreciated that the chicken katsu had only a slight drizzle of katsu sauce. I grabbed a bottle of the katsu sauce ... Volcano's version seems watered down and lacked the zing that most katsu sauces have.

The portion sizes are large and the food is hearty and good, especially for the price.
author: Melissa K.

description:
After coming here enough times to fill two cards and get two free meals, I figured it was time to write a review.  

So today, I came here with my mom and brother.  My brother loves his food spicy and my mom likes curry that isn't so spicy.  I'm a medium-type of girl.  Volcano did not disappoint today.  My mom and brother were so happy they took an extra order "to-go".  

Other than the cashier giving me my brother's volcano dish at first, (it took my mouth a few minutes and a lot of water to recuperate) we were thoroughly satisfied.  Thanks!  I'll be seeing you next time!
author: Rachelle G.

description:
I crave for the curry here. Like, a lot.

Original with tofu nuggets, soooo good.
author: Ringo M.

description:
still like the curry here. it's a little watery but it has nice flavor and the spicy version is quite spicy. there is a level above spicy called volcano but i have yet to attempt that version.  the spicy level is just right for my palate. i can imagine that only Thai palates can handle the volcano version.
call ahead and you're in business!
author: Jeff W.

description:
Reminds me of college. P-I-C says I'm showing my age by saying this... Eh ::shrugs::

It's good for a quick bite and don't really feel like thinking (even though you do have to decide your level of hotness and curry meal). Menu's easy to decipher, not rocket science, luckily.

It's quick and simple. And it's good for what it is. Now this is Japanese curry, not Indian and there's no sushi rolls folks!

P-I-C and I had the pork katsu and there's a good helping of katsu although I do wish my plate was drenched in curry. And if anything wish the katsu was a bit more moist but overall good.

I got mine's mild and that was good enough for me since I'm not in my early 20s no more but was still good enough to have me sipping a good few times on my Sprite but not where I would have bought a second one.

College kids on a budget, wish to be reminded of college life or simply just lazy and don't wanna think what to eat then I recommend Volcano.
author: Holden L.

description:
I tried this place for the first time yesterday and it was quite satisfying! For a cheap price, you get a very good amount of food and delicious food at that. It's a perfect place for people looking for some comfort food at a simple, relaxed place.

I got the chicken katsu curry with a potato croquette on the side. Both the katsu and croquette were cooked to crispy perfection! The curry was flavorful though it would be better if it was a little creamier. Also, I ordered the spiciness level to be 'hot' yet it seemed pretty mild to me. Though it's understandable since they usually don't come very spicy anyway. And there's the 'Volcano' level so perhaps for people looking for a spicier Japanese curry here should try that instead.
author: Lei I.

description: Am I the only one who feels like they got hit by a freight train after eating here? It's delicious but very heavy.
author: Nicole D.

description:
So after passing this place by soo many times and reading my Yelp buddies reviews, I thought it was high time I gave my curry taste buds some Japanese curry lovin'. 

So I came to this place after seeing my dentist. Yeah, hungry like crazy because the appointment was at 11. So I walk from the office to Geary and start browsing the shops for noshing stuff. I pass a couple of place by before I smelled curry. Fragrant curry. Japanese curry.

I followed my nose to Volcano, a small-ish place with some chairs and tables and an ordering counter. The menu is as simple as can be. If you can't order from their menu, then you should be shot in the head for your stupidity. I ordered the shrimp curry with a couple of croquettes. She asked me what level did I want. I asked how hot the Volcano was and she said very hot. So me being a smart one ordered the hot level. Waiting...Waiting...Waiting...Your food is ready! Sweet! Take the bag and I walk out.


Get home and start to look in the bag. The curry is in a separate container. Awesomeness! A lot of place don't do that. I smelled the curry. Nice and fragrant like more Japanese curries. The taste? Meh...Like there should have been a waa waa trumpet sound bite for the disappointment I felt when I tasted the curry. Hot? Maybe in temperature! Really? This is not enough to burn anyone's tongue off! Thus is the case with most spicy foods. They say it's hot or really hot and it turns out to be a limp dick that can't perform. And next time, I am not ordering the shrimp again. I got 2, count em, 2 whole shrimp! Granted that was how many in the picture but still! 2??? I'm pretty sure these aren't Louisiana gulf shrimp so why so skimpy? 


Anyways, I will be back one more time. This time, I am going for the Volcano level, the namesake of the shop. If their Volcano level wimps out like the hot level, there will be hell to pay!!!


To be continued...
author: Anthony L.

description:
As you might expect there is basically one food here - japanese style curry. Tastes great.  Does not cost much. Comes quick.  Eat and enjoy. There are plenty of optional meat / vegetable things ($), too.  Rice with everything of course.  I liked the grilled eggplant, but the chicken katsu looked good.

Excellent lunch or simple dinner.
 
Remember, while humans have been walking upright for some 50K years, Japanese style curry is only about 150 years old, so count yourself lucky to have been born an eater in bountiful times.
author: Kevin R.

description:
A friend took me here and it's the first time I tried Japanese curry. I'm not a big fan of Indian curry so, people if you think it's the same as Indian..heck no. It is so much better! I ordered the chicken curry and it was delicious. Their portions are huge so if you're trying not to eat too much at once, it's good for two meals. 
They asked how spicy I wanted it, either mild-medium-hot-volcano. I went for medium just in case if it was way too much and I can't really handle spicy. But the sauce had a nice kick to it and the chicken was cooked to perfection. 
I will definitely come back here and try the pork and shrimp curry. Thanks to my friend Mike I now like Japanese curry.

OH and it is great hangover food, it coats your stomach well. :)
author: Lana K.

description:
Once again I returned to Volcano on the 30th. As usual I got the Chicken Katsu Curry, along with the sausage topping. As this is an update, I will not be reiterating the restaurant as a whole but rather focus on the food itself. 

The price was $8 but was definitely worth it as it was definitely filling and the perfect amount. The food as usually came with 4-5 chicken katsu pieces as well as 5 cut up sausages, two bowls of rice and a simple selection of boiled carrots and potato. 

In short, this past experience was definitely pleasing and I will return, only bound because of my free topping card haha! I hope you guys get a chance to try it out. Hope you enjoy it as much as I did.

NOTE: If you do eat at Volcano, be sure to pick up a stamp card. For every 3rd visit, you receive a free topping and may I suggest that you get the sausage. For every 12th visit you receive a free curry & topping.

Enjoy

Cleanliness: 9/10

Portion: 9/10

Quality: 8/10

Hospitality: 10/10:
author: Kyle C.

description: i drool every time i step into this place.
author: Benson M.

description: Not an expert in curry and I am not good at spicy food.  The flavor of the curry was sweet as jap curry suppose to be, the pork katsu was quite crispy and good amount of rice.  It was not much potatoe and carry on the sauce.  Place look like fast food of curry, yet it has good quality.  Just reserving star for better ones.
author: Z G.

description:
obscenely tasty.  Who doesn't like sauce over rice... especially yummilicious curry sauce with vegetables poured over a fried but super tender chicken katsu.   hmmm....     I love all the extra toppings you can add - for the katsu, definitely cheese and fried tofu.     tried the sausage, which I think was a little salty.

My toddler likes the pork/chicken noodle... its a pretty tasty broth and he loves noodles.  

mom likes noodles too... especially the beef curry noodle... broth is so thick and full flavored.   love it.   

I also like their garden salads... the dressing is delicious and the spinach half w/ mayonaise... not usually a fan of mayo, but somehow it works well.  

affordable, always find seating... and tasty food.   

will plan on returning to try the fried calamari and fried oyster.
author: Regi K.

description:
Well worth the drive all the way across town.

I will start my review by saying I haven't been to Muracci's so I can't compare, but in terms of the Japanese curry that I've had, this place was great.

I ordered the chicken katsu curry, my husband ordered the tonkatsu curry.  You can get mild, medium, hot and fire.  We both got medium.  They have ad-ons which is great, but not necessary.  Our plates came out with crispy katsu and veggies (loved the carrots) with a ton of perfectly spicy curry sauce and a sprinkle of tsunemono (the red one I love - don't ask me the name of it.)

I spent the next few days telling everyone about it.  I can't wait to try the croquette ad-on. *YUM MY MOUTH IS WATERING THINKING ABOUT IT!*
author: Christine O.

description:
This place is definitely a good bang for the buck.  A decent meal for under 7 dollars.   I've had better Japanese curries and many horrible curries houses.  I recall the curry spots in Japan being darker and a bit more thicker.  Still pretty good. This is why I am giving it a 4 rating.

I enjoy the mild curry chicken katsu. Not a fan of standard chicken or beef; a litte sparce and dry in the meat department. The best part about this place is the close proximity to my work. 

Don't forget to ask for the frequent flyer card for free toppings and free meal on your 12th visit!
author: Herbert G.

description: Awesome curry rice & curry noodles. Best in town,  will definitely go back.
author: Cheri W.

description:
Wow! If you are weak sauce, like me, and can't take a little burn then you can only eat the Level 1: MILD curry. I tried the Medium level and that was already HOT HOT to me, so for anyone who dares try the VOLCANO level let me know if your tastebuds are still alive. 

Aside from curry you can get rice/noodle/bread plates and sandwiches. I loved the curry and can't wait to go back to try more toppings and sandwiches. They even had a mini spam katsu sandwich on the menu! They also have croquettes, calamari, shrimp, and fish. Their curry sauce is thinner than I'm used to but it was easy enough to sop up with the rice. I highly recommend the tofu nuggets and extra pickles as they taste great with or without curry rice. 

Finding parking kind of sucks but for the most part it isn't too much trouble getting inside the door. It is a bit small though so take out is recommended. Plus, if you do take out you can keep that pitcher of water on hand more easily. That spicy curry will totally heat you up from the inside out!
author: Kat W.

description: It's a mix of Japanese, Indian and I think Chinese. Ordered the pork katsu with curry. To my surprise it was rather tasty! It wasn't anything too special, but for under $10, and the decent amount you get it was pretty good! I'll probably be back here again sometime.
author: Serge C.

description: Best curry ever, if your looking for Japanese curry then u have to come to this place! And good customer service!
author: Mabel M.

description:
walked in to see all the tables full and a line at the counter.

this place seems like the spot to get takeout. during my visit there was a constant stream of people in line ordering to-go.

food was okay, nothing to write home about.
author: Ameer N.

description:
I had dinner here on a weekday.  I ordered the beef curry.

The food was good, especially for the price.  It wasn't too fatty.  Medium spicy was as expected.  I didn't get any toppings so I think that made the dish seem a bit plain.  But it was a very good value and I'll go back.
author: Dan C.

description:
I passed by this place so many times and never noticed it. When my girlfriend picked it to eat I was pissed that she didn't want to go to Gordo's next door. When I got my Chicken Katsu sandwich, mini-salmon sandwich, and eggplant side I never wanted to eat Gordo's again.

The girls working here are great. Tip them well and use the Volcano card to get a free curry of your choice plus a bunch of free toppings along the way.
author: Phil S.

description: I was surprised how yummy it was. I like that the curry has veges in it. They give alot. I got pork katsu and added a piece of fried shrimp! Yum!
author: Karen H.

description: This curry is awesome and the add ons are all delicious. I have fallen for the classic with tofu nuggets - really, it's the best Japanese curry I've ever had.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I've never been to Japan but I'd imagine there are fast food places like this all over. You order at the counter and then they bring the food out to you shortly after.

The girl at the counter was friendly, I asked her what she liked and she gave me a few different suggestions. I ordered the chicken katsu curry dish with no toppings, you can get a boiled egg, veggies, many other choices for an extra $1 each. I only tried the medium level, the person who recommended this place said to work up to "Volcano" hot.

Good portion, tasty food, pretty much a gut busting lunch I probably could have taken some home. Next time, hotter and probably with a few toppings just for fun.
author: Richie C.

description:
I am a curry critic. I grew up with Japanese curry, so I am overly critical. (Please keep this in mind while reading my review)

I prefer curry to be thick and have lots of vegetables, like stew. This place is  not. Curry is soupy. I think the catch is their toppings. The chicken kastu is really good, and filling. Probably their best item. 

Overall, the taste and prices are there! I just like my curry thick.
author: emily f.

description:
This place has high quality and consistent food every single time. I love ordering food from here with my wife. We always try to find a night when we happen to be in the area and have a craving for Japanese style curry. It satisfies like none other!

Why the four stars? I have the perception that this place isn't so clean and it's hard to find seating. The last two times I was here, I had to wait a bit and people don't really clean up after themselves. I guess this isn't the restaurant's fault, but it still makes the experience a bit unpleasant.
author: Jj H.

description:
First, I want to start out by saying it's a wonderful fun little place that is well thought out and executes a well focused and delicious selection:

1) Pork Katsu was crispy and still tender inside,
2) The vegetables were spot on (delicious zucchini exploding with flavor!).
3) Curry flavor was wonderful and reminiscent of the British curry I ate as a child (see here for background: http://blogs.sfweekly.com/foodie/2010/09/beef_curry_muraccis_volcano_japanese.php) 

A few technical suggestions for the owners, if they happen to be the type that reads Yelp reviews:

1) Eggplant could use a little work texturally. It was soggy and bland. A little focus on mimicking the result that you get at a good Thai food place would go a long way to bringing in more vegetarians.

2) Tofu selection was weak. Vegetarian style should be an option and come with a large amount of tofu included, which is an extremely cheap protein to cook and is again something that vegetarians like. My pork katsu was enormous but my date's tofu addition was only two measly pucks. 

3) Seaweed salad just wasn't very good in my opinion and could probably be easily improved.

In closing, this place is delicious with giant portions at prices that you won't ever feel bad paying. Vegetarians should be vocal about getting better options, since the curry sauce makes a satisfying, spicy gravy that goes well with any fried food and that you won't stop eating until it's gone. Go eat here soon and make it a fun way to treat yourself to a trip out to the Richmond, you will never regret it.
author: Aaron G.

description: I tried the chicken curry, and it was okay but I have had better. Employees were friendly, prices were good.
author: Joey A.

description:
Me and my secret lunch lover Ada H. Cho love hitting up that VC whenever we get the opportunity to.

There are certain things that I just absolutely hate exchanging currency for. One of them USED to be Japanese curry which my aunts would ALWAYS make for me when I spent my Summers at their place in Japan as a child. I hated it when I saw them bust open that stupid instant curry packet at home. Don't get me wrong, it was alright, but they pulled that out whenever they were too lazy to cook and after awhile eating the same thing over and over just wears you out.

However, that VC (Volcano Curry) can have my hard earned money any day of the week! The (medium) sauce is superb, them carrots and them potatoes, supah tendaaaah!!! I always get that PORK KATSU ever since my homegirl Ada recommended that to me. It is off the hoook! Oh, and that potato croquette, WHAT YOU KNOW 'BOUT THAT POTATO CROQUETTE?!?! It's like an 11/10 in my books, when it's fresh that is. I'll admit, I've had a couple that haven't been as hot and crispy as I'd like it to be, but as a former employee in the world of food service I tend not to get mad (or anything negative at all for that matter) at little things like that. Never had that potato croquette? TRY IT. NAO!!!

Man, writing this review at 1am in the morning is making me hungry. o0o Time to hit up my lunch lover once again :)
author: Ron T.

description: Food is really good, price is not.  $10 for veggie curry with three pieces each of carrot, potatoe, zuchini, and if you can find the small pieces of eggplant they are there too.  Maybe add some more veggies.
author: DJ L.

description: This a great neighborhood curry place, we usually get it to go since we live in the neighborhood. The curry is tasty and hits the spot. I wished we had more Japanese/fast food type places in the neighborhood. Would love to see something like a Zippys open here!
author: Tkpasq P.

description:
I was skeptical at first, but Volcano was a hit. 

I wasn't expecting a cafeteria style eatery with a walk up to the counter and menu on the wall. At first glance, everything looked deep fried. But since we had been eying this place for awhile, we decided to order. 

I had the tomato chicken curry medium. If you don't add any sides, you just get rice, curry and chicken. I recommend ordering a few sides to spice things up.  The curry was delicious! Very flavorful and I used the sauce to coat the rest of my rice.  My hubby got it volcano style - extra spicy. It was very spicy for me.
