I also ordered a side salad which was $2.50. It was the most interesting salad ever. A few spinach leafs, some corn, and some cabbage all separated on the plate with dressing sprinkled on the top. Not bad for $2.50...
author: Natalie S.

description:
3.75
cheap and decent standard curry. They offer a buy and sit down place for curry that ranges from $6-8 per plate. The portions are about average and the medium flavor was just right for me. They have tomato chicken and pork, katsu chicken and pork, or regular, beef, chicken, pork. They also have side dishes and add ons for extra. Today on scoutmob there was a 50% coupon which made the curry even more satisfying. Id recommend this place as a cheap place to get a decent curry.
author: Robert Y.

description: This place is amazing! Great prices too btw! The katsu chicken with curry is the best in San Francisco! Absolutely amazing! Plus, adding a hardboiled egg to anything you'd like blew my mind- imagine that! I wish the place was closer to the city, or that they delivered- It's a bit out of the way in Richmond. Well worth the drive though...
author: Sheryl P.

description:
i had been on the search for a curry house since i moved out here. my search finally came to an end when they opened up VOLCANO. Instantly I knew this place was gonna crack. 

The curry is authentic Japanese style. Chicken Katsu is what I normally get with the #2 MEDIUM heat. Ive tried #3 and found it too hot for my liking. I can't imagine even enjoying #4 Volcano hotness. 

The service is great, establishment is clean, and the prices are just right.

I must also mention the card stamp promo they run. get 10 punches on your card and you get a free curry meal. im a sucker for that promotional trick. it gets me every time.
author: Marcus S.

description: This place was a great surprise. Wonderfully favorful curry and veggie dishes. The Chicken katsu was great as was the veggie katsu. The kids enjoyed Chicken teriyaki and the noodle soups. We would recommend this place to all adventurous families.
author: Franz P.

description:
I can't wait to go back here again :) I'm not even really a curry person but I can't stop thinking about this place. Love their selection for more stuff to add on yo plate like sausaaaaage.

So far it has always been a pleasant visit for me!
author: C. C.

description:
I LOVE Japanese Curry. I like this place, not too much in love. But I can see myself coming back in the future, so it's a good sign. 

I've heard good things about this place, and finally got a chance to visit. Upon entering, I was a bit surprised by the almost 'fast-food' concept. 
Come here for curry and strictly for curry only because that's pretty much the only thing they offered. 

It's good, not spectacular. But it's good curry and very reasonable price. Good portion, enough to make me happy. They also have this frequent card that allows you to get free toppings. 

I tried the HOT curry and it wasn't hot for me. Next time, I'll try the VOLCANO spiciness and hope it gets better.
author: Marlis T.

description:
Sometimes when something works really well, you don't notice it, but I am taking the time to send some stars in their direction, as I realize they deserve them.  
I have always associated curry with India and Thailand and I had never tried Japanese style curry until I found Volcano.  They have a numbering system here, with one being mild and four being "Volcano" hot.   I always pick four, but one day I may try doubling that (for the sake of cleaning out my sinuses).   My favorite is definitely the chicken curry with tomato, and a topping of zucchini (sauteed, not fried).   And on your twelfth visit, your dinner is free!  How many restaurants offer that deal?   Just ask them for the little card that they will stamp each time you dine there.
author: Philip R.

description:
Volcano is a cute little restaurant that's filled with some good food and service! 

I can tell that the people there work hard to please their customers.  Why? The waitress was very helpful and friendly.  She was really good at a multitasking while holding a sincere smile.  They chefs are very quick and efficient. :D

Try the Chicken Katsu Curry.  
-You can pick the level of spiciness. I love spicy food, but I chickened out on trying the "VOLCANO."  I do challenge you to try it. Haha. :D
-Rice cooked perfectly.
-Curry is filled with so much flavor with steamed vegetables! Yummy!
-Portions are very generous! You can eat some now and save the other 1/2 for later.   

To top it off, gulp down some ice cold water & you're HAPPY! :D 

Curry makes my stomach smile.
author: Deborah C.

description:
I was hesitant to try it out - despite the fact that it is right down the street.  Then I got curious.  Then my curiosity peaked and I ventured in.

The place is very clean, the staff polite and friendly.  The price - fantastic.

The food.  I keep getting the same thing.  I LOVE the curry chicken noodle soup!  It had grilled chicken.  The noodles are very filling.  The broth flavorful and hot.  Al in all this is a terrific neighborhood to go place (or eat in) and one that I will continue to patronize for as long as I can.
author: Bill G.

description: Love this place!  Prices are reasonable and you get a ton of food!  My favorite is the Shrimp and Calamari plate.  I do wish that they delivered, parking is tough when I just need to grab some take out.
author: Nichole P.

description: Love Japanese curry and this is in my top 3.  Maybe not the ultimate best but very tasty with generous portions and a good price.
author: Ric S.

description:
Okay, so all my reviews have been 5 star ratings recently, but I can't help it! I love Yelping my favorite restaurants! Especially when I see that their overall rating is lower than what I would give them ... Gotta give them a little boost!

Volcano is my favorite "fast food" restaurant. Considering I don't eat fast food and Volcano is super convenient for me (being close to my house and all) ... it's definitely a favorite. One of my favorite foods is curry and I randomly crave it, so hey, Volcano is perfect for me. I always get their Chicken Curry plate, which comes with your choice of rice, veggies, a meat and the Japanese curry! & MILD because I can't stand super spicy, but they do have that option! 

They're quick, reasonable, convenient, they open pretty late ... and just great! I mean if you're looking for something fast but not a fan of fast food like me, Volcano is perfect. You can totally take it to go and get the same amount of food as if you ate it there! I hate it when you takeout sometimes and they give you less than if you actually dined in ... so dumb.

Yay, just went here 2 days ago and I'm so down to go again! 

PS. My boyfriend doesn't really like the beef though. He says it's "dry". I've never tried it, but just saying.
author: Chrisy Y.

description: If you like Japanese curry, you'll love this place. The price is great especially since you don't have to pay tips since you pay before you get your food. The food is delicious, the curry is sweet and tasteful. The tomatoes in the tomato chicken curry made the curry a bit sour so be mindful of that. The chicken katsu curry blew me away, it is definitely my go-to choice. The beef curry was good but meat wasn't the greatest. If you want things spicy, get the hot or volcano level spiciness. The mild isn't spicy at all and the medium has a small kick to it. Great restaurant but can be problematic for larger parties at busy hours.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I'm a new fan of Japanese curry (sad to say, I used to think all curry was the same after being traumatized by Indian curry) and potato croquettes and this place had both! 

My bf said that this place was ohhhkay but I still wanted to try it. I ordered the beef curry mild spicyness with a potato croquette, and he ordered a chicken curry volcano spicyness. I must say the volcano spicyness was VERY hot. My tongue was burning after five seconds. 

Other than that, I became a fan after trying the curry and croquette. My bf handled the volcano spicyness and said it was really good too! I'll be sure to come back here for more curry goodness and to try the sandwiches too.
author: Samantha K.

description:
I have been here many times and recently just went with my mom. 

I always get the Chicken Katsu curry plate with Volcano spice!!
It's weird I notice the spice is not always the same... some days its spicier then others. (Doesn't really matter to me, as long as it's super spicy with flavors)

I got my mom fried shrimps & calamari plate which consist of 2 shrimps, 5 calamari, rice, soup and salad (no curry). Although she thinks my curry can be spicier (Talking to a woman who just eat those little Thai pepper without anything!)

I added some toppings: Tofu Nuggets, Potato Croquette and Sausages.

Service - they only serve you food if you dine in. The rest is self service. Get your own spoons & forks, water and clean up after yourself.

Overall, everything was decently priced. The food was ok. The volcano curry is GOOD as usual. For those who like spicy curry, I recommend this place. 

FYI - Frequent Diner Card - I found out they no longer combine cards.
author: Nokie N.

description: I had a quick meal here with my girlfriend the other day...it was surprisingly good. We came here on a whim- we're not really crazy curry people. The girl at the counter (Sophie or Stacie I think?) was really helpful and just generally helpful. The food came fast and was great. It's on boring Geary, but I'll definitely be back!
author: Sean F.

description:
Japanese curry places tend to be pretty similar.  They serve curry.  The curry usually has rice with it.  There is usually the red pickle stuff.  If you're smart, you get TonKatsu in the curry.  It will often be tasty.  

Volcano doesn't deviate from this formula.  You get curry (a bit watery, but not to to the point where I hate it), with potatoes and carrots and zucchini, which I traded to my grandmother for some of her meat (what happened to your grandparents trying to feed you veggies?!?!), and delicious Tonkatsu, which walked the perfect border between being not too dry, and not too greasy.  And all that for just $7.  

But then, compared to Muraccis, this place has slightly worse curry, slightly worse katsu, worse pickles, but cheaper prices.  Solid 3 stars.
author: Leon K.

description:
Updating on one thing: the highest level of heat possible on curry, the Volcano. I got the Pork Katsu, which I think is one of the best curry combinations, and decided to add eggplant as one of my toppings. 

Starting with the heat, it is stupid hot! Similar to this is thai curry. It's a type of heat that lingers in your mouth and you have to take a sip of something cooling after each bite. Be warned! I could take a certain level of heat, but I guess I was almost at my limit. The Pork Katsu is still perfectly fried and the curry goes well with it. The eggplant was great! Sweet, soft and packed with eggplant flavor! 

I'm still loving Volcano curry, especially their sandwiches! If you can, give it a shot!
author: Jeremy L.

description:
Today my sister told me she was craving some kari-rice. She said she wanted to visit this curry place on Geary, so we decided to go there.
The place is a cafe-type. You go in, order your food from a menu, sit at the table and wait, and then, a few minutes later, your food is ready. 
There are four types: mild, medium, hot, and volcano.
I had a hot chicken curry. I didn't realize they had a volcano type, because otherwise I would've taken it. 
My curry had a plenty of chicken in it, and the portions were big. 
If you are a curry lover, go check this place out :)
author: ponch l.

description: The entrees here are ok but not the best I've had.  The curry dishes are the main choices so we always get the chicken or pork.  I like the fact that they have a loyalty system.  The ambiance and food is simple.  Pretty basic curry dishes with rice.
author: Jennie W.

description:
I've been here twice now, and was pleased both times. Good value. Pretty quick service. Curry is yummy. Rice is perfect. Katsu (chicken or pork) is as good as I've ever had it. 
In an ideal world I'll take more carrots, more potatoes and a little more curry sauce, but this might require larger plates. The overall experience is positive. The atmosphere is very informal, and feels like a small, friendly cafeteria.
I'll go back again soon.
author: James W.

description:
It's a huge letdown when your Chicken Katsu Curry gets served to you lukewarm.  Really, Volcano, really?? 

Putting serving curry at a disgraceful temperature aside, the food was actually good.  I was surprised at the moistness of the chicken katsu.  And the "mild" isn't too spicy.  The winner of the night (and by winner, I mean it kicked my arteries' ass) was their Spam Katsu sandwich!  SPAM KATSU people!  If only they made Spam Katsu Musubi.  Nevertheless, it was awesome.

They're stingy with the veggies (TWO potato quarters and TWO carrot pieces) and even more stingy with the radish toppings.  My friend had asked for more radish but the worker said we had to pay for it.  How much could half an ounce of radish cost?! Luckily, he didn't make us pay for the take-out boxes at the end of our meal.

Despite the eh service and cold curry, I actually think I'd go back.  The meal was cheap ($7/curry) and it was pretty darn good when I heated my leftovers up the next day for lunch!
author: Helen V.

description:
I saw this place a few weeks ago cruising down Geary, so I thought to myself- 'lets give it a try.' I settled for the chicken curry. They asked me if I wanted it mild or spicy. Of course I went with spicy. So about 10 minutes later they bring out my curry dish, also served with potatoes and a side of rice. Sad to say all of it was rather..... eh! The curry was NOT spicy in the least bit, and the chicken was rather dry. I just ate the curry sauce and potatoes and left the rest.

I'm not saying that Volcano is bad per say, just saying that I have no desire to go back.
author: David D.

description:
Ok, this isn't the best place in the world. It is one of the homiest though.

- The curry is just that damned comforting.  I always add an egg, eggplant & a croquet to my curry.
- The beautiful art on the walls are care of one of the employees. My eyes drooled to see such a splendid thing.
- The croquet is BOMB.... and I never use that word.

Craving comfort? Think local. Get Volcano.
author: David F.

description:
I had the pleasure of having my lunch here today after receiving a 50% off coupon on scoutmob. I had vegetarian curry (although it was not on the menu; so I am not sure if it was made specifically for me..?) and my husband had chicken teriyaki - which looked moist and tender; with no complaints. 

The food was served quickly and in decent sized lunch portions. Normally, I like to have doggie bags to take home whenever I go out to eat;  but there was huge hunks of potato (gross..) in the curry. Thus, pretty much the entire meal was one huge potato cut into 4 pieces with zucchini and peeled carrots. Since I am not a fan of potato; my meal was greatly reduced to the aforementioned. (I did not place the order; thus if I ever return I will be sure to specify no potatoes.)

I also agree with Tony L.'s comment about the curry sauce resembling a turkey sauce from a can. Very dark and sort of watery..although it was tasty. 

I would return for another meal even without the 50% off coupon as their prices are fair for the amount of food you get.
author: Maple S.

description: The sandwich was awesome.  It had the biggest slice of white bread, which came wrapped and cut diagonally.  The tangy, crunchy coleslaw inside the chicken katsu was the best.  Beware, you do have to like Worccestershire-like sauce (tangy vinegary).  This sandwich is so huge ( A meal in itself ) that you can split it with another person.   I am so hooked.  I can't wait to go back to get another one.  The onion croquette is so creamy inside.  I usually order the curry with rice, which always hits the spot.  The service was great and friendly.  This is such an inexpensive place.
author: Helen L.

description:
I accidentally found Volcano as I was driving by and got excited about the fact that it was a Japanese curry house.

While Volcano isn't "traditional" Japanese curry, I love them. They make their own curry from scratch so there is a unique flavor and doesn't taste like the stuff I can buy in a box and make myself. The vegetables are flavorful and cut large for a hearty bite. The chicken katsu was some of the best I've ever had - crispy with perfectly tender meat. I also got the zucchini with my curry and it inspired me to grill my own zucchini to add to my curry.

My friend got the beef curry which had delicious chucks of beef stew meat. We also ordered the potato croquette which was delish.

I love the vibe and the fantastic thought put into the art and decor of Volanco - it's different and delicious in its own right.
author: Wendy T.

description: Tonight this place has lost my business completely. We were here, from out of town, visiting my family so we decided to walk and see what we wanted for dinner. They love Volcanos and I've eaten there when I have visited in the past.  Our party of 6 walked up to show our guest the menu posted outside on the window. We were looking at the menu at 9:36pm. After looking at the menu, we decided to eat there. However, before we could open the door,  a girl inside saw us, avoiding eye contact. She ran and locked the door, flipped the open sign off and the electric open sign off. She did not acknowledge us at all and was pretty rude about it, in my opinion. My guest were shocked. She could have opened the door and peeked her head out and said that she was sorry she forgot to turn off the open sign. That would have been the correct customer service. There was also a person outside in a car waiting that appeared to be waiting for her that yelled that they were closed. We understood that now, but how it was handled was horrible. Maybe this was a blessing as we just read that they received a poor score on their recent health inspection.
author: Sabrina M.

description:
I really like Katsu Curry, but it is usually hard to find a place that does it right. Most places have some soggy piece of Katsu with some semi-bland curry where all the vegetables are soggy as well and tasteless.
This place is different. Their Chicken Katsu was crispy and tasty, their rice was done well, and their curry was excellent. The vegetables were not soggy at all and they retained their flavor while blending in well with the curry. My only complaint is that they have varying degrees of hotness for their curry, and I thought their Hot would suffice... It was spicy, but not THAT spicy. I guess I will have to try volcano next time. Other than that, this place is bomb and I will for sure come here again.
author: Dale S.

description:
I've been trying this place since it opened and I haven't been disappointed yet. Good portions, decent price, great comfort food, and mellow atmosphere. You can get in line to order take out or choose to dine in at the restaurant if you can manage to find an empty table on a busy night. So what if you have to grab your own utensils and wait forever for the food to arrive? It tastes delicious and they're generous portions! Although the majority of the customers order their popular curry plates, I have discovered my new go to item on the menu. The CHICKEN KATSU SANDWICH. Oh so finger-licking good....

It's chicken katsu smothered with homemade tangy and spicy coleslaw in between two thin, crunchy, buttery, sweet slices of bread. I could eat those sandwiches everyday if I lived close by. I'm definitely a fan and would go back in a heartbeat whenever I'm in the neighborhood. It'll take me forever to find a parking spot on Geary Blvd. but what a great creation. Sigh =)
author: Chau H.

description:
I really didn't know what to expect from the food here--the world of Japanese curries/katsu is foreign to me. 

Anyway, the cashier was knowledgeable and told me that the only truly vegetarian option was the veggie katsu (no soup, and she recommended the tofu nugget as a substitution). Others in the group ordered the chicken katsu curry and the chicken noodle soup.

Our overall opinion was that we were underwhelmed. My croquette was truly cold, and the vegetables had no flavor except for batter. The tofu nuggets were actually really good, and I can't complain about the rice/slaw/salad. I ate mostly everything, but in the end I can't say I'd ever want to order the dish again.

Other comments were that the croquettes were really nice when actually hot (too bad for me!), that the curry was pretty tasteless (needed salt), and that the noodles in the soup were kinda soggy. We all left feeling like we ate something unhealthy, but not in the good way. 

The frequent buyer card seemed like a good deal, but I'm not sure I'll be going back. I'm glad I finally tried it after walking past so many times, but I guess it's not for me.
author: Robyn M.

description:
fast food cafeteria-style japanese curry

that's as best as i can describe it.

nothing fancy, just good old far eastern comfort food.  

i got the mild chicken karaage curry - steamed rice, small, deep fried chicken cubes in a flavorful curry with potatoes and carrots.  perfect for a wintery sf day.

decent prices too!
author: Ray R.

description: This place awesome for cold days, which are often in San Francisco. Everything I have ordered has been solid. Once or twice i have gotten an under cooked potato piece but it wasn't so under cooked that it wasn't edible. More often they cook everything to a great level. It's awesome comfort food for a relaxing evening or lunch.
author: Zachery H.

description:
Really?  People are complaining about "no vegetarian options"?  

Then GET THE *(expletive that rhymes with "duck")* OUT.  

I don't walk into restaurants like Millenium (which I highly enjoyed) and get offended by no meat options.

This is a Japanese style curry place.... which means tonkatsu and chicken katsu and BEEF... RAWR!!  Bring on the MEAT!!!!!
author: s m.

description: That teriyaki chicken sandwich! If they ask if you want sriracha with it, say yes!
author: Jay A.

description: This place looks like a mom and pop restaurant.  This was my first experience there.  There was a very friendly gal working the counter.  She promptly brought us our food and even checked on us later to see how we were doing.  I ordered the mild chicken curry with a croquette ($1.00!!) and a side of calamari ($1.50 What a bargain! I LOVE calamari).  My boyfriend ordered the medium chicken katsu curry.  He loved it because it was not too spicy.  He finished his whole plate! The service was superb, and the food was great.  I will definitely come back again.
author: Colleen L.

description: Good food, fast service. Menu is interesting and the staff is helpful at helping you figure out the menu.
author: Sarah A.

description: I'm a big fan of Japanese curry and grew up on it, so I think I'm a bit of a tough critic.  Everything was pretty good, but I thought the curry was pretty bland.  I wasn't too impressed with the flavors, but to be totally fair I did get mild.  Still, the service was quick and the chicken katsu and Japanese sausage were cooked to perfection.  I also loved the little "add-ons" to the curry dishes, like veggies, croquettes and sausages for $1.00 more.  I've never had that before! I'll try this place out again with a spicier option and update my review.
author: Jeanne M.

description:
Very Nice surprise in the Outer richmond!  
Chicken Curry was flavorful and had a nice "kick" for the spicey hot selection.  Potatoe Crocquet was very light and crispy.  Price was very nice at about 6-7 bucks spent per plate.  
I even got the free topping card!
author: Curtis L.

description:
A quaint and cozy little place that has a overall pretty comfortable environment that is also well lit. The artwork surrounding the place matches well with the concept Japanese style curry. The place is very clean and sanitary. 

Price is very reasonable and portions are pretty generous. There are 4 levels of spiciness: Mild, Medium, Spicy, and Volcano. To me, mild is just a dazzle or hint of spiciness and things don't get a little too crazy unless you decide to stick with Spicy or Volcano. 

While sandwiches and noodle soups are available, the place specializes none other than curries and croquette (which btw are very well made and comes in either onion or potato croquettes). 

The beef and pork is also cooked relatively well; with most of it being quite tender. 

Overall, I had a pretty good experience every visit.
author: Killah K.

description: Volcano is one of my most favorite places to get Japanese Curry. It has a home setting vibe. I usually get the chicken katsu curry, mild. It's not too spicy and it has a late effect on the spiciness. I get this for under $10. I enjoy this because it comes out the perfect temperature for eating. Parking can sometimes be a problem but I usually get parking within a block. I'm not sure but I don't think there is a legitimate waiter, so we would have to place out dirty dishes in a container they leave on top of the garbage. But that's okay it feels like we are a guest in a house.
author: Jay R.

description:
I'd passed this place a million times, and finally went in when I had some errands to run. What a pleasant surprise! A fast food type of place with non-fast food. I got the shrimp curry. It was wonderful! The shrimp was delicately fried, not overly greasy or stale from sitting around.

Keep in mind that this is Japanese style curry (curry rice), and not Indian. It is not especially spicy, more flavorful, and on the sweet side. I think curry that I had at an Irish restaurant is more similar. Oh, and to respond to other comments that the curry is not that spicy--well, I think spicy is a relative term. Japanese are generally wimpy when it comes to spicy. If you want spicy, you probably want Indian or Thai curry. The spicy level in this curry would knock the socks off of most of my Japanese relatives.
author: 和子

description:
Cheap
Fast
Clean Place
Nice workers
Above average food

Can't really talk bad about this place yet can't really talk about great things either.
author: Sonlay V.

description: Still one of my favorite places to grab some curry. I also love the Katsu sandwich they have!
author: Nat Q.

description:
I love Volcano Curry. Oh yum. 

I get the medium sauce - and I love hot, so be warned hot is hot. Like kills a cold hot. 
I like anything they make- katsu, chicken, you name it. Add extra veggies, an egg and a croquette and this one plate easily feeds two. Super yum.
author: DasLael D.

description: Awesome curry and very authentic to what I ate in Japan. Also points for cute atmosphere and a great value in San Francisco. Eat here at least once a week. Shout out to Tiffany.
author: Adam C.

description:
I was watching a Japanese food show and saw a Ramen noodle shop focused on curry noodle. It made me curious and decided to find out if there is one in SF. Found this place with 400+ Yelp reviews, and invited my families to get together there. 
Not sure if I have an unreasonable expectation, I was not impressed with its food. I felt that I probably could do the same thing at home by purchasing those pre-made curry blocks at regular markets. Basically, nothing is particularly exciting at this place.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I've been to this place quite a few times.  Place offers great comfort food and has yummy options for extra toppings.  Great portions and the pricing isn't that bad. The sandwiches are ok and the BF is fan of the chicken teriyaki volcano plate.  I always opt for the curry.  The beef is usually overcooked so I go for the chicken which can be hit or miss. Most of the times it's right on.  My next try will be the original curry.  I always get the eggplant topping and they always cook it to perfection. Delicious. The potato croquette is yummy as well as the newly added onion croquette. 

The place is simple, easy, clean, and fast.  I say if you like curry, want something hearty and hassle-free....give this place a shot.
author: Malisha J.

description:
I'm not that big of a curry fan.  The spiciness is too hot to handle for my mouth.  So, I really have only had the Japanese green curry that was either made by my grandma or my Aunty.  

But, yesterday I was starving and I just walked into anywhere really and I'm glad I did.

I got the chicken katsu Plate and ate some of my friend's curry because I thought it would be too hot.  But, it was really mild and had a good flavor.  The chicken katsu was also very good.  It tasted like the kind that you can get in Hawaii (which is the best btw).  The batter is light yet really crispy! 

My only beef with Volcano is the tonkatsu sauce they put on top of the chicken katsu.  It didn't taste very good.  It was edible but too salty and had a weird flavor.  So next time I just won't get any!
author: Marisa R.

description: Came here with the girlfriend after going through our weekly comic book hunt because we love curry! Being avid fans of Japanese style curry in particular peaked our interest in this place very much. There is always a crowd when we pass through around dinner time, so we had to try it out. We were not disappointed. This is a great place for some decent cheap curry. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area. They have great spices and fry up their Katsu pretty well to the point where it is very crispy. I definitely recommend this place to a curry fan who enjoys a nice plate with a little zest to it.
author: Michael N.

description: Had the pork katsu. Was the best I've had in the states. The pork wasn't too thick, was perfectly cooked, tender and juicy. I had the volcano plate with salad. The combo was very good. I'll be eating here again.
author: Mark S.

description: Bad Customer Service Attitude.  For the food alone I'd give 4 stars but for the service and attitude of staffs, I can only give 1 star because I can't give 0 on Yelp.  It's a cafe style place with staffs / cashiers who are not very happy working there - they are unpleasant and rude to customers.  You will not find the transitional Japanese manner here.  They are terrible especially handling large orders.  I recently place a few separate orders for friends and family online under my name, and we went to pick them up at the counter.  Cashier there just give me one receipt for everything.  She combined the orders into one order.  I asked the cashier why they'd combine orders originally placed separately and has different order#, and asked if she can identify what's in each bag, stone-faced she told me that's how they do it, they have decided to combine them and told me that I just have to go figure it out myself.  Turns out to be a nightmare trying to match the sauces to the right order and figure out which one is chicken and pork - not every container was marked, not to mention that I have to recalculate the cost for each original order to collect money!
author: Muka M.

description:
been there a number of times and the food is very consistent.
Place is very clean, well lit and the self serve items are laid out nice.
I can see the pride of ownership in this small business.
Very easy to order what you want your way because the menu is set up that way. 
Now, Price?
Very reasonable because you order at the counter and they will bring your order to your table. 
And the food of course is just like in Japan!!!!!
author: dave m.

description: Very yummy. Japanese curry is one of my favorite foods on the planet and they do it well. Their veggies are also top notch. Huge pieces of potato, carrot, eggplant and zucchini, cooked perfectly. Also their seaweed salad is like $2 (its always at least $4 at any sushi place). My only complaint is that their menu is a bit deep fried for my taste and they don't deliver. Otherwise, awesome.
author: Lauren T.

description:
i keep going back and forth with this place.  i think this will be my last review.  
do NOT order salmon anything.  its basically a frozen patty deep fried.  awful awful awful.  the rice is always bad.  too dry.  the pork katsu has been getting thinner and thinner so when its fried the meat basically turns into cardboard.
the curry itself is still pretty good.  so i'd rather get this to go.  beef curry.  but i'd make the rice at home.  fry some pork katsu and i am set.  but to go through all the trouble, i might as well cook my own curry.
i gave it two stars only because of the katsu sandwich...but, like i said earlier...the pork katsu is becoming bad too.  :(  i'll just stick with the two stars. the curry itself is saving the extra star.  sorry volcano, i once enjoyed coming here..  :(
author: Elisa O.

description:
Cheap and good.

Japanese Curry Dishes run $5-$7 and sides like croquets and sausages run $1-2. The curry is a little watery, but pretty tasty. The croquets are worth trying if you've never been, they're pretty good. 

The girl that was working that night was super helpful and nice (although it was kinda quiet). Overall, a good experience.
author: P M.

description:
There is chicken curry. And then there is tomato chicken curry. Almost like a pasta sauce but thicker, it's awesome, and I have Volcano to thank for introducing us. I'm glad we met.

Portions are large, prices are cheap and service is fast and friendly. Mini sandwiches are also available if you want to sample more of the menu (teriyaki salmon is also quite good.)

Just leave plenty of room for the tomato chicken curry.
author: Jason B.

description: i like this place a lot.  the curry is cheap and good, and a lot of times the cashier provides tableside service.  nice spot and with the new fivestar rewards program tablet up front now, you can easily collect points for free food later.
author: Daniel Y.

description: I work near Japantown but when I need a curry fix, I am DEFINITELY heading to Volcano on Geary btw 18th & 19th Ave.  It's worth the drive and headache of Geary Street traffic!  Hands down, the best curry I have had in a long time.  I use to go to a place in the inner Sunset but after two disappointing meals, Volcano is my new favorite curry place.  Thanks previous YELP reviewers!
author: Mark L.

description:
Had the chicken curry, and it was less than meh. Old chicken, small serving with no extra stuff. 

I still come here for the non-curry stuff, though.
author: Stacy J.

description:
Oh man I love me some Japanese curry. Let me be up front about that. If you like curry you know that Indian curry tastes completely different than Thai curry. And we just won't talk about Chinese curry (blah)

A friend of mine (thanks Viral) heard about this place and we decided to go, and let's just say I've been back many times since.

The menu is simple...mostly curry dishes with or without chicken or pork katsu.

I normally get the katsu curry with chicken although you can get it with pork, or vegetables, as well. They ask you how spicy you want the curry, I go with "Volcano" spicy and it has a little kick although my tolerance for spice is very high, so if you're not into spicy foods, go for something milder.

The curry includes a good amount of potatoes and grilled zucchini which is a nice change from most curry places. The meat has always been very tender and juicy. Really well prepared.

And the curry! Thick and very flavorful, really quite tasty! 
Now, I've been to a lot of Japanese curry places and my old favorite, Hurry Curry of Tokyo, has to take a second place to Volcano.

Now don't go here expecting anything fancy, cause it isn't. The decor is clean and simple - actually looks like it was furnished by Ikea. But honestly, that's not why you come here. You come for the delicious food.
author: Bernard F.

description:
The curry wasn't bad for the price but it definitely doesn't compare to the curry they have at Mifune-don in Japantown. I think if I were in the neighborhood I would eat here but because I would have to drive here, I wouldn't waste the gas. I always enjoy katsu curry.

No diarrhea! So that's a good sign that it's a good curry place (:
author: Christina B.

description: Spicy tasty curry with fried shrimp side, rice, and pickled radish. Brings back memories of a hole-in-a-wall stand across from school housing in Osaka. I'm definitely coming back for lunch!
author: Tatyana K.

description:
If you enjoy brown, warm liquid over rice, you will love Volcano.

The curry sauce is robust in flavor, and the portions are huge for the price. The sauce ads a savory flavor without the need for meat. My favorite is the original, vegetable dish both for cost and the veggies. 

The atmosphere is casual and friendly, and the service snappy.

If Joe were around today, he would not be versus this volcano.
author: Nik D.

description:
Like others have mentioned, the cafeteria-style eating (order at the counter, put your dishes in the bin when you're done) surprised me when I walked in. 

The place is nice and clean and feels like it could house a decent restaurant, but Volcano's menu has very little on it and the cafeteria-style aspect makes it feel cheap (despite paying $9 for rice, meat and curry sauce). 

We had the pork curry and chicken curry, medium spicy. It tasted good, but I couldn't help but feel that I could make it myself at home and probably make it better. 

I could see going to this place once every few months for lunch if I had a craving for curry, but I really don't think I'll be back.
author: Justin B.

description: This place is awesome! I lived in Okinawa a few years back, since then i've been craving japanese curry.  Volcano curry foods are amazing. Nice and spicy!
author: Johnny T.

description: Cheap comfort food for a great deal! The portions are huge at Volcano! And how could you not love a place with point cards, earning you free toppings and a free curry!? I eat really spicy so if you want to break the spice bank go for the double volcano. I tried triple and it was edible but for a more enjoyable experience go for the double!!
author: Deanna B.

description: Decent japanese curry in comparison to The CURRY HOUSE, enough to fill a craving. Can't say the server was very friendly. Don't think I'd drive all the way to outer Richmond for this place. It has a fast food feel to it and maybe it was just the server on the day I went, but I've had better curry, better service, and better surrounds for this kind of curry elsewhere for the same price.
author: Debbi S.

description:
Cafe style curry joint on 19th and Geary. Recent discovery - you'll find a nice sit down curry place here with good portions starting at $6.25 + tax and no requirement for tip due to the fast food / cafe style layout of the place! Cashiers have all been patient and nice when explaining questions about the meals served here. I usually get the standard basic curry here which comes with eggplant and one other topping I cannot recall. It is self serve but they will bring out the food for you and clean it up for you if you are done. I'd say its somewhere inbetween a cafe and a regular restaurant - you pay and order before you sit. The curry is very enjoyable, but please note I am half Japanese and grew up on Japanese food, so what might be 'great' to me may simply be 'good' to most people. I have come with at least 6 or 7 unique people here in my many visits though and everyone seems to think it is pretty good here.

Someone wanting a sit in decent sized meal of good japanese style curry on the cheap you can get by on under $7 a meal here if you go basic, and they have a point card system so if you make this place a habit, you can get free toppings every 4 purchases and a free meal every 12 purchases. 4 Spicyness levels - Mild, Medium, Hot, and their trademark Volcano. I always get Medium and it is a decent spicyness. I've heard the Volcano is pretty high on the spiciness scales, so even if you love spicy I'd start with a "hot" just to be safe. But hey, if you think you can take it, don't let me stop you. Just remember, water is self serve.

I know I sound cheap but I'm always on the lookout for affordable meals that are healthy, good, and that I don't have to prepare myself. Volcano passes on all these requirements and its a decent atmosphere that feels like a normal restaurant.

Typically very affordable meals are somewhere in the Vietnamese pho or Chinese food in my experience, so this place is a little different for me in that category and adds variety to my low cost prepared meal options in my area. Highly recommended.
author: Ken S.

description:
Good and hearty comfort food.  The curry is full of flavor despite being healthy.  You could walk on the wild side by adding the deep fried bits.  The katsu and tonkatsu are both crunchy, tender, and fried to order.  Good stuff if you're not watching your heart!  Opt for the extra pickled relish to give the curry an extra zing.  

This place is never busy so you can always grab a hot plate before heading out for the night.  

Beware, the volcano level of spiciness is HOT and it will ruin your appetite unless you like pain...
author: MTBer I.

description:
Get the onion croquette! :)

Curry is good.  I might try the sandos next time :)
author: Margaret S.

description:
I've supported this place since it opened but today it crossed the line by serving me food that another table had sent back. 

First off, they delivered our food to the wrong table and the people at the other table didn't realize it (or had a very similar order) and started eating the food--no big deal, the counter-girl apologized and went back to give us their food (seriously) which I declined.

A minute later, I saw the dude with our grub give it back to her, she took it in the back and came back out with "our order" which was THE SAME FOOD that the guy had just sent back. All they did was take the chicken off the plate and put it back on in a different order--I could see it all from my seat.

I went up to the counter (holding a wriggly 4 year old the whole time) and asked if it was the same food and the girl was telling me no but the manager/owner guy in the back admitted it. I demanded my money back but they still charged me for the drinks! Unreal. 

In the past I've seen them handle money then touch food--which is gross, but pretty common. This however was disgusting, and hugely disappointing and I can't imagine within the bounds of the health department.

UPDATE: For the record, I kept my cool and didn't use any foul language. The commenter who claims I did must work there...wisdom of the crowds, my ass.
author: dave r.

description: This place is great! I got the Pork Katsu Curry and it was deee-licious! It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be but it was still very good. I guess next time I have to get it super spicy! Oh, and either the plates are small or I just eat a lot cause my plate was CLEAN!
author: Hwan L.

description: Too tired to cook? Nice place for economical tasty meal. Favorite is curry over rice or noodles with either Tonkatsu or chicken katsu.
author: Hiroshi F.

description:
Full disclosure: I'm giving this place an extra star so it'll have a chance to get better. 

One of the things I miss most about Los Angeles is the Japanese curry houses all over the place (Hurry Curry is a chain that got me through college.) It's cheap, hot, spicy comfort food. So last week when we were driving up Geary and saw Volcano, I made my husband do a U so we could go in to grab a menu. 

That night we ordered (for take out) the chicken curry (ok), beef curry (meh), tonkatsu curry (crispy! good!), croquets (good! I don't think I'm spelling this right. they are those potato fritter things), and pickles (LOVE pickles with my curry!). 

The tonkatsu curry was by far the best (it's served with the plain curry) and with the pickles it was darned good. The one curry I wouldn't get again is the beef curry -- it was too beef stew-ish. 

Is this the best curry I've had? NO. They could use some more variety. In LA, most places have more vegetarian options like spinach, pumpkin, or mushroom curry. Also, I think the veggies are cut too big and it felt like you didn't get enough. 

But on nights where you want something hot but don't want to cook, this place is fast and tasty. And cheap too! Each dish is just $6.
author: L. M.

description:
My girlfriend and I walked into Volcano on a recent evening because we were trying to find a place to grab dinner before getting a scoop at Joe's Ice Cream. Being a typical SF Summer, we wanted to get something to warm our bellies. 

I got the beef curry (medium) with jalapenos and my gf got the pork katsu curry (mild) with a croquette. We thought the curries were fantastic, especially at its affordable price point. I generally like a decent amount of spice and the medium curry didn't disappoint (the extra jalapenos were great too). I think the only thing that came up short was the beef itself. It tasted like stew meat...nothing to write hoe about. What really surprised me was the pork katsu. That was some of the best, juiciest pork katsu I've ever eaten! I also though the croquette was delicious too. It was like eating a deep fried scoop of yummy mashed potatoes.

Volcano also has both a "hot" and "volcano" spice level for their curries. They do offer gelato, but Volvano is a few doors down is Joe's Ice Cream, and that's definitely a wining combination.
author: Kevin Q.

description:
Good, basic Japanese curry.

4 level of burn....
   mild, medium, hot, and volcano.

It is basically self serve...
   you get your own utensils, ice water, and napkins.

I had ordered the beef curry with additional topping:
                                              calamari and onion croquette.

I am no expert in japanese curry. It was pretty good to me.

However the beef was cooked too long. I was like when I made huge batch of beef stew that would last 7 days. Instead of heating up only what you will eat...you would reheat the whole batch. Voila, the beef would be bleed dry of it's natural juice and the texture will tender but pulpy like texture. The stew would benefit from the beef flavor exuding out every time u reheat it.

Note...I will try it again...after I try the curry pork katsu (tricky...more than half of restaurants tend to over cook it because of the thiness of the meat)


The onion croquette was flavorful and velvetly smooth inside.

I will need to try out the other dish to finalize my review...
author: S.K. Y.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the Outer Richmond. Super cheap, super delicious. One of my favorites is the basic noodle soup. It's one of the cheapest things on the menu -- and one of the best. Crazy casual; great place to go if you just don't feel like cooking dinner, but don't want to break the bank. Love it.
author: Michael B.

description:
Volcano is my favorite place to satiate my Japanese curry cravings. They serve their curry in varying levels of spicyness: mild, medium, hot and volcano. The price is reasonable for the amount of food they serve, and if that's not enough, they offer a variety of toppings. Now, mini-sandwiches are also available for around $2!

What I appreciate most about their curry is the fact that their flavor does not reduce in quality as the spice level increases. The curry keeps its wonderful well-rounded flavor as the spice gradually builds up after each bite. Personally, I would want a level beyond their volcano curry. I wrote them a suggestion requesting for a "super volcano" level. That should be delicious!
author: Anita L.

description:
Well, I've returned to this place a few times since my initial review--do to the fact they send Val-Pak coupons. At $4.95 for a curry, it's a decent deal--the $1 extra for brown rice puts it under $6.

I'm really surprised it has lasted as long as it has, but will continue to go there as long as they keep sending me coupons..
author: Hank S.

description:
Ok, so have you ever been like set up by someone? They give you a picture of the person and you are like, "Thanks, but no thanks." Then for some reason, you are kicking it with your friends and you meet the person they are trying to set you up with face to face with. You get to know them and you are likee, "wow, this isn't so bad." And by the end of the end of the night, you have fallen deeply in love. 

I live right by Volcano curry. When they first opened up, they took pictures of their curry and stuck it on the front window. Maybe I am photosnob, but one look and I was in in full "do not want" mode. So a few months slip by, I walk by the front each time vomiting in my mouth a little at the thought of actually eating here one day. 

But fate loves to play these cruel tricks. One day, my friend randomly calls me up to go hit this place up. In my mind, I was already thinking about having a burrito at Gordo's next door. Maybe I was lonely, maybe I was temporarily blinded and I agreed. Between the hours of 2 pm and 5 pm, I braced myself for what was to come. 

I got the chicken curry with a side potato croquette. It was fantastic. This was legit curry. No joke. I was blown away. I was humbled as this "ugly chick" of a restaurant actually moved me. 

The only thing is their curry comes in not hot and really hot

Then they started serving sandwiches. It brought back old high school memories when the same spot was a quick Korean BBQ take out place with the best sandwiches I ever had. Now they have katsu sandwiches. Those are amazing as well. 

Well done, ugly chick, well done.
author: Andy C.

description: This place is great! The best thing about this place is that you can make your curry super spicy. I have a really high heat tolerance so the volcano hot was not hot at all to me. The nice lady at the counter told me that you can double, and I think even triple the spicy level above volcano. Woot woot! I ended up getting another meal to go just so that I can try the double volcano spicy at home. It wasn't bad, I was sweating a bit but it wasn't ohhh my gawd this is super hot i'm gonna die heat, which I enjoyed very much. I cant wait to go here again and see if I can up the heat level another notch!
author: Mark C.

description: The chicken katsu curry + friendly service + affordable price + casual ambience + cleanliness = WIN!
author: Mia C.

description: I had the chicken katsu curry. It was ok. Servers are nice though. Good for a snack.
author: Alex M.

description: If you're ordering their small selection of sandwiches, be prepared to wait awhile. I tried ordering one of their chicken teriyaki sandwiches early one evening and it took like 20 minutes. There was only one other customer in there at the time I ordered. Two other customers came and went after me who ordered rice plates. Not sure why one sandwich would take so long, or maybe I'm being unreasonable to think waiting 20 minutes is too long? I cancelled my order and left.
author: Jag F.

description:
I've never been a big fan of curry, but ever since my friends started coming here on a regular basis I've found that I've developed a taste for it. Of course, that being said, take my review of Volcano with a grain of salt, since I'm not judging it based on any pre-existing notions of what Japanese curry should be like.

Volcano is a nice little place along Geary, a street with many, many other decent-to-good places to eat. I never noticed it before, so I'm assuming it must be somewhat new, like it was built in the last two or three years or something. Either that or they like to keep the place clean; the decor is classy looking and everything inside looks neat and shiny.

In terms of the menu there's a choice between the curry plates (rice, curry, choice of meat), the "volcano" plates (rice, choice of meat, soup, salad ... I think), sandwiches, and toppings. Personally I've only ever had the curry plates with a few of the toppings, all of which have been rather tasty. Nothing is terribly expensive here (no more than $8 a plate), and the portions are more than enough to fill you up. And they sell some Japanese drinks like canned Pokka/UCC coffee and Calpico if you're looking for a bit of added "authenticity" (note the quotation marks).

The staff is always nice and friendly, and considering the girl at the counter both takes your order and brings it out to you, I'd have to say they do a pretty excellent job of things. Food might take awhile to come out if you have a larger group though, so if you're like my friends and I who wait until everyone has their food before starting, you'll probably want to order last.

Volcano isn't the best or most authentic place I've been to, but for some good curry it's definitely the most comfortable place to go on a weekly basis. Oh, and if you're here often, be sure to grab a stamp card. Every few trips you'll get a free topping, with a free curry for every 12 (I think). Not a bad deal.
author: Will C.

description:
Very clean place
Polite staff
Pricing was cheaper than I thought it would be
Was served very quickly
I had the chicken curry and loved it. Will come back again.
author: Terry M.

description:
"Why be mediocre when you can be just plain trash?"

::Curry & Veggies::
If this isn't from the package it may as well be.  Watery and flavorless.  They cook the vegetables separately from the curry, so both haven't a chance in hell of doing their job (which is to be tasty in curry land).  

::Spicy::
You can pick a spicy level, but it won't matter... it's all void of spicy action.

::Paper Plates::
Okay, I get it... this place has no interest in being in anyway decent.

::Overall::
This place claims to be about curry, yet their curry is diarrhea quality.  The reality is clearly that they want to try a new nice, purely for the sake of making a quick buck.  I'm so tired of that business model... we have more than enough of that in this area, thanks very much.
author: Dan M.

description:
Cheap food for the hungry. 
Curry is decent.
Meats is kinda meh -- well I was cheap and ordered chicken, which tasted like nothing.
Thumbs up on the chunks of vegetables (zucchini!), pickled too.
Service is kind of funky, staff seemed airheaded.
But oh well, clean place, decent food, close by.
I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Faffy L.

description:
To be honest, this really does seem like a hawaiian Drive in but for curry. Anyways, the food is not that bad as some people say it is. I actually think it is pretty good, maybe its because i never had GREAT curry. But how great and curry GET? 

The pork katsu curry was really good. The katsu was actually better than hawaiian drive in IMO. 

not very expensive at all, good amount of food. Nothing more you can ask for.
author: Andrew H.

description:
There are very few options on the menu, which is refreshing .. the pork and chicken are great, the shrimp is kinda meager to say the best. 
It's very cheap and good. 

It's on the newer side. I recommend getting the potato as an extra. It's worth the extra dollar.   :)
author: Angela M.

description:
Friend shoved $6 into the tip jar and all he got was a half smile from the girl behind the counter. Don't expect too much is what I'm saying.

It's nothing special, just curry. Nice sized helping of food (although said waittress spilled a lot of curry onto the table while serving it) and rice. Don't you hate it when they don't give you enough rice to soak up the curry?? 

Curry: a little watered down but still okay. A little too spicy to be considered mild (yeah i'm a wimp , suck it).  Got our own water and utensils. 

Airy and comfortable, kind of like eating lunch in a cafeteria. Nothing pretentious about it.
author: tammy m.

description: I came here with a group of friends for dinner. It was one of the better chicken katsu curries I've had in a while. The curry was good, and the chicken katsu was crunchy, and not too oily.  It reminded me of homemade chicken katsu. I also tried the tomato chicken, but that was rather bland to me. The portion size was extremely filling and well worth the price. Definitely would come here again for quick and decent curry.
author: Kim K.

description:
I really wish yelp could rate things in half intervals, because this place doesn't deserve 3 stars, but 4 is too generous.

How easy is it to be pleasantly surprised by food served on plastic forks and paper dishes? Eh?! EH?! Pretty easy for these folks actually.

The place looks like they cut a lot of corners in order to give you a meal that doesn't melt a hole in your pocket and is surprisingly decent. It felt like a fast food joint decided to get hot and sticky with a Japanese curry shop and out popped little tasty mutated children.

The service person was pretty on top of making sure we were happy and took our plates away when we were done... by taking them to the trash bin four feet away from us.
author: Alfred Y.

description: I'm proud to say I've made Volcano converts out of some of my friends. Their japanese curry is super good! I usually get the beef or katsu curry dish with mild spiciness. I'm literally on my second rewards card. I also like to mash the carrots into my curry sauce. That's kinda random, but I still wanted to mention it.
author: Christy V.

description: My friends and coworkers have been talking about this place for months, so I decided to drop in this past Monday.  Kevin had the chicken curry over rice and added the egg & cheese as additional toppings.  Spicy level HOT.  I think he could have gone Volcano since he's used to Korean food.  I on the othehand had the chicken katsu sandwich.  It's a quick fix when craving curry in the Richmond distruct.  I would have liked to see the curry consistency just a tad bit thicker.
author: Stacey L.

description:
I love curry.  Curry to me is like ethnic gravy.  And if you don't know me, I am a drinker of such saucy eats.  I remember watching an episode of "Married with Children" where Al Bundy drank cans of gravy straight, and me thinking, "yum, ain't nothing wrong with that picture..."

I love sauces, wet and savory, and I'm easy to please.

Here at Volcano, I got their original curry (medium spicy) and thoroughly enjoyed the salty, stew-y curry with nice chunks of vegetables over brown rice.  What's not to like.  Tasted like Japanese curry, piping hot and I'm starting to think this may be a comfort food for me.  If you do not like the spices that are in curry than don't eat it.

Slurp on!
author: Susan C.

description:
It's cheap.  The restaurant is simple and very clean.  The food is delicious.

To me the consistency was just right, the portion was just large enough, and my "very spicy" plate of chicken katsu was exactly what I would describe as very spicy.
author: Darren C.

description:
I went here for here for the first time last week during the middle of lunch time with my bro who had wanted to try it for quite some time.  I walk in and notice none of the tables are taken yet, but there is a group of people in front ordering together.  I wasn't sure whether to feel relieved that we had many seating choices or to feel worried that this place was almost empty (filled up halfway as we sat down tho).

I like how their menu is short and sweet and have some $1 addons.  Dishes are abt $6.50 before tax.  We both got the Chicken Katsu in spicy curry...it had quite a kick but Im used to that stuff, while my bro bit off a little more than he could chew.

Unlike previous reviews, all the food was on a regular ceramic plate, not paper plate like they have in the crappy pictures on the windows but you still have to get your own water and metal utensils which is just fine.  The curry tasted good...not fantastic, but good enough and cheap enough for me to go back if Im hungry and in the area and decide to pass on the Gordo Tacqueria next door.
author: Gilbert C.

description:
The curry was really good but the chicken was really gross and fatty.  I might try it again but I'd get pork katsu or something where cheap meat isn't such a big deal.  Maybe just veggies actually.  

Clean, nice place with friendly service just gross meat (like most chicken teriyaki places).
author: Eamonn T.

description:
Five stars are hard to come by, but when it's deserving, it's deserving.  The place is small and quint and looks like a normal coffee shop, fast food joint.  The stuff on the menu though, makes it a place to go to when you crave Japanese curry.  The fact that they have different spiciness options is a HUGE plus for me being a Thai person whom love pretty spicy foods.  Also, the amount of options for a vegetarian, another plus!

I ordered the Original Curry with the tofu nuggets, pickles, and potato croquette.  I was not sure about the pickle, but they are THE PICKLES to have with the curry.  It made it taste even better and calmed the spiciness a bit as I got Volcano spiciness and a half... I almost went with two Volcano heat, but the waitress suggested I try either Volcano first just in case.  My friend suggested getting another half, so I went with that.  It was perfect!  I could go double, but I like it with 1 and half Volcano.  For those whom do not like habanero peppers, I don't suggest going with Volcano cause that has enough heat of one habanero or more.  Anyway, the tofu nuggets are also bomb!  I actually went online to search for where I could purchase it, but I think they actually make it in house.  It's amazing and will be what I get again along with the pickles.  The potato croquette is good too, but I could do with more tofu nuggets instead.  I will try the onion one next time.

Over all, I'm completely satisfied with this find.  The employee there is nice.  The prices are AMAZING (well, if you don't get too many toppings but some of it is a must).  My friend got the curry noodle soup and loved it.  I will definitely be back for more curry here.  Too bad they don't have one in the South Bay!
author: Andrew N.

description: This place is A-OK as represented by the 3 stars. You'll definitely leave full and the japanese curry is pretty good....but, I think Kare-Ken, Muracci's and JapaCurry are better...
author: Joe M.

description: I usually go with the chicken katsu curry quick lunch or cheap lunch option. Fried chicken katsu goodness on a bed of white rice smothered in your spiciness level choice of Japanese curry. Typically I order mine with an extra serving of the red pickles which go really well with each bite. The taste is similar to Marucci's downtown on Kearny but parking is much easier to find. Metered spaces are plentiful and residential free spots are only a short wall away. Even if you're ordering take-out the curry still holds pretty well because they know to separate the curry from the rice. Seating is rather limited and can be a problem if they are busy.
author: Dennis L.

description:
This place gets one star for being super clean & speedy, one star for the extremely affordable price, and two stars because the food is really good. 

I'm personally a fan of the Chicken Katsu Curry with rice, potato and veggies. Not super spicy but just enough kick to remind you that you are enjoying Japanese Curry. 

Beware though with all the add-on options you can spend more than you originally planned.
author: Marissa P.

description: This was my first time trying any kind of japanese curry. I wanted to try it since a lot of people go in there and I also pass by it. I read on yelp that the chicken katsu curry was good so I got that. Medium spicy. The first bite, it was overwhelming but as you keep eating it, it gets more delious. It was pretty good and I would want to go again.
author: Karena C.

description: Curries tasty!! It didn't look appetizing so was a little leary but that feeling went away as the food tasted really good!
author: Sandy N.

description:
Came here last night at a friends suggestion.  They liked the Japanese curry in Japan so wanted to try it here.  I've never had the joy, so thought I'd join.  Five of us dining right at closing.  Waitress was friendly, nice, attentive, and didn't rush us out at all...love good customer service!!

Food was good...everyone enjoyed their dish.  I tasted the medium curry chicken but didn't order it since I know curry will give me heartburn.  It was  different than the thicker Indian curry that I'm used to, but still good nonetheless.

I ordered the regular chicken teri plate and it was really good!!  Chicken was perfect not like other places that give you the chicken pieces w/ all the fat on it and love that it came with fresh greens! =)

Would come back if I was in the neighborhood or if a friend wanted japanese curry.
author: Ninja H.

description:
This place is decent and the portions are huge and all for very little money. In my opinion, this place is no where near as good at Muracci's, but if you are in the area and you want curry, this is good enough. I like how they add grilled zuccini to the dish. Gives it a nice texture. 

And they have some good topping options. Like kurobuta sausage. YUM!!
author: Jen D.

description: Great spot. I've tried a few different menu items, but the beef curry is my favorite. So tender! I wish they used more veggies in their curry, but I always order extra. The portions are huge and the rice is never dried out. I do find that sometimes there is way too much curry in proportion to the rice, but the last few times this has not been an issue. So maybe the owner is catching on after reading some Yelp reviews! In any case, I'm super glad that Volcano exists. It's the only place I've found in the city that tastes home cooked.
author: Kay B.

description:
I was really excited to try this place since I am a big fan of Japanese curry.   Walking in I loved  the modern and yet simple decor.  Ok on to talking about the food...   I had the chicken curry with the potato croquet.  What can I say?  It was ok.  I kept eating waiting for the "WOW" factor to kick in and it just never did.  It was kind of bland for my taste and the chicken tasted boiled.

My expectations for Japanese curry rivals that of "Curry House" on Oahu.  (Those of you who love curry and go back to the islands know what I am talking about!)  I'll give it a try one more time and have the chicken katsu with spicy curry...maybe that will change my mind so that I can give these guys another star....
author: Cris H.

description:
Just called to see if they can accommodate a large dinner party tomorrow, but no avail.

They're pushing back their grand opening to Monday, February 23.
author: Jenny L.

description: Oh yes. The bomb. If you've lived in Japan and you are craving that curry house experience, this is the place to be. If you haven't lived in Japan/aren't familiar with Japanese curry--this is the place for you to get introduced to it. Chiken katsu--bomb. Sauasage--bomb. Tofu nuggets--bomb. You really can't go wrong. Be sure to get fukujinzuke. They are little slices of pickled sweet radish that are required on any plate of respectable Japanese curry. Don't worry; you'll love them. Man, I have been searching for a place like this for so long, I can't say enough good stuff about them. Puts On The Bridge on notice.
author: Sbicy Meatball J.

description:
I have to say I AM a Japanese curry connoisseur. I used to love Hurry Curry of Tokyo in Los Angeles, and I've eaten tons of Japanese curry at various places (mom and pop as well as chain) in Japan.

This place, for SF, was pretty darn good. I've tried the other two curry-only establishments (Muraccis and Over the Bridge) and neither satisfied me. I thought the curry sauce at Volcano was flavorful, if not a bit sweet, which I like, and not too watery. The chicken katsu was all white meat, hot, and crispy, just how it should be. It is quick, and affordable.

In short, I like. I'll be back.
author: Katie B.

description:
I have a friend that LOVES this place.
So it's nice that they have a frequent buyer's card, which earn you free toppings.

Japanese curry is different from Indian Curry. I lean toward Japanese, so this place is good.

Their curry plates are simple and good. Though because I have friend who makes it as well, the simplicity can be a let down. 2 pieces of carrot, 2 chunks of zucchini, 1-2 wedges of potato...but still yummy and filling.

+My favorite is the mini spam katsu sandwich for $1.75
Those things are TASTY!

+No minimum for credit cards which is a rarity for small Asian restaurants in SF

-We had 5 people and the server couldn't quite give the right plate to the right people, and switched up a medium and spicy... she probably does better with small groups. So get your own number if you want to eliminate the confusion.
author: Angel L.

description:
FIrst off, I have to say I by no means a japanese curry connoisseur. 

Second off, I have to say that I hate it when people review things that they don't really like in the first place. "I don't really even like sushi, but I went cuz my friends wanted to. It was alright. 2 stars." ...it's like really? Why did you even bother reviewing it. You don't even like sushi.

Anyways.. so I just want to preface my review with... I have not had the best curry in the entire world and I am comparing it to that. I have had regular japanese curry you get at a japanese restaurant. 

I wanted to try this place since it opened. The possiblity of a quick to-go rice plate place in my neighborhood for those I-am-too-tired-to-lift-a-pinky-to-make-myself-some-damned-dinner-after-work nights, was too hard to resist. (Actually I wish there were more places like this ...just like fast food in Asia) I did read the reviews here first - but I'm glad I took it with a grain of salt.

First of all, the portions were huge. I got the chicken katsu curry with potato croquette. I got a huge piece of chicken katsu which was light and delicious and same with the croquette. The curry did seem thin for japanese curry, but it had good spice and it didn't give me that weird feeling i get from japanese curry afterwards. 

I must say that probably the paper plates are not the best idea. This is curry for god's sake.... you want to be able to scrape that stuff without getting pieces of paper or something (which didn't happen, but if i let it sit longer, it could had).

But for the person that actually complained that this was a quick to-go place.... I think they said it was the "L&L of japanese curry" ...i say to you this:

 I like L&L. I think it's great. I think it's better than Hukilau any day. Japanese curry is suppose to be fast. Judge the place for what it is, not what it should be. What it is: A whole lot of decent curry to-go for $5 to $7.
author: Bonnie H.

description: Love this place, nice staff, clean kitchen and delicious food.  Their volcano-level curry has great heat while still being flavorful and their meats and noodles are cooked well.  The spam katsu mini sandwich is the stuff of dreams if you're into tempura and spam.  The interior feels a little cheap and it can get hot sometimes when the sun beams in, but those things aren't as important to me as the rest.  This is only place I frequent that I have to drive to, I like it that much.
author: Chris H.

description: Every time I am in San Francisco I make a point to try and eat here if I can. I am a big fan of Japanese curry dishes, something you just really can't get much of in Sacramento. This place has never disappointed me thus far. Curry is nice a solid, not runny like other places I have been to, and with it on top of tonkatsu plates - yum! It's even better during the cold winter to have a belly full of warm curry. I mean, winning the Lottery would be better, but warm, delicious curry in my belly? Pretty damn good.
author: Chris M.

description: This place's curry is real tasty. The two  reasoner  Why I'm giving this spot four stars is because they got my order wrong and it took quite a bit of time for 12 noon to get the food...but the chicken curry is legit!!
author: John C.

description: This was my first Japanese curry experience and I have to say that I'm hooked!  We came after a morning/afternoon of bouldering and were all really hungry.  I got the spiciest curry beef option which still could have been spicier but it was still really good.  Even being so hungry, I still wasn't able to finish my plate.  They give you a LOT of rice.  I'll definitely be coming back here
author: Jenny S.

description:
When my boyfriend and I found ourselves in the Outer Richmond last week, we decided to look for a cheap place to eat a late lunch. I almost decided against eating at Volcano, based on the unappetizing yellow-tinted pictures of the dishes displayed on the window. I'm easily swayed by low prices though and decided we eat at Volcano anyway.

The inside of the restaurant was clean, modern, and simply decorated. The girl behind the counter was helpful and incredibly sweet. My boyfriend and I both felt really bad because we didn't have any cash to put in the tip jar. I ordered chicken curry with a potato croquette and my boyfriend ordered chicken katsu with tofu. The curry was flavorful, with just the right amount of spice (I chose "medium" spiciness, if I remember correctly). The serving sizes were large, not enough for leftovers but just enough to fill you up. I'm often disappointed that restaurants serve more rice than curry, but I'd say the rice and curry portions at Volcano were about the same. Definitely a great place to visit for a quick cheap lunch or dinner. I'll be sure to make sure I have a little cash on me next time for the tip jar!

Oh, and if you have a guilty desire for chicken mcnuggets, order the fried tofu and that will satiate your craving.
author: Rose S.

description:
OK, this is a very new restaurant, like this week new.  So, I read the harsh reviews here and only think, you folks need to relax!  Give a place a fair shake before posting o' your bum.  Oh wait, I forgot, this is Yelp. . . .

The good news - Volcano is a tasty, casual, inexpensive curry house in the Japanese style, with fried pork or chicken cutlet topping a mildly spicy curry with grilled veggies.  You can order regular, hot, or Volcano hot, with a couple toppings and it'll cost under $12.  I recommend the Japanese pickled radish, fukujinzuke, definitely a must-have with curry.  Right now they don't have a vegetarian curry option, but hopefully down the road this will happen.  Fried items are fresh and tasty.

The space is very casual, almost fast food style.  It's not going to want you to stay and linger, but if you are in the mood for some tasty curry in the Richmond, you should definitely try out this newcomer.  

I will visit Volcano again soon, and update this review.
author: Todd E.

description:
Awesome place for Katsu curry!  The Katsu is crispy and fresh - I really like the batter, and it comes with a bed of grilled veggies to keep the Katsu raised up so it doesn't get soggy.  I usually get the curry with extra red pickle, which gives the dish a little more crunchy texture and cuts the heaviness of the curry.

The 4-stars is for the Katsu curry, but I'm not as much of a fan of the plain chicken curry (3-stars).  The chicken appears to be pre-cooked and then added to the curry for reheating...would prefer the chicken to be fresher/juicier.

Someone has mentioned that the curry wasn't thick enough for them...I can see that.  The curry is just thick enough in my opinion.  Any thicker, and I feel like it would be too heavy for me (as some curries seem to congeal a little as they cool).
author: Fontane L.

description:
Cheap.  Sincere.  Amiable.

Right, so it's not the best Asian curry you'll ever have, but it's definitely not terrible, especially if you're a meat and potatoes (not curry connoisseur) kind of guy.

For FIVE bucks, you get a paper plate full of curry and delicious veggies and two heaping scoops of rice!  My veggies were the highlight of the dish - carrots were exceptionally sweet, savory, and tender and the eggplant was hearty and flavorful and certainly not mushy.  The curry was a bit watery and had a misplaced hint of BBQ sauce flavor (?) but it was forgivable.

The service is extremely friendly.  Keeping in mind that this is more reminiscent of a clean, hip fast food-joint than a full service restaurant, the kind girl behind the counter was ever diligent in making sure that we were enjoying our experience and un-necessarily cleared our table for us.

Walls are adorned with art-deco 'Frisco landmarks and institutions  - very cool.  

$So cheap!  $5 for a filling plate of veggies, rice, curry, and pickled cucumbers.
author: Jane L.

description:
My wife and I, after living in the area for over a year and a half, decided to finally check it out.  We aren't curry connoisseurs in the least, but we've had a decent amount of curry in our lives together (particularly the Japanese style).  

The restaurant itself is a bit simple.  Simple in the sense that it could be greater.  It could be more of a "sit down" lunch & dinner spot, rather than a mediocre sell as a diner-esqe establishment.  This place, if they wanted to, could be a legit restaurant filled with the murmur of the Neo Asian hipster youth culture, but alas, it maintains it's diner-esque environment.  Single star for the ambiance.

'Yeah, but what about the food', you ask?  Well, the flavors are good.  Great? Not quite, but well meaning.  I appreciate the availability of choice when it comes to the levels of spicy heat, but what I really needed was a choice of curry thickness, as the curry came out as a soupy sauce.  Everything was separated from the other.  The rice and vegetables sat on the sauce, as did the tonkatsu (deep fried pork cutlet).  I believe that the sauce was cooked independent of the vegetables and meat - a strange notion, when considering my own experiential view of curry.  All in all, the curry (and tonkatsu) get a solid three stars.  Unfortunately, no more, but fortunately, no less.
author: Darkie L.

description:
Can we give this place a round of applause for having racially diverse workers up in a Japanese Curry house?! A caucasian girl, a japanese girl, and a mexican working in all of its synchronicity to make a "curry."  Yes we all had better curry indeed.. but if a 4 year old sings the national anthem out of tune.. are you going to judge the singing or the effort?   

Here is my true experience: Even though my friend and I were supposed to get our own water and utensils, the cashier actually poured our water and got our utensils ready for us. Of course I was wearing a Naruto Ninja outfit on but that is besides the point..

This place shouldn't be called Volcano. 
It should be called Melting Pot O' Curry.
author: Jon F.

description:
OK.. I came here cuz a friend suggested me that their curry is smokin good! I ordered their katsu curry - VOLCANIC: which I think very spicy to the point that i couldnt taste much of the curry flavor. The less spicy one would have better taste of the curry. The portion was quite generous - filled me up to the max. The price is reasonably cheap.

I wont recommend if you'r coming in a big group since they prolly have 6-8 tables max. 

Will comeback!
author: Ray S.

description: Pretty good. We decided to try this place out when we overheard a conversation at another curry place about how much better this place was. The drive there sucked because the traffic was horrible, but I'm guessing that that's just because we went during Fleet Week. We were able to find smoe parking right across the street.
