There wasn't a line or anything when we went in the late afternoon, but the cashier told us there is usually a 15-20 minute wait during dinner time. I got the Pork Katsu Curry (medium-spicy) and my boyfriend got the beef curry (hot-spicy). It was good! I wouldn't say it was the best Japanese curry we've tried, but it was still yum and filling. I would get the next level of spicy next time, because the medium level wasn't spicy at all.
author: Raizel G.

description: It's hard to find a good Japanese curry spot here in SF, but Volcano makes me so so happy! I always order the fried fish curry with brown rice.  It's spicy, tasty, fresh, and you can customize your toppings. And for Spam lovers like myself and those that are a little more adventurous, try the spam katsu sandwich! So bomb. The staff here is also super friendly and service is quick.
author: Meesh N.

description:
After reading reviews on Yelp, I decided to try it a while back. 
I L-O-V-E THIS PLACE. I go here so often that I'm embarassed and am tempted to hide my face with a fake mustache and stick on caterpillar eye brows :P

It's now my favorite Japanese curry restaurant!!!!

I love the CHICKEN KATSU AND POTATO CROQUETTES. The pork katsu is awesome and the beef curry is delish! Most of their dishes come sided with rice and you can add an assortment of toppings :)

They have little point cards that tally up: you can get free toppings and eventually a curry meal as your points add up with every purchase :D :D :D

Order whatever because it's all good!!!!!
author: Vada K.

description:
Very good -- a solid, solid, j-curry.  Strange music, though, ya.  I heard an eclectic mix of 80s and country and heaven knows what else.  I wouldn't mind so much except they were so slow and I didn't have any earphones for the mp3 player (I had brought it to read -- ***** re: Stanza, by the way.)  Anyhow it was well worth the wait.  My spicy curry with fried shrimp, egg, and croquette was great.  The egg was perfect; creamy and delicious.  The spicy curry was very, very flavorful with almost an undercurrent of black-pepper-hot (vs. say, chili-hot), but no, it doesn't blow you away with the heat.  I guess I'm getting old, because that's exactly how I like it.

Aside from the music, my other complaint is with the lack of a curry ramen or curry udon on the menu.  They have noodles, but as a starch, not a soup.

They close too early.  A curry place like this should be open until at least midnight, if not one or two (or three!) am.
author: Eric W.

description:
Wow - yelper's are fast....just tried this out and overall this is good.

Its definitely set up for fast food (including bussing your own table) and the dining room is spare; but clean.

The Chicken katsu is good; I got the spicy which was a little tamer than I owuld have liked - Volcano style next time :-)

The katsue was piping hot; and crunchy; and the curry was a little sweet and spicy at the same time.  Better than the japanese curry I make at home (out of the packet).  Plus with the prices (low) I think this is a recommendation on my part.
author: Omer K.

description: Hard to find good Japanese curry in SF. This place fills a big void. I would only rate one other place higher... The Japa Curry lunch truck.
author: Joseph H.

description: I had the tomato chicken and my mom had chicken udon.  The prices and portions are so reasonable!  I can't vouch for the authenticity, but I enjoyed it and I am planning to go back.  Great for a quick eat.
author: Tony And Candace T.

description:
The prices are extremely reasonable, and Japanese curry is always sort of fast-food like, so you shouldn't let it bother you that this place is fast- food like. I've had plenty of curry in my life that was just sauce and rice - at Volcano there are nice, actual big chunks of vegetables in the sauce. It's comforting (especially if you're Japanese American), spicy (you have to get the "hot", not the "regular" - the regular version is too mild and kind of blah. If you're a real wimp about spicy food, have your friend get the "hot" while you get the "regular", and  put a few spoonfuls of their sauce into your sauce.)  It's nice that you can get white rice or brown rice, and that you can do this sort of build-your-own thing by adding extra zucchini, eggplant, pickles, potato croquette, etc. 

It's a small, clean, not-highly-decorated storefront - no, it's not the lobby of the Fairmont Hotel, but it's pleasant enough, and I find the cleanliness very nice. Actually, the cleanliness is kind of a miracle, considering the moldy, damp, pigeon hangout of Geary Blvd. in general! It is totally worth a try. And yes, they do serve on paper plates, but they have real cups, drinking water and a cute little Igloo filled with ice, with an ice scooper, so at least you're not using yet another paper cup, like everyone who gets a daily Starbucks drink.
author: Dani Y.

description:
Came here today with my mom.  There wasnt much ppl there, I think including us there were only 10 people in the whole place.  Now saying that you would think that you should be able to get your food pretty fast, seeing there there is like no one there.  Plus, how hard can it be to heat up the same sauce the same meat/veggie.  NOPe... took at least 10 minutes to get our food after we ordered.  I cant imagine it needed that much time to make that food.  THATS ALL THEY MAKE.... CURRY.. THE SAME SAUCE THE SAME INGREDIENT OVER AND OVER AGAIN.

Anyways... the food was OK.  I got the chicken Katsu with spicy curry.  It was pretty good.  The curry was spicy enough.  The chicken was a pretty decent size.  I also added a coquette.  That was pretty good too, nice and smooth in the inside.  

NOt sure I will come back though.  nothing special....
author: Janet S.

description:
Since eating at the Curry House in Honolulu, HI (my Hawaii nei), the bf has been OBSESSED with Japanese curry, chicken katsu, and rice.  We found Volcano on Yelp and decided to give it a shot since I live in the area.  We ordered the Curry, medium spicy with Chicken Katsu.  

I may be spoiled with good Japanese curry since I"m from Hawaii, but I really found the curry here to be tasteless and watery.  I give it 3 stars since it wasn't horrible, but it wasn't that great either.  I'm glad we got some Chicken Katsu with it (which was also ok) b/c if we didn't I would have been completely disappointed.  It gave it a nice crunch.  

Overall, I think the meal was very "meh" - deserving of 3 stars.
author: Angelica Z.

description: this is amazing, I just get the chicken katsu curry its hella bomb!!!
author: Tony M.

description: Convenient, reasonably priced, delicious, in my neighborhood. 'Nuff said.
author: B Y.

description:
Volcano Curry is an average at best Japanese-style curry joint.  I could be wrong but I think the place is run by Korean people, not Japanese people, if you are looking for pure authenticity.

GOOD:
- Plenty of metered parking along Geary before 6:00PM.
- Service is pretty fast and the food comes out in a few minutes.  
- Plenty of clean tables and seats and not cramped like many other places that specialize in Japanese curry that I have been to.

JUST OKAY:
- The pork katsu curry was okay (about $7). The katsu was good but the curry could have been better. It was decently thick but a little on the bland size. I got the medium level spiciness and it was not spicy at all. Portion size is good but not overwhelming and it comes with some slices of carrots, zucchini and potato.
- I added a "Japanese" sausage to my order. I was expecting kurobuta sausage but what I got resembled a hot dog link (the skinny Oscar Meyer kind). I was disappointed but the sausage/hot dog tasted much better than how it looked. That being said, I wouldn't order it again because I want kurobuta sausage, not an Oscar Meyer hot dog looking sausage.
- The potato croquette wasn't very good in my opinion. It was mushy and not a very good Japanese croquette. I would not get it again.   

BAD:
- Nothing really bad here. Maybe the only real complaint is that they give super stingy portions of their Japanese pickles with their curry. They really force you to pay $1 more for extra pickles if you like them even just a little bit. 

CONCLUSION: Volcano Curry serves some average-quality Japanese curry and it will only cost you about $7-8. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but if I was nearby and wanted Japanese curry, I would eat here again.
author: Alex P.

description: I don't particularly like curry but this place makes me want to eat it. Don't know what more to say.
author: Adeline L.

description: Delish curry sauce and good cut of pork for the tonkatsu. Would be nice if they served a bit more rice, but good value for money in any case. Order at the counter and take a number on a stand, and they deliver. Nice friendly staff.
author: Bruce C.

description: I love it. I am a Burmese and somehow curry from this Japanese restaurant taste so much like curry from Burma. It's not that expensive and close to my place.
author: Pan P.

description:
Ah volcano... I first heard about this place 5 months ago... but didn't go because I have an impression in my mind.. that there is no curry shop on geary that can beat one in japan town. I was right. 

After looking at the menu posted outside, I figured that the price for the curry was relatively cheap. However, after walking in to the restaurant and ordering, the price of the curry evens out. (they charge a dollar for a boiled egg) 

the potato croquette was pretty good, though i don't believe that they made it themselves.. but what do I know. The tonkatsu was pretty good though. Nicely breaded and at a good temperature. I got the volcano curry, (spicy) I was a bit disappointed. The curry tasted the same as the medium curry.. except it had an aftertaste... like they had put in a hot sauce from a bottle.. and mixed it with the medium curry to make it "spicy". It could've been sriracha or tobasco. It was an interesting flavor. Also, being a Japanese curry enthusiast.. the texture of the curry was disappointing. The curry seemed to be watered down, and not as thick as previous Japanese curries that i have had and enjoyed. 

Overall, the tonkatsu was tasty, the curry flavor was relatively enjoyable, but the texture was not thick like I liked Japanese curry to be.
author: Tony W.

description: Curry is pretty good here. It's not the chinese or indian style curry. Its japanese style. I think. Since it taste like those from other japanese restaurant around. I got the mild, since i anticipated it to be bit more hot that what it was labeled. I was wrong. they dont label like some other places. I should of gotten at least a hot. Got the katsu curry rice. it was pretty good, would be better if i ordered HOT. If you like curry, try it out for yourself. See will you like it or hate it.
author: Albert W.

description:
I love going here! I usually get a Spam Katsu sandwich and either chicken curry or tomato chicken when i am here. It is not worth it for brown rice, but It takes great with white rice. 

Its not a fancy place, its just good japanese curry. Food comes out quickly and you bust your own table. 
The rewards stamp card is an added benefit.
author: Vicki C.

description:
Katsu is never the same without that awesome spicy curry on top of it.  

I think i was suspect at eating here at first, because it was completely empty on a Saturday night, where the parking outside was busier than the restaurant itself.  But after a few plates of that awesome katsu, it made all the time spent looking for parking worth it.

A highlight of their dishes, is the variety of vegetables they offer.  But dont be fooled the katsu is still king.

Stay hungry friends
author: J Y.

description: I love Japanese curry and this was my first time trying this place with my girlfriend. Staff was friendly and service was pretty quick. The flavor was great and the chicken katsu was yummy! Vegetables were steamed pretty well. Definitely coming back to this place.
author: Son H.

description:
Pretty good.

I got the chicken katsu. The chicken was pretty good quality. Each order comes with rice and some veggies (potatoes and zucchini).

I ordered my curry hot - and pretty sure it wasn't even medium.

Service is really nice, each order is made to order and they're relatively fast.
author: Chili B.

description: Good curry, but not great. Shout out for having spam katsu mini sandwich.
author: Kai C.

description: I thought it was restaurant style ordering, but few reviews on yelp failed to mention how to order here. I was confused when I walked in, thinking the guy behind the counter would give us menus. Then I finally saw the "Order here" sign. The menu was behind this wall too, so I couldn't see that it was a menu when I first walked in. Long story short, it's like fastfood restaurant ordering. You choose to eat there or to go. You get your own utensils if you eat there. Overall, the food was great. The plates could be a little bigger, to accompany the amount of food on the plate. The curry was reallly good. I believe it's family run. I definitely want to go again!!
author: Angela H.

description:
The staff/owner is great, super service. I always get the beef curry "volcano" hot. It comes with slow roasted potatoes and carrots....the beef is awesome. I like it hot, so add the jalapenos. Prices are perfectly reasonable. 

My kids and wife find things they like on the menu, too.
author: Biff A.

description:
The food is pretty good.  I recommend the chicken katsu sandwich, it has a nice crunchy tangy coleslow wrapped in soft bread and crispy katsu.  Its the right balance of crunchy and tasty.  The curry is on the spot.  If you can handle really spicy then there's the volcano spicy but mild was spicy enough for my taste.  Volcano spicy should come with a warning label, its pretty darn hot.  

As for the service, the getup is really self service and I like that they are clean.  The service has always been good, except on my last visit a staff who was a girl behind the counter continued to check up on us every other 5 mins on our meal to see if we were ok and each time we said yes, thank you.  By the 4th or 5th time she asked the same question, we were annoyed that we couldn't hold a conversation and left the place.  I don't understand why she had to do that.  Does excessively checking up on a customer every few minutes constitute as rude interruptions?  You bet! I'll consider it a 'fluke' and give them another chance though, since it was just once...and the others seem respectfully nice.
author: Peachie Y.

description: i went here twice and ordered chicken katsu curry. it's super good. for the price, it's cheaper than good curry at japan town and around downtown and the portion is big. i love spicy so for the second time i went there, i ordered triple volcano spicy. I recommend triple volcano for the spicy lovers.  For the side dish, the potato croquette is great!
author: Allentine T.

description:
Seems like a lot of people are having trouble with the chicken.

Well...i don't order it and my experience has been fine.

I usually get the pork katsu with volcano curry. Sometimes a side of sausage. For the money i find it decent and have no general beef with this restaurant.
author: Richard D.

description:
I thought this place was great for what it was, a super casual order-at-the counter type place. I ordered the tomato chicken curry and it was so good! I got the hot version and it was just the right amount of spicy. 

Will I go back? Honestly, probably not because it's out of the way for me and there are so many other places to try in the city. But should you try it? Absolutely! I recommend the tomato chicken curry. My boyfriend got the Chicken Katsu (fried) and also thought it was good. 

Even better, I had a scoutmob deal so it was half off. yay. Even without the deal you can easily leave with a good amount of food for under $10. Don't expect gourmet, and you won't be disappointed.
author: Caitlin B.

description: Absolutely delicious food at very reasonable prices. Their curry is fantastic. It's a bit of a hike for someone living in the downtown area, but definitely worth it.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Don't understand the "no vegetarian options" comment. Unless that just happened recently, I saw a vegetarian curry option on the menu. 

At any rate, no, this is not as good as Muracci on Kearny, downtown. BUT Volcano is open after 6pm for dinner and it is in my neighborhood.

The normal prices are extremely reasonable, but tonight even more so. I used my little Val-U-Pak coupon for $4.95 each curry. Got 2 pork katsu curries to go. It was quite a decent meal. I usually order the curry without the zucchini, as I'm not a zucchini lover. 

You gotta order the curry at medium spicy at the minimum. Otherwise, it's flavorless. Both pork and chicken katsu are very decent. I've been here about once a month since I moved to the hood, and it's always decent, fast, and cheap. 

I saw tonight that they've added some noodle soup option, including a beef curry noodle. Gotta try some! Good option for upcoming winter days. I asked them what type of noodle, and they said udon.
author: Lola X.

description: Loved the Curry Chicken Katsu with Noodles ($1 more for noodles)!  The potato croquette was yummy too!  I thought the noodles might be a "spaghetti-like" noodle, but the gal said they use udon noodles which wound up to be very tender and delicious.  I got "medium" which was perfect as I wanted something one notch up from not spicy since I don't usually eat spicy...  Would definitely go back there again!
author: Jennie L.

description:
Over the years it has gotten better. i tried it again and have found it to e on par with packaged rue s good when i don't feel like cooking.
Updated-
I  was so excited to see this place open and better yet close to my house. Then I went in. Terrible curry. I was so sad. Back to "On the Bridge" in J Town for me. It seems so simple...the instant curries from the market are much better....So Sad....Please someone find a good curry in the richmond district.
author: John D.

description: satisfying.  tried chicken katsu and pork katsu.  hot and medium.  hot is better if you want that stronger spice not typically present in japanese curry.  medium has a sweeter taste to it.  medium consistency sauce and some soft carrot/potatoes.
author: Rob C.

description:
If I could give NO STARS, I would. And I would like to apologize to my friend for making her go here at random, especially cause she hates curry and this place most certainly did not change her mind.

We decided to skip Gordo's next door and check out this newly opened place. I regretted coming in as soon as I smelled the place. It reeked of plastic and bad sauce. We ordered anyways. I got the Spicy Chicken Katsu with noodles and my friend got the Pork Katsu with eggplant. The whole thing cost us about $16 and we sat down to wait for our food.

The whole time I kept saying how I knew this place was janky and I was scared of what we would be getting. Finally they brought out our food and I turned out to be completely right. My place had chicken pieces on top of noodles and a side consisting of zucchini (about 3 pieces) and half of a small potato. All this was decked out in some kind of "curry sauce". My friend's plate didn't look any better, except with eggplant and rice. The whole thing tasted very weird and just plain bad. Compared to other amazing places I've been in the city this joint is pretty much a waste of time, money and a buzz kill.  We didn't even eat half of our plates and the whole time talked about how it's all my fault...which it really is. 

So once again, I'm sorry to both of our stomachs. 

P.S...some people mentioned paper plates, which is all that place needed to add on to it's jankyness. :(
author: Bella S.

description: Got the Tonkatsu curry with onion croquette level 4 spiciness. Definitely a surprise with the spiciness, not something typical you can get with japanese curry. The tonkatsu was alright, and even though the spiciness was okay, it made the curry taste a little funny. Would try again non level 4.
author: Danny K.

description: There's been a lot of complaints and grumbling about the paper plates at Volcano, but seriously people, the meal is $5! I have to admit that I've only had katsu curry a couple times, but I thought for the price this was some tasty curry. I also thought the side of veggies was different, but a nice addition. Be sure to order it hot, and don't forget the potato croquets and the Calpis.  BTW, the serving was more than enough to fill me up, but then again I don't usually eat a lot for lunch.
author: Staci B.

description:
I'm kind of confused by the negative reviews. I've been here three times, and each time it's been pretty darn good. I've had the beef, the chicken, and the pork cutlet. The menu is super-simple, and I think it's a pleasure to have a place that specializes in something, and does just that, unlike, say, all the Japanese restaurants that add ramen just to have it on the menu, but that don't do that dish service. 

The complaints about decor and paper plates -- well, I'm not sure what to say about those. It's a simple place, with simple service. That appeals to me. It's a little pricey for lunch, but for 6.95 (the most expensive dish in the curry menu), you're sure to be full for dinner.
author: OuterLands X.

description:
yum! not quite tokyo-caliber cheap curry but good nonetheless. it's a shame that they're so far out in the richmond because they could make a killing in fidi based on the variety and prices.

i had the tomato chicken curry medium, which was spicier than i expected (but still manageable)... it even had cooked jalapenos swimming with the chicken... hooo! my boyfriend had the pork katsu curry medium which was solid. best thing were the croquettes--the onion in particular, which was something we've never tasted before (like a creamy onion ring?!?).

total? just under $18 to feed two hungry souls. would definitely visit again if i can't figure out where else to go.
author: Andrey C.

description: WOW! i come here so often. I love getting the beef noodle with volcano curry. i love it spicy! i introduced many of my friends here and they all loved it. if you get volacno there, i hope you can take spicy stuff well.
author: Terrance Z.

description: When I crave Japanese curry and it's too far, I literally walk down the block and go here. I usually always get thr chicken katsu curry "volcano" spicy hot level. Friendly staff told me there is a "secret" double volcano level.. Will have to try that next time. Four stars for being Cheap, clean, and convienient. Minus one because there are better japanese curry spots in sf.
author: Cliff L.

description: I've never had such crispy croquettes with such lovely creamy, tasty filling inside--Yum-- Their onion croquettes awesome! So savory.  Nice.  And their chicken katsu sandwich - the best, tender chicken encased in crispy breadcrumbs, sandwiched with coleslaw, probably mixed in Japanese salad dressing cos' it has the right mix of savory and very slight sweetness, between Japanese-style thick sliced milk bread. Best sandwich I've tasted in ages! Can't wait to try all their menu items.
author: Sheue L.

description:
I love Japanese curry, simply because it is delicious and simple. Although it took me 7 months to finally step foot in here, I'm glad I did. When I'm craving curry and don't have enough time to cook it on my own, I am coming here. It literally takes 2 minutes after you walk in the store. They have 4 levels of spiciness (3rd level "Hot" is plenty spicy for me). 

They are quite generous with chicken and portions - it was enough to last me 2 meals. It was about $7 including tax. Considering I get crappy lunch food for the same, I can't complain. Woot.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I passed up a Koren BBQ place and a Japanese sushi house because my adventurous butt wanted to try Japanese curry. The name Volcano suggested incredible spicy heat. Well... let's get to the exposure.

The fill in the blank Katsu pics looked pretty good on the wall menus. We noticed because you have to order from the counter. Cool... reduces the tip a few notches. So what's the scoop on this curry? They pour it over the ______ (pork, chicken) Katsu. I chose pork, with calamari rings (extra 1.50) with level 3 of 4 levels of heat. Served with rice and Miso Soup if you want to pay for it as a side. The flavor was only adequate, while the heat was weak. Level 4 would probably be a joke too. There is no extra charge for the Volcano Heat options, so the menu promos are pretty much a waste of ink. Oh yeah, they also have Teriyaki Chicken and Tempura on the menu. The Teriyaki was OK, served with rice... and the Tempura (shrimp) is offered as add on sides to the Katsu or Teriyaki... at a buck or more a piece. Don't get excited... the shrimp seems pre breaded or battered most likely frozen. Beverages include tea bags with hot water and cans of drinks all available for you to pick out from a display.

All the food tastes just like you'd imagine would fit my description. Not bad, but less than good restaurant quality. Kind of like Jollibee. Want another hint? They offer frequent dining coupons... I dunno 10 visits and you get a free curry dish or something. Oh, you've got another option. Leave your dirty dishes on your table... or sort out your trash, recycling, utensils at their recepticles. Just follow the directions on the wall. Uh... we chose the former, wanting to leave a tip. Service was OK, by the way.

You want decent Curry...? Go with Indian, Pakistani, Thai or even Chinese. If someone suggests Volcano, best pass before disappointments erupt.
author: Rick V.

description:
Went here for lunch with a 50% off coupon from ScoutMob. 

Solid food. Volcano spicy is SPICY. The curry was pretty good, not watery and flavorful. The curry came with a few pieces of vegetables but could've had more. The chicken katsu was adequately thick and not meatless like some other places.

Can't expect too much for a $7.25 plate. Cheap and decent.
author: Anthony L.

description: I love curry! This place hits the spot...I got the medium and its the right amount of spice....Next time I will try the next hottest one. The space is a bit small but really friendly service...The only thing I didnt like was that someone took a deuce in the bathroom but did not flush! It was disgusting! But not the restaurants fault....People...PLEASE FLUSH!
author: Brendan L.

description: Ordered the chicken Katsu n potatoe croquettes ..dish was very good.would come back
author: Avery H.

description:
ok, i am so so sorry i was miss curry snob in my last review of the joint.  I went in today to check out their expanded menu.  i was so impressed!  i ordered tenpura noodle soup togo.  im not sure what i can compare the broth to, but it hit the spot.  i have a stomach problem that was acting up today so the ginger aroma and taste were nice.  i guess you could say maybe- shoyu, dashi, lots of sweet cooking sake,  and when you add the tenpura haystack, it gets a lil bit of fried veggie goodness to complete the taste.  personally, next time i might water it down a bit.  i saw someone order the sandwich and it looked heavenly!!
huge!  japanese white square bread, katsu, cabbage and tonkatsu sauce.  extra charge for toasting the bread though?
one thing i have always noticed about japanese owned places is that they will often have strange rules or requests.  fucking weirdos! 
ok, thanks for reading my update!
author: yayoi s.

description: My favorite Japanese curry place to eat. Their chicken katsu is always crispy, even though the sauce is on it. Its a hearty portion for the price and the service is good. I always order medium because its got a nice kick to it, but its not too spicy that I can't taste my food. But you have to know, Japanese curry is my comfort food. =)
author: Cindy S.

description:
Why are people giving this restaurant such low ratings?  People (vegans) are so stupid sometimes.  I give this 5 stars for several reasons:

1) FOOD - The curry is outstanding. I don't understand why people are complaining about the amount of food.  My chicken curry had plenty of vegetables, a good amount of chicken, and the perfect blend of rice and curry.  Obviously, you want to hear about the curry.  What can I say?  It's hot, flavorful, and spicy.  I like Tani's, but this is much better than Tani's.  I was also impressed by the chunks of vegetables.  Usually you'll get these small, freeze dried vegetables, but here they give you big chunks of vegetables.  I would also like to add that the potato croquette adds a lot to the meal, so I would go get that if you don't mind spending another $1.25.  In all, the food here is great.

2) MENU - All it is is curry.  I love it when menus are small and focus only on one thing.  You don't have to think.  It also means that they specialize on only dish.  Perfect.  No sushi, no ramen, just curry.  

3) PRICE - You won't find a cheaper restaurant for curry.  You also don't have to tip because they take your order at a counter (like a McDonalds) and you just wait and then take a seat.  So not only is it cheap, there's no additional cost.  They did raise their price on some of the sides, but only by a few cents.  

In all, this place is great if you want straight up japanese curry and nothing else.  If you're a vegan, stop complaining.  I'm sick and tired of people wanting vegan options and therefore giving this place low ratings.  Japanese curry was never meant to be vegetarian.  Stop trying to enforce your views on ethnic dishes that were never meant to be vegetarian in the first place.  Don't say, "This is San Francisco, you should have vegetarian options."  In the words of Biff, "Make like a tree, and get outta here."

So if you're not an elitist vegan who originally grew up in Oregon, yet calls themselves a San Franciscan just because they're attending some art school here and you'd like some curry on a cold day, come to Volcano.
author: SAS Z.

description: Love me some curry.  Hear that?  Mmm, .  .  This place has great curry for the price.  A fried curry dish slice of heaven.
author: Thomas G.

description: This is a casual place.  There is no table service, you order at the counter and sit yourself.  Good quality food.
author: Jason H.

description: I can't handle anything spicy so I usually get the chicken katsu or tonkatsu (the pork katsu) with mild curry.  Even without the extra spice, everything is still very tasty.  Each time I've visited (which is quite often), the breaded meat is consistently crispy on the outside and not dry or overcooked on the inside.  They provide more than enough curry for the meal, with some veggies included.  Each plate is a generous serving, and I usually eat until I can no longer eat anymore, which means I lick the plate clean and am beyond stuffed!  As for the atmosphere, it's very casual, and I like the paintings they have on the wall.  It's a simple place to eat, which is just fine with me!
author: K C.

description:
A lot of the negative reviews for this restaurant to my mind focus on irrelevant things like the lighting scheme or the quality of the chairs (really, does anyone care where they bought them?) and where you pick out your drinks (yes they actually refrigerate them!).   To me, what's the most important criteria for deciding a restaurant's quality?  The food.  Duh.  The curry is very smooth and quite flavorful and every other ingredient in my Chicken Katsu curry was cooked perfectly, from the katsu itself and the potatoes and such.  

I'm a big fan of curries, especially Japanese and Indonesian ones, and this place ranks pretty highly among the many places I've eaten excellent curries.  And when you figure that two full dinners (and big portions) came out to a grand total of $16.32 who's going to complain?

I guess if you really, really care about the provenance of a restaurant's chairs, the wattage of its lights and insist that your beverage comes in an ice-cooled silver bucket than you should probably be prepared to spend many more dollars on inferior curries and put up with dismissive service as the logical price for being fashionable.
author: Chris K.

description: 41.5 weeks preggers now and here is my promised update....we went back and had 2 'green salads' and shared the 'original curry' w/extra rice and veggies and chose "hot" for the spice level. WOW...what a perfect meal. I love this place. The salads are big...shredded cabbage, corn, tomatoe and arugula. A salad that you could expect to pay $8 alone for downtown. And the curry was just perfect...a nice rich sweet curry. We asked for extra eggplant since I heard that induces labor. The eggplant was grilled and creamy. We walked it off on a long walk at Land's End but now I'm hungry again and want to go back already!
author: Amy E.

description:
Get over the paper plates and plastic utensils. There's no reason why we're entitled to dinnerware at a place that's order at the counter and the menu is shorter than your checklist for allowed items in your carry on.

The food is fantastic. I got the Chicken Katsu Curry with Potato Croquette. The plate came out HOT, in temperature and spicyness. Service is fast, the place is impeccably clean, and it's no frills. I hate frills.

I'm getting noodles instead of rice next time, just to make it even more wow.
author: Jenny M.

description: I have to say i was a little hesitant to go here at first...BUT my boyfriend came home with half a sandwich for me (he saved some because he was so surprised at how good the place was:) i am a fan of very spicy food and what was so impressive was the curry...(you dip the sandwich in their curry)..they actually made it spicy *granted after he sent it back 3 times to add more of their secret spice* but nonetheless it is delicious! it is not only spicy but the flavor of the curry is very complex...very addicting.The sandwich itself is so so but a very good combo with the curry sauce. I will be back!
author: Sarah F.

description: Great Neighborhood Curry. Get the Rewards Card if you like it, 3rd, 6th, 9th visit you get a free topping. On the 12th you get a free Curry and Topping!!!
author: Christian F.

description:
Amazing! Love this place. It's not exactly health food, and not exactly local organic handcrafted food, but it's pretty awesome drinkin' food.  It's also spicy enough, at least if you get the Volcano option.

Also, really really fast - call in an order and it'll be ready 5-10 minutes later. And nice and cheap.
author: J N.

description:
The first time I stepped into Volcano I was turned off.  It was not what I was expecting at all.  Paper plates?  Plastic utensils?  Am I in a cafeteria?  But after trying the chicken curry, I was easily able to forget all the other stuff.

The curry is on the thin consistency side, but it tastes great.  You can get mild, spicy, or volcano curry (which is surprisingly spicier than I anticipated).  And at about $5 for a meal that fills me up AND is completely satisfying I have made room in my heart and stomach for Volcano.

I now usually just get the original curry because even that is sometimes too big for me to finish, but the potato croquettes and fried shrimp are pretty yummy too.  And can't forget the cream puffs cause they're hella good.

Oh, and they do take credit cards, but only with a $10 min.
author: Violet S.

description:
good authentic japanese style curry. 
they do one thing, and they do it well. i wish there were a few more options, but it's good stuff nonetheless. i definitely suggest trying the katsu curry if you havent been there before. oh, and i got spicy. it wasnt that spicy. go for volcano.
author: Brian T.

description: I love this place for curry. In my opinion, I have yet to find a place with better tasting curry. I know that toppings may be a bit expensive, but in today's world with the economy, a lot of things are becoming more and more expensive.
author: Nick L.

description: I've been coming here since this place opened and I must say, its been a "go to" place for me and my friends.  The food is hearty and the prices are great.  Unfortunately today was my last visit to this establishment.  The service at this place has always left somthing to be desired, but I have always just said to myself that the prices and food were good enough to overlook that.  Enough is enough.  The service here is bad and the food no longer masks that.  I was treated bad by the staff in front of customers.  They even knew who I was and have known me as a regular there for years.  This review is warn others about inconsistent and bad service.  Do not support an establishment that maltreas its customers.
author: B L.

description: i had a change of heart after eating at on the bridge today..their food went totally down!  volcano is now my current choice of location to have japanese curry...woohoo!
author: Jen W.

description:
i have heartburn as i'm writing this.  don't listen to the previous reviewer who said to order at least medium spicy.  she must be some sort of curry ninja.  medium spicy is spicy!  and spicy is pretty much sweat dripping lava hot.  even my friend who claimed to be kung fu curry level started whimpering after a few bites.

i like this place because
-it's clean
-service is friendly and efficient
-self serve water and ice = even cheaper cuz less tip required
-large portions = good deal
-the croquette is the best!

i'm not liking this place because
-my tonkatsu was dry instead of juicy
-the curry was watery and a tad too sweet (it's not gravyish if thats what u like), and i thought the flavor was flat.
-you have to pay extra for the pickles

i might come back to try something else...
author: Josie M.

description: I never really wanted to come to this place, probably because I'm not a huge curry fan but I ended up getting to-go from here because I was starving and I didn't want anything else from around this area. I had the Chicken Katsu "sandwich"....It was ook...nothing that "wow-ed" me, at least not enough for me to want to go out of my way to eat there...the service was nice....they gave me the wrong to-go box and left, but one of the girl attempted to run after me...but I was too fast haha...when I realized it wasn't my order, I took it back and I was told that the girl was looking for me to give me my order. Thought that was sweet of them. But I guess I can't completely give them a bad review since their specialty is curry and I didn't have that...maybe next time...so if you were to really come here, please try the curry instead...
author: Helen T.

description: Ive only done take out from here but the chicken katsu curry is pretty good. They offer different levels of spicyness in their curries and I usually  ask for hot, which is moderately spicy in my opinion--just enough kick without overpowering the natural flavor of the curry. It's also pretty inexpensive; it's about $6-$7 for the curry, chicken, and rice. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who's looking to grab a quick lunch and wants something quick, yummy, cheap and fulfilling.
author: Winnie T.

description:
A nice change from the rows of sushi -teriyaki places in the Richmond.  My girls and I are fans of thier katsu curry. Rich brown curry with a nice kick. Served over steaming rice with just right potatoes or spurlge with extra's like  eggplant or egg.  Wish they would give us more red pickles.
Easy to order- chicken, beef or pork or chicken katsu- no frills-no muss just good hot "fast" food.  
Service with a smile and a nice window seat - curry me over anytime!
author: Grace A.

description:
Food here is pretty average. I had the pork katzu with the potatoes. It's cool that you can let them know how spicy that you want your dinner. Probably too much fried stuff for me w/ a big scoop of rice. 

It is a bit different to be eating on paper plates & with black plastic forks. I hope that they'll either move to real plateware/silverware or possibly compostable forks, so all the items can go into the compost instead of the landfill.
author: M M.

description:
Fresh, each order appears to be custom made.  all good signs, right?  Very flavorful and without MSG, I think.  That's an achievement byitself.  The restaurant was also very neat and clean.  
Only sort of "con" is veggies and meats were cut in pieces that were "too large."
author: Mina C.

description: A jewel of a place in the city. I'm not into spicy food but came for a ride with a group of friends. I was surprise with the veg dish I had. Very good and have to try the other stuff there.
author: Leon C.

description: I had the pork katsu curry and two croquettes ... I'll save my money and go to Muracci's next time.
author: Jeff X.

description: Nice simple Japanese curry.  Yes this is Japanese curry, sorry no vegetarian option required.
author: Kiyoshi O.

description:
Simple tasty curry. I enjoyed the fried chicken cuttlet curry they serve it with potatoes & zucchini which is not the Japanese way but its fine.  Curry was somewhat watery but absorbed well so no complaint.  My friend didn't care for it, I believe because he didn't feel it was authentic. He's right but so what? 
I've had better but it is still not a bad for the price.
I'm still looking for the best Japanese curry in the Bay Area.
author: Sparky W.

description:
on my first trip to japan in 2OO4 when i was 17, i was lucky to have been traveling with a local who took us to hole in the wall spots for authentic japanese eats, rather than hyped up tourist spots :]  it was in a small restaurant in Yamaguchi where i fell in love with...JAPANESE CURRY!!

like most people, i am a creature of habit.  if i like something, i will most likely always order it.  what do i always order at curry places?  T0NKATSU CURRY!  or in volcano curry`s menu`s case, pork katsu curry.  

the pork katsu itself is great.  perfectly panko breaded tender pork cutlets fried to a lovely golden brown.  yummmmm :]  

the curry, however, leaves something to be desired.  i love that it`s full of veggies, such as carrots, zucchini, and potatoes, but the sauce itself has a thin consistancy.  japanese curry is supposed to be a bit thicker than volcano`s, more rich and filling.  the curry here always seems watered down.  

the one time i ordered the fried shrimp curry was a MAJ0R disappointment.  i ordered by phone and had my coworker walk down and pick it up for me.  when i opened up the box, there were two, let me repeat TW0 measly pieces of shrimp in there.  most places will give you 3-4, but volcano only gives you TW0.  i understand that it`s only $6.95 with tax, but come on now, throw us a bone [or shrimp, in my case]!  i seriously felt like i got screwed up the butthole!  

i hate to say it, but the shrimp was good though...panko breaded, perfectly crispy, delicate flavor...but that`s not the point!  LoLx

there are better places to go for authenic japanese curry.
author: Dee W.

description: After my dental cleaning, I was looking to dirty my teeth up again.  Volcano hit the spot.  I ordered the chicken katsu curry, "hot" spicy (there's mild, medium, hot and volcano), with an order of the red pickles.  The katsu was good - the slices were a bit on the thin side, but it was flavorful.  The curry was what I was craving, just the right level of spiciness for me, and I think the best Japanese curry I've found in the city.  They also include large chunks of potatoes, squash and carrots, which is a nice, healthy touch and adds flavor.  The service was friendly and it was inexpensive enough ($8) that I still had money left over for dental floss to undo the damage.
author: Neill T.

description: $5 for the original curry plate and I'm stuffed! Overall it was delicious. Not out-of-this-world but very good. The only negative was that my friend's topping order was mistakenly put on my plate. When we told our waitress, she seemed annoyed. Although we didn't have to ignore it, we did. And overall we enjoyed it.
author: Trisha L.

description: I finally tried Volcano after my bro. recommended this place. I ordered Chicken Katsu Curry and it was good compared to other places. The outer fried section was crispy and not soggy. Great portions and the chicken katsu strips had a chunk of chicken inside (not mostly the breaded part like most places). Mild sauce was not too spicy but can still taste a little "kick" in it. I would come again and try other items.
author: Cor N.

description: Ordered chicken curry with number 3 on the heat.  4 levels, three is hot, 4 is volcano. Was told that the potato croquette is a popular addon, so I gave it a shot.  The plate of food was large and tasty.  Volcano would have probably hurt me.  Next time, I'll drop the potato croquette.  Not sure why it's popular.  It's just a mass produced, breaded and fried potato cake.  It was prepared properly, just not my thing..  Also tried the chicken udon soup.  Nice portion and very tasty.  Next time, it'll be the chicken curry soup with udon.  If you leave here hungry, you have to be something other than human.
author: Scott K.

description:
i love their curry card! i tried the potato croquette as my free topping, that was pretty good! the people at work like this place too now.  

i wish they gave more rice tho... but now i just bring my own brown rice from home.. yea.. i'm being cheap... but economy is bad nowadays.
author: JUDY L.

description: Potato croquette is crispy on the outside with being mushy inside, and not oily at all. Volcano level of spiciness is spicy enough with a good balance of the sweetness.
author: Tanya C.

description: chicken katsu curry at volcano always hits the spot when we're looking for some japanese curry.  there are a couple other places i've tried (muracci and japacurry truck) and theyre all slightly different in the consistency and taste of the curry sauce and each one is unique in their taste.  definitely worth trying each of them! i usually get the mild chicken katsu curry and it's delicious!  i was having last minute finals studying cravings and we picked this up so i could study and eat at the same time and it was perfect!  the portions are large, the chicken is well breaded and is crunchy on the outside and juicy meat on the inside, the curry is always flavorful and has some cooked veggies/potato inside.  if you're in the richmond district, SF and craving curry, this is the place to go! for $6.95 you really can't beat the price and quality of the food.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Cheap.. but delicious!. Chicken Katsu curry over rice for under $7, yumm.
Hard press to find parking, but that's to be expected being on Geary.

There's like 3 other asian curry restaurants nearby as well.. haven't tried yet tho.
author: Andy H.

description: So  I think Volcano deserves maybe a 3.5 rating but not a 4.  We ordered take out.  Beef curry, and cutlet curry.  Both were good.  We also tried the mild and medium sauce and I  liked the mild much better.  It's good enough to return for a second try.  Doesn't seem like there's too many places dedicated to curry in SF, but Volcano's seems like a good to go place.
author: LittleBird 8.

description: Very cheap restaurant, and for once that doesn't mean it's not good.  The food here was great, and filling.  I got the spicy curry with beef and it was fully satisfying. I would definitely come here again.
author: Theo T.

description:
My new favorite restaurant in SF.

I've been to Japan and like another review stated, Volcano's curry itself isn't quite as thick as the curry in Japan.. but it's still delicious.

Pork Katsu (tonkatsu) Curry, Medium. With a Potato Croquette. It doesn't get much better.

The restaurant may be small and there's typically only over 2 or 3 people working (so they sometimes get swamped around dinner time) but the service is still always amazingly fast.

A+
author: Chris F.

description: Very very yummy.  I scarfed down my chicken katsu curry (with two servings of extra pickles) and finished off my friend's noodle soup dish.  I'm not a big fan of soup, but this was simply delicious!  It's too bad that you have to pay for extra pickles.
author: Natalie V.

description: I'm pretty pumped on this place and wish they had similar type joints in the South Bay. As others have said, the curry portions are generous, the price is on point and the flavors are really good. Most importantly, they got some good things going on with the deep fryer. I had the curry with Tonkatsu with a side of Potato Croquette, and the breading on both were nice and crispy. I'm a fan and will definitely be back for lunch domination post OB summer sessions.
author: David P.

description: Love this place! Friendly and fast service, delicious curries (I switch between their pork katsu and their chicken katsu) and reasonable prices. A great value.
author: Liz H.

description: I like curry. And volcano delivers. Portions are GOOD so bring your appetite. I've had the beef curry twice, and the pork cutlet twice. Both are a solid option. I will be frequenting this place often, so that they stick around! Dinner for less than $10 is a win.
author: Randy K.

description: First time here and I got the beef curry and had it made hot. I was contemplating volcano, but my friend warned me of the after effects, lol. I actually enjoyed the dish, the sauce was solid and the meat was good too. The hotness did have a kick to it but it was the right amount for the entree to taste so good. Will be coming back to try the other entrees soon when I go out there again.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Filling and inexpensive, I've started stopping by this place for lunch more and more often.  

I love Indian and Thai curries, and Japanese curry is now starting to grow on me.  The regular curry is spicy enough for me, and I love that I can get noodles or rice.  I usually get the chicken katsu curry, but have found that the original (meatless) has enough to it to be just as satisfying.  Potatoes, carrots, eggplant and zuchinni along with the pickles.
author: Miriam G.

description: Great food. We Paid 20 bucks for two dishes which i found a little expensive but food was worth it. i will highly recommened adding jalapeno peppers to your order :)
author: Zeshan T.

description:
the lady working here was sooo  nice. she was very friendly and attentive. i cant really say much about their food.  curry was MEH... chicken katsu was A-OK... potato croquette was actually good...and thier brown rice was pretty awesome. with a name like volacano, i was expecting some sort of bukkake eruption in my mouth. too bad i didnt get it. hahah. jk. =) 
  
and yes, they DO serve everything on paper plates!
author: B B.

description:
Got home and discovered we got a box of rice and six tiny pieces of eggplant ($2 for that topping, btw) but no chicken katsu!

I know the cashier sometimes does not have time to check the take-out boxes, so could the management please hire cooks with half a brain?
author: Richard S.

description: Quality chicken katsu curry. Spice levels seems accurate. Service was very friendly.  I would definitely return.
author: Mackey J.

description: Very good, very real Japanese curry. Tastes just like it does in Japan. And it is super filling for not much cash. Check it out. I recommend the Pork Cutlet curry. And be sure to get it spicy.
author: Thomas E.

description: Never heard of japanese curry before I tried this place. Didn't know what to expect for my first time but have to say that I loved it (Keep in mind that this is the only japanese curry place I've tried). I ordered the chicken curry combo with calamari and potato hash. The curry consists of chicken, potatoes, and some veggies. Everything was really good. The spice level on the curry my perfect for, just the right amount of heat. Definitely going here again for a curry fix. Couple things to keep in mind: the place gets pretty busy during dinner hours and the wait for your order tends to take awhile.
author: Ajay K.

description: So apparently the first time I went there, there was some kind of mixup/misunderstanding and my "volcano" level of hotness was not actually as hot as it should've been. However, I went back, and this time it was hot! so yay!
author: Eric W.

description: The curry here is not bad for the cost. Just a decent place if you are craving curry and want it quickly.
author: Nelson H.

description:
Every neighborhood in town should have a place like this.

It's pretty cheap to begin and then they give free meals to frequent diners

The hottest spice level they offer is pretty tolerable - they should have one more level on offer, Volcano+
author: Jerry M.

description: So, you don't want to spend hours making Japanese curry at  home.  Then go to Volcano.  The sauce is a little on the thin side but you can get out of there under $10.  Lots of add ons are fun - I love eggplant and think it naturally goes with curry - well add it on!  It's an inexpensive, fast and fairly satisfying dinner.  The katsu sandwich is huge!  Worth going to.
author: Luri S.

description: Great curry, and very affordable at about $7-$8 per plate.
author: David M.

description: A good place to eat if your REALLY hungry.  Not bad, not horrible.  Solid 3 stars.
author: John B.

description: Cold Food, Small Portions, Horrible Service. They serve the food on paper plates............ uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh gross.
author: Brian P.

description: Where have you been all my life?? I love Japanese Curry and cant believe I neglected this gem. The curry isnt really too spicy so I usually go for the hottest but I hurd they have a house curry that even hotter. If you haven't eaten here you need to!
author: Jasmine M.

description: I was pretty excited about a Japanese curry house, but it wasn't all that great. I had just the regular curry, w/the potato croquette and brown rice. The curry sauce was okay, but vegetables were dry and not very tasty. I think the curry in the restaurants in J-town are better.
author: Emy s.

description:
I've been meaning to try Volcano since they opened a few months ago, but the reviews have been a huge deterrent for me.  However, a few of my coworkers have been here and raved about this place so I decided to give it a try.  Mind you, I've never had Japanese curry before so I had no idea what to expect.  I ended up ordering the Chicken Katsu Curry ($6.50) with a Croquette for an extra $1.  The waitress told me that I could choose from Mild, Spicy or Volcano Spicy (not on their menu), so of course I had to give the latter a try.  The curry was pretty spicy but still palatable.  I actually tried a little of my coworker's regular spicy one and I thought that one was a little sweeter, which I liked better (the Volcano spicy was a little tangier from the chili sauce).  Overall, I thought their curry was actually quite tasty.  Everything came out piping hot and fresh and the portions are HUGE!

I do hope that they will switch to regular plates and utensils because paper plates and plastic utensils are not very eco-friendly (and quite expensive in the long run).

If I ever get a craving for curry, I know where to go now ;)
author: Katelynn L.

description: Not many Japanese curry places in the city.  Volcano is ok.  I had the Chicken Katsu Curry (Volcano spice) with a potato Croquette, egg, and brown rice.  I definitely like that they give you the option of brown rice.  Not many places do that.  The curry, however, was watery and not as spicy as I had hoped.  Muracci's has a better one IMO albeit a bit pricier.  I haven't found a place up here that can compare to great Japanese places like Hurry Curry in LA where the curry is nice and hearty.  I would come back, but only out of convenience since Muracci's has ridiculous hours and wait time.
author: Bert N.

description: I wish there were more places like this in my neighborhood.  It must be so nice to pick up some hot, comforting, tasty, and not to mention cheap japanese-style curry on the way home from work.  I love love love the jalopeno toppers and always order them no matter what curry dish I get (pork tomato curry is pretty freaking good, btw).  I also recommend ordering their mini spam sandwich as a little treat to scarf down while you wait for your curry.  I love volcano curry!!!
author: Sarah K.

description: Great little place for lunch. The atmosphere looks a little fast foody, but the curry is great. Chicken katsu and pork katsu are great. Just be careful what extra toppings you get. There's one called "sausage" which is actually like chopped up Oscar Meyer weiner. Stick with the standards and you should be okay.
author: Mark B.

description:
Updated review

giving them a slight upgrade/bump.  Not that it really makes a difference (other than to the environment) but they have normal plates now.  Curry is runny.  Not a whole lot of substance (i.e. meat, veggies, etc) in the curry itself.  It's an ok meal for the price.  The chicken katsu sandwich is pretty good though.  Volcano level spicy is pretty spicy indeed.  It's probably equivalent to on the bridge's XX spicy.  I've gone from almost never going there to sometimes going there.  The sandwiches are convenient.

Old review - 

I was a bit concerned coming here based on the previous yelp reviews.

Paper plates?  Plastic Utensils?  If these things really bother you that much, you are a stuck up food snob.  I eat plenty of fair and festival food on paper plates and with plastic utensils.  Does it affect the eating experience?  In an institution defined as "fine dining" Yes.  Is Volcano Curry or should you consider it such an institution?  No.  The only thing I can say about it is it isn't a very green practice.  It would be nice to see plates and silverware eventually but I won't grade them down for not having them.

Sauce - yes, the sauce could be better.  It wasn't very smooth.  It was kind of starchy kind of like when you use potatoes in the sauce creation or as a thickener rather than the roux they claim to use.  Taste was ok.  I can make better curry but since I'm not planning on opening a restaurant anytime soon, who am I?  I got the spicy and it was a nice level.  If you are a serious spice head, I would probably try to order it extra, extra-extra, or extra-extra-extra spicy.  Don't know if they will oblige.

Fillings - I got the chicken curry.  The chicken was cooked inconsistently.  There were some overcooked pieces.  A few nicely cooked pieces.  Nothing offensive.  Nothing awesome.

Accoutrements - served with three types of pickles.  The red ones really match well with the curry.  The green pickles and the pickled onions really seemed out of place.  The croquette was pretty standard.  I haven't been to a place that actually makes their own croquettes.  Or tasted like it was homemade.

Service - you order at the counter.

Price - this is the biggest thing you have to factor into the equation.  The prices are really cheap.  You buy at the counter.  You don't have to tip.  You get a plastic number for your order.  It's almost like this place is... fast food!  I think people really expected too much out of this place hoping for a Richmond Curry Heaven.  I know I was but when you step back, it's really just the Curry version of Gordo's (which I can't say I find to be very good when you compare it to somewhere like Cancun or El Farolito's).  Cheap, quick, serviceable.  Good for when you are lazy or in a dinner pinch.  My two friends were actually very satisfied with their meal.  I had previous had this place at 3 stars because of their reaction but I guess in the end I have to grade it on my experience.  I went back a second time and got the curry with shrimp tempura (?).  It was too doughy, totally lost the shrimp.  The eggplant skin was inedible and the vegetables were overcooked.  I get the feeling they used vegetables from the stock instead of using fresh ones for the serving dish.  In the end, I have to hold up a certain standard and I can't tell people I think Volcano is on par with other 3 star rated institutions.  Cheap curry eats.  Good if you are easily pleased.  If you are a fine diner, avoid.  I might go back from time to time but I doubt very often.

2 stars for food.  0.5 star for price/value.
2.5 STARS
author: Nat L.

description: The chicken katsu curry was delicious! The plate does look like it is mainly covered with rice, but the chicken katsu serving wasn't small either. I got the curry in medium spicy, and it was just right. I felt really full after finishing the plate. The only thing I would ask for is maybe serving the curry with a bit more of the vegetable it comes with...
author: Elise C.

description: Wowzers... it's always been said that one can determine the quality of a Japanese Curry by the consistency of the carrots and potatoes... both of which were PERFECTLY COOKED.. Volcano Curry is amazingly delicious and I especially love the house curry, spicy and with brown rice...delicious!!
author: Amy L.

description: This place is pretty cool- the food is tasty and reasonably priced. Parking can be an issue because of the location so you have to time it right. I had the chicken katsu without curry and it was a- ok.
author: John S.

description: I'm not a big fan of Japanese curry, so my review might be a little biased.  I came here after being lured in by a Scoutmob deal, since I couldn't resist everything being 50% off.  Actually, even without the discount, the prices were already very reasonable as most dishes were around $7.  We got the chicken katsu and the pork katsu.  I will say that the portions were very big and that I liked the chicken more than the pork.  It was moister and more flavorful, whereas the pork seemed bland.  These curry dishes come with 2 pieces of potatoes, carrots, and zucchini.  In addition, you get a heaping portion of rice topped with some pickled daikons.  I got the medium spicy curry, which packs a little heat, and it goes well with the rice.  If you add toppings, I recommend the pork croquette, as that was very good. The other toppings that I tried weren't remarkable - calamari, sausage, and boiled egg.
author: Tyler C.

description: Sure this is the only place that I've had Japanese curry.........but it was super yummy!  Oh, and the hot/spicy is SPICY.  Like #@$%.  I love me a good spice and that was it.  Super yummy and super cheap.
author: Stephanie M.

description: For the people who gave this place 4 stars or 5, how many times have you eaten at volcano? once? Coz i've been there a couple of times and.... how should i describe it..hmmmm.. it sucked ass!. i mean how many chefs are there? how many beef curry variants are there? Coz i always order the same thing(beef curry) and it taste different everytime. The first time i went there it was good, next it was nice, after that it went downhill. The sauce became watery, then bland and so on. I mean theres no consistency!, The last straw was last week when i ordered beef curry (surprise surprise) and what came was nothing like beef curry, it didnt even taste like beef curry. i Asked if she got the order wrong but she assured me it was beef curry. what kind? martian?.  Not going back there again.
author: Eddie 'bhong' V.

description: Awwww...  nancy boys can't deal with paper plates? What's the matter, did you catch your mom getting railed by the mail man while she was packing for a picnic? Bad memories can be brutal I'm sure, but deal with it you pansy.  Tell you what, if you'd rather pay extra for the costs that are incurred via having actual plates and stemware do me (and the rest of the richmond) a favor and go some where else. You are not wanted. I hear the mission is nice this time of year.
author: kenton y.

description: Their curry is OK and cheap, and because they changed to regular plates... when I am in the neighborhood and want cheap meal, this is definitely one of my choices.
author: Wakaknee J.

description:
The service method is very casual; we placed the order at the counter and the food is brought to our table by the cashier. She was very nice and attentive to our needs, she explained in detailed what everything tasted like and even gave us samples of their curry prior to our purchase. 

The atmosphere was quiet and nice; a very relaxing environment. Tables are self served. The drinks are self served at the counter if you decide to order tea or water. 

The volcano chicken katsu was very good; it's the spiciest type of curry on their menu. Although it was really spicy, it was tasty. I've had a lot of spicy foods where they're just really spicy and nothing else. The volcano sauce was spicy yet not overwhelming to a point where I cannot taste the other flavors that were embedded within the sauce.

The serving size was very generous; the katsu came with rice which was also very filling. I was unable to finish the whole entree, I had to bring half of it home with me even though I went in with an empty stomach.

Overall, I would recommend this place to everyone who enjoys spicy curry and katsu. It's definitely a restaurant that I would revisit.
author: Wenting L.

description:
If I'm working from home in week I try and make it to lunch here. I believe the salads are fresh as I ask for mine without corn. The food is very acceptable for the price - I sometimes go for the non-curry option and rarely the chicken that people have been having problems with.
The toppings are a bit pricey but their loyalty card gives you a free one with every 3 visits.
Service is very good and friendly.
The only thing stopping 5 stars is that they sometimes have problems with flies although they still have good hygiene.
author: Dan C.

description: had the chicken katsu, it was delicious. I live just down the block, so I would probably come back here again. Woulda got 5 stars if it was a buck cheaper. Once you add the brown rice and a drink... could get a bit pricy
author: boston j.

description: I like Volcano if I'm much too lazy to cook some golden curry at home and I want it spicy and don't care that it's a little too over-priced.  You can make the same kind of curry at home, with all the "toppings" that you can handle.  The "volcano" hot curry is pretty damn hot though, and you do get quite a bit of food for the cash.  I was a bit disappointed to hear that curry joints in Japan don't charge extra for pickles...instead they have them out on the table like condiments apparently.  It would be nice if volcano offered the toppings as part of the package.  It might make the experience a little less "could have cooked this at home-y"
author: Jay S.

description: Went here with a dinner club and really enjoyed the curry.  It's not exactly Japanese style, but close enough.  I got the Katsu Curry with a Koroke on the side.  I wish more Japanese places served up Koroke.  The price was was very good and I wish these place was closer to where I work because I would go here at least once a week.  One of my friends got the katsu sandwich and it looked really good, I'll have to try that next time.  We had a pretty large group and there was not much room for us so I wouldn't recommend coming here with more than 4 or 5 people.  One last thing, I ordered "spicy" and the curry actually had some heat.  I didn't know that there was a level above.  I'll have to try the "Volcano" style sometime.
author: Peter W.

description: good comfort food--I like the tomato flavored curry and medium wasn't too spicy for me.  Pick up at counter and self serve water/utensils.
author: E. C.

description: I love their curries, and you get to pick your spicy-ness level. Pork Katsu is my favorite, and the onion croquet is awesome.
author: David L.

description: Wow, the Chicken Katsu is so good. The chicken is fresh and of good quality. The mild curry sauce has a really nice mild spicey flavor. The little bit of veggies on top are fresh.
author: Phillip L.

description: They no longer serve the food on paper plates with plastic utensils... yes, they've upgraded to real plates and forks/knives/spoons!  I guess they realized how wasteful using disposable everything was when business started to pick up.
author: Gary L.

description: I love volcano. I first tried Japanese curry (didn't even know there was such a thing) in Japan and loved it, so I was delighted when this place opened up near my house. The food here is good, simple, and reasonably priced. Nothing too fancy here, but it's just not that type of place. The actual building is (unlike many places in this part of town) actually clean , well kept, and there is always somewhere to sit.
author: Luis M.

description: I really enjoyed my chicken katsu curry.  For $7, not bad at all.  Definitely need to make another stop here next time!
author: Jasmine T.

description:
not bad.

not the best of curries, but very friendly staff. 

drink+beef curry+extra rice+boiled egg = around $10

i'd most likely go back just cause it's a local business with curry nearby. don't know about the paper plates, even though i had my order there, and the feel is very minimum. but the meal is comfort food for me, and the owners even stopped off to ask how the food was.

give it a try.
author: Darrell L.

description: Gonna keep it nice and short, went here tonite for the first time. I ordered the chicken curry with an extra hard boiled egg with brown rice.  It was actually better than i thought it was going to be! Good portions and filled me up! Gonna be back here for sure
author: Nick T.

description: I've grown to like the curry at Volcano Curry of Japan.  I didn't even know Japan had curries??  I especially like the chicken curry with brown rice...you can add toppings for a little extra.  The curry is very flavorful, and can be mild or hot.  Different from the Indian curries...a little bit sweeter and not as spicy.  I'm a fan...but my secretary asked me today why I was eating curry again? and then she made a face and brought me a bottle of water.  Nice secretary.
author: George S.

description:
people keep commenting on their paper plates but who really cares? it's their curry that i'm concerned about and after eating at this place, i know i could make better japanese curry at home with the instant stuff.

to me, this is NOT like any japanese curry i've had, in a bad way. the curry was super watery, it had a broth-like consistency. i like my curry thick. and, i was bummed when i opened my to-go container and  saw that my chicken katsu was covered in grated cheese (the kind you would use to make quesadillas)! i don't know if they got my order wrong or thought it would be a nice added bonus but it was strange! 

granted, this is probably the cheapest japanese curry meal you'll find but you could better spend that money next door at gordo's and get a yummy quesadilla. i don't think i'll be back.
author: elsie k.

description: I usually don't like noodle dishes, but I liked their beef curry noodles. The noodles were half the thickness of regular udon noodles- which I found delightful to chew, and the soup flavor wasn't overbearing, beef so tender! I'm a tiny girl, and I finished this whole bowl of goodness! They are clean and serve hot quick. Good place for a quick lunch/brunch.
author: A L.

description: Considering the price, service, and environment, I really like this place. I'm not sure why people are so harsh on them. Yes, their curry is a bit on the bland side, but being the only restaurant around that specializes in Japanese curry, I think they've done a good job. I got the chicken katsu curry, and kind of had a blast eating it. The place is clean and organized, so I really don't mind serving myself. In my opinion, it adds to the fun.
author: Alex Y.

description: I was hit with a curry craving and decided to try out Volcano as it is only a few blocks from my house.  The chicken katsu curry definitely hit the spot.  For $6.50, you get lots of chicken, and curry with two pieceseach of zucchini, potato, and carrot.  More veggies would have been nice but overall this is satisfying, cheap food.
author: Sheryl L.

description:
This is a good place to get a cheap and delicious meal. True, the price is  a little more than a 4.50 rice plate on Clement and the meal won't leave you as full as a super burrito. But this place finds a happy medium between, price, quality and portion size. 

I had the spicy chicken curry which was quite good. It was indeed very spicy but not so spicy that it was hard to eat. I tried a bite of my friend's beef curry which was even better. It's served in a rich brown gravy with a hint of sweetness to balance the spice. 

I'll be back again, (and next time I'll be getting the beef curry!)
author: Joe S.

description:
3.5 stars. slightly above average, but nothing special. 

i don't have japanese curry very often, so i can't relate it to similar places, but i wasn't too impressed by the food. it was relatively inexpensive, however, so for the price i'd say it was overall worthwhile, if you are already in the area.

i got the original curry ($5 - meatless). if i ever go back, i will order a katsu. my friends ordered it while we were there and it seemed like a better bet.
author: Tyler b.

description: I had the impression that this place would be more of a waiter serviced restaurant than a take out place so instead what you do is order from the counter and pay immediately upfront. There are tables available and someone will bring your food over but you have to fill up your own water and grab your own utensils. I saw the tomato curry and was intrigued so I ordered a tomato pork curry medium spicy. I was told it would be on the sweeter side. My friend order the chicken curry. I was kind of disappointed in my curry. It no longer tasted like a japanese curry dish. It reminded me of a non-japanese ethnic dish. I guess I should have known better. Oh well. It did start to taste better to me as I kept eating though. I tried my friend's chicken curry and really liked it. I also preferred her chicken to my pork. I would like to come back and when I do I would order what she had. It definitely tastes way better than the Golden Curry packets I use back home. I wanted to try something new but was disappointed. Lesson learned: Stick with what you know (at least for the first time dining at a new place)!
author: Helen L.

description:
This place just opened, so it will probably take a few weeks for them to master the new menu and service.  I recommend it. 
I never had this type of curry before, and I liked it.  The portion was just right. I liked the curry - not too smelly or spicy.  I thought the price was right- less than $9 for my chicken plate - especially since I'm looking for more affortable places to eat these days.
It is a great quick bite to eat on work days or nights.
Try it at least once.
author: R R.

description:
I tried Volcano curry today with my daughter.  The food was very good and I felt the prices were reasonable.  Adding a piece of korokke or a generous portion of eggplant to the already  large chicken katsu curry was only a dollar.  The restaurant was simple and clean.    

We both enjoyed Volcano.  I didn't feel the portions were particularly small, one plate with an added korokke and a portion of eggplant was plenty for me and my 4.5 year old.
author: M R.

description:
Ever since visiting Tokyo and having CoCo Ichi curry, I have found myself craving Japanese curry.  This place is a pretty close match.  I had the chicken katsu and was delicious.  Make sure to get the fukuzinzuke pickles with your curry. Yum Yum Yum.
I havent tried the curry at the Volcano spicy level, but the regular is pretty mild in my opinion. The price is right too.
author: Stephanie S.

description: hella good curry. i usually have the pork or chicken katsu curry. i recommen the hot one. if u r feeling spice get the volcano. i like how u can add a bunch of stuff to ur curru like onion or potato croquettes just to name a few. ive always enjoyed my curry here. they also have really good sandwiches. ive only tried the chicken katsu sandwich and it was sooo good. i never thought that a chicken katsu sandwich would taste so good. the food comes out fast and the prices are decent.gotta support my japanese restaurants
author: Cory Y.

description: I really like this place for Japanese curry.  There aren't too many curry places in SF, and my husband and I are return customers to this one.  Usually, we like the curry a little thicker, but here, it's runny.  Still, the taste is really good.  I pretty much stick to the pork katsu curry.  The pork katsu is fried crunchy, and the curry is flavorful.  The serving is large and fulfilling.  I've tried spice level volcano before, and it's a little too much.  It's numbing hot, and not too enjoyable.  I like the level just below that (hot, I think).  We always get a side of the potato croquet too.  Prices are reasonable.  There's nothing else to ask for on cold nights when you don't feel like cooking!
author: Allison M.

description: Make a long story short: The curry beef was decent, but the texture of the curry was too runny for my liking. If the curry texture was thicker, I'd probably give it four stars.
author: Gerry L.

description: I love Japanese Curry. This place is nice because you can customize your dish as you wish. The base curry comes with meat and a few stewed vegetables, but you can add additional ones as toppings, which is nice. The curry flavor is very good and the chicken katsu plate is my favorite. I've also had the chicken curry and chicken curry soup noodle dish. The chicken curry rice plate is good, but the soup is a bit too rich. There is definitely a lot of curry flavor, but the soup is just too heavy for my taste, although I can't say it is heavier than the curry soup I've had anywhere else. The portion sizes are good- I generally eat more than the average person and while I'm not stuffed after leaving this place, I'm content. The Prices are very reasonable and I would probably go to this place 2 or 3 times a week if I could get myself to drive all the way out to the richmond that many times a week
author: Tyler C.

description:
This is not haute cuisine. But what Volcano Curry does, it does extremely well. Like a few other Yelpers, I was driving around and found this restaurant by accident. I've been engaged in the pursuit of the ultimate bowl of chicken katsu curry for several months and was happy to add another contender to the list. The menu is simple, as has been previously noted, but there are a few things that stand out for me. 
1.) Prices here are very reasonable. You can order a bowl of tasty, meaty, satisfying curry for several dollars depending on your toppings. I like the option of adding eggplant- that's something I haven't seen before.
2.) Salads. I know this is a somewhat American preference and I ordered the green salad which was way more than just iceberg lettuce and a slice of tomato. My salad had crisp mixed greens, including frisee (which isn't authentically Japanese, but I loved it) and a tasty dressing.
3.) Cleanliness. The restaurant is very, very, very clean. Bathroom is also very clean, which tells me that the owner and staff pay attention to all the details.
4.) Last but certainly not least, the curry. It's the star of the menu and it's the perfect consistency. Not runny or clumpy, it's velvety smooth, hearty, slightly spicy.

I have to try the potato croquette next time- how did I miss that option?
author: Modestly I.

description:
