I'm replacing my review. I went to Volcano this evening to see if they had improved, and they actually had. It's still not great, but the presentation was much better, there was a bunch of cheese on my chicken katsu, and everything just tasted better than on opening day.

Yes, some of the same problems are still there -- paper plates/plastic spoons, a curry sauce that's more runny and bland than the good stuff -- but I wouldn't necessarily steer people away from Volcano anymore.
author: Chris K.

description: i love that this place is so close to my house.  their sandwiches are yummy.   how can you go wrong with katsu between big slabs of toasted japanese white bread and fresh slaw?  you can't...you just can't.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I was so excited and couldn't wait until Volcano opened. There are so many restaurants around this area with the same kind of food, I was excited to have something different.  I love japanese curry.

We went on opening day.  The owner was there.  The service was good, although it did take a long time for the food, but hey, I'll wait for freshly cooked food.  Price is decent, although you only get two tiny small shrimp.  I recommend that they serve 4 shrimp but up the price by $2.
The curry was so-so, pretty bland, but not bad.  We would have recommended this place, for a cheap, mediocre informal meal.  

Yes, "would have".

Now, we would never recommend this place, purely for the horrible service.  Without the manager there, the service was night and day.   On Saturday, the place was empty when we first walked in.  No one was there.  We placed our order.  First, the order took 30 minutes.  When we got them, 2 of the 3 were wrong.  I should have known, because there was a lot of confusion with the order takers (2 of them) arguing with each other.  By the time, I received my wrong order, there were about 20 people in the restaurant.  They told me that even though they screwed up my order, the new corrected order would be cooked AFTER the 20 that came in after me.  We were pissed.  We argued and reminded them that NO ONE was in the restaurant when we walked in, and that we should be ahead of all of them, and they were the ones that screwed up the order.  They assured me we would be next.  20 minutes later, and 8 plates passing by us, we still didn't receive our corrected order.  They forgot to give it to the cook.   They never apologized, as a matter of fact, they made me feel like I was being completely irrational and impatient.

We will never recommend this place again.  While we understand that new places take time to get things together.  There is no way they are going to work out with the staff that was there Saturday (Feb 27) evening.  Their lack of common sense, rudeness and condescending manner was inexcusable.  I hope the owner of this restaurant reads this and considers restaffing if he wants to keep this place open.
author: Stacey F.

description: This cozy establishment in the Richmond makes excellent curry and katsu. I had the chicken katsu curry and was very impressed. The curry is flavorful, unlike ordinary curry that you get at the store. You also get to pick your level of spiciness. I had medium, which adds a tinge of spiciness to the flavor of the curry, which I liked a lot. Prices were very reasonable too. I'd definitely be back. Volcano would've gotten 5 stars, except that there wasn't nearly enough curry sauce, so I guess that's my only complaint.
author: Barn M.

description: i'm glad to see the place has gotten busier but this isn't curry from japan cause there is too much starch in the curry and way too watery.  too bad, the price is pretty cheap and they give you actual meat.  but this isn't really curry.  too bad.
author: Food Is L.

description: one of my favorite places! the vegetable curry noodle soup is AMAZING!!!
author: Chrissy P.

description: Wandering around the Outer Richmond after a bike ride, ravenous and exhausted, I was so excited to stumble upon this place. I love Japanese style curry, and Volcano didn't disappoint. Cheap, very generous portions, and good quality. I ordered the chicken katsu curry. The chicken was crispy and juicy, veggies were cooked just right (although cut rather big), and the curry sauce itself was flavorful (albeit a bit thin). The only thing is that "Spicy" isn't really spicy at all. The interior is clean, more of a cafe then a restaurant, I'd say, and our cashier/cook/server was nice. All in all, a great place to stop by if you're already in the area and are craving some good, cheap eats.
author: Tammy C.

description: I don't understand what the big fuss is about!  The curry is not that bad and I am no curry virgin.  I've had my share of good japanese curry - including Tokyo curry that you need to get a ticket for from a vending machine.  I ordered the ebi fry curry, spicy at Volcano.  It was definitely a little thin in texture but the flavor was all there.  The zucchini and red potato was a weird touch but their fried shrimp was very tasty and their curry was spicy enough for me.  There's even a spicier level than the one I got.  I'd definitely go back for a quick fix.  Yeah, Muracci's is better but unfortunately, it's not open for dinner!
author: Ming Y.

description: can't say i'm a huge fan of japanese curry.  seems a little plain to me.  i like indian curry better.  has more flavor and a better bite.  japanese curry can be spicy but it's more of a plain spicy.  can't quite explain it.  anyway, we wanted to try the japanese kind since we have a trip to tokyo planned in the next few weeks.  so why not get in the mood, right?  the spicy was decently spicy but didn't have a lot of complex flavors.  not crazy hot either which is good.  other than that, the food is fairly non-descript.  it's basically: rice, some veggies and some straight-forward curry.  it's one step up from fast food but the neighborhood must love it because there was a big-ol line when i arrived to pick up my order.  and they are not built for speed!  yeesh.  i think i had to wait 15 minutes for 3 people to place simple orders.  i mean the menu only has like 8 items on it.  no idea what took so long.  but when the food finally got home, it was good.  solid selection for a lunch spot better, i think than dinner.
author: dan h.

description: we've been to this place twice in 5 or 6 months and i'd have to say that we'd go back again.  i like the idea of this place and the art on the walls is right up my alley... depicting san francisco in it's own unique way.  my husband and i ate for just under 20 bucks.  he had curry with shrimp and a hard boiled egg topping and i had the tried and true chicken katsu with zucchini toppings.  we had forgotten just how much food they put on those plates!  when i was asked how spicy i wanted the curry, i absentmindedly said "medium" when typically i like things hot.  the medium turned out to be just perfect!  we gorged ourselves on this feast and left the place in a stuffy but happy haze.  i would definitely recommend getting the zucchini.  i also appreciate the self serve ice water.  so, yeah, i like this place and don't understand why it's not crowded while gordos next door has a line.  imo gordos is bland and pricey but i'll save that for another review, yeah?
author: Nix B.
